1.doctext: According to U.S. defense officials on January 3, the  U.S. Pentagon will dispatch a second aircraft carrier strike group to the  Gulf region as a warning to Syria and Iran and to give them command Officers have more flexibility when conducting missions in the area. Defense Department officials announced that the  John C. Stennis Carrier Strike Group, homeported in Bremerton, Washington, will deploy  this month    and will Sent more than 5,000 U.S. sailors to the Gulf, bringing the total number of sailors in the region to 16,000.  The Dwight D. Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group  entered the   Gulf Area  in December 2006   . Pentagon spokesman Brian Whitman leaned toward a comment that the Department of Defense would not negotiate future deployments or ship movements. But military analysts concluded the carrier move was intended to demonstrate U.S. resolve in addressing provocative actions by Iran and Syria.  John C. Stennis Aircraft Carrier Strike Group  was originally planned to be deployed in the Pacific region. However, after receiving a request from the U.S. Central Command,  the Pentagon agreed to interrupt the  John C. Stennis aircraft carrier strike group's plan and send the aircraft carrier strike group to bay area. Senior defense officials said the request was aimed at increasing central command flexibility in executing a variety of missions and creating deterrence in the Gulf.

2.doctext: U.S. Special Operations Command has successfully completed the first phase of the  ISR Data Link capability upgrade project in  Afghanistan. . In the test, the C-130 aircraft, which was previously equipped with an ArcLight modem and an 11.5-inch, Ku-band VR-12 antenna, used the new modem without changing the antenna. The  data link was able to operate at up to 4Mbps. Rate transmits full-motion video from the aircraft to an undisclosed  network hub also  deployed in  Afghanistan. According to ViaSat officials, if the antenna is upgraded to the Ka-band VR-12 type, the new modem will be able to achieve data transmission rates of up to 10Mbps. However, in order to match the video decoder on the aircraft, during the actual mission flight, the data transmission rate of the link is usually 2.5Mbps. The trial is part of a three-phase  trial  project to be completed over the next four to five weeks. In addition, ViaSat officials said that in addition to the C-130 aircraft, the test and evaluation project will also involve about 100 ISR aircraft including the PC-12 from the U.S. Special Operations Command, the U.S. Air Force, and the U.S. Army. .

3.doctext: The Indian Navy  is forming a cyber team to combat cyber attacks. This move will also enhance the network-centric warfare capabilities of the Indian Navy's more than 100 surface ships and submarines. Sources from the  Indian Navy  said the cyber team's mission also includes attacking enemy networks, but did not disclose further details. The establishment of the Indian Navy's cyber team became a top priority after the computers of India's Eastern Fleet were attacked earlier this year.  Navy The first batch of IT officers will be selected from college graduates in fields such as IT, computer science and engineering, and they will be admitted to the Naval Academy in Ahimara from December this year, Navy officials said Commencement of 22 weeks of training.  Cyber ​​Officers will be  deployed on approximately 100  naval platforms, along with new aircraft carriers, frigates, nuclear-powered and conventionally-powered submarines Being introduced into the Indian Navy, the network-centric warfare capabilities of the Indian Navy will be enhanced.  The Indian Navy  is about to  launch  the long-delayed  multi-band geostationary orbit surveillance communication satellite , and the potential of naval network-centric warfare will also be amplified. The satellite will bring maritime domain awareness to the Navy through high-speed data links and will operate in conjunction with surface, subsea and air platforms of the  Indian Navy  as well as shore-based operations centres.

4.doctext: According to the "Rodong Sinmun", the official newspaper of the Workers' Party of Korea,  North Korea Deputy Minister of the People's Armed Forces Kang Pyo-yong attended the Pyongyang City Military and Civilian Assembly held in Kim Jong Il Square in Pyongyang the day before yesterday to support the statement of the spokesperson of the Supreme Command. , and delivered a speech on behalf of the People's Army officers and soldiers, saying that the  People's Army officers and soldiers stationed at the  Fatherland Unification War starting position are on standby and have been determined to be used. Various missiles such as intercontinental ballistic missiles that attack targets are equipped with nuclear warheads that are lightweight, miniaturized, and diversified, and are on standby. He also threatened that missiles can be launched at the push of a button, and then Washington, the base camp of U.S. imperialism and the source of evil, and the strongholds of U.S. followers will all turn into a sea of ​​flames. The "Armistice Agreement" has become a piece of waste paper.  North Korea is left with only a duel of firepower and nuclear bombs. No matter where it is and no matter what warning it faces, our People's Army will target everyone at the required time. Launch a merciless and just attack on the target in need. According to analysis,  North Korea openly mentioned that it is preparing to launch intercontinental ballistic missiles, indicating that in the future  North Korea may launch  intercontinental ballistic missiles in order to threaten the United States. of  test firing.

5.doctext: After coming under Iraqi anti-aircraft fire,  U.S. forces and  British forces aircraft  bombed   on April 19th  Air defense systems in northern Iraq. In Baghdad, Iraqi Information Bureau officials quoted the Iraqi military as describing the attack as an attack on civilian facilities, but Iraq did not specify casualties.  The US military  stated: This is the first time since February this year and the third time this year that it has bombed northern Iraq. In the anti-terrorist war launched by the US government, there is a fierce debate on whether to make Iraq the next target. Since 1991, the  United States and  British   stationed the  Air Force in  southeastern Turkey They have been patrolling the skies over northern Iraq. They say the purpose of the patrol is to protect Kurdish civilians in northern Iraq. Washington has signaled it could launch a war to overthrow Saddam Hussein's regime if Iraq's leaders continue to deny access to U.N. weapons inspectors. Weapons inspectors are tasked with checking whether Iraq has destroyed mass-produced weapons. But since 1998, Iraq has refused inspections by weapons inspectors. It was originally planned to hold talks between Iraq and the United Nations on the issue of the re-entry of weapons inspectors in mid-April this year, but Iraq requested that the talks be postponed on the grounds that if the talks were held at this time, they might be affected by the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. (Northern Institute of Science and Technology Information, Shen Wei)

6.doctext: Thirty of the U.S. Air Force's more than 70 B-52 bombers have been converted to conventional bombing capabilities. This summer, Barksdale Air Force Base in Louisiana, USA, carried out work to eliminate the ability of bombers to carry nuclear weapons to meet the New Strategic Arms Reduction Agreement signed by  the United States and  Russia The requirements of the Treaty, also known as the New START agreement, came into effect in 2011. The U.S. Air Force Global Strike Command said that 12 non-combat B-52H aircraft are stored at the  U.S. 309th Aviation Maintenance and Renewal Regiment in Tucson, Arizona. These aircraft will also be converted to carry only conventional weapons. . All conversions are expected to be completed by early 2017. Under the New START agreement, neither the  United States nor  Russia may possess more than 1,550 deployed nuclear warheads, 800  deployed and undeployed  intercontinental ballistic missiles missile launchers,  submarine-launched ballistic missile launchers and nuclear-capable  heavy bombers, 700 deployed  intercontinental ballistic missiles ,  satellite-launched ballistic missiles and nuclear-capable heavy bombers.

7.doctext: Data map: Singapore Navy landing ship HMS Perseverance. Xinhuanet, Singapore, April 10. Local media in Singapore reported on the 10th that  Singapore   On the evening of the 9th to  the Gulf of Aden   dispatched  a  naval ship to prepare to actively participate in  the fight against   Somali pirates . According to reports, the  naval landing ship  named  Perseverance  set off from Changi Naval Base in Singapore on the evening of the 9th. The ship carries 2 Super Puma helicopters and 240 officers and soldiers. They will join the 151st Joint Task Force to patrol the  Gulf of Aden waters, hunt down  Somali pirates and provide  attacked merchant ships with necessary  Assistance. When seeing off the task force that night, Rear Admiral Zhao Wenliang, chief of the Singapore Navy, said,  Singapore shares the international community's concern about the situation in the  Gulf of Aden and supports the fight against  Somali pirates. ’s actions. He said the Singaporean military has extensive anti-piracy experience and he has confidence in the task force. Singapore's Deputy Prime Minister and Defense Minister Teo Chee Hean said in February this year that  Singapore's economic lifeline is closely related to maritime security,  Singapore decided to dispatch  Gulf of Aden  Warships, do their part to maintain navigation safety and jointly maintain the safety of important maritime routes around the world.

8.doctext: The U.S. Navy The Third Fleet released a statement saying that the  Nimitz-class aircraft carrier USS Theodore Roosevelt returned to San Diego on July 9, marking the end of its service in the  U.S. Seventh Fleet.  Deployment of Action Zone.  January 17,  More than 6,000 sailors from the  USS Theodore Roosevelt Strike Group and the 11th Carrier Air Wing in  In the Indo-Pacific region carry out  deployment operations to maintain security and stability in the region.  The Roosevelt  sailed a total of 31,835 nautical miles and supported dual-carrier operations, expeditionary strike force operations, air defense exercises and joint service interoperability exercises through dynamic deployment. In early March,  The Roosevelt  visited Da Nang, Vietnam. After the outbreak of COVID-19, the  USS Theodore Roosevelt  sailed into Guam, and more than half of the crew was transferred to different locations in Guam for quarantine, and the aircraft carrier was cleaned and disinfected. On June 4, sailors who met the standards of the U.S. Pacific Fleet combat unit returned to work, and the  USS Theodore Roosevelt  set sail again to perform deployment tasks.

Subject: The U.S. Navy
Militaryforce: Nimitz-class aircraft carrier USS Theodore Roosevelt
Location: U.S. Seventh Fleet.  Deployment of Action Zone

9.doctext: Sarmat missile is a  new intercontinental ballistic missile with a range of up to 11,000 kilometers. It is an independent target reentry capable of carrying up to 24 nuclear weapons. As a strategic weapon for aircraft,  Russia regards the  Sarmat missile as a force to maintain global strategic stability amid the United States' plan to develop an advanced missile defense system. Rogozin, general manager of Roscosmos, praised the capabilities of the  Sarmat missile  in an interview with Russian television. He said that this is a  heavy ballistic missile  capable of defeating and destroying any existing or future missile defense system. Rogozin said that once  deployment  is completed, the  Sarmat missile  will become the backbone of  Russia's  strategic capabilities.  Russia   began status  testing of the  Sarmat missile last year and is expected to begin mass production in 2020 , and will be deployed to the missile force of  Russia for the first time in 2021.  The Sarmat missile  is capable of carrying a variety of warhead and decoy combinations and is also said to be capable of deploying up to 24 nuclear-capable Pioneer hypersonic glide vehicles. Once deployed, the  Sarmat missile is expected to serve as a deterrent to several U.S. Department of Defense initiatives, as well as the so-called Prompt Global Strike massive precision-guided conventional weapons air strike program, which is designed to  span_16 Missiles Potentially neutralize an adversary's strategic countermeasures before launch.

10.doctext: As part of the Russian-Mongolian Selenga-2019 military exercise,  Russia   deployed  the  Eastern Military District Joint Arms in  Buryatia  The troops conducted the first joint shooting training with the  Mongolian Armed Forces. Based on the experience of modern armed conflicts, motorized infantry used stealth attack tactics to practice the process of attacking imaginary enemies. According to the new tactical concept, the motorcycle infantry drove the BMP-2 infantry fighting vehicle to complete the march, arrived near the designated residential area, and advanced covertly under urban combat conditions. The reconnaissance platoon of the participating countries in the exercise, as the leader of the action team, checked whether there were ambushes and entrapments in the local area. Tanks and BMP-2 infantry fighting vehicles travel behind the motorized infantry groups to provide fire support in the event of an enemy surprise attack. During the training,  drills  were also conducted on the  cooperation issues between motorcycle infantry and tank troops, artillery and aviation helicopters  .  Russia The equipment invested in the exercise mainly includes 152mm self-propelled artillery Acacia, Hail multiple rocket launcher, Shilka anti-aircraft self-propelled artillery, T-72B3 tank, BMP-2 infantry fighting vehicle and Mi -24 helicopter and Mi-8AMTSh helicopter, etc.

11.doctext: On March 20,  U.S. Marine Corps  the first F-35C squadron obtained flight safety certification, taking a step closer to combat readiness and deployment. Over the past five months, the  314th Fighter Attack Squadron  at Marine Corps Air Station Miramar has completed the conversion from  F/A-18C  to F-35C , and conduct training with the assistance of the Navy's 125th Fleet Replacement Squadron to complete flight safety certification, which specifically involves equipment, personnel and plans: the installation and operation of management information systems and their accompanying support networks; the operational squadron is equipped with a reliable maintenance plan, and Complete inspections ranging from conventional weapons technical skills to safety; squadron personnel complete transition courses and maintain specific competencies under Naval Aviation Training and Operations Procedures and Standardized Doctrine. The refitted squadrons are required to pass this certification before independently conducting flight operations.  The Marine Corps' 314th Strike Fighter Squadron plans to begin  deployment in  2022 as one of the four strike combat squadrons in the aircraft carrier air wing. ; The 323rd Fighter Attack Squadron is currently equipped with  F/A-18C fighter attack aircraft and is assigned to the 17th Aircraft Carrier Air Wing. It will be followed by  F/A-18C   Final  deployment; the 225th Fighter Attack Squadron will be the next squadron to be equipped with F-35Cs.

Subject: U.S. Marine Corps
Militaryforce: The Marine Corps' 314th Strike Fighter Squadron

12.doctext: The U.S. Navy USS Hamilton collided  with a  ship of unknown nationality on  December 6 . At the time, the  USS Hamilton  was conducting maritime operations in the  Northern Arabian Gulf . No one aboard the  Hamilton  was injured. The ship suffered a hole in its  side above the waterline  but was still able to continue its mission. The cause of the accident is currently under investigation.  Destroyer USS Hamilton  belongs to  USS Lincoln Battle Group  . The carrier strike group is on its regular six-month  deployment  mission in support of Operation Enduring Freedom.  USS Hamilton  is an Arleigh Burke-class destroyer used to protect larger ships in battle groups. Its role is primarily to undertake strike, anti-air, anti-submarine and anti-surface warfare responsibilities.

13.doctext: The U.S. Department of Defense announced on the 17th that  the United States will deploy   missile interceptors in  Alaska, California   and in Before 2005  deployed on  ships at sea. A few hours earlier, President Bush stated that  the United States would   deploy a  limited missile defense system by  2004, To avoid catastrophic damage from a terrorist attack or an attack by a country like North Korea. The Pentagon said in a statement that the first phase of this plan will deploy 20 ground-based interceptor missiles that can... destroy intercontinental ballistic missiles in mid-flight. Among them, 16 are deployed at Fort Greely, Alaska, and 4 are deployed at Vandenberg Air Force Base, California. In addition, in the first phase, 20 sea-based interceptor missiles will be deployed on existing Aegis ships to intercept missiles within the first few minutes of missile launch. The Pentagon also stated that the missile defense system also includes the air-transportable Patriot Advanced Capabilities-3 system to intercept short- and medium-range ballistic missiles. Missile defense systems will rely on land-based, sea-based, and space-based sensors. This will involve existing early warning satellites, a modified radar now based in Shemya, Alaska, a new sea-based X-band radar, modified versions of existing early warning radars based in the UK and Greenland, aboard Aegis cruisers and destroyers Radar and other sensors.

14.doctext: The budget document submitted by US President Bush to the US Congress on February 2 shows that despite facing widespread international opposition, Bush still plans to send weapons into space. The Pentagon's Missile Defense Agency said Bush's 2005 spending plan includes an unspecified amount of money for the development and testing of advanced lightweight space-based interceptor components. The Missile Defense Agency said in its budget overview that the Pentagon is seeking to secure $47 million and use that money for weapons such as these and others that could be phased into U.S. missile defense beginning in January 2012. Technical development of weapons in the system. The Missile Defense Agency said the  Pentagon intends to deploy   some missile interceptors in orbit  over the  next two years to  Test. Whether space-based lasers or interceptor rockets in orbit, once deployed, these weapons would give the United States the ability to attack enemy satellites and incoming warheads. In 2003, the U.S. Missile Defense Agency received $14 million for research on a space-based interceptor test bed, but it has not yet decided to deploy it.

15.doctext: The U.S. Navy amphibious assault ship USS Saipan, together with  Helicopter Mine Countermeasures Squadron 15 Black Hawk Squadron, successfully launched a mission in the  Persian Gulf Completed a training  exercise.  HM-15 Black Hawk Squadron  personnel piloted HM-53E Sea Dragon helicopters to tow the MK-105 magnetic induction mine clearance system, also known as the sled-high-speed catamaran hydrofoil platform. The sled is a high-speed mine clearing system. It is good at clearing magnetic induction and acoustic induction mines, and can perform tasks more flexibly and faster. Years of experience have proven that mine countermeasures operations are extremely useful to navies as they protect ships and personnel from invisible threats in the water.  HM-15  was loaded onto the  USS Saipan  along with the sled on November 3. The exercise marked two in two months in the  Persian Gulf /span_7 Successfully  demonstrated mine clearance capabilities.  USS Saipan is currently  deployed in the   U.S. Navy Fifth Fleet Operations Area, in the Gulf of Aden, Gulf of Oman,  span_13 Maritime security military operations are conducted in the Persian Gulf, Arabian Sea, Red Sea and Indian Ocean. Maritime security military operations contribute to the security and stability of the maritime environment, while also contributing to counter-terrorism and regional security. These military operations combat international terrorists' use of the sea to carry out attacks and transport personnel, weapons or other materials.

16.doctext: The United States and  South Korea   will hold a  large-scale naval military  exercise next week in the  Yellow Sea /span_5  , aimed at sending a strong signal to Pyongyang, a South Korean defense ministry official said. The exercise will be held from June 8 to 11 to demonstrate the strong joint defense posture between  the United States  and  South Korea , the official said on condition of anonymity. Relations between North and South Korea have deteriorated since  South Korea  accused  North Korea of ​​  sinking the  1,200-ton  South Korean Cheonan frigate . The ship sank  on March 26 in the  disputed northern limit of the Yellow Sea, resulting in  46   people   Death. Subsequent international investigations confirmed suspicions that the ship was destroyed by a torpedo fired from a  North Korean  submarine. North and South Korea are still technically at war, and the Korean War ended with an armistice agreement from 1950 to 1953. South Korean officials stated that the  United States will  mobilize a 97,000-ton aircraft carrier  the USS George Washington nuclear-powered aircraft carrier and an  Aegis destroyer and a  nuclear submarine.  South Korea will  deploy a 4,500-ton  destroyer, a  submarine and  F-15K fighter jets /span_27 .  Last week, the  South Korean Navy conducted a separate anti-submarine  exercise in the  Yellow Sea waters in response to  North Korea /span_32 Part of the measures for further attacks. About 10 warships participated in the exercise, which included  live gunfire  and  projecting anti-submarine depth bombs  .

17.doctext: According to a report in "Defense Systems Daily" on December 21, 1999: Raytheon recently received the first $14 million payment of the Rolling Body Missiles Company's guided missile weapon system helicopter, aircraft and surface mode research contract. , aircraft and surface mode research contracts, the rolling body missile system will use an improved software and currently studied Block 1 autonomous infrared seeker to attack helicopters, low-flying small aircraft and surface ships. Helicopter, aircraft and surface model improvements will be put into battlefield use in 2002.  Rolling body missile is a light, fast-response ship-based self-defense missile jointly developed and produced by  the United States and  Germany. A key part of the shipborne self-defense of the two navies, it is currently deployed on more than 50  US and German ships , and more than 60 more ships are planned to be equipped, including  Amphibious ships,  Cruisers,  Destroyers,  Aircraft carriers and patrol boats. The missile's autonomous passive seeker does not require shipboard support after launch, thus creating conditions for high firepower. The Block 1 rolling body missile has made major improvements to the guidance part of the missile, but retains the original dual-mode passive guidance device. It has the additional ability of an image scanning infrared seeker to act independently, which can deal with advanced anti-ship threats. , instead of using active radar guidance device.

18.doctext: On Wednesday,  U.S. Missile Defense Agency  Director Lieutenant General Patrick O'Reilly said when reviewing the U.S. alert system in 2010 that the U.S. is increasingly at risk of ballistic missile attacks. According to the Huntsville Times, at a space and missile defense conference in Huntsville, Alabama, O'Reilly mentioned increasing missiles aimed at maritime targets and said that if such weapons were obtained by extremists, will become a terrible threat, and other countries currently have the ability to manufacture and produce their own missiles. Yoz Rubin, the former head of the Israel Missile Defense Organization, said that the presence of thousands of ballistic missiles in the four countries of Egypt, Libya, Syria and Yemen has caused domestic political instability. And Iran and other countries hold many more of these weapons. According to O'Reilly, an improved design is intended for future  deployment in  Alaska and  California  Land-Based Mid-Layer Defense Missile Interceptor System /span_4's  detection device, experienced two failures in  tests involving the flight of  missile warheads, construction of the system was interrupted, and It is planned to  conduct another  trial in the second or third quarter of next year. It also said that a review of the latest failed  test  to destroy a  aircraft  in outer space would be carried out within about a year.

19.doctext: The Royal Navy's Type 45 destroyer  HMS Diamond  has successfully passed six weeks of  training  and evaluation, crossing the final hurdle before its operational deployment. The UK currently has three Type 45 destroyers ready for deployment. During basic operational sea training,  Diamond  hit missiles launched from a submarine and dealt with fires and water damage in dark and smokey environments.  The British Royal Navy built a total of six Type 45 destroyers, the first three ships  HMS Brave,  HMS Indomitable and  HMS Diamond is planned to be deployed in  2012   , along with three other ships of the same type:  Dragon,  Defender and  The Duncan is undergoing training,  trials and final outfitting. The Type 45 destroyer has a full load displacement of 8,000 tons, a designed maximum speed of more than 27 knots, and a range of more than 7,000 nautical miles. Its main task is to provide local regional fleet defense and has extensive regional air defense capabilities. The ship is equipped with a weapon system that can intercept various air threats, and is also equipped with a close-combat weapon system for terminal defense. Its shipborne advanced active air defense missile system can effectively protect the ship from single or simultaneous missile attacks.

20.doctext: Just as the U.S. Air Force is trying to shut down its combat-responsive space office, the  U.S. Army is planning to demonstrate  validation using  nanosatellites and  A small, low-cost mobile launcher that provides direct support to  deployed   forces. Such an asset would eliminate the need for traditional data processing and distribution systems in the United States.  Army  may seek low-orbit satellites with short life cycles;  Army  has more tactical needs, and the products must be delivered directly to ground troops. The Pentagon has provided low-level investment for three Army advanced concept technology demonstrations: ① Hawkeye, a 15-kilogram, 1-meter resolution  optoelectronic imaging nanosatellite; ② Snapshot, a Beyond visual range communication satellite; ③Jian  Low-cost mobile launcher, which can send a 25 kilogram payload into an orbit of 750 kilometers. Each project will maximize the use of existing commercial products and services. Hawkeye has been built and is expected to launch in 2013; Snapshot will also launch in 2013. The total cost to build the Hawkeye is $1.5 million.  The Army  hopes to use commercial-grade materials instead of aerospace-grade materials, bringing the cost of the sword down to $1.8 million per launch, including range fees. Operable on virtually any concrete road, the  Mobile Launcher  can also be transported using a C-130 transport aircraft.

21.doctext: According to U.S. Department of Defense officials told the media on December 19, as part of  the United States's shift of strategic focus to the Asia-Pacific,  the United States plans to deploy the latest warships and other high-end technological weapons Deployed in Asia Pacific. The senior official said that the Pentagon will deploy  P-8 submarine hunting aircraft,  cruise missiles,  Virginia to Asian ports and bases in the next few years. -class submarine,  Littoral combat ship,  F-35 jet fighter. Defense Secretary Panetta stated on December 18 that  will be deployed at the U.S. Army Iwakuni Base   in   Japan in  2017  New stealth fighter F-35  . If realized, this will be the first time the US military deploys  F-35  at an overseas base. In addition, according to news announced in September,  the United States  will also provide  powerful  X-band radar  to  Japan  . After ten years of  Iraq and  Afghanistan   wars, the Pentagon is beginning to shift its focus to the Asia-Pacific region, which reflects the rise of US military power against China. and its concern over territorial disputes with neighboring countries. The senior Defense Department official said that  the US government  will pay close attention to the movements of China's new political and military leaders regarding territorial disputes.

22.doctext: The U.S. Navy’s Integrated Maritime Network and Enterprise Services received Milestone C approval from Department of Defense acquisition director Frank Kendall on December 14. This means that the  Navy will deploy the  San Diego-based USS Milius destroyer in limited production and for the first  deployment   Next Generation Tactical-Class Maritime Network CANES  /span_3 . C4I project executive officer Jerry Burroughs said at a press conference of the Navy Space and Naval Warfare Systems Command that  CANES  will provide the fleet with a new capability model, integrating five traditional networks into one network, simplifying support and training and combat procedures.  Northrop Grumman Corporation  is the prime contractor for the program. The contract is worth US$700 million. It is planned to deploy   CANES  on approximately 190  ships  , submarines and  maritime combat platforms  . In addition to integrating 5 traditional networks,  CANES  can also support approximately 40 C4I applications.

23.doctext: Northrop Grumman recently received the first protective cover for its new generation MQ-8C Fire Scout unmanned helicopter. The MQ-8C unmanned aerial vehicle will be able to withstand strong electric fields and electromagnetic waves. interference, providing stronger protection capabilities for key electronic components of the aircraft. If this protective cover is not equipped, the electronic devices inside the helicopter will be extremely susceptible to lightning and other electromagnetic interference on the aircraft. Summit Aviation is responsible for the design and manufacturing of the protective shield. The company was selected to undertake the construction contract last year. The related products came out within five months. The product manufactured by the company is named Faraday Cage.  Northrop Grumman  is the prime contractor for the U.S. Navy Fire Scout program.  Northrop Grumman  will build a total of 28 MQ-8C durable upgraded Fire Scout drones based on modified Bell-407 helicopters. Once completed, the Faraday cage will be shipped to  Northrop Grumman's Unmanned Systems Center in  Moss Point before being installed on the MQ-8C fuselage.  Electronics Devices will be pre-commissioned for integration  testing and more. The MQ-8C Permanently Upgraded Fire Scout UAV has a larger fuselage, its range can be increased by more than 1/3 compared to  MQ-8B , and the load weight it can carry has also increased significantly.  MQ-8B UAV is currently  deployed on  U.S. Navy frigates and  Afghanistan, and can be deployed on sea and land The commander provides intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance capabilities.

24.doctext: In light of ongoing quality issues with the new ships, the Chief of Naval Operations placed the new Joint High Speed ​​Transport Ship program under the Littoral Combat Ship Committee. Jonathan Greenert mentioned in his memo that  JHSV  has the same high-speed performance and load adjustment capabilities as LCS and can perform similar tasks in similar environments. Greenert formed the LCS Program Committee in August 2012 to oversee the development of LCS ships and their mission modules. Rear Adm. Mark Buzbee of the Military Sealift Command also joined the committee as a result of joining the JHSV program. According to the  Navy  plan,  JHSV  will use an aluminum catamaran type, with a total of 10 ships built by  Austal America . The first ship  Pioneer was delivered on  December 5, 2012    and  stationed at   home port  , and entered service on February 16, 2013. The second  USS Choctaw City is expected to be delivered to   Military Sealift Command in the summer of  2013    Millinocket will be delivered  in late 2013   . There are currently three LCSs in service, and the fourth one is expected to be delivered  at the end of 2013    .

25.doctext: U.S. Fleet Command will be deployed on  May 14 at the location of U.S. Naval Forces Central Command -  Manama, the capital of Bahrain   /span_3 5  Coast Guard Ships. The USS Great Tempest, USS Tornado and USS Thunderbolt are expected to arrive in  Bahrain  this summer, with the other two arriving next year. Since 2006, there have been five  Coast Patrol Ships  responsible for coastal patrol missions within the U.S. Fifth Fleet theater. Coast patrol ship crews currently stationed in  Bahrain  are working alone and cannot take rotational leave. Through this additional deployment, these sailors will receive six months of rotational rest to reunite with their families. Under the condition of ensuring the same combat capabilities, the crew members have sufficient vacation time. By  Spring 2014, 10  Coast Patrol Vessels will be permanently  deployed in  Bahrain, with 3 remaining In the continental United States.  Coast patrol ship  provides a fast and reliable combat platform for the U.S. Navy to respond to emergencies in shallow water environments. The main tasks of these ships are coastal warning patrols, interception and surveillance, and coastal operations. They are an important force in executing the U.S. Navy's maritime strategy.

26.doctext: Raytheon Company announced that it has  delivered more than 500 airborne active phased array radars, including:  APG-79 ,  APG-633  and  APG-821  have accumulated more than 400,000 combat flight hours in the F-15, F/A-18E/F and EA-18G. In 2000,  Raytheon Company  designed, developed and deployed the world's first fighter AESA radar. Through years of use, Raytheon AESA radars have been found to have lower lifetime costs and significantly improved system reliability compared to mechanically scanned radars. Currently,  the U.S. Air Force has completed the development and  testing of Raytheon's new generation  APG-821AESA radar and launched  in March this year /span_9 Operational  testing and evaluation began.  Raytheon's  multi-mode, multi-function AESA series radars can significantly improve fighter combat capabilities, including: simultaneous air-to-air/air-to-ground combat, excellent detection, targeting, tracking and self-protection capabilities.

27.doctext: Philippines   Tuesday held a  welcome ceremony in  Subic Bay   to celebrate the  retirement of the U.S. Coast Guard cutter  Joined the  Philippine Navy and became the second largest ship in the Philippine Navy. The ship will  be deployed  to the  South China Sea region  which is rich in oil and gas resources and is disputed by China. Philippine President Benigno Aquino III attended the welcoming ceremony and paid tribute to the ship. The  patrol ship  with a displacement of 3,250 tons was renamed  Ramon Alcaraz  and is anchored at the Subic Bay Naval Port northwest of the capital Manila.  Subic Bay was once a U.S. naval base. The U.S. military withdrew in 1991. Recently,  Philippines took advantage of its geographical advantage close to disputed islands in the South China Sea and planned to add a new navy here. and air force base. These old ships cannot weaken the absolute superiority of the Chinese navy, but  Philippines and U.S. officials believe that the addition of U.S. retired ships will change people's view of  Philippines as the most powerful navy in the region. The impression of a weak navy.  The United States  and  Philippines  have a military alliance and are obliged to assist  Philippines  in resisting attacks by external forces.  USS Alcaraz is the second largest displacement warship in the Philippine Navy, second only to  the United States   2011   presented  Another  retired Coast Guard patrol ship. The largest ship in the Philippines is named  USS Gregorio Pilar , with a displacement of 3,390 tons. It once performed patrol missions in the Scarborough Shoal, which is disputed with China. Scarborough Shoal is 260 kilometers west of  Subic Bay . After the withdrawal of  Philippine warships , China actually controlled this area.

TACIP Container  is a fully IP-based  system  capable of establishing a secure and robust network for deployed troops in harsh locations. Bob Lambert, principal solutions architect for EADS' Kaixidian subsidiary, told Jane's that multiple  TACIP boxes can be used in series to monitor communications records in organizations large and small, but it is not practical The above is envisioned to serve medium-sized office information system communications with a scale of about 10 to 100 users. This provides a core service functionality ranging from email/communications, office environment and document management and IT infrastructure processes, including secure data and application hosting. It also provides a unified communications infrastructure with data connection speeds of 100 Mbit/s or 1 Gbit/s LAN, POE, serial interfaces, fax, WiFi, as well as support for access control, ID management, firewalls and The gateway provides security tools. These gateways work through a single cross-domain TACIP box, for example, radio station users communicate with others via IP or GSM networks.

29.doctext: The Boeing Company Two tracking and data relay satellites  TDRS-K  and  TDRS-L  developed for NASA's Tracking and Data Relay Satellite System project The space  test  and the ground  test  have been completed respectively, which will further enhance the tracking and communication network of  NASA . The  TDRS-K  currently in orbit was launched in January 2013. All on-orbit  tests  have been completed and  handed over to   NASA  . The satellite will provide a critical information link for  NASA 's low-Earth orbit spacecraft and satellite control centers. The next satellite of NASA's Tracking and Data Relay Satellite System program,  TDRS-L , is already at   Boeing's  Satellite Facility in El Segundo Completed performance  testing and is ready to be shipped to the Kennedy Space Center in Florida and will be launched in late 2013.  TDRS-K  and  TDRS-L  are the first two satellites of the third generation of the Tracking and Data Relay Satellite System, achieving low cost while improving payload capacity and communications Bandwidth has been improved. The third satellite in the series, TDRS-M, has completed critical design review and is currently in the production stage and will be launched in 2015.

30.doctext: Russia's  Vikramaditya aircraft carrier  modified for the  Indian Navy will be launched on  November 15th   Delivered to   India  and arrived in  India  in February 2014. According to the original plan,  INS Vikramaditya  should be delivered to  Indian Navy  in 2008, but its modification process was not smooth and encountered a series of delays.  Last December   Russia  planned to deliver the aircraft carrier, but during the  sea trials  it was discovered that its boiler was not working properly. An official from Rosoboronexport stated that the  aircraft carrier Vikramaditya will be  stationed in  Mumbai and will arrive in  Mumbai Prior to this, the aircraft carrier would make short-term berths at 14 ports.

31.doctext: The U.S. Navy's San Antonio-class amphibious transport dock ship  USS Somerset successfully passed the acceptance inspection  of the  U.S. Navy on  September 20, 2013 Sea trial, the ship is the ninth ship of the  San Antonio class and was built by Huntington Ingalls  Avondale Shipyard. After successful acceptance,  Somerset will be  delivered to the   Navy and will be officially  deployed in  next spring  . LPD26 John Mursa and LPD27 Portland are being built at Huntington Ingalls' shipyard in Pascagoula, Mississippi, and are expected to be completed in 2016 and 2017 respectively. Each LPD17 class ship is designed to deploy combat and support functions, including a flight deck and berth deck. The area for loading combat vehicles exceeds 23,000 square feet. It has enough capacity to accommodate more than 800 Marines. The berth deck can take off and land. Osprey MV-22 helicopter.

32.doctext: Senior Indian Navy officials said that currently Indian Navy has 136 warships, but in the next ten years, the number of Indian Navy ships will reach 200, and each of the three naval commands will have one aircraft carrier , Indian domestic shipyards have undertaken a large number of ship construction orders.  Indian Navy  hopes to build more destroyers and frigates. Currently, India only has one amphibious transport ship, INS Garashwar.  Indian Navy  plans to build another 4 amphibious transport ships.  Indian Navy The  aircraft carrier INS Vikramaditya purchased from  Russia will also be delivered in  November    will be  deployed to  Karwar Naval Base. Another  Indian-made aircraft carrier is also under construction and will be  Stationed at  Visakhapatnam on the east coast of India.

34.doctext: Lockheed Martin   today  delivered  its 14th  to the  U.S. Air Force   at its Marietta facility C-5M Super Galaxy improved strategic transport aircraft. The U.S. Air Force crew flew the aircraft from the Marietta factory to the Stewart Air National Guard Base, where the aircraft will undergo interior painting and refurbishment before flying to its permanent  station base  Dover Air Force Base. This aircraft is the second  C-5M  delivered in the past two weeks and the fourth aircraft of this type delivered in 2013.  The C-5M  is currently the only true strategic transport aircraft of the US military that can fly to anywhere in the world in one flight without aerial refueling. Before 2017,  the U.S. Air Force  will receive a total of 52  C-5M Super Galaxy  .

35.doctext: Russia confirmed on Monday that it had deployed  tactical ballistic missiles in the  border area with NATO international treaties. Germany's "Bild" reported last weekend that  Russia secretly placed 10 sets of  Iskander-M missile systems in the  Baltic Sea enclave of Kaliningrad deployments, in addition to areas bordering the  Baltic States and  NATO members Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. The deployment marks the realization of Moscow's threat response to  NATO's planned deployment of  the so-called  European Missile Defense System  Russian border    A tough stance. Russian military spokesman Major General Igor Konashenkov said that the deployment of the Iskander missile battalion on the border of the Western Military Zone does not violate any international agreement. Konashenkov declined to provide details on the number and specific locations of the  missiles  deployed.  Iskander-M missile  belongs to the  Mobile Battlefield Missile System . Each set is equipped with two solid-propelled single-stage 9M723K1 guided missiles and has quasi-ballistic capabilities. According to reports, this type of missile has an effective range of 400 kilometers and is not included in the range of intermediate-range nuclear missiles prohibited by the 1987 Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty signed by the United States and Russia. However, the  missiles  deployed at Kalinin could hit NATO targets in Poland, Lithuania and even Germany.

Subject: Russia
Russia
Location: NATO members Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania

36.doctext: According to a report in Defense Data on January 23, 2002,  ANPC Corporation   launched  the  Firefly Active Transmitter Response Landing System  . The system can be loaded into a mobile trailer, allowing military and civilian aircraft to safely land in almost any location in adverse weather conditions. Utilizing civilian TLS transponder landing system technology, the  Firefly System  provides precise tracking and guidance through interrogation of radar beacon transponders within the aircraft. It requires no new avionics and can be fully deployed by three military personnel in six hours. Unlike traditional instrument landing systems, the  Firefly system  has no requirements for the terrain in front of the runway, so a temporary airport can be established anywhere.  The Firefly system  will be installed on the rear of the C-130 Hercules.  ANPC 's Director of New Business Development said,  Firefly sets a new standard in air force safety, with the system adapting to uneven and mountainous terrain to enable precise approach to aircraft anywhere . After detailed  testing and evaluation by the  FAA  and  ANPC , the system received type certification from the FAA in December 2001, which will prove that the system is The technical and operational aspects can serve as a national space system.

37.doctext: An industrial team led by Lockheed Martin  announced on February 19 that the keel of the USS Sioux City, the 11th  Littoral Combat Ship  of the U.S. Navy, has been laid. The team is responsible for building the Freedom-class  Littoral Combat Ships for the  U.S. Navy. Currently, 2 ships have been  delivered and another 5 are under construction, including 1 The ship is nearly completed. As the  United States's first  Littoral Combat Ship, the  USS Liberty has completed its  deployment in South Asia span_9, during which it participated in many international maritime exercises, completed patrol missions in the South China Sea, and participated in some disaster relief operations. The ship's platform is designed to carry multiple mission packages, including anti-ship warfare, mine countermeasures and anti-submarine warfare. Next, the Freedom-class  Littoral Combat Ship   USS Ford Vos  will be deployed  late this year    . Lockheed Martin's Littoral Combat Ship team includes Marinette Maritime and Gibbs & Cobbs Ship Design.

38.doctext: RIA Novosti reported that  Russia announced on Wednesday that  this year would begin  deploying   robots to protect the country's  robots. span_4 Strategic Nuclear Missile Base. Major Dmitry Andreyev, spokesman for the Ministry of Defense, said that the  mobile, unmanned security system  will be deployed at five  missile launch bases  across the country. He said:  In March this year,  Russia’s Strategic Missile Forces began  testing of the  mobile robot system being developed to protect key facilities span_10. The spokesperson also said that  robots  can provide backup for security forces, detect intruders, destroy moving targets and perform surveillance tasks. The U.S. Department of Energy also uses robots to patrol remote areas of a former nuclear weapons testing site in Nevada. Russia's relations with the West have never been so tense since the end of the Cold War, and in this context, the deployment of robots increases Russia's  nuclear weapons sites security. NATO and the United States have stepped up military deployments in countries bordering Ukraine.  Russia  has so far resisted European and American demands to withdraw its military forces from Ukraine's Crimean peninsula.

39.doctext: U.S. Secretary of Defense Hagel, who is visiting  Japan, said during a meeting with Japanese Defense Minister Onodera on the morning of the 6th that in view of North Korea’s provocative behavior, the Japan-U.S. Security Treaty and the  United States's national security interests,  The United States will send  2 more ballistic missile interceptors to  Japan   before  2017 Performance  Aegis Ship. Currently, the  U.S. military is stationed in  Japan   with 5  Aegis ships. After adding 2 more ships, the U.S. military is  span_11 Japan has deployed 7  Aegis ships. At the beginning of the talks, Abe said: As the security environment in Asia is deteriorating day by day, he hopes to send a signal that the solid alliance between Japan and the United States remains unchanged. He also emphasized that discussions on the relationship between the right of collective self-defense and the Constitution are being solidly advanced. Hagel expressed unequivocal support for  Japan 's preparations to authorize the exercise of the right of collective self-defense. He said: Once again, we welcome this move by  Japan . Hagel also said: It is our common interest to safeguard the stability and security of this region. The two sides also reached agreement on revising Japan-US defense cooperation guidelines and other matters to accelerate the expansion of cooperation between the Self-Defense Forces and the US military. During the talks, Itsunori Onodera and Hagel reached a consensus that Japan and the United States should work closely together and deepen cooperation with South Korea, Australia and other countries to deal with North Korea's nuclear and missile development issues. In order to revise the Japan-US Defense Cooperation Guidelines within this year, which stipulates the division of responsibilities between the Self-Defense Forces and the US military, the two sides also agreed to speed up relevant work.

40.doctext: As the situation in Iraq becomes tense, US Secretary of Defense Hagel has ordered the  USS Bush aircraft carrier  to enter the   Persian Gulf  from the North Arabian Sea . This will provide aircraft carrier commanders with more flexible military options to protect the lives and interests of Americans in Iraq. Together with the  USS Bush aircraft carrier  entering the   Persian Gulf is also  the Philippine   USS Sea guided missile cruiser and  guided missile destroyer USS Truxton. The aircraft carrier  is expected to enter the  Persian Gulf  on the evening of the 15th .  The USS Bush aircraft carrier  left its home port of Norfolk, Virginia, in February this year to perform defense replacement missions in the Middle East. These forward-deployed military forces will strongly support maritime security operations. The U.S. Navy says its military presence in the  Persian Gulf  supports  the United States'  commitment to long-term security and stability in the region.

41.doctext: India  The first domestically produced Kamorta-class anti-submarine frigate  Kamorta  will be commissioned in Visakhapatnam in July. The ship was built by Gardenridge Shipbuilding Engineering Co., Ltd., and 4 more ships will be built in the future. The ship adopts a stealth appearance design and integrates a new domestic rocket launcher for the first time. It has a total length of 109m, a displacement of about 3400t, a maximum cruising speed of 25kn, and a range of 3500nm at a speed of 18kn. It can accommodate 123 crew members including 17 officers. A helicopter can be deployed on the stern landing deck, and a fully automatic helicopter universal traction system and a folding hangar door are used to improve anti-submarine performance. In addition, the ship is also equipped with  bow sound navigation and ranging sonar  and  Revathi surveillance radar  to enhance its underwater, surface and air surveillance capabilities. The ship's power plant is 4 self-designed  diesel engines with a speed of 1050r/min and a power of 3888kW. In addition, there are 4  Wärtsilä equipment  equipped Powered by diesel generators and  Kirlosca engines, the latter delivered by  French SEMTPIELSTICK company   ,  raft gearbox  Delivered by  European shipbuilding company DCNS   .

42.doctext: U.S. Department of Defense spokesman and Army Colonel Steve Warren told reporters today that  the U.S. military  yesterday reported to  the Ukrainian army   Delivered 3  lightweight, anti-mortar radar systems. Warren said this is the first of 20  radar systems that will be  delivered in the  coming weeks to the  U.S. military span_8 will begin providing training to the  Ukrainian Army in mid-December. A spokesman for the U.S. Department of Defense said that the radar system can detect mortar shells launched by the enemy and quickly calculate the origin of the mortar shells launched by the enemy, allowing friendly forces to respond appropriately. The Ministry of Defense spokesman added that it would be up to the  Ukrainian Army  to decide how, when and where to deploy the radar system. At the same time, it will also depend on Ukraine whether these radar systems will be installed in the firing system to attack the turrets, or whether they will be used independently. The radar system is part of a U.S. commitment to provide equipment and training worth approximately $118 million to  the Ukrainian military .

43.doctext: November 10 Successfully completed the long-awaited  test, concluding nearly eight years of joint research and development,  Israel and  Indian Navy /span_3 Prepare to  install the advanced  Barak-8 air and missile defense system on  warships.  The Barak-8 vertical launch air and missile defense system was developed under the leadership of  Israel Aerospace Industries. It has a range of 70 kilometers and can provide 360-degree defense against sea skimming. Saturation attacks on missile and aerodynamic threat targets. IAI executives said that the  Barak-8 sea-based variant is now ready for full-rate production for use by the navies of  Israel and India, with an announcement expected within months. initial combat capability. Meanwhile, a team led by  IAI  is preparing to roll out a land-based version of the Barak-8 for the Indian Air Force, with deployment expected to begin in 2015 and extend into 2017. Defense ministry officials and naval officers from both countries hailed the successful interception test on November 10 as all system elements were verified and at the same time cemented the strategic relationship between the two countries. Boaz Levy, executive vice president and general manager of IAI Systems' Missiles and Space Group, told Israeli reporters that issues related to the missile engines have been resolved for  sea-launched versions and all land-launched versions  Parts are  verified and ready for mass production.

44.doctext: According to a report in Defense Systems Journal on April 8, 2002:  The German Army's  satellite communications program has entered the first phase of construction. After extensive  trials,  NDSatCom Corporation has built its first  satellite  satellite communication ground station    Transferred to  German Army. Construction of the  ground station  is expected to be completed by the end of 2002. The satellite communications contract signed between  NDSatCom Company and  German Army includes, in addition to 14 multi-channel and 26 single-channel  ground stations Other services necessary to ensure the successful deployment of satellite communication systems, such as NDSatCom will provide training facilities for the German Army School, train operators, etc. When completed, the  new satellite communications system  will be able to provide a complete communications network to connect German troops abroad with communications systems at home. The communications network consists of mobile ground stations, fixed ground stations, and network management facilities that control and monitor all system components.

45.doctext: The US Department of Defense stated in its news release on December 26, 2014 that  the United States has  deployed its second  missile defense radar . The  AN/TPY-2 radar is a transportable system and a high-capability sensor for homeland and theater missile defense, the news said, indicating the deployment of the  new radar to central Japan Will be used exclusively by U.S. Pacific Command and U.S. Northern Command. 47.doctext: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Rogozin believes that although the situation in 2015 will be unprecedentedly complex, defense procurement can be completed smoothly. Russia's defense procurement total in 2014 was 1.7 trillion rubles. According to Rogozin's forecast, total growth in 2015 is about 20%. On January 14, the Military Industry Committee discussed the need to ensure the completion of defense procurement in 2015. At this meeting, the leaders of the Russian Ministry of Industry and Trade, the Ministry of Finance and the Ministry of Economic Development jointly discussed with the heads of military industry enterprises that in 2015, the completion of defense procurement must be guaranteed under complex economic conditions. Russian Ministry of Defense Minister Shoigu said that in 2015 the army will receive about 700 armored vehicles, about 15,500 cars, 126 fixed-wing aircraft and 88 helicopters, as well as 2 Iskander-M missiles system. The Navy will receive 2 multi-purpose submarines and 5 surface ships. Shoigu said:  Deployment  The  Voronezh Radar Station  in  Yeniseisk  will begin operational duty in 2015, one year earlier than expected.  Deployment  The  radar station  in  Barnaul  will also be put into use 6 months ahead of schedule.

The fifth and sixth boats of the ALROSA class submarine will be named  Veliky Novgod and  Korpino, and are planned to be launched on  In November 2016,   was delivered to   Russian Black Sea Fleet .  The Russian Navy has ordered a total of 6 Type 636 submarines for the  Black Sea Fleet. The 6 submarines are all named after Russian hero cities. The first submarine of this type is  Novorossiysk.  was delivered in  August 2014    fleet, the second  Rostov-on-Don was delivered in  2014 Delivered at the end of the year    . Both submarines are undergoing  testing  in the  North Sea  and will be stationed at the Black Sea Fleet station after completion of testing. The Type 636 submarine is a third-generation diesel-electric submarine. As the lowest-noise model among Russian submarines, this type of submarine can fight against surface and underwater ships and is used to protect naval bases, coastal areas and sea lines of communication.

49.doctext: United States  Robert Collins, Army Distributed Common Ground System program manager, said that currently the  Army  is planning to implement DCGS-A Increment 2. DCGS-A is one of the key systems of the  Army  and is mainly used for intelligence distribution and long-distance analysis. Collins said in a recent interview that  DCGS Increment 1 Version 1  is already  fielded  by the  U.S. Army  around the world. The system was used 101 times during Ebola relief operations in West Africa.  Version 2 of DCGS Increment 1  has just completed development  testing  at  Fort Huachuca  . In NIE15.1, we deployed it to the 2nd Brigade of the 1st Armored Division. It will complete  NIE15.2  related  testing  in  May 2015  . Robert Collins will present a discussion on intelligence cooperation at the 14th Annual C4ISR and Cyber ​​Conference on April 7. He also said that during the development process of DCGS Increment 1, the industry was deeply involved. As we move toward Increment 2, we've largely removed the roadblocks. We ask industry to provide information on the environment, technology, funding flows, continued processing of incremental equipment, and how to better cooperate.

50.doctext: The U.S. Navy deployed its fourth nuclear attack submarine at  Guam Naval Base  , marking another step in the Department of Defense's shift to the Asia-Pacific theater. One step forward. The  submarine deployed  this time is the  USS Toledo  originally deployed in  Groton, Connecticut . It is a Los Angeles-class attack nuclear submarine.  The United States The Navy previously deployed three nuclear submarines in  Guam , namely  USS Oklahoma City and  USS Chicago span_10 and  Key West.  The U.S. Navy began to deploy   nuclear submarines in  Guam   starting from  October 2002,  In 2007 the size of the nuclear submarine force stationed in  Guam will be expanded to three. The deployment of nuclear submarines to  Guam  is a boost to the shrinking U.S. submarine force. Compared to Pearl Harbor or San Diego, submarines stationed in  Guam  have shorter ranges to combat zones and can perform longer cruise missions in the Western Pacific and Indian Ocean regions.  The US military  has a total of 30  deployed  in the  Pacific  and 30  nuclear submarines  in the  Atlantic Ocean   Deployment There are 22 ships. Submarines stationed in  Guam  are supported by the submarine maintenance supply ship USS Frank Cable, which also provides support for submarines visiting  Guam .

51.doctext: The U.S. Maritime Systems Command announced that the first forward floating base  Levi's B Puller   built by General Dynamics NASSCO Shipyard  was delivered to the United States   Navy.  USS Levis is based on the Alaska-class commercial tanker design and can carry  Navy special forces and mine countermeasures helicopters, as well as amphibious assault forces for Sea Systems Command and the Marine Corps, providing Flexible frontier presence capabilities. Henry Steven, tactical and battlefield naval project manager, said that  NASSCO Shipyard used mature design and production lines to manufacture AFSB, meeting the needs of the  Navy and reducing risks and costs. to the lowest. MLP-3 is the third ship based on the Alaska-class design. The first two are mobile landing platforms, namely the USS Montford Point and the USS John Glenn. The two ships can carry military supplies and  U.S. Navy  air-cushion landing craft. In December last year, the Naval Sea Systems Command awarded NASSCO Shipyard a $498 million contract to build a second forward floating base, and plans to allocate funds to build a third ship in fiscal 2017. The first two AFSBs are planned to be deployed to the Navy's Fifth Fleet in the  Middle East  and the Seventh Fleet in the Pacific. Currently, the  Navy  is deploying the  USS Ponce  as an interim AFSB   in the  Middle East  .

52.doctext: Raytheon Company announced that day that the  U.S. Navy and  Raytheon Company successfully intercepted Super Vision for the first time using  Standard-6 missiles from supersonic targets. A Navy sandship located at the  White Sands Range launched a  Standard-6 missile to intercept a medium-range supersonic target. The target location was determined by sensors located elsewhere through the Navy's integrated fire control- Air defense net provided. This weapon has greatly expanded the defense range of the  Navy. Mike Cambisi, Raytheon Company's Standard-6 missile project manager, said that ships can now assist missiles in intercepting targets through long-range sensor data, more than ever before. Fire weapons quickly to deal with threats.  Raytheon  stated that  last summer  ,  Standard-6 missile   hit  over-the-horizon and supersonic targets respectively. This  test is the first time that the  Standard-6 missile intercepts beyond visual range and supersonic targets. The missile has become the first multi-mission missile with the ability to intercept beyond visual range and supersonic targets. .  Standard-6 missiles are currently  deployed on   U.S. Navy   ships, which can fight fixed-wing aircraft and helicopters, and drones at long distances Man-machine, cruise missile and other targets.  The missile  adopts the traditional standard missile aerodynamic layout and the improved active radar seeker of the advanced medium-range air-to-air missile.  Last month,  Raytheon   delivered the first batch of mass-produced  Standard-6 missiles. Produced by Redstone Missile Factory.

53.doctext: U.S. Air Force The first batch of  combat F-35A  was delivered  to  Utah on  September 2, 2015   Hill Air Force Base, State.  Hill Base  The 34th Fighter Squadron and the 466th Fighter Squadron, as well as related units of the Air Force Reserve Command, will become the first combat-equipped units to fly and maintain F-35 fighter jets. Colonel Brad Lyons, commander of the 388th Fighter Squadron, flew one of the two aircraft  F-35A aircraft from the Lockheed Martin Fort Worth factory to  Hill Air Force Base . The two aircraft, with Air Force serial numbers 13-5071 and 13-5072, are among the 72  F-35A aircraft that will eventually  be deployed to the  Salt Lake City base /span_10's first aircraft. This aircraft delivery marks the establishment of the  10th F-35 base, and  Hill Base is the US Air Force's  fifth F-35 base .

54.doctext: The U.S. Sea Systems Command stated that  the U.S. Navy  will start the electromechanical hybrid transformation of 34 DDG-51IIA destroyers next year to reduce the ship's fuel consumption. This system will connect a propulsion motor to the main reduction gearbox of the ship to provide propulsion power when the ship's speed is less than 13 knots. It is expected that a single ship can save thousands of barrels of fuel every year. In 2012, the  U.S. Navy  awarded  L-3 Company  a $50 million electromechanical hybrid propulsion research and development contract. The company  earlier this year   delivered  two  electromechanical hybrid system prototypes  for trial  testing  and is expected to be completed in fiscal year 2016 First shipment in the fourth quarter. Previously,  The British Royal Navy  also  applied  the  electromechanical hybrid system  on its  Type 23 frigate  . The DDG-51 class destroyer uses the LM-2500 gas turbine. Although the ship is more efficient when sailing at high speeds, it is inefficient when cruising at low speeds and wastes fuel. Maritime Systems Command said that when a ship is deployed, using the  electromechanical hybrid system  half of the time can extend the refueling interval by 2.5 days. The U.S. Sea Systems Command began studying electromechanical hybrid propulsion concepts in 2008, when military fuel prices reached $174/barrel. Before 2012,  The U.S. Navy  awarded a contract to General Atomics to develop a  electromechanical hybrid propulsion system  on the DDG-103 destroyer, using permanent magnet propulsion motors from DRS.  The U.S. Navy will equip two  DDG-51 Class IIA destroyers in the  fiscal year 2016   Outfitting, followed by Outfitting is completed at a rate of 4 ships per year.

56.doctext: Recently,  Raytheon Company won a US$500 million ship-based ballistic missile contract, aiming to design a  ship-based ballistic missile that can capture, track and destroy incoming missiles . The contract amendment, announced by  U.S. Missile Defense Agency officials, says  Raytheon will build,  test and  deliver 17  SM-3 missiles. This type of missile will be able to intercept and destroy short- to medium-range ballistic missiles. It uses outer space jamming devices to affect incoming missiles. The jamming device would collide with the incoming missile, with the effect equivalent of a 10-ton truck traveling at 600 miles per hour.  SM-3 missiles  can be launched from land or from Aegis destroyers and cruisers.  Standard-3BLOCK-1B  Equipped with an enhanced two-color infrared guidance device, its guidance and propulsion capabilities have also been upgraded.  Raytheon Company is developing the next generation of  Standard-3BLOCK-IIA missiles and is working with  Japan to prepare for deployment on land and  surface ships  on. It has two new distinguishing features that allow it to defend against a wider range of rocket motors, as well as a larger kinetic energy warhead than before. It is reported that this type of missile will be tested in  this year    and  deployed  in  2018 . This contract will be executed in Arizona and needs to be completed before March 2020. The total contract value will reach $630 million.

60.doctext: France   Jaguar EBRC reconnaissance vehicle  is the most complex wheeled armored combat vehicle under the Scorpion program, developed by  Nycost Systems, Renault Trucks Defense and Thales A team composed of communications and security companies jointly developed and are currently manufacturing three prototype vehicles and one set of mobility test devices. 63.doctext: [US defpost website reported on September 26, 2020]  The U.S. Naval Air Systems Command awarded  Swedish Saab AG a fixed-price contract worth US$25 million for production. and  delivered two sets of  AN/SPN-501 shipboard air traffic control radars, and one  Navy installation and inspection kit.  AN/SPN-50 radar is developed based on Saab's Giraffe agile multi-beam radar and can be  deployed on the U.S. Navy's  Independence-class Littoral Combat Ship , used for air and ground surveillance; it can provide aircraft position, radar signals and radar information and other data for aircraft sorting and separation, airspace identification and control, safety alerts, weather processing and landing guidance. This type of radar is currently in the engineering and manufacturing research and development stage, and is expected to be officially produced by the end of 2020; in fiscal year 2021, it will gradually replace the Navy's current AN/SPN-43C radar system on Nimitz-class aircraft carriers and amphibious assault ships; expected  It will reach initial operational capability by the end of 2022 and will be  deployed on the  USS Eisenhower aircraft carrier and the USS Bougainville amphibious assault ship currently under construction; it is planned to be deployed by fiscal 2028 A total of 25  AN/SPN-50 radars were produced in the year. The modern radar processing technology used can improve target detection and tracking capabilities in electromagnetic interference environments, improve the spectrum limitation problem of the AN/SPN-43C radar, and achieve compatibility with the new AN/SPY-62 enterprise-level air surveillance radar .​

76.doctext: [Belgian Navy Awareness Network reported on November 23, 2020] On October 23,  French Defense Procurement Agency notified a framework related to the  Navy offshore patrol ship plan protocol. Maritime patrol ships  will perform a variety of tasks, including deterrence, situation assessment, personnel escort, and interest protection. This plan aims to design a  multi-purpose patrol ship  with better situational awareness than existing patrol equipment, self-defense capabilities against asymmetric threats, and equipped with a high-performance communications system. The offshore patrol ship program will comprehensively renew the patrol ships stationed in  France mainland, including  stationed in   Brest and  Toulon /span_10's  ocean patrol vessel and  stationed at  Cherbourg's  official patrol boat.  The maritime patrol ship  will fully take over French territorial defense and maritime security operations, while focusing on strengthening its aircraft carrying capabilities.

77.doctext: The F124 anti-aircraft frigate FGS  Saxony will become the first ship deployed by the  German Navy in  2018   . It is planned to be Departing Wilhelmshaven Naval Base on January 5, 2018. The lead ship of the F124 frigate will join the EU-led Operation Sofia in the Mediterranean. The purpose of this operation is to prevent the smuggling of people and weapons by monitoring the Mediterranean waters between Italy and Libya.  Saxony Frigate picture source:  German Navy This time  Saxony replaced the F123 frigate Mecklenburg that participated in this operation in August 2017 -Western Pomerania.  Saxony  and her crew will be led by Colonel Mirko Wilken, who assumed command of Saxony five months ago.  Saxony  is the first of three F124 Saxony-class frigates. Germany originally planned to build four frigates of this class, but it was finally decided to build three, the other two being Hamburg and Hesse.  Sachsen was laid at the  Blohm+Voss shipyard in February 1999,  delivered    Navy. The ship is 143 meters long, has a displacement of 5,800 tons, and is powered by one steam turbine and two diesel engines.

78.doctext: The U.S. Space Force plans to carry out the first launch mission after the establishment of the  Space Force on March 19, launching a  space situational awareness small satellite TDO-2  Launched together with the Advanced Extremely High Frequency-6 communications satellite.  The U.S. Space Force Space and Missile Systems Center delivered the delivery to  Cape Canaveral Air Force Base   on  March 6  A fully  tested and integrated  TDO-2 satellite. The TDO-2 project was sponsored by the Air Force Research Laboratory and developed by the Georgia Institute of Technology. It is a small satellite carrying multiple payloads of the US government. It can use lasers to collect distance data of other objects in space and has optical calibration functions. In this mission, AEHF-6 serves as the anchor satellite, and the  TDO-2  payload is integrated into the rear of the Centaur rocket's upper stage and will be first  deployed  . This will be the second time the U.S. military has carried out a ride-sharing launch in a national security space launch mission. The TDO-2 program will demonstrate  verification  payload replacement capabilities late in the integration effort, allowing  the Space Force  to replace payloads up to one month before launch.  The Space Force  believes this operation allows for greater flexibility in deploying national security payloads.

79.doctext: Recently,  Turkish Roketsan Company President Murat Iginji said that soon  Turkish Armed Forces will use new drones, such as unmanned combat aircraft Bayraktar Akanc and Turkish Aerospace Industries Corporation The domestically produced medium-altitude, long-endurance UAV Aksungur was developed. While developing new combat drones,  Rokestan Company  will increase the range of its small smart munitions and equip them with the country’s armed combat drones. Ijinji added that the  Sungur pedestal air defense system developed by  Roketsan Company is ready to be  handed over to the   military  , the system can be installed on a vehicle and launch missiles from the vehicle. In addition, a  single system combining  Sungur  and Cirit pedestal-mounted laser-guided missiles  will also be  delivered  to  the Turkish Armed Forces Force, a missile capable of striking both air and ground targets, is in the final stages of production.

80.doctext: The  Galaxy-13/Horizons-1 spacecraft manufactured by  Boeing Company based on the H601HP platform was launched on  Beijing time  October 1 12 At 03:03 it was successfully  lifted off by a  Zenit-3SL launch vehicle co-produced by Ukraine and Russia from a sea launch platform near the equator. Jointly owned by  United States  and  Japan , the satellite's mission is to relay high-definition television service throughout the United States. One hour into the flight, the  4090-kilogram satellite  was  deployed  into a  geostationary transfer orbit  . Over the next few days, the  satellite  maneuvered itself into geosynchronous orbit at 127 degrees west longitude, 22,300 miles above the equator. Pan Am Satellite Corporation of Connecticut, USA, and JSAT Corporation of Tokyo, Japan, will provide digital video, INTERNET and data transmission services to North and Central America, Alaska and Hawaii through this satellite. The satellite has 24 C-band transponders and 24 Ku-band transponders. The C-band payload is called GALAXY-13 and is owned by Pan AmSat, while the Ku-band payload is called HORIZONS-1 and is jointly owned by the two companies.

Subject: Boeing Company
Location: Zenit-3SL launch vehicle co-produced by Ukraine and Russia

81.doctext: The U.S. Army deployed the General Atomics Aviation  IGNAT Extended Range Unmanned Aircraft System in  Iraq   and has maintained 95 % can perform all tasks. The deployed  system  includes the aircraft, a ground control station and a crew of 10, including aircraft, sensor operators and maintenance technicians. The aircraft is equipped with various sensors, including a synthetic aperture radar. In March 2003,  The U.S. Army awarded  General Atomics Aeronautical Systems a contract totaling US$7.99 million to purchase three IGNAT-ER aircraft and a set of modular ground control station, several portable ground data terminals and related ground support equipment and spare parts. This acquisition is initially intended to provide the  Army  with an unmanned aircraft system to support the development of the  Army  combat drone concept. Due to the requirements of urban combat, the work of manufacturing, using flight  testing and  delivery was accelerated. As a result, the first set of  was delivered in March of this year span_12 Unmanned Aerial System, two months ahead of the contract schedule.  IGNAT-ER UAV system now continues to perform reconnaissance and surveillance missions for  stationed in   Iraq   U.S. ground forces on a daily basis Minimum flight time is 12 hours.
