82.doctext: Germany's  radar satellite TerraSAR-X  will be launched on  February 27, 2007 from  Baikonur by  Dipny-1 The rocket   launches into the sky. Due to the failure of a  launch  of this type of rocket in  summer 2006  , the original launch plan of October 31, 2006 was postponed.  The TerraSAR-X satellite  is expected to begin full operation five and a half months after launch.  TerraSAR-X  is the first German satellite to be built in a public-private partnership between  German Aerospace Center  and EADSAstrium. The European EADSAstrium company is responsible for providing funding for the development, construction, and deployment of satellites.  The German Aerospace Center  is responsible for the processing of satellite data, and Infoterra GmbH is responsible for commercial market operations.  TerraSAR-X  Orbiting in a polar orbit 514 kilometers above the earth, the satellite is equipped with an active antenna that can collect high-quality X-band radar data. The operation of the satellite does not depend on meteorological conditions. , cloud coverage and illumination, with a resolution of up to 1 meter.

83.doctext: According to the spokesperson of the Russian Ministry of Defense,  Russia deployed the   destroyer Marshal Shaposhnikov in the  Gulf of Aden   , and escorted five merchant ships through the pirate-infested waters of Somalia. According to RIA Novosti reports,  March 29, 2010,  Russia deployed  Pacific Fleet special forces in the  Gulf of Aden   The task force includes  the destroyer Marshal Shaposhnikov,  the MB-37 rescue tug and the  oil tanker Petchenga. The Russian navy will use the port of Djibouti in the Horn of Africa as a temporary base for anti-piracy operations in the region. Currently,  Russia is deploying the fourth batch of fleets from the Pacific Fleet to  Gulf of Aden for escort. Previously,  Russia Northern and  Baltic Fleet /span_14 are  dispatching   troops to the sea area.

84.doctext: The German Wehrmacht   June 28, 2010 announced that it had deployed  three  PzH2000 self-propelled howitzers in  Afghanistan   . Two of them were deployed on launch positions adjacent to the German-led  Kunduz Province reconstruction team, and completed  test launches under local climate and terrain conditions. Gate 3 serves as a reserve. The German Defense Minister stated that the deployment of  PzH2000  in  Afghanistan  was in preparation for the inspection of Mazar Sharif, where on April 14, 2010, the most violent war since the Second World War broke out. The fiercest battle in which the German Army was involved.  The next day,  Stationed The  German 345th Artillery Regiment   Deployed Kusel  To  Afghanistan for 8 months. The first PzH2000 arrived on May 28, and the remaining two arrived on June 3. Along with the 3  PzH2000  were  deployed 36  soldiers  , in addition to personnel responsible for logistics, maintenance, recovery and meteorology . These personnel were assigned by the Joint Fire Support Coordination Team, which was previously stationed in  Afghanistan . Germany is the second country in the NATO International Security Assistance Force to deploy  PzH2000 self-propelled howitzers  in  Afghanistan .  In 2006  ,  the Netherlands   deployed  three  PzH2000 self-propelled howitzers  . As Germany prepared for deployment, the Netherlands transferred its experience with the  PzH2000  in  Afghanistan  to Germany.

85.doctext: The UK is currently donating additional  surveillance and communications equipment to  Lebanon   to enable the Lebanese Armed Forces to build additional Border surveillance station. On July 5, 2013, during a meeting between the British Chief of Defense Staff and the Commander of the Lebanese Armed Forces in Beirut, Lebanon, the British Ministry of Defense announced details of the full range of equipment it will provide for  Lebanon . The UK Ministry of Defense issued a statement saying that  the UK will provide  specific  support components to  Lebanon   to assist  Lebanon deals with the current security situation facing its border with Syria. The support component includes mobility, communications, protection and surveillance equipment, as well as related training that can help  Lebanon  protect its border areas. A spokesman for the British Ministry of Defense said that the component includes 164 civilian Land Rovers, as well as a number of trailers equipped with mast sensors, surveillance cameras, binoculars and military high frequency and very high frequency radio stations. Protective equipment includes 1,500 bulletproof vests and helmets, as well as deployable defenses. This is the second batch of support equipment provided by  Britain to  Lebanon in 2013. The previous batch of equipment included support for the Lebanese Armed Forces’ training facility in Hamat. and assisting  Lebanon in the construction of multiple border observation towers. Since 2010,  Britain  has more than doubled its assistance to the Lebanese Armed Forces.

86.doctext: Northrop Grumman delivered the  LITENINGG4 advanced targeting system for F-16 to the  Danish Air Force  , LITENINGG4 pod It can provide drivers with powerful long-range target detection, identification and tracking capabilities for precision weapon delivery or non-traditional intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance missions.  Denmark is the 8th international user to choose LITENING pod. The delivery of this pod makes  Denmark the first international user of  LITENINGG4  .  LITENINGG4  is the latest configuration of LITENING advanced targeting pod. This type of pod applies the latest technological advancements in the fields of sensors, laser imaging and data links, including 1Kx1K forward-looking infrared sensor and CCD sensor. It is currently the The highest resolution of  deployed's  targeting pods. Other advanced technologies used include short-wave infrared laser imaging sensors, tracker improvements and enhanced focusing capabilities.

87.doctext: Japan  reportedly plans to introduce a law to speed up the  deployment  of  overseas peacekeeping forces  to better support allies. The move is likely to exacerbate  Japan's  relations with some of its neighbours. According to the "Nikkei" report, the Abe government and the Liberal Democratic Party plan to establish a bill in early 2015 to promote administrative procedures related to the Japanese military's deployment of troops overseas. This move will overturn the previous practice of requiring special legislation every time  Japan  deploys   Self-Defense Forces  in  foreign countries  . This move will rewrite the past history of requiring specific legislation to be passed every time the  Japan Self-Defense Forces were deployed overseas. According to Japan's permanent law, overseas deployments can only be made except for United Nations peacekeeping operations and emergencies around Japan span_9 Self-Defense Forces. The bill provides for the dispatch of overseas troops to provide logistical support to multinational forces or a major ally, the United States. However, Japan's Komeito party does not agree to enact the law, and Japan's Liberal Democratic Party, one of the ruling coalition parties, still needs to persuade it to support the plan. Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has been committed to strengthening  Japan 's military power after the re-election of Congress. He hopes that the Japanese military will be able to support and help its allies, such as assisting the US military when it is attacked. In the early 21st century,  Japan promulgated a temporary bill allowing its navy to participate in the multinational force in the Afghanistan war and deploy it in the relatively safe  southern Iraq   span_13 established the  non-combat reconstruction force. Under pressure from the United States, Japan's military has played an increasingly important role in global affairs.

88.doctext: The U.S. Marine Corps spokesperson said on December 9 that the service will soon  deploy the  new KC-130J Super Hercules developed by Lockheed Martin. /transporter. By  February 2005,  Lockheed Martin will have delivered 12  KC-130J    North Carolina Used by the  252nd Air Refueling/Transport Squadron at Marine Corps Air Station Cherry Point to achieve initial operational capability.  Marine Corps  Originally planned to advance the IOC time to September 2004, but later considered that early deployment would lead to insufficient pilot training time, so the deployment was postponed for a few months.  Lockheed Martin  A spokesperson said that the  Marine Corps  requires a total of 52  KC-130J  and has ordered 33 so far.

89.doctext: The U.S. Marine Corps  purchased a  ear-piercing sound weapon  to deter potential attackers, control crowds and clear buildings.  American Technologies said it has begun deployments to  deployment of  1st Marine Expeditionary Force and  in Iraq span_6 3rd Marine Aircraft Wing   delivered  the above-mentioned long-range acoustic device. The contract is worth US$1 million.

90.doctext: According to senior Navy officials, by mid-May this year, the  U.S. Navy will deliver  4  Silver Fox small drones to the  Marine Corps   Man-machine,  deployed to perform combat missions in  Iraq. Developed by the Office of Naval Research, the Marine Corps Combat Laboratory and Advanced Ceramics Research Corporation, the  Silver Fox features a 6-foot fuselage, two detachable 8-foot-long wings and a vertical tail. Fits into a golf bag-like carrier bag. The Silver Fox weighs 20 pounds, can fly up to 1,000 feet, and is equipped with a GPS device and video camera.  The Silver Fox  is an example of a small unmanned aerial vehicle designed for individual use by Marines. The drone has a flight life of 6 hours.

91.doctext: The U.S. Marine Corps is scheduled to deploy the  Longyan UAV   within 4 years starting from  May 2004  To  each  Marine Corps combat company. The Marine Corps plans to purchase 323 systems -- 41 in fiscal 2004, 50 in fiscal 2005, and 50 in fiscal 2006, said Lt. Col. Don Bruce, Longan program officer at Marine Corps Systems Command. 83 units, 90 units in fiscal year 2007, and 59 units in fiscal year 2008. He said the figure was one-third higher than the procurement target a year ago. He believes that once the  Dragon Eye drones   are delivered  into the hands of  Marines  at the small unit level, their numbers will increase. Bruce said the cost of longan is between US$120,000 and US$130,000. According to a report by the US "Unmanned Online" on April 29, 2004, in addition to the  Longyan small drone, the US Marine Corps in Iraq will soon receive other drones. Help them spot potential threats in explosive cities like Fallujah. The U.S. Navy has purchased four Silver Fox small drones to be used by U.S. Marines in Iraq in mid-May.

92.doctext: U.S. Marine Corps H-53 project director Croisetiere said at a meeting of the American Helicopter Association on the 9th that the Marine Corps hopes to obtain approval from the Department of Defense before December to begin development of its aging  CH -53E Super Stallion helicopter's replacement aircraft. The new machine is a derivative of the  CH-53E  and is called the  CH-53X  . A recent analysis of replacement aircraft by the service recommended the  CH-53X . Croisetiere was reluctant to reveal too many details about the CH-53X program, but he expected Sikorsky, the manufacturer of  CH-53E , to play a leading role in the new program. He said the Corps hopes to field the aircraft starting  in 2015   . The aircraft will have a larger load capacity and a longer range; the aircraft's loading and unloading time will be shorter than that of the  CH-53E . Croisetiere said that during the transition period before the new aircraft is delivered, the US Marine Corps will improve  CH-53E , such as improving its survivability. The US Marine Corps  CH-53E  currently  deployed in  Iraq  is installing cabin floor armor to protect the machine gunner, and adding a machine gun to Provides rear protection. At the same time, the US Navy's MH-53E minesweeping helicopters will gradually be retired, and H-60 ​​helicopters will take their place.

93.doctext: ,  Two senior officials from the U.S. Marine Corps  arrived at Camp Fallujah, Iraq, to ​​inspect the Marine Expeditionary Force's new air eyes. General Spyder Nyland, deputy commander of the Marine Corps, and three others,  August 23 watched  at   Marine Corps Expeditionary Force Headquarters ScanEagle drone  performance   . Dave Sliwa, Field Group's flight operations director, said: 'ScanEagle' is a low-cost, long-endurance fully autonomous unmanned aerial vehicle developed and manufactured by Boeing and Field Group specifically for the  Marine Corps . He said that in June 2004,  Marine Corps signed a contract with  Boeing Co. and  Site Group Inc. for  stationed in   /span_10 The  Marine Expeditionary Force   in Iraq is providing two  ScanEagles mobile deployment units.  The Scan Eagle Mobile Deployment Force  consists of a number of drones as well as computers, communications data links and ground stations. Sergeant Scott M. Freche of the 1st Marine Division said: ScanEagle provides intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance support to the 1st Marine Expeditionary Force during combat missions. It is our eye in the sky. 'ScanEagle' provides fighter jets with timely and clear images of the battlefield. The Scan Eagle is launched autonomously from a pneumatic wedge-shaped catapult launcher and flies according to a predetermined program or is initiated by an operator to perform a mission.

94.doctext: As part of the forward presence mission in the Gulf, the  U.S. Navy Explosive Ordnance Disposal Mobile Force completed the  Dolphin Anti-Frogman System--MK-6 on  November 18-19 Marine Mammal Systems   Demonstration  .  MK-6  uses bottlenose dolphins and is currently performing missions in the area to protect Navy warships. Because their shape is ideal for swimming at high speeds underwater, and their inherently efficient sonar system can detect a variety of underwater targets, dolphins play an irreplaceable role in tasks such as detecting, locating, and marking underwater threats. . Navy officials say man-made machines cannot replicate the dolphin's abilities. Since  2000   Arleigh Burke-class destroyer USS Cole was bombed  near the port of Aden in Yemen   ,  The US Navy began to pay attention to the protection of ports, warships and high-value ships. In addition to developing advanced protection systems, the  Navy  is also considering using marine animals for surveillance missions, with bottlenose dolphins and California sea lions being selected for combat missions. The most important reason for selecting these two animals is their ability to perform tasks easily and efficiently in various environments. The main responsibility of the ODMU is to deploy the  5th Fleet to the Gulf. span_12 Provides force protection capabilities. In addition to being equipped with MMS, it is also equipped with a Sea Lion shallow water intruder detection system.

Subject: U.S. Navy Explosive Ordnance Disposal Mobile Force

95.doctext: Boeing Company and  Insitu Group said on February 28 that they developed the  Scan Eagle long-endurance drone   last fall Following the  Persian Gulf  test run it will be deployed on a number of other U.S. Navy ships. The two companies first received a contract from the  U.S. Marine Corps  in July 2004 to  provide  2 sets of  Scan Eagle mobile deployment systems  . The contract was revised again in July 2005. In April 2005,  the U.S. Navy  awarded a contract totaling $14.5 million to provide intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance means for the Navy's Expeditionary Strike Group during their missions and to protect the security of oil platforms in the Gulf. In September 2005,  the Navy awarded a supplemental contract worth $13 million to  provide   ScanEagle systems to support Navy high-speed craft and surface forward assembly. base.  Last September,  Tarawa ESG  sailed into the Iraqi war zone, and  deployed on it  Scan Eagle. This It is the first time that an unmanned aerial vehicle system has been officially deployed at sea to perform maritime air combat missions.  ScanEagle Since  August 2004 deployed with the first  Maritime Expeditionary Force    The manned aircraft completed 8,900 combat flight hours in Iraq.

96.doctext: The first deployment of  Lockheed Martin's  Digital Reconnaissance Image Processing System greatly improves the  U.S. Navy's ability to identify and engage seconds-critical targets. . This tactical input system has been installed on Nimitz-class aircraft carriers and has also been  delivered  to the  Naval Plan Center in Washington  and the  Naval Air Defense Warfare Center  . The  TIS system  provides the  Navy  with the ability to receive and process digital reconnaissance imagery from multiple sensor platforms. As the first system passed the  recent   acceptance  , the  TIS system  will soon become a tactical component of the naval joint force image processing system. Thanks to the acquisition of this ability to receive and process digital reconnaissance imagery, the  U.S. Navy now has a complete, end-to-end electronic imagery system that greatly improves the ability to collect, identify, and attack targets on the entire battlefield. ability. The TIS system is a major step forward for the  Navy toward sensor-to-shooter capabilities and is expected to deploy the  TIS system   to all 12 ships  On board the aircraft carrier and several other  major amphibious ships. As an important part of the naval firepower network, the  TIS system  can receive digital images through radio lines of land-based and sea-based airborne sensor platforms, including electro-optical, infrared and synthetic aperture radar imaging. Naval intelligence officers can analyze images, obtain critical information, and flag potential targets through a simple touch interface.

97.doctext: Signal Technology has recently been awarded several contracts to develop microwave components and guidance subsystems for the  Standard Block III missile  program, with a total amount of approximately more than $5 million, and product delivery is expected to last until 2004. Signal Technologies predicts that the potential value of the continued contract will exceed $5 million, with product delivery continuing into 2010. Signal Technologies will provide cutting-edge microwave components and guidance subsystems for the MK45 target detection equipment on the  Standard Missile .  Standard Missile is a modular medium- to long-range surface-to-air missile that is  deployed on   U.S. Navy cruisers, destroyers and frigates, etc. ships. In addition, several U.S. allied navies have also  deployed this type of missile.

Subject: U.S. Navy
Location: U.S. Navy cruisers, destroyers and frigates, etc. ships

98.doctext: According to a press release issued by the Ministry of National Defense News Service on July 7,  The United States and South Korea, through recent consultations, will deploy   in  South Korea   War Zone  High Altitude Area Defense Missile  reached a unanimous agreement. According to the website of the US Department of Defense Missile Defense Agency,  THAAD missile  can provide a global ballistic missile defense system, with the ability to quickly intercept and destroy end-of-range ballistic missiles inside and outside the atmosphere. Through discussions over the past few months, the  US-ROK Joint Working Group has determined the deployment of   THAAD missiles on the  Korean Peninsula   military purposes, and is prepared to submit proposals for missile deployment locations to the defense ministers of the two countries to meet environmental protection, health, and safety needs.

99.doctext: American Hydraulic Robotics Corporation and  Japan Hydropower Systems Development Corporation will deliver the first batch of  Wave Gliders   to   Japan Coast Guard.  Hydraulic Robot Company  and  Hydropower System Development Company  will help  Japan Coast Guard   deploy  8 units of  Wave Glider autonomously monitors and senses ocean currents, waves and weather conditions near the coast of Japan all year round.  Hydraulic Robot Company  stated that this is the first ocean observation network in Japanese history, with wide-area, comprehensive and economical marine environment monitoring capabilities. The Wave Glider is a marine robot with strong endurance and environmental adaptability that can collect and transmit ocean data in real time without fuel. This will be Japan's largest  wave glider formation  .  Formation  The data collected can meet the operational needs of  Japan Coast Guard .  Hydropower Systems Development Company  With the help of  Hydraulic Robotics Company , the wave glider has a series of customized mission services, including typhoon tracking, tsunami detection, and general ocean research. The wave glider has better measurement results and can record time series data information for a long time. These capabilities are not available to ordinary ships. This data information helps to better understand the marine environment in Japan and around Japan, and improve national security and disaster resilience.

100.doctext: BAE Systems has been awarded an $84.7 million contract to develop the  Cyber ​​Tactical Common Data Link System for the  U.S. Navy, which will be used by the  U.S. Navy /span_2 Provides multi-source real-time ISR data synchronization sending and receiving capabilities and cross-network command and control information exchange capabilities, enabling  US Navy to realize cross-platform and cross-network sharing of massive ISR data.  NTCDL  will increase communication capacity, improve signal waveforms, has the advantages of modularity and scalability, and adopts an open system architecture with a universal interface and repeatable programming capabilities to adapt to changing mission requirements. .  NTCDL  enhances the situational awareness and tactical battlefield advantage of the  U.S. Navy  through the exchange of real-time voice, data, image and video information from multiple sources.  NTCDL  will support warfighters to simultaneously conduct multiple networked operations using currently  deployed  common data link equipment and new generation manned and unmanned platforms .  Systems  will be prioritized for  installation  on  aircraft carriers  and  large deck amphibious ships . BAE Systems Electronic Warfare Services stated that this technology has stronger and faster tactical communication and information sharing capabilities, which will help the  U.S. Navy  maintain maritime superiority. BAE Systems is the prime contractor for the project and will work with Bell Aerospace to make full use of the two companies' development experience in data link systems.

101.doctext: The US Navy is planning to deploy the  100-150 kilowatt solid laser weapon prototype   to deploy on  surface ships and carry out related   span_4 test. Senior leaders of the Navy also revealed that a high-energy laser weapon development plan will be released in the next few months. With the support of the Naval Research Agency's High Energy Solid Laser Weapon System Prototype Project,  Northrop Grumman Space and Mission Systems Division was awarded a contract worth US$53.1 million in October 2015, and the total contract value may reach US$9,100. . The LWSD project aims to combine the  fiber laser core module with government-provided  other subsystems for self-defense testing in  2018 in  Before carrying out  testing on board the ship, the technology maturity level needed to reach level 6.  Northrop Grumman Space and Mission Systems Division has previously developed the  Maritime Laser Demonstration Prototype for the  Navy and in  2011 Completed  test at sea and successfully destroyed targets at sea. LWSD has extensively applied systems developed earlier and replaced the slab lasers in MLD with more advanced fiber laser technology.

102.doctext: Former Russian Navy Commander Viktor Kravchenko said that  Russia reached an agreement with the Syrian government to expand the  Tartus Naval Material and Technical Support Station, and the comprehensive spillover effects will See, in fact  support station is similar to a naval base. Kravchenko said:  Tartus Naval Support Station  has almost become a naval base. This means that in the future, the  Russian Navy can station  various types of ships in  Tartus  including aircraft carriers . He also said that the first priority is to improve the berthing facilities of the ship terminal to ensure the supply of fresh water, fuel and electricity. A battery room must be established in the area to replace or recharge the submarine's batteries. He emphasized that there is no doubt that the protection of  base is important. For this reason,   air and missile defense should be  deployed at or near  base system, as well as  Prom or  Bastion Shore-Based Missile System.

Subject: Russia
Location: Tartus Naval Material and Technical Support Station

103.doctext: The U.S. military will deploy 12 Lockheed Martin  F-16 Fighting Falcons, marking the first time Washington has deployed military assets to a Northeast Asian country since President Donald Trump took office.  U.S. Pacific Command said in a note on January 30 that approximately 200  Air Force personnel and 12 from the 119th Fighter Squadron at the Air National Guard Base in Atlantic City, New Jersey. The  F-16 Fighting Falcon fighter jets will be deployed to  Osan Air Base, South Korea in  February  .  The U.S. military stated that the  U.S. Air Force's routine deployment of  fighter jets to the region is for the  U.S. Pacific Command and  Pacific Command Air Forces   provide the   Theater Security Package that will help maintain deterrence against threats to regional security and stability.  The Security Package  demonstrates the United States’ continued commitment to stability and security in the Indo-Asia-Pacific region.

104.doctext: The Australian Department of Defense reports that the  C-band Space Surveillance Radar System  jointly operated by  United States  and  Australia  has reached full operational capability.  C-band radar  is a dish-shaped mechanical tracking radar that can track 200 targets a day and can also identify satellites, satellite orbits, and potential anomalies. Despite its limited data capacity,  C-band radar  provides very accurate satellite positioning and characterization data. The radar was originally  deployed  on the Caribbean island of  Antigua  to track space launches from the US military's Cape Canaveral.  Starting from 2014 , the  Air Force  will gradually migrate it to  Western Australia   for deployment . In March 2017,  C-band radar  achieved full operational capability at the new deployment location. Australian Defense Minister Marise Payne said in a press release that the  C-band radar operated from the  Harold E. Holt Naval Communications Station near Exmouth, Western Australia.  , is the first low-Earth orbit space monitoring network sensor  deployed in the Southern Hemisphere. Operating in this new location, the  C-band radar  can provide coverage of the Eastern and Southern Hemispheres, improving position accuracy and predictive capabilities.

Australia

105.doctext: The Indian Navy  will retire its iconic equipment, the Russian Atlas-142 Albatross long-range maritime patrol aircraft, at the end of March 2017.  The Indian Navy has installed a total of 8 Tu-142MEs, which have been in service since 1988. It is the only user of this type of aircraft besides Russia. It mainly uses it to perform anti-submarine warfare and maritime patrol missions. In addition, it also Carry out photographic reconnaissance and radio reconnaissance missions. Now the maintenance cost of the aircraft continues to increase, and the problems related to obsolescence and obsolescence are becoming more and more serious. In addition,  India has introduced the  P-8I Maritime of  American Boeing Company patrol aircraft, prompting  the Indian Navy to decide to retire the aircraft. At present, only 3 of the 8 Tu-142MEs of the  Indian Navy maintain combat readiness, and are stationed by this service  at  Rajali Aviation in Alakonam City Station is used for  No. 312 Squadron operations. Currently  Indian Navy  has 8  P-8I  in use and has purchased 4 more.  Boeing will begin delivering  additional aircraft to  India   starting in  2020 and will be completed within one year deliver.  The Indian Navy is also equipped with the  Russian-made Ilyushin Il-38SD Sea Dragon anti-submarine patrol aircraft, which received a comprehensive mid-life upgrade in 2009 and has recently received the Russian-made The capabilities of the Kh-35 air-to-ship missile.  In February 2017  ,  Indian Navy  announced the first  demonstration  of the IL-38SD with this capability.

In the early stage, 1,500  missiles  and 16 sets of  launchers   have been delivered to the   German Bundeswehr  . This supplementary contract involves 1,000  missiles and 97 sets of  launchers and related supporting equipment. The total contract value is approximately 137 million euros. The contract is in accordance with the Federal Arms, Information Technology and Active Service Standard signing is stipulated in the Equipment Support Bureau's Contract Management Guidelines. The currently added  lightweight multi-purpose guided missile system  is expected to be  delivered in the second half of 2018  . Lightweight multi-purpose missile system  It is a general-purpose anti-tank weapon system that can be used to attack ground armored targets such as main battle tanks 4,000 meters away. 107.doctext: The head of the Russian Military Industrial Company stated in an interview that due to the needs of the  United Nations peacekeeping force,  Russia will provide  the peacekeeping force   /span_3 A batch of  BTR-80 wheeled armored personnel carriers.  The BTR-80 8×8 wheeled armored personnel carrier  is an improved version of the BTR-70 wheeled armored personnel carrier. It was installed in 1984. The turret can rotate 360°. The turret is equipped with a KPVT 14.5 mm large-caliber machine gun, and the auxiliary weapon is a PKT 7.62 mm parallel machine gun. The vehicle can carry two 9K34 or 9K38 pin-type individual air defense missiles and one RPG-7 anti-tank rocket launcher. The person in charge of the Russian Military Industrial Company did not disclose the specific countries and regions where these armored personnel carriers were delivered, the delivery quantity, and the delivery time.  In February 2017,  Russia delivered  a batch of  light weapons to the  Fiji peacekeeping force   and  ammunition, which will equip the  Fiji Mechanized Infantry Battalion stationed in the Golan Heights.

108.doctext: The U.S. Air Force  announced on the same day that it would increase funding by US$45.99 million for the two space-based infrared system satellites being built by  Lockheed Martin . This also increases the contract value of the SBIRSGEO-5 and GEO-6 satellites that the company won in 2014 to US$1.86 billion. These two satellites will use the new A2100 platform. The U.S. Department of Defense said the additional funding will be used to integrate a new subsystem and improve the propulsion system. This work is expected to be completed by the end of July 2022.  The U.S. Air Force ’s fiscal year 2017 space procurement funding increased by $12.19 million. The SBIRS missile warning constellation is one of the priority projects the Air Force hopes to support in the fiscal year 2018 budget request, which will increase by $862 million compared with the fiscal year 2017 budget. These funds will be used to complete the construction of GEO-5 and GEO-6 satellites, and support the  launch of the   GEO-4 satellite  in November this year and subsequent operations. Provide cybersecurity upgrades and deploy   ground systems  for potential procurement of GEO-7 and GEO-8 satellites  .

109.doctext: The U.S. Department of Defense announced on June 12 that  the U.S. Air Force  awarded  Lockheed Martin  a $108 million contract to develop the Advanced Radar Threat System-2. ARTS-V2 is a preliminary plan for Milestone Node B, aiming to develop and deploy  a  high-fidelity threat launcher for the training of real combat personnel in anti-access/area denial environments. span_3.  Lockheed Martin will provide a  ARTS-V2 typical sample for research and development and  testing, and  provide 20 span_8 Alternative systems  . This work is expected to be completed by  June 30, 2027 .

110.doctext: The Australian Defense Force Capability Acquisition and Sustainment Department awarded a A$223 million contract to  Northrop Grumman Australia in June, selecting  Northrop Grumman Corporation to provide  for its  /span_2 Satellite Communications System to improve  Australia’s satellite communications capabilities and increase communications coverage to enhance connections between Australian troops and global commanders.  Australia  joined the Broadband Global Satellite Communications System project in 2007 to provide funding for the expansion of the constellation in exchange for a global share of WGS bandwidth. The 2008 joint project is a large-scale multi-phase project for the ADF  deployment  of a  integrated broadband satellite communications system  . During Phase 5B2 of the project,  Northrop Grumman Corporation and  ViaSat Corporation. and  Optus Corporation will operate in  New South Wales   /span_11 Deployment of a  ground station and a  broadband SATCOM network management system. The ground station and network management system will be integrated into the high-performance, safe and reliable military communications satellite WGS constellation.  Northrop Grumman will provide it with a network management function similar to the one used to successfully regulate WGS systems in the United States, complementing the high performance of ViaSat dual-band satellite terminals and the operational experience of Australia's Optus,  span_16 Northrop Grumman, ViaSat and Optus will provide a comprehensive and mature solution for ADF.

111.doctext: Airbus   Military Satcom Suite   Deployed  on  Royal Navy   HMS Queen Elizabeth  , providing key data links for it in Sea Trial.  Airbus  has installed two 2.2-meter-long shipborne satellite communication terminal antennas on the ship, which will link the aircraft carrier through an enhanced communication network composed of five geosynchronous orbiting military satellites. In addition,  HMS Queen Elizabeth is also equipped with  Airbus's  Complete Maritime Terminal System, providing the  aircraft carrier with global range of secure and reliable communications. The communications system allows the carrier crew and builders to collect sea trial data and send the information back to the shore base, so data is available in real time during sea trials. Richard Franklin, head of defense and space security communications at Airbus, said it was crucial to install a satellite communications system for the maiden voyage of  HMS Queen Elizabeth . The satellite communication system has been installed and  commissioned before the  HMS Queen Elizabeth leaves port for its maiden voyage. The  aircraft carrier arrived in Portsmouth last week Sri Lanka's home port.

India and  Russia signed an intergovernmental agreement as early as October 17, 2016, that is,  India purchased the  Russia purchased 5 sets of  S-400 air defense missile systems. In October 2015,  India decided to purchase the  S-400 air defense missile system from  Russia. The system is equipped with three interceptor missiles with different capabilities and can It can intercept various targets within a range of 120 to 400 kilometers at supersonic and hypersonic speeds, and can implement radar locking on the American F-35 fighter jet and shoot it down. Together with the  medium-range air defense missile system jointly produced by India and Israel, and the Spade air defense missile recently received from Israel, the  S-400 air defense missile system will  Delivered   India Airborne  Deployed for use.

113.doctext: The Trump administration has been called upon to petition  Congress  to request $200 million to fund the construction of a fourth missile defense base at Fort Greely, Alaska.  Fort Greely is the site of the  United States majority of  land-based intermediate-range missile interceptors that are designed to Protecting the United States by intercepting long-range missiles outside the atmosphere. Trump said the request was to support efforts to detect, defeat and defend against North Korean ballistic missiles launched against the United States, allies and partners.  Fort Greely  already has three missile defense bases that can deploy up to 40 interceptors. At the same time, the United States has built four more defense bases at Vandenberg Air Force Base in California. Trump hopes to add an additional $5.9 billion to the original 2017 budget, including $4 billion for missile defense and North Korea-related military spending. The budget amendment request also asks Congress to provide $1.2 billion to enable the U.S. Congress to deploy an additional deployment of 3,500  troops /span_9, and $700 million to repair the damaged U.S. Navy destroyers USS John McCain and USS Fitzgerald.

114.doctext: Recently  ,  Airbus Helicopters  delivered  2  AS565MBe  to  the Mexican Navy   . So far,  Airbus Helicopters  has completed the delivery of 10  AS565MBe  orders signed with the  Mexican Navy  in 2014 in two years. As the first user of this type of aircraft, the  Mexican Navy will  AS565MBe   deployed in three  bases, currently mainly executing Reconnaissance, patrol and training missions.  AS565MBe  It adopts two Arriel 2N engines, a new generation tail rotor, a 4-axis autopilot, and a new main reducer. It has a maximum flight speed of 278 kilometers/hour and a maximum range of 780 kilometers. Compared with the previous models of the family,  AS565MBe  has enhanced adaptability to high temperature and plateau environments, and its safety, operational convenience and cost-effectiveness have been significantly improved.

115.doctext: CAE America announced that it has been awarded a contract by the  U.S. Army to provide  Abrams M1A2 tank  training   . According to this contract,  CAE America will develop 2 new sets of  Abrams M1A2 tank driving stations and equipped with  on-site engine maintenance trainers, providing support for diagnostic and troubleshooting training tasks. These 2 sets of  Driving Stations will be delivered  in 2019    and  deployed to  Fort Benning, Georgia /span_11 . Additionally, the option contract includes the development and  delivery  of nine  Abrams Field Engine Maintenance Trainers  to the  Army  .

116.doctext: The U.S. Navy  has awarded a contract to  Lockheed Martin  to develop a ship-based laser weapon system. According to a statement released on the 26th,  Lockheed Martin received a US$150 million cost-plus-fee incentive contract from the  Navy to implement the Navy's surface ship laser weapon system project increment The first phase of the mission is to develop high-energy laser and integrated optical dazzling surveillance systems.  Lockheed Martin  will develop and deliver  two  test prototypes  in  2020   . One  prototype  will be used for ground  testing  and the other will be installed on the DDG51IIA destroyer. According to the contract, this phase of research and development work will end in April 2020. If the option is exercised, the contract value can be increased to $942.8 million.  The Navy has developed a  laser weapon system test prototype and installed it on the  USS Ponce amphibious ship in 2014,  deployed  in the  Bay Area.  The USS Ponce  will be decommissioned in the fall of 2018, and the LaWS will be transferred to the Naval Surface Warfare Center Dalgo Division for use as a test platform. The upgraded SEQ-3 will be installed on the San Antonio-class amphibious ship USS Portland later this year.

117.doctext: The  Asahi destroyer and  Seiryu submarine built by  Mitsubishi Heavy Industries were launched on  March 7 and  respectively. On the 12th,   was delivered to   and entered into service with the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force.  The Asahi destroyer is the first of the two Asahi-class destroyers planned to be deployed in Japan's "Medium-term Defense Force Readiness Plan". Construction began in May 2015, with a length of 151 meters and a width of 18.3 meters. It is 10.9 meters high and has a speed of 30 knots. This type of ship is the first destroyer of the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force to adopt a composite gas turbine electric propulsion system. It has achieved a leap in endurance and its anti-submarine capabilities are also greatly improved compared to the previous generation ship. The ship's construction cost is 75.9 billion yen and will be deployed in the Maritime Self-Defense Force's 2nd Escort Force in Sasebo City. In addition, the No. 2 Asahi-class ship Shiranui is expected to enter service in March 2019. Both ships were built at Mitsubishi Heavy Industries' Nagasaki Shipyard.  Qinglong is the ninth ship of the Soryu-class submarine. It was built by Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Kobe Shipyard. It is 87 meters long, 9.1 meters wide, with a standard displacement of 2,950 tons. The construction cost is 53.1 billion yen. The submarine depth is , excellent durability and quiet performance.

118.doctext: The Ukrainian military has received Javelin man-portable anti-tank missiles purchased from the United States.  The United States  has confirmed the delivery of   Javelin anti-tank missile systems  to  Ukraine  , a State Department spokesman said on Monday. Recently, the President of Ukraine confirmed the news. According to Ukrainian experts,  Ukraine  received the first batch of Javelin anti-tank missiles on April 6, and the batch of missiles has been transported to the training center.  The U.S. Military Assistance Fund  paid   $47 million  to  Ukraine   for this purchase. According to reports, the U.S. State Department approved the supply of  Javelin anti-tank missile systems to  Ukraine in early March 2018, including 210 Javelin anti-tank missiles and 37 Javelin launchers, including 2 pieces are spare parts. The Defense Security Cooperation Agency also revealed that the  Javelin system  will help  Ukraine  establish long-term defense capabilities to safeguard national sovereignty, territorial integrity and meet defense needs.  Ukraine  prepares for rapid  deployment  of the  Javelin system  into the  Ukrainian Armed Forces .

119.doctext: The U.S. Naval Sea Service  is seeking to break its own record set in April of commanding and controlling 50  ocean gliders  simultaneously. We are ready to  deploy  100  gliders  at the same time. We find new ways to automate and improve efficiency, and this requires effort from all parties. said Brian Mensey, chief of the Naval Oceanographic Service's glider operations branch.  The Naval Oceanographic Service's 's  Offshore Combat Space Awareness Glider  is an unmanned underwater vehicle used to collect environmental data such as temperature, salinity, water clarity and depth. Once launched  from the  T-AGS Ocean Survey Vessel   , the  unmanned underwater vehicle  will be directed to the intended location by a glider navigator at Stennis Space Center in Mississippi Location. Navigators in the command glider operations center use satellite communications to command the  glider  while monitoring data collection and  glider  performance 24 hours a day, seven days a week.  Glider  Temperature and salinity data collected in the water are fused into an ocean model that provides underwater forecasts, similar to the atmospheric models that provide weather forecasts. These predictions are important for widespread naval operations and have many uses in diver safety, submarine detection and hurricane prediction.  The Naval Sea Service has for decades been home to the world's largest fleet of gliders, operated by the  U.S. Navy,  U.S. Coast Guard,  span_15 A series of  vessel   launches  operated by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and  universities.

120.doctext: Lockheed Martin  said it has delivered its 300th  Terminal High Altitude Area Defense System  .  Terminal High Altitude Area Defense is the world’s only ballistic missile defense system capable of intercepting threats both inside and outside the atmosphere, protecting U.S. forces, allied forces, urban centers and critical infrastructure from short-range and medium-range attacks. range ballistic missile attack. In flight  tests  the system achieved a 100% successful interception rate.  Terminal High Altitude Area Defense System  Easy to deploy quickly and interoperable with Patriot PAC-3, Aegis and command, control, battle management and communications systems. In 2011, the UAE became the first international user to purchase the  Terminal High Altitude Area Defense System . In December 2016, the  U.S. Army seventh  Terminal High Altitude Area Defense System Company was officially completed and is currently  deployed in  Guam /span_9 and  Korea. In September 2017,  Lockheed Martin  delivered the 200th  Terminal High Altitude Area Defense System  .

MH-53E Sea Dragon helicopter  It weighs 33 tons and is 100 feet long. It can accommodate up to 55 soldiers. It is mainly used to perform mine clearance missions and transport equipment and personnel. The  Sea Dragon landing on the  USS Queen Elizabeth is part of the U.S. Navy Helicopter Minesweeper Squadron 14,  stationed at  Naval Base Norfolk, Virginia.  .  Gyrocopter  The first landing follows the F-35B Lightning II fighter's  first flight  on the  HMS Queen Elizabeth  last month. 122.doctext: The Russian Ministry of Defense plans to  install 15 sets of  Samarkand Voltage Control Systems and connect them to the  Russian Ministry of Defense data transmission system.  The Russian Ministry of Defense plans to conduct military operations in the  Kaliningrad region,  Murmansk region,  other parts of northwest Russia And  13 units of Primorsky Krai   deployed  3 types, a total of 16 sets of  voltage control systems . The contract execution date is until November 10, 2019, with a maximum cost of 61 million rubles and will be delivered in two installments in 2018 and 2019. Since  2017  the  Russian Northern Fleet  has been  fielding the   Samarkand voltage suppression system  .  Samarkand Voltage Control System  Fixed and mobile systems designed to assess the electromagnetic situation; search, detect and rapidly analyze radiation types; locate radiation sources and similar technical control and radio-technical reconnaissance.

123.doctext: Gilat Satellite Networks was selected by the Japanese government agency Local Authority Satellite Communications and received millions of dollars in investment. Gilat will develop a next-generation disaster response platform for 47 prefectures in  Japan . Gilat will work with Sky Perfect Sunstar to provide necessary communication services to Japanese residents in the event of a disaster. LASCOM required a highly secure, bandwidth-efficient multi-service single system that could be integrated into LASCOM's wider network. Networks need to deliver extremely high throughput, quality and resilience to reliably deliver a range of services to county and local governments, individuals and first responders. Services include voice services, video feeds to disaster sites, video multicast to local sites, emergency alerts, mobile services and data services. After a thorough evaluation, Gilat's multi-service platform SkyEdge II-c and its h modem were selected to provide LASCOM with the reliability and services required in disaster situations.  Redundant Hubs will be  deployed in two different locations and will be deployed  throughout Japan   thousands of  span_5 Very Small Aperture Terminal.

124.doctext: In September 2018,  SRC Company successfully completed the  demonstration of the  AN/TPQ-49 radar, which is designed to Performing counter-drone and aerial surveillance missions for the Australian Defense Force Ground Air Defense and Radar Program. The Australian Army has confirmed it is looking into options to develop counter-drone systems and aerial surveillance capabilities to help protect warfighters from enemy drones.  Australia  has  deployed  multiple  AN/TPQ-49 radars  for counterattack missions. The SRC Company's LSTAR aerial surveillance software equipped with these AN/TPQ-49 radars can be upgraded online, thereby providing UAV aerial surveillance capabilities without the need to replace the radar hardware. This upgrade will give these existing radars advanced aerial surveillance and drone detection capabilities to protect against emerging threats. Paul G. Tremont, President and CEO of SRC, said: “This demonstration provides proof to our Australian allies that they can perform these important missions without changing hardware. This has important strategic significance, not only improves the capabilities of Australia's defense forces, but is also cost-effective. We are proud to support Australia with innovative technologies that help them protect warfighters and vital assets.

125.doctext: The U.S. Army will purchase the  Israeli Iron Dome air defense missile system   The U.S. Army  has released a procurement plan for the  Iron Dome air defense missile system . This system was developed by  Rafael Advanced Defense Systems.  Iron Dome System is based on the Spade air defense missile system and can defend against rockets within a range of 4 to 70 kilometers. , successfully intercepted a 122mm unguided rocket in the  test. The system began to be developed in early 2007.  March 2011 The first set of  was deployed,  April 4th The second set of  was deployed span_9, successfully intercepted rockets in actual combat for the first time on April 7,  August 31 The third set of  was deployed. In the operational  deployment of  August 2011, the target recognition rate of the  Iron Dome system reached 100%, and the target interception rate exceeded 90% .  The Israeli military  plans to  deploy  a total of 10 to 15 sets of  Iron Dome systems  , each costing approximately US$50 million. In August 2011,  Rafael stated that it was cooperating with Raytheon to sell  Iron Dome to the United States and provide forward operating bases with the land-based Phalanx. Counterfire capability. In 2014, the two governments signed an agreement to produce Iron Dome components in the United States. So far, the United States has spent US$1.397 billion on the  Iron Dome air defense missile system .

The first batch of three boats purchased in 2011 has been  delivered  two, and  Boat No. 3  is undergoing  sea trials  . The new submarine procurement project is funded by Indonesia's Defense Credit Program. The newly purchased  submarine is the same as the previous three  Nagapasha class, with a displacement of 1,400 tons, a length of 61.2 meters, and is equipped with eight 533 mm torpedo launch tubes, which can launch black Shark heavy torpedoes and other weapons. 127.doctext: Thales is working hard on the integration,  testing and qualification of the  offshore  Mine Countermeasures Demonstration System , planned for  April 2020   Delivery  to  France  and  United Kingdom . The MMCM project is jointly funded by France and the UK and includes the design, development, and integration of a  maritime mine countermeasures system  with the ability to autonomously detect, classify, identify and clear mines. In March 2015, an industry team led by Thales was selected to implement the MMCM project. The first phase of the project defined the system architecture, including an unmanned vessel towing synthetic aperture sonar, three autonomous underwater vehicles equipped with synthetic aperture sonar for detecting and locating mines, a remote-controlled underwater vehicle for clearing mines, and a Portable operations center deployed ashore or aboard. After the completion of the first phase of the project, in October 2016,  Thales won a contract to build two sets of  mine countermeasures systems, one of which was delivered to the French Navy and the other to the French Navy. To the Royal Navy. So far, MMCM has completed the acceptance test of multiple subsystems, including the towed synthetic aperture sonar acceptance test completed in May 2019.

128.doctext: US officials stated that the first five  mobile short-range air defense system prototypes are scheduled to be delivered   in October     Army   Test  . The latest short-range air defense system is a Stryker variant. Its weapon station is equipped with an M230LF 30mm automatic cannon, a 7.62mm machine gun and two external launchers, each carrying two Hellfire missiles. and four Stinger missiles. The new mobile air defense system will fill the current shortcomings of mobile force air defense against aerial threats including rotary wing, fixed wing and unmanned aerial vehicles. The system provides 360-degree air defense to Stryker and armored brigade combat teams throughout military operations. By the second quarter of fiscal 2023, the goal is to field 144 mobile short-range air defense systems in four battalions.

129.doctext: Boeing Inc. produced 21 sets of  RQ-21A Blackjack UAV systems for the   U.S. Navy Marine Corps 's final set has been  delivered to the U.S. Marine Corps Air Station Cherry Point, North Carolina. The Black Jack UAV system delivered this time is mainly used for training and will be deployed by  at  Cape Cherry Naval Station's  Second Naval UAV Squadron /span_7 is responsible for maintenance. In July 2010, in order to meet the needs of the U.S. Navy/ Marine Corps for small tactical unmanned aerial vehicles, the U.S. Naval Air Systems Command supported Incitu Corporation in developing the Integrated UAV, which The aircraft is the prototype of the  RQ-21A UAV, which is designed to provide tactical intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance capabilities and is equipped with electro-optical/infrared sensors, laser rangefinders, automatic identification systems and communication repeaters.  RQ-21A UAV It has an endurance of up to 15 hours at a speed of 60 knots and can operate at an altitude of 20,000 feet. A UAV system includes five UAVs, one ship-based or 2 A land-based control station, a launch and recovery system, accessories and ground supporting facilities. In the second quarter of fiscal year 2016,  The U.S. Marine Corps announced that  RQ-21A  had initial operational capabilities, and VMU-1 and VMU-4 UAV Squadrons successively received the UAV. In March 2019, VMU-3 received the squadron’s fourth set of  RQ-21A unmanned aerial vehicle system.

130.doctext: In the coming weeks,  the United States will formally establish a Space Command based on the existing Joint Forces Space Component Command, headed by Air Force Gen. John Raymond as commander, with  Alliance Force Space Component Command and  Joint Task Force Space Defense Force.  Alliance Force Space Component Command will be located  at   Vandenberg Air Force Base, with the Alliance Space Operations Center as the command center responsible for global The U.S. military commander provides space-based information services such as navigation and positioning, satellite communications, and missile warning. Major General Stephen Whiting, commander of the 14th Air Force, serves as the commander.  Joint Task Force Space Defense Force will be located  at   Schriever Air Force Base, with the National Space Defense Center as the command center, responsible for protecting in-orbit military satellite, whose director has not yet been announced.

Subject: the United States
Militaryforce: Joint Task Force Space Defense Force
Joint Task Force Space Defense Force

131.doctext: U.S. Coast Guard  The 35th fast response craft  Angela McShane  was delivered on August 1 in Key West, Florida. The boat, named in honor of the first African-American woman promoted to the rank of Chief Petty Officer of the Navy, is to replace the 110-meter patrol boat built in 1980 and will be  stationed in  The last of three rapid response boats in Cape May, New Jersey.  Angela McShan is 154 meters long, has an endurance of 5 days, and a maximum speed of 28 knots. It has excellent habitability and seakeeping, and is equipped with advanced command, control, communications, computers, intelligence, Surveillance and reconnaissance equipment that can launch and recover high-speed boats via a tail davit. So far, the  U.S. Coast Guard has ordered 50  fast response boats, 33 of which are in service, of which 12 are  deployed in  Florida, 6 ships in  Puerto Rico, 4 ships in  California, 3 ships in  Hawaii,  Alaska,  New Jersey,  Mississippi and  North Carolina each have 2 ships. Future  deployment locations also include Deke  Galveston in Saskatchewan,  Santa Rita in Guam,  Astoria in Oregon, and  in Alaska Kodiak,  Seward and  Sitka. (Gao Meng, China Shipbuilding Industry Comprehensive Technical and Economic Research Institute)

132.doctext: On August 21, Bill Sullivan, vice president of  Raytheon Company GPS Next Generation Operation Control System, said that the GPSOCXBlock1 system has completed development and will begin deploying Block1 receivers in ground stations around the world this fall. Provide complete system functions to the US Air Force before the contract ends in June 2021. Block 1 is expected to command and control GPSIII, GPSIIIF satellites, and  GPS satellites  launched earlier. OCX has stronger network security, signal strength, accuracy and anti-interference capabilities, allowing it to connect more satellites and reduce the number of operators.  Raytheon Company is committed to fixing errors in the OCXBlock0 system this year and plans to launch the third  GPS satellite in  December    previously patched more vulnerabilities.  Raytheon Company  stated that 2019 is a critical year for the OCX control system.  GPSIII  The  launch  of the second satellite created the opportunity for the OCX system to support multiple satellites in orbit simultaneously.

133.doctext: According to a recent news report, the U.S. National Guard and relevant national agencies are protecting and preventing malicious cyber attacks on U.S. network infrastructure. A U.S. Air Force general said that cyber attacks will become part of the daily battlefield in the future. Our enemies will use cyber activities to target U.S. soldiers, and the destruction of commercial and government infrastructure will also be very serious. On November 5, during a media conference at the Pentagon, the chief of the National Guard mentioned the Guard’s cyber mission and capabilities and noted that cyber attacks have occurred at the federal and state levels.  Earlier this year, several  schools and  institutions in  Louisiana and  Texas   suffered  a ransomware attack. Ransomware is a type of malware designed to block access to a computer system until a ransom is paid. The Illinois State Guard is forming a cyber task force to assist Illinois if needed, the National Guard chief said. The Illinois task force will be composed of Guard Soldiers and Airmen who perform cyber, information technology and other military functions. Indiana recently established a cyber battalion where soldiers will receive military-standard training to prepare for domestic cyber operations capabilities. The National Guard chief said the cyber mission force would become part of the Army's combat mission, which could be federalized and conduct cyber activities for the U.S. Army or U.S. Cyber ​​Command.

134.doctext: U.S. Space Command has added its 10th  Broadband Global Satellite  to its operational constellation and will migrate users to take advantage of the bandwidth provided by the new satellite.  Boeing  completed the satellite performance  verification  on  July 10  and handed over control to the U.S. Air Force. After the handover was completed, the  U.S. Air Force Space and Missile Systems Center WGS Program Office worked with the  U.S. Army and  Navy to complete the satellite's in-orbit   Testing, mainly including: carrying out multiple payload characterizations and verifications to optimize the performance of the end-to-end system; verifying new anti-interference capabilities, as well as technologies and procedures for future integration into the constellation.

Subject: U.S. Air Force Space and Missile Systems Center WGS Program Office
U.S. Army
Navy

135.doctext: On December 2, 2019, Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency handed over  Small Verification Satellite-4  to  Sunshine Sky Perfect Company . This cooperation is the first time JAXA has handed over to a private enterprise. Self-developed satellite, and  Small Demonstration Satellite-4  is the first low-orbit satellite owned and operated by  Sunstar Sky Perfect Company . The small verification satellite is a technology verification satellite mission proposed by JAXA in 2006. It aims to use micro-satellites to provide a space technology on-orbit demonstration verification and technology risk assessment platform for large satellites.  Small verification satellite-4  Since  2012   was launched  into orbit, it has verified the performance of the spaceborne ship automatic identification system; carried out the on-orbit performance of parallel heat pipes Assessment; carried out  space materials  flight tests in cooperation with  French Space Agency; used microscales to measure plumes generated during spacecraft operations material or atomic oxygen pollution. (Liu Yiwen, China Academy of Aerospace Systems Science and Engineering)

136.doctext: According to a report on the U.S. Defense Update website on January 8, 2020,   Israel Defense Research and Development Agency and  Elbit Systems Corporation and  Rafael Company jointly launched three  Ground-based Laser Weapon System,  Vehicle-mounted Laser Weapon System and  Airborne Laser Weapon System span_7 Demo project.  Ground-based laser weapon system  Can be deployed in the field to enhance the interception capabilities of the Iron Dome defense system and reduce interception costs for optimal response.  Vehicle-mounted laser weapon system will be  deployed on  heavy and future armored combat vehicles to enhance the vehicle-mounted active protection system to protect combat forces from direct and indirect fire threats, providing a higher level of protection. Airborne laser weapons can be mounted on drones to intercept missile threats above the clouds and attack the threatening target when it is in the boost phase before or shortly after launch. It has the characteristics of wide interception range and fast response speed. Recently,  Israel Defense Research and Development Agency  has successfully developed electric light source laser technology. This technology can overcome atmospheric interference, accurately focus the laser beam on long-distance targets in a short period of time, and intercept a variety of threats.

Subject: Israel
Location: heavy and future armored combat vehicles

137.doctext: The French Defense Procurement Agency has ordered 8  Diving Support Vessels for the  French Navy. The contract was awarded to  the French Merlay shipyard on December 18, 2019. , the first ship is expected to be received in early 2022, and the remaining seven ships will be  delivered from 2023 to 2025   . These eight  new ships  will replace the nine Dionée-class diving support ships of the  French Navy  and will be used for mine countermeasures operations in shallow waters. The ships have an aluminum structure, a displacement of 87 tons, a length of 26.5 meters, a width of 7 meters, and a maximum speed of 13 knots. They will be used by the French Navy’s Saint-Mandry Diving School, as well as  stationed in  Used by three groups of  Mine Divers at Toulon,  Brest and  Cherbourg. (Gao Meng, China Shipbuilding Industry Comprehensive Technical and Economic Research Institute)

138.doctext: The Ministry of Defense of Japan is studying the deployment of the  Amphibious Regiment at the  Ground Self-Defense Force Base located in  Hokkaido. This will be Japan's second  amphibious combat unit deployed after Aiura Base in Sasebo, Nagasaki Prefecture, with a size of about 600 people, is planned to be completed in  2023  deployment . Japan is continuously enhancing the actual combat capabilities of its  amphibious operations force  to strengthen its defense capabilities against southwestern islands.  In 2017,  The Ministry of Defense of Japan, using the U.S. Marine Corps as a model, has been deployed at the  Aiura Base in Sasebo, Nagasaki Prefecture in southwest Japan    Two  companies troops were deployed, as well as rear support, communications, reconnaissance and other troops. The number of combat personnel remained at about 2,100. On this basis, Ministry of Defense will again discuss the deployment of the third   Amphibious Mobile Regiment in  Hokkaido   span_17 Company.  The Ministry of Defense believes that although the deployment of troops in  Hokkaido will affect the mobility of the  Amphibious Mobile Regiment, areas such as the Hamadaiki Training Base in Hokkaido have The training ground near the sea has rich training experience. From the perspective of training environment construction and surrounding environment and other factors,  Hokkaido is suitable for the construction of amphibious mobile groups.

139.doctext: The 6  new multi-functional tugs built by Remontowa Shipyard in Poland will all use German SCHOTTEL propulsion solutions. The current first ship is  Polko  has been  delivered to the   Polish Navy , and the other 5 ships are also planned to be  delivered in the near future   . The propulsion system of this type of tugboat will consist of two 2-meter fixed-pitch SRP360 ice-class Schottl rudder propellers. Each propulsion system is driven by an MTV12V4000 engine with a power of 1193 kilowatts, allowing the tugboat to obtain up to 35 tons of moorings. pulling power and a free speed of 12 knots. SCHOTTEL said that thanks to the FSICIA ice-class hardening measures, the tugs can be  deployed year-round in the  Baltic Sea for support of military logistics operations at sea and in ports, as well as Personnel evacuation, transfer, search, rescue and oil spill recovery, etc.

Subject: The 6  new multi-functional tugs built by Remontowa Shipyard in Poland

140.doctext: U.S. Army Completed  Advanced Extremely High Frequency Communications Satellite System   Deployment   U.S. Army  Successful  Launch    Advanced EHF-6 satellite. The satellite is the last of the U.S. military's advanced extremely high frequency protected communications satellite systems in active service. It was developed by Lockheed Martin and uses the A2100M platform. It has a communication capacity of 430 Mbit/s, 10 times that of the previous generation of military satellites - 2 satellites, capable of supporting 6,000 user terminals at the same time; using frequency hopping and phased array antenna technology to achieve anti-interference capabilities.  Advanced Extremely High Frequency System can provide global coverage of secure, anti-jamming data and voice communication services for U.S. strategic command and tactical operations, ensuring the  U.S. military’s ability to operate in a highly confrontational environment Safe and reliable high-speed communication capabilities can also provide services to U.S. allies such as Canada, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, and Australia.

Subject: U.S. Army
U.S. Army

141.doctext: Raytheon Company has been awarded a $2.1 billion contract from the  U.S. Missile Defense Agency to produce and span_3 Delivery of   Standard-3BlockIB missiles.  SM-3  is the only ballistic missile interceptor capable of both land and sea launches and is used to destroy short-range ballistic missiles and medium-range ballistic missiles. Currently,  SM-3  deployed around the world has successfully intercepted ballistic missile targets outside the atmosphere more than 30 times.  SM-3BlockIB missile   May 2016 Completed third-stage rocket engine  test, achieved mass production in 2017, and delivered within the project cycle Received more than 400 coins. SM-3BlockIIA is an improved version of the  SM-3BlockIB missile , which is characterized by being equipped with a larger rocket motor and kinetic energy interceptor. In November 2018, the U.S. Defense Security Cooperation Agency proposed to sell 8  SM-3BlockIB missiles  and 13 SM-3BlockIIA missiles to Japan for approximately US$561 million.

142.doctext: On April 21,  Eielson Air Force Base in Alaska, USA received the first two  F-35A fighter jets and delivered  to   The  354th Fighter Wing under the United States Air Force Pacific Command assumes combat duty and participates in the Red Flag multinational joint large-scale air combat exercise.  Eielson Air Force Base  has a cold winter climate, with temperatures generally around minus 40 degrees Celsius, so the 354th Fighter Wing will equip pilots with special polar survival kits. The base will eventually  deploy 54  F-35A fighter jets , making  Alaska  a  U.S. military   deployment   The place with the most fifth-generation fighter aircraft. In addition to the  F-35A fighter jets  at Eielson Air Force Base, there are two  F-22 squadrons   stationed in the state's Joint Base Elmendorf-Richardson .

Subject: Eielson Air Force Base in Alaska, USA
Eielson Air Force Base

Location: Eielson Air Force Base in Alaska, USA

143.doctext: Recently,  US CapellaSpace Company  has signed a contract with the US Department of Defense to provide synthetic aperture radar data services for the  US Navy , including information collection and data analysis and processing. The SAR system is used for all-weather and all-time radar imaging. By capturing amplitude and phase historical data, it can obtain accurate and valuable information such as material properties, moisture content, altitude, etc. that cannot be provided by optical images.  CapellaSpace Company has now passed the verification of airborne radar data acquisition, and plans to launch   a satellite equipped with a SAR system  later this year  /span_5 . According to the company’s report, the  satellite constellation   deployment will achieve SAR imaging with a resolution of less than 0.5 meters, which can be used to identify aircraft or vehicle targets on the ground, and can be used in any weather Provide all-weather monitoring services for the US military under various lighting conditions.

144.doctext: According to a report on the U.S. C4ISR website on June 12, 2020, Colonel Kevin Finch, program manager of the U.S. Army Intelligence, Electronic Warfare and Sensors Program Executive Office, said that the  Army is working in  Europe  and  Pacific   deploy   new electronic warfare equipment, the first reintroduction of electronic warfare systems since the Cold War, an effort that will continue until  Fiscal Year 2021. This new system includes a tactical electronic warfare system mounted on the Stryker, and a light tactical electronic warfare system mounted on the Flyer72. The former has electronic support and attack capabilities, while the latter is only used for electronic support. Additionally,  the Army  is working to establish multiple units, including tactical cyber units, electronic warfare companies and electronic warfare platoons, to ensure the right people are in the field to field these systems.  The Army will accumulate experience through these electronic warfare systems and provide reference for the ground-level system. The latter is the  Army's first integrated signal intelligence, electronic warfare for brigade-level troops. and network platform, with the first batch of systems expected to be delivered in fiscal 2022.

145.doctext: Japan Ground Self-Defense Force received the first  V-22 tilt-rotor aircraft   July 10,  Japan Ground Self-Defense Force /span_3 The first  V-22 Osprey tilt-rotor aircraft has been temporarily  deployed from the  U.S. Marine Corps Air Station at Iwakuni Base in Yamaguchi Prefecture The  Kisarazu Air Base Camp in Chiba Prefecture, east of Tokyo, marks the completion of the  delivery of the first  V-22 .  On May 8th  , two  V-22 Osprey tilt-rotor aircraft  purchased by the Japan Ground Self-Defense Force  arrived at Iwakuni Air Base. The U.S. Navy Military Sealift Command used the USS Green Ridge naval cargo ship to transport the first two  Ospreys to the U.S. Marine Corps Air Station in Iwakuni, where they were delivered to  Japan aspect.

146.doctext: U.S. Indo-Pacific Command Commander Phil Davidson believes that currently  deployed on  land-based and  in  Guam The sea-based missile defense system cannot provide all-round defense. It is hoped to deploy   land-based Aegis in  Guam  before  2026 Missile Defense System to defend U.S. territories against advanced ballistic and cruise missile threats. Davidson made it clear to the U.S. Council for the first time in March that the Indo-Pacific Command’s priority weapon system in fiscal year 2021 is the Guam homeland defense system. The backbone of this system will be the Baseline 10 version of the  Land-based Aegis system, designed to use SM-3 missiles to track and shoot down ballistic missiles in flight. Currently, the  United States has deployed the first  land-based Aegis system in  Romania , and the second system is planned to be launched in It will be put into use in Poland in 2022.

Subject: U.S.
Militaryforce: in  Guam The sea-based missile defense system

147.doctext: The U.S. Air Force is intensifying the  testing and  fielding of a new set of  hardware and  software, These hardware and software will become the mainstay of military command and control. Since February, the  Air Force has issued three RFPs for technologies that could be integrated into the Advanced Battle Management System, a program dedicated to networking military data to form a complete picture of the battlespace. Part of the Air Force's joint all-domain command and control concept.  The Air Force awarded the first batch of advanced combat management system contracts in May and July to a total of 46 companies. Each company initially only received an indefinite delivery/indefinite quantity worth US$1,000. rewards, but with the opportunity to compete for more funding in the future. The Advanced Battle Management System networks every launch platform and sensor to a cloud computing environment and uses artificial intelligence to ensure relevant information moves immediately to the platform that needs it. For example, the system could compile data from Global Hawk drones and Navy destroyers to help instruct fighter jets to lock missiles on nearby targets.

148.doctext: On September 9, 2020, the executive officer of the U.S. Navy's unmanned and strike weapons program stated that  Marine Corps will begin  deployment the following months   Armed MQ-9 Reaper UAV.  MQ-9  is a medium-altitude, long-endurance UAV, mainly used to perform persistent intelligence, surveillance, reconnaissance and strike missions. Compared with the RQ-1 Predator, it has a longer endurance and a larger payload. Can fire heavier precision ammunition.  Since 2018, the  Marine Corps has leased General Atomics span_9 RQ-9 , General Atomics provides various services including UAV control, and the Marine Corps UAV Squadron participates in learning. In March 2020, Marine Corps soldiers controlled  RQ-9  for the first time in a combat mission. In June,  Marine Corps  invested US$26.9 million to purchase 2  MQs. -9 , which will help drone squadrons learn how to operate Group 5 drones and provide input to the Marine Corps expeditionary drone program.

149.doctext: United States President Trump dispatched  B-52 nuclear bombers to the  Middle East   , which is obviously a response to  Warning from Iran. Trump has reportedly been considering whether he should attack   Iran  before Biden takes over as president in January 2021. Under the Trump administration,  the United States  and  Iran  have experienced a series of  conflicts  and relations between the two countries have reached new lows. U.S. Central Command announced the arrival of  B-52 heavy bombers , saying the aircraft would deter aggression and provide security for  U.S.  partners and allies. At least three  B-52 bombers  flew to Israel before heading to a US military base. This is the third time in 18 months that the  United States  has seemingly deployed   B-52 bombers  against  Iran   .  B-52 bomber aircraft  fly direct from a base in North Dakota to the  Middle East  and are expected to  be stationed  at a  US base in Qatar  .

150.doctext: According to a report on the U.S. Air Force Technology Website on December 1, 2020,  General Atomics Aeronautical Systems announced that it has delivered the last two aircraft to the  Spanish Air Force     MQ-9ABlock5 UAV and 1  ground control station, marking that the company has completed the supply to  Spanish Air Force    Foreign military sales project of 4  MQ-9ABlock5 UAVs and 3  ground control stations.  Stationed at  Talavera-La Real Air Force Base, the  233rd Squadron will operate the newly delivered  MQ- 9  . Prior to this delivery,  General Atomics  has completed relevant acceptance  testing  procedures at its Gray Hornet flight operations facility. The U.S. Air Force MQ-9 System Project Office witnessed this acceptance event on behalf of the Spanish Armament Directorate. Spain has granted the  MQ-9ABlock5  an airworthy military type certificate, the first time this type of drone has received such a certificate.  General Atomics stated that the award of the type certificate demonstrates Spain’s confidence in  MQ-9ABlock5 . The successful operation of this type of UAV will ensure Spain’s intelligence and surveillance and reconnaissance needs.

151.doctext: Kratos Corporation delivered the 100th  BQM-177A target drone to the U.S. Navy   U.S. Kratos Corporation to  U.S. Naval Aviation Systems The headquarters   delivered the 100th  BQM-177A subsonic target drone, and is close to completing the third and final low-rate initial production contract. The company also won the first batch of full-rate production contracts worth US$29.2 million on September 29, totaling 35  BQM-177A target drones  .  The U.S. Air Force Aviation Target and Decoy System Program Office stated that it is currently deploying  this type of target aircraft at the  Pacific Missile Range on Kauai  , and Virginia has reached The Atlantic Fleet Combat Training Center in Mneke will also receive this type of target drone.

152.doctext: On September 28, the U.S. Department of Defense announced that  the U.S. Marine Corps  began receiving ACV new wheeled amphibious combat vehicles to replace amphibious assault vehicles.  Starting in October 2020, the  Marine Corps will  deploy the first batch of  ACV amphibious combat vehicles armored personnel carriers . In the future, the  Marine Corps also plans to purchase and  deploy three other models, including  command and control vehicle and  rescue vehicle and  Fire Support Vehicles. The ACV amphibious combat vehicle has a total combat weight of about 32 tons. It is equipped with a remote-controlled weapon station. The weapon station is equipped with a Mk-19 automatic grenade launcher or an M2-style 12.7 mm heavy machine gun. It can carry 3 crew members and 11 Marines. , the maximum water speed is 11 kilometers/hour.
