153.doctext: BAE Systems selects  Kongsberg Aerospace Defense to design and manufacture the  MCT-30 medium-caliber remotely controlled turret for the  U.S. Marine Corps ACV-30 amphibious combat vehicle program . According to the contract,  Kongsberg  will  deliver  150 sets of  MCT-30  in phases.  Test prototypes  of the turret will be  delivered  starting in  early 2021  and then enter the production phase.  MCT-30 medium-caliber remote-controlled turret Equipped with a 30mm automatic cannon, it can provide high-precision firepower for Marine Corps amphibious combat vehicles. The crew can remotely operate weapons to aim and shoot targets from the armored crew compartment. Thereby improving the safety of the occupants. The turret has been deployed in the  U.S. Army    for combat use since  2018 and is the main weapon of the Stryker series armored vehicle Dragoon infantry combat version. and fire control systems to meet the European Deterrence Plan. All  MCT-30  for US customers are manufactured at the  Kongsberg Corporation  facility in Johnstown, Pennsylvania, USA.

154.doctext: Dassault Aviation delivered  the first  upgraded Mirage 2000D fighter to the  French Air Force    Dassault Aviation  The Clermont-Ferrand repair shop of the French Air Force has recently moved to the  stationed at the  118th Air Force Base of the French Aerospace Forces in  Mont de Marsan /span_7 Delivered the first  Mirage 2000D fighter jet that has undergone mid-term life extension upgrade. The aircraft will then undergo comprehensive  testing  , laying the foundation for the full implementation of the  Mirage 2000D fighter  mid-term life extension upgrade in early 2022. In order to enable the French Aerospace Forces and Navy to have 225 combat aircraft, the French Aerospace Forces have decided to retain at least 55 Mirage 2000 fighter jets by 2030. This mid-term life extension upgrade mainly improves the air-to-air and air-to-ground strike capabilities of  Mirage 2000D , including the installation of MICA infrared air-to-air missiles produced by Euromissile, modular guided bombs produced by Sagem, and BAT-120GL lightweight laser-guided missile produced by Thales Group. At the same time, the avionics interface has been improved, a new central navigation/attack system and Talios multi-function targeting pod have been installed, and the performance of the new data link has also been improved. Law

155.doctext: At the start of winter deployment in 2021,   UK 45 Commando Royal Marines and  a number of specialist units from 3rd Commando Brigade have been  span_3 Deployment to the  North Pole. This training course is divided into three stages: survival, maneuver and combat, aiming to ensure that soldiers have the ability to survive on land and cope with cold shocks in ice-breaking exercises, so that they can effectively carry out operations in the harsh Arctic environment. action.  Training  content mainly includes  jumping into an ice cave and climbing out of the water using ski poles without assistance . The purpose is to help soldiers understand and reduce the risk of cold shock. Soldiers also need to understand the basics of survival, which is key to performing missions in arctic conditions. Deployed with  45th Commando to participate in Arctic training are  30th Commando Royal Marines Information Development Group and  Commando Logistics Regiment and  Commando Helicopter Force, and  24 Commando Royal Engineers and  29 Commando Royal Artillery.

156.doctext: Australian Navy  The first supply-class new-generation auxiliary refueling supply ship USS Supply has been commissioned. In May 2016, Spanish Navantia Shipbuilding Company won a contract to build two supply-class supply ships for the  Australian Navy  to replace the upcoming supply ships Success and Sirius. After commissioning, the lead ship  Supply will be  deployed at  Australian Navy Eastern Fleet Base Sydney, while its sister ship  Starwater USS will be  deployed at  Western Fleet Base Sterling. Australian Defense Minister Peter Dutton said that auxiliary refueling and supply ships are a key element of the country's modern maritime operations. As regional security challenges intensify, strong maritime business support capabilities are more important than ever. The supply class will help maintain Australia's strong naval capabilities and safeguard the security, sovereignty and prosperity of Australia and its regional partners.

Subject: Australian Navy

157.doctext: The formation of the first Rafale fighter squadron of the Indian Air Force was completed. On April 21, the Indian Air Force once again received 4  Rafale fighter jets , thus completing the formation of the first Rafale multi-purpose fighter squadron. These fighter jets are part of the Indian Air Force’s $9.5 billion order for 36  Rafale fighter jets  in 2016.  India’s first Rafale fighter squadron is the  17th Golden Arrow Squadron, which will be  deployed at the  Ambala Air Force Base in northern India.  France's Dassault SA is expected to start delivering   aircraft to  India's second squadron of Rafale fighter jets  in the coming weeks. span_9, the squadron is  101st Falcon Squadron,  deployed based at  Haseemara Air Force Base, delivery may be by the end of 2022 or Completed in early 2023. Both squadrons consist of 18  fighters .

158.doctext: On May 25, the  U.S. Army  disclosed the equipment configuration of the mobile short-range air defense battalion formed around the newly installed mobile short-range air defense system.  The Army plans to form 4 mobile short-range air defense battalions. Each battalion will have 550 soldiers and be equipped with 40  mobile short-range air defense system vehicles and 20 infantry transport vehicles. With medical evacuation Strykers or mine-resistant ambush-resistant vehicles, 100 joint light tactical vehicles or high-mobility multipurpose wheeled vehicles, 75 support vehicles, and 75 trailers. The mobile short-range air defense system is based on the Stryker combat vehicle chassis and is equipped with Stinger and Hellfire missiles. It is mainly used to provide field air defense capabilities for mobile troops. The first batch of 4  vehicles have been launched  April  Delivery of   Army  Stationed in a  Air Defense Battalion in  Europe /span_9 .  The U.S. Army  is currently conducting a project environmental assessment for the fielding of the air defense system.

159.doctext: Russia Diamond-Antey Company executives recently stated that the Sky-M radar has excellent anti-stealth capabilities and can detect targets including the U.S. F-22 Raptor and F-35 Lightning II. advanced fighter aircraft.  Diamond-Antey Company  is a major developer and manufacturer of Russian air and space defense systems. The company attaches great importance to various radar projects and technologies and has produced more than 30 types of mobile multi-functional radar systems.  Sky-M  and  Container Radar  are the backbone equipment for realizing Russia’s ground border omnidirectional radar field. These latest radars are now  delivered    Russian troops stationed in the most dangerous direction. The first batch of  Sky-M  was delivered  to the  Western Military District of Russia  in  2017   . This type of radar was later equipped with  stationed in  Transbaikal,  Khabarovsk and  Primorsky Krai span_16 Corps and was delivered   to the Crimean Air Defense Forces in  2018 .  Sky-M  Can detect aircraft and ballistic missiles 1,000 kilometers away, and hypersonic air targets 600 kilometers away.  Mobile Sky-M  Can be quickly redeployed by land or air, stealth technology will not work against this new radar. In addition to  Sky-M , the  container over-the-horizon radar  with a detection range of 2,000 kilometers can also be used to monitor military aviation activities close to the Russian border.

Object: to the Crimean Air Defense Forces

160.doctext: Russia recently stated that it plans to deploy  multiple  Resonans-N radars  in the  Far East region   to detect hypersonics and stealth target and provide guidance. The radar operates in the meter waveband and can detect hypersonic aircraft flying at up to 20 times the speed of sound. When facing aerodynamic targets, its effective detection range is 600 kilometers; when facing ballistic missile targets, its detection range is 1,200 kilometers. The maximum detection target altitude is 100 kilometers.  Russia  plans to deploy up to five  Resonans-N radars  in the  Far East  in  2027  . The first radar will be  deployed  in the  Sakhalin region  . Resonans-N operators will start training at the Vladimir Regional Air Defense Center in 2022. The 45th Air Force and Wehrmacht of the Northern Fleet currently have three  four-module circular view Resonans-N radars  , and two more are being deployed in the  Arctic    .

161.doctext: According to a report by the Washington Times on December 19, the U.S. Department of Defense is planning to establish a second missile defense system near the east coast of the United States or in Europe to combat threats from the Middle East. The Washington Times noted that Bush administration officials familiar with detailed plans for the missile defense system said the plan calls for establishing another interceptor base in Maine to defend against missile threats from the Middle East and Europe. Additionally, the  United States may deploy   interceptors in  United Kingdom,  Hungary, or  Poland   Missile. The governments of these NATO allies have privately expressed their willingness to cooperate with the  United States  and provide bases for missile defense systems. The Times stated that Russia had criticized  the United States  for deploying a missile defense system on the 18th, and the deployment of  interceptor missiles  in Europe may further unsettle Russia. It is also reported that Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Liu Jianchao said at a regular press conference on the 19th that  The United States and Japan are jointly studying missile defense systems. China’s response may bring negative consequences to regional stability and security. He is worried about the negative impact and said that relevant countries should not harm the security interests of other countries in developing theater missile defense systems in the Asia-Pacific region.

162.doctext: According to British Ministry of Defense officials, the  Royal Air Force is deploying MBDA's  advanced short-range air-to-air missiles to the  Middle East   The  F3 Tornado fighter jets are preparing to deal with Iraq. This is the first time  ASRAAM missiles  have been deployed overseas since they were put into service. The  ASRAAM missile  entered service in 2002, after a one-year delay due to Department of Defense concerns about the missile's performance.  F3 Tornado  is the first fighter aircraft equipped with  ASRAAM missiles . In addition, improved Harrier fighter jets and Eurofighter aircraft will eventually be equipped with the missile. At the same time, the  improved GR4 Tornado fighter aircraft that have been  deployed in the  Gulf may be equipped with Raytheon's Enhanced Paveway II and Enhanced Paveway III Precision guided bombs. In 2001, the above-mentioned guided bombs entered service with the  Royal Air Force . A company formed by Raytheon, MBDA and Boeing is bidding for Britain's long-term precision-guided bomb program. The group led by MBDA offered Boeing's JDAM modified missile to participate in the bidding, and Raytheon proposed using Paveway laser-guided bombs.

163.doctext: Xinhuanet, Ankara, March 12th: The Turkish military announced on the 12th that  Turkey  has completed the air defense deployment of  early warning aircraft  and  Patriot missiles . The Turkish General Staff issued a written statement on the 12th saying that  Two  early warning aircraft provided by NATO    have been  deployed  Konya Province Base in central Turkey;  Three groups of  Patriot missiles provided by the Netherlands    were  Deployed in  Diyarbakır Province and  Batman Province Base under the jurisdiction of the Second Military Region Headquarters, both provinces are close to  Turkey  and the border area with Iraq. The statement said these early warning aircraft and  Patriot missiles  were now engaged.

Subject: Three groups of  Patriot missiles provided by the Netherlands
Two  early warning aircraft provided by NATO

164.doctext: In  Annapolis, the capital of Maryland,  held a presentation by  Northrop Grumman Corporation to the  United States Navy   Ceremony of Delivery of the   Advanced Seal Delivery System.  ASDS  is a combat submersible that can carry SEALs and their combat equipment covertly to and from enemy shores. The boat can be deployed on some modified Los Angeles-class attack submarines and will eventually be deployed on Virginia-class attack submarines, Ohio-class ballistic missile submarines and a third Seawolf-class attack submarine. Fallone, ASDS program director at Naval Sea Systems Command, said the system could provide SEALs with a new combat capability in high-threat areas. The delivery of  ASDS  marks a critical milestone in ensuring that our  Navy  has the most advanced equipment to fulfill today's vital missions.

165.doctext: The U.S. Air Force's  Joint Standoff Missile Joint Program Office and the B-52 Systems Program Office have approved the development of the  Lockheed Martin Corporation The joint standoff missile can be put into service.  Lockheed Martin has deployed to  at  Barksdale AFB and  Whiteman AFB in  B-52 bomber fleet,  delivered 42 of the missiles. In addition to being initially equipped with B-52 bombers, the missile will also be equipped with B-1 and B-2 bombers, as well as F-16 and F/A-18 fighter jets. The Appropriations Committees of the House of Representatives and the Senate had planned to significantly reduce funding for the missile in the fiscal year 2004 defense appropriations bill, but only modest cuts were made in the final defense appropriations bill, which approved an allocation of US$85 million. The number of missiles purchased is 200, which is still less than the 250 required by the government.  Lockheed Martin  estimates that during the implementation of the missile program,  the U.S. Air Force  will purchase an additional 50 missiles at some point.

166.doctext: BAE Systems/Rockville Collins Data Link Solutions LLC has received a $56.6 million order from the  United States  Naval Space and Naval Warfare Systems Command to provide multifunctional information distribution system terminals.  MIDS terminal  can provide secure, high-capacity, interference-resistant voice and data communications for U.S. military and allied forces. The terminal will be equipped on several U.S. aircraft, including U.S. Navy F/A-18s and U.S. Air Force F-16 fighter jets, and will also be supplied to Australia, Belgium, Norway and Poland. Approximately 14 countries have installed/opted  DLSMIDS terminals  on 19 types of aircraft. It was the first certified  production MIDS terminal and the first to be  deployed to  Afghanistan and  Iraq span_6 Terminal for performing combat missions. This order includes the supply of an additional 216  terminals  and spare parts. It is part of a contract signed in January 2000, bringing the number of  terminals  ordered under the contract to over 600. After successfully passing the defense procurement process, the project will begin full-rate production.

167.doctext: The U.S. Naval Special Operations Command handed over the first  Cyclone-class patrol boat   to   Coast Guard Force will  transfer 6 ships in succession in the next four years. The Cyclone-class high-speed patrol boat has a shallow draft and a length of 170 feet. It is a piece of equipment used by the US Navy SEALs to quickly land ashore. There are 13 boats in active service, all of which are no more than 7 years old. Two weeks after the handover of the first  Tornado class , its replacement, the  Tornado class  will enter active service. This new high-speed patrol boat is provided by  Congress  on its own initiative  . Each boat costs US$23 million, with annual operation and maintenance costs of US$3 million. The boat is 9 feet longer than the Cyclone class at the rear

Subject: The U.S. Naval Special Operations Command
The U.S. Naval Special Operations Command

168.doctext: Boeing Co.  announced Tuesday that it has been awarded a $189 million contract to develop and operate a  space-based surveillance system  for the U.S. Air Force. The contract calls for  late 2007 for  The Boeing Company and its partner  Bell Aerospace & Technologies to develop and  launch  A  satellite that can track moving targets in space. The Department of Defense will use the data obtained from this SBSS to provide information support for military operations. In addition, NASA can use this information to enable the International Space Station and space shuttles to avoid orbital debris.  Boeing's  phantom task force will be responsible for operating the system for one year before the system is  transferred  to the  Air Force .

169.doctext: According to a report in Defense Systems Daily on May 19, 2000:  The FAA  recently took delivery of an air defense radar and completed final installation. The ARSR-4 radar will provide improved location information and weather detection, thereby improving U.S. military air safety. The route surveillance radar is an all-solid-state, long-range, three-dimensional radar. It will replace existing legacy radars and provide weather data to the  FAA  , the U.S. Air Force, Navy and U.S. Customs. The ARSR-4 radar, produced by Northrop Grumman, provides many capabilities that other long-range radars do not have. It can detect targets with an area of ​​1 square meter 250 nautical miles away, which is 50 nautical miles farther than ordinary long-range radars. The radar can also detect targets with an area of ​​1 square meter under many harsh conditions. The superior target detection capability enables it to identify enemy intrusions and drug smuggling. Due to the added weather processing function, it can improve weather detection from Level 2 to Level 6. The meteorological information provided will give controllers and pilots greater understanding of the operating environment. The 43  operating systems in the plan are  deployed in  the surrounding continents of the United States,  Guam,  Hawaii Island and  Guantaramo Bay,  Cuba. The 44th system is used by the FAA Academy in Oklahoma City.

Subject: The FAA
FAA
Location: the surrounding continents of the United States

170.doctext: Lockheed Martin is improving the airborne mine clearance capability for the  U.S. Navy MH-60S helicopter and is developing combat operations for the  MH-60R  Mission capabilities.  Lockheed Martin has previously developed a common cockpit for Sikorsky's  MH-60R  and MH-60S helicopters under a contract from the  US Navy  . The five-year contract calls for the supply of 141 to 270 cockpits per year. This universal cockpit has been installed on 70 MH-60S used for logistics support. The MH-60S's AMCM capabilities will make the aircraft a mine-sweeping helicopter.  Lockheed Martin has received a contract from the  U.S. Navy for 9  AMCM consoles. The first one is scheduled to be  by the end of this year   /span_9 Delivered  ,  2006   Deployed  .  The US Navy  plans to purchase approximately 250 MH-60S.  MH-60R  will undertake more combat missions than MH-60S. The project is currently in the  trial  and low-rate initial production stages.  An improvement program for the MH-60R  has been defined, including dipping sonar, an integrated self-defense system and Hellfire torpedoes.  MH-60R  is scheduled to start use  next spring   test  and evaluation work, and will form initial operational capability in 2006.  The US Navy  also plans to purchase about 250  MH-60R  .

Subject: Lockheed Martin
Lockheed Martin
Lockheed Martin
Equipment: An improvement program for the MH-60R

Subject: Lockheed Martin
Lockheed Martin
Lockheed Martin
Equipment: An improvement program for the MH-60R

171.doctext: Although  Germany 's military exports are far less than those of the United States and Russia, it is still one of the world's top 10 important arms and equipment exporters.  Germany 's military exports account for approximately 6% of global military exports. More importantly, certain weapons and equipment of  Germany are very popular in the international market, especially the ships and armored vehicles produced by  Germany are in high demand in the international market. big. German weapons experts believe that  Germany  successive governments have strictly controlled the export of German military products, especially the export of armored vehicles. The German government only allows German companies to export armored vehicles to EU or NATO countries, with very few exceptions. The most notable exception was  in 1991   Germany  delivered  36  German tanks to  Saudi Arabia   / span_9, and the other is the planned  deployment of   German tanks in the  Iraq Army training project.

172.doctext: December 10, the Boeing Ground-based Midcourse Defense Project Team and the  Missile Defense Agency conducted an underground launch silo at Vandenberg Air Force Base in  California China  deployed its first  land-based midcourse defense interceptor. Six  missile interceptors   have previously been deployed  in  underground silos  at Fort Greely, Alaska.  Boeing  Deliveries of the first  interceptor to the  Vandenberg Air Force Base Land-Based Midcourse Defense Missile Launch Site Further enhancing the United States' ability to defend against ballistic missile attacks, said Paul Hoff, Boeing Vice President and Director of Missile Programs. The ground-based midcourse defense system includes integrated ground-based interceptors, a large number of sensors, and a scalable battle management command, control and communications network. It is capable of protecting the U.S. homeland from limited long-range ballistic missile attack. As prime contractor,  Boeing is responsible for the development and integration of land-based mid-range defense system components, including land-based interceptors; sea-based X-band radars; battle management, command, control and communications systems; early warning radars; and Provides an interface to the Defense Support Program early warning satellite system. Other members of the Ground-Based Intermediate Range Defense program group include Orbital Sciences Corporation, Raytheon Company, Northrop Grumman and Lockheed Martin.

Subject: Boeing
Boeing
Object: Vandenberg Air Force Base Land-Based Midcourse Defense Missile Launch Site

173.doctext: The U.S. Army Communications and Electronics Command, on behalf of the U.S. Army Close Combat Systems Program Management Division, has awarded a contract with a total potential value of not more than $78 million to  General Dynamics Land Systems Division-Canada , aiming to provide 148  RG-31 medium mine-resistant vehicles, including $3 million worth of  spare parts. According to the contract,  General Dynamics Ground Systems Division-Canada Branch  is responsible for providing project management and logistics support, and BAE Ground Systems South Africa OMC Branch is responsible for producing the vehicle. The contract, initially funded at just $38.2 million, was awarded through a Canadian commercial company. The final specifications and pricing of the contract will be completed in April 2005, and  delivery  will be implemented in  April ~ December 2005  .  RG-31 tactical vehicle  has excellent ballistic and mine explosion protection capabilities and can be deployed in the  U.S. Army  to support various ongoing missions. In  2003 and 2004  9  delivered  9  RG-31 mine protected vehicles  and have been in service overseas.  The Canadian Army  has  deployed 3 of these vehicles  to  Afghanistan  as part of its contribution to the International Security Assistance Force. In addition, the vehicle was widely used by NATO forces deployed in the former Yugoslavia and United Nations forces deployed in Lebanon, Georgia, Canada, Syria and Kosovo.

Subject: General Dynamics Land Systems Division-Canada
General Dynamics Ground Systems Division-Canada Branch
General Dynamics Land Systems Division-Canada
General Dynamics Ground Systems Division-Canada Branch

174.doctext: British company QinetiQ announced on June 5, 2008 that it had delivered  the first set of  modular advanced weapons to the  US Army   Robot system. The modular design of the remote-controlled MAARS allows for the insertion of a variety of mission components, including sensors, robotic arms and multiple weapons. According to  Qinetic Corporation , MAARS can provide a variety of functions from non-lethal to lethal. MAARS can be equipped with a 7.62mm M240B medium machine gun and can also fire 40mm high-explosive grenades. MAARS can be used as a non-lethal weapon if the operator uses a stun laser, bean bag, smoke screen and pepper spray.  Qinetic Corporation  Pay attention to the safety features of MAARS to prevent accidental firing of the M240B medium machine gun. This is the experience and lesson learned from the early product of MAARS - the Special Weapons Observation, Reconnaissance and Detection System. Currently, there are 3 sets of  SWORDS   deployed in  Iraq , and equip the 3rd Infantry Division.

175.doctext: The U.S. Air Force  is improving the software of the  F/A-22 Raptor  to eliminate glitches in the aircraft's flight control system. According to  Air Force  and  F/A-22  prime contractor Lockheed Martin, the new Raptor aircraft will receive modified software. Raptor aircraft built before the software issue became apparent will also be improved.  The Air Force  said this approach would be the least expensive. The modified software has passed rigorous test flights by multiple test pilots. Steps are currently being taken to make this improved software available to all Raptor aircraft in the Air Force roster. Air Force investigators recently found a fault in the flight control system that caused the  Raptor 4003 aircraft to malfunction  during the  flight  test on September 28 last year Turbulence Flaws in unexpected events. Although the aircraft  landed safely, it suffered $3.6 million worth of damage  .  The U.S. Air Force  plans to  begin  deployment of the   F/A-22  in December of this year  .  The Air Force  has raised funds to purchase 179 Raptors and is seeking more funds to increase the number to 381.

176.doctext: North Korean media reported that since  2004, the  United States has deployed   ATACMSBlockII missiles in South Korea   span_4 to reinforce the  BlockIA missiles that have been  deployed to  South Korea. North Korean media reports suggest that the purpose of this reinforcement is to demonstrate the deployment of part of the  Second Infantry Division   when  stationed in  South Korea /span_11 The ongoing commitment of U.S. ground forces to  South Korea through  Iraq. If the above reports are true, this will be the first time that  the United States  has deployed  ATACMSBlockII missiles  overseas except for the 2003 Iraq War. In another piece of news related to South Korea's ATACMS missile deployment, the U.S. Army Aviation and Missile Command signed a $45 million contract with Lockheed Martin in February 2005 to purchase newly produced ATACMS LockIA missiles, but no Clearly indicate the purchase quantity.

177.doctext: Phoenix website reported on July 15 that  the US Air Force the last  B-2 stealth strategic bomber   today was at  Langley Air Force Base span_4  held a  delivery and naming ceremony, and the aircraft was named  Spirit of America.  Ｂ-2  It is the latest of the three types of strategic bombers in the United States, with a cost of US$1.3 billion each. Since the first B-2 was delivered in December 1993, the  U.S. Air Force has purchased 21 aircraft of this type, including  American Spirit, 19 of which are state-owned. The only exceptions are American Spirit and the Kitty Hawk Spirit commemorating the site of the Wright Brothers' flight experiments.  B-2 strategic bomber   deployed  at  Whiteman Base, Missouri , which can launch GPS-guided precision weapons under any weather conditions. This type of bomber first participated in military operations during last year's Kosovo war. The 4-round, two-man piloted  B-2 bomber is shaped like a bat and can carry more than 18,000 kilograms of ammunition. It is an important member of the United States' long-range bombers. The other two long-range bombers cost US$200 million. The above B-1 bomber and the B-52 bomber cost 74 million US dollars. B-52 bombers began to be delivered in 1955, and currently  US Air Force  has a total of 85 aircraft; B-1 bombers began to be delivered in 1985, and currently  US Air Force  has a total of 51 aircraft.

178.doctext: A report from the Russian Space Agency stated that  Russia  does not have a meteorological satellite in orbit, and the  Meteor-M satellite  will fill this gap in 2006. It is expected to complete the construction and  testing of the  Meteor-M satellite  and a smaller satellite  Canopus-Vulkan  in  2006  and launch. A new draft of the federal space program indicates that the deployment of   Earth remote sensing  in 2006   will require approximately 4 billion rubles. Until now, Russian weather forecasts have had to use information from extremely expensive foreign weather satellites.  Representatives of the Russian Hydrometeorological Service said: We only have one meteorological satellite  Meteor-3M-1  in orbit, but due to  failure it has been  Cannot provide weather information. We can only use information from the United States, Japan, and some other land survey vessels. Before the  1990s, 32  Meteor series meteorological satellites were built and  launched under the contract of the  Bureau of Hydrology and Meteorology span_16.  Meteor satellite  is one of the key elements of the  Hydrometeorological Service  monitoring system, which has greatly improved the quality of weather forecasts and established an environmental monitoring system for the vast territory of the former Soviet Union. However, since the 1990s, due to financial problems  Russia  the development of domestic meteorological satellite systems has stagnated.

Subject: Representatives of the Russian Hydrometeorological Service
Bureau of Hydrology and Meteorology
Hydrometeorological Service

179.doctext: KVH Industries USA has signed a $1.5 million contract with Reconnaissance/Optics to provide  the  U.S. Army new Universal Remotely Operated Weapon Station   DSP-3000 high-performance fiber optic gyro system. The  CROWS system has been  deployed to  Iraq and allows the gunner to operate, aim and fire turret weapons from a safe position inside a Humvee or other vehicle , without being exposed to the threat of enemy fire. Each  CROWS system is equipped with 2 sets of  KVH Company's  DSP-3000 fiber optic gyro system. This fiber optic gyro system can provide precise stability and weapon recoil control, allowing the weapon to stay on target. The CROWS project engineering director said that  KVH Company's  DSP-3000  is the core part of the weapon station stabilization system. The accuracy of  CROWS stabilization system allows shooters to The bullets are fired without missing a beat, effectively improving the combat effectiveness of the troops in urban combat environments while ensuring minimal collateral damage.  The CROWS system  is jointly designed and produced by Reconnaissance/Optics Corporation, Electron Optical Systems, Inc., and the U.S. Army Soldier Program Executive Office/Soldier Program Management Office.  CROWS  can be equipped on a variety of vehicles, including the Military Police's M1114 Armor-Upgraded Humvee, the Air Force's M1116 Armor-Upgraded Humvee and the Military Police's M1117 Security Vehicle with Armor Protection.

180.doctext: According to senior Taiwanese Navy officials, two  Kidd-class destroyers  are about to join the Taiwan Navy. These two ships are the first two of the four  Kidd-class destroyers that will be  delivered to  Taiwan. They will be  2005 In early November 2016 left  the United States for  Taiwan. The other two destroyers of this class will be delivered to   Taiwan  in  2006  . With the approval of US President Bush,  Taiwan  purchased these four destroyers with a full load displacement of 9,600 tons in April 2002.  The United States released a report last month warning that  China has  deployed 730  ballistic missiles on the  mainland  points to  Taiwan . Analysts say  Taiwan  urgently needs these destroyers. They are equipped with standard-2 anti-aircraft missiles, which can track dozens of incoming targets at the same time. Their anti-aircraft missiles have a range of 144 kilometers, which is far stronger than the standard-1 missiles. , At present, the Taiwan Navy's Chenggong-class frigates, built in imitation of the Perry-class frigates, are equipped with standard-1 anti-aircraft missiles.  The Kidd-class destroyers  will also enhance the surveillance capabilities of the Taiwan Navy and provide  Taiwan  with a maritime anti-missile platform.

181.doctext: Estonia plans to upgrade its  air defense system and invites  European MBDA Company and  American Raytheon Company to bid for this project worth 4500 million euros to provide  with   missiles. Estonia's defense minister said two companies have been identified as suppliers of short-range anti-aircraft missiles needed by the country.  Estonia  joined NATO in 2004. He added that  Estonia  is a country with significantly weak air defense capabilities among NATO members and currently only possesses old and outdated Israeli missiles. The goal of the state procurement is to provide  Estonia  with a modern and flexible  air defense system  that will be able to be integrated into the Allied forces' joint  air defense system  . The $55 million bid will be announced at the end of August, with the winner to be announced in 2006. He said the new  system  should be deployed   before  2009  .

182.doctext: The U.S. Navy  awarded  Kvichak Maritime Industries  to build 10  MPF utility boats  . The 40-foot  High-Speed ​​Landing Craft will replace the  Navy existing LCM-8s as support  and pre-positioned   for improved maritime transfers for maritime amphibious assault missions part of the system. The 40-foot-long, 14-foot-wide  landing craft  has a speed of approximately 25 knots fully laden and 30 knots unladen. Power package includes: two Komis QSM11 engines with 660 hp and 2300 rpm, ZF325 marine gear, Hamilton 364 water injectors. In order to ensure the safety and effectiveness of transporting 30 people, gear and cargo, the boat is equipped with a building structure and a bow door at the stern for landing deployment. The first  all-aluminum boat will be delivered  in February 2006   , and the tenth boat will be  December 2006   Delivery  . The San Diego base of the  Navy  will receive two  MPF general purpose boats  , and the other two will be homeported in the Port of Norfolk. The remaining six will be  deployed  on  MSC prepositioned ships . Other features include a 6-kilowatt Northern Lights generator set, integrated electronic instrumentation package, loading and unloading brackets, three mounting brackets for M2/MK19 and M60E3 weapons, tools and spares bag.

183.doctext: Singapore has made the latest effort to provide multinational support for the reconstruction of Iraq - deploying   to the  Gulf region   and landing the Singaporean Navy's HMS Resolute tank Ship. With Lieutenant Colonel Tan Bian as the main person in charge,  Resolute will perform tasks such as protecting the waters around key oil terminals, patrolling, and landing operations, and will also provide support to the joint forces during the three-month deployment period. Fleets and helicopters provide logistical support. On the morning of September 2, Rear Admiral Chew Men Leong presided over a farewell ceremony at Changi Naval Base for the  tank landing craft Resolute  and its crew, a total of 175 people. Since  2003, in providing multinational reconstruction support to the  Gulf of Iraq, the  Singapore Armed Forces has completed 4  tank landings ship, 5  KC-135 aerial tankers and 1  C-130 transport aircraft combat  deployment missions.

184.doctext: Senior officials from the United States  and Japan have reached an agreement to advance information sharing on ballistic missile defense between the two countries. The agreement was reached at the ministerial security talks in Washington between the US Secretary of State and the Secretary of Defense and the Japanese Foreign Minister and Director of the Defense Agency. This is the so-called two plus two talks. An interim report released on October 29 reflected the agreement between the leaders of the two countries to deepen the U.S.-Japan alliance and develop more comprehensive cooperation between the Japanese Self-Defense Forces and the U.S. military. At a joint press conference held by the U.S. Department of Defense after the meeting, Japan stated that the readjusted consultations marked a historic process to enhance the bilateral alliance. The Japanese government is ready to expand the role of the Japan Self-Defense Forces to participate in joint defense operations with U.S. forces. The 14-page report, titled "The U.S.-Japan Alliance: Reform and Adjustment for the Future," calls for the establishment of a Japan-U.S. Joint Operations Center and proposes moving the Air Self-Defense Force's air defense headquarters from Fuchu to Yokota. The report also calls for the two countries to increase information sharing and joint information-gathering activities on missile defense systems.  The United States's  New Advanced X-Band Early Warning Radar will be  deployed in  Japan and cooperate with  Japan The FPS-XX next-generation anti-missile radar system works together to create an effective missile attack early warning network. Shared defense information enables U.S. Aegis destroyers to launch interceptors based on radar information provided by  Japan . In addition,  American Standard-3 missiles  will also be deployed in  Japan   .

Subject: Senior officials from the United States
The United States
Senior officials from the United States
The United States
Militaryforce: New Advanced X-Band Early Warning Radar

185.doctext: ITT Corporation  has completed preliminary  testing  of the  Portable Approach Control System-AN/MPN-26 . The system will provide the U.S. Air Force and Air National Guard with capabilities similar to those of the FAA's fixed installations. Testing includes preliminary performance and communications capabilities of the  system  as well as full radar performance testing, including flight  testing  . The  system  is currently undergoing  government department  review and  testing  . According to the current schedule, the first batch of five  devices  will be delivered to the  Air National Guard   in April 2006  . For rapid deployment, the  AN/MPN-26 system  package includes: a sheltered digital airport surveillance radar, operating subsystems and a precision approach radar.

186.doctext: India  announced an important acquisition plan for the Navy on December 2 and stated that the new military equipment will have an important impact on the energy channels in the Indian Ocean. In addition to building and purchasing new surface ships, submarines and aircraft, the Indian Navy will also establish military cooperation with neighboring countries.  India  deployed a number of  ships during the  2004   Indian Ocean   Tsunami  For disaster  relief in  Sri Lanka and  Indonesia.  India  is reducing dependence and uncertainty on foreign suppliers. The navy has handed over the construction contract for 27 ships to its own state-owned shipbuilders and has also begun building aircraft carriers.  India  currently plans to build 36 ships. The Navy is preparing to buy 30 long-range aircraft to replace the British-built Sea King rotorcraft, and is also waiting for two P-3 Orion anti-submarine aircraft to be leased by the United States. At the same time, the renovated former Soviet aircraft carrier and its carrier-based aircraft will also be delivered to the Indian Navy.

187.doctext: U.S. Air Force Senior Officials Say  Active Denial of Non-Lethal Weapons will be deployed to  Iraq by the end of    or Afghanistan, this non-lethal weapon fires directed energy at a living target that feels like a bee sting. This weapon uses millimeter wave technology to produce a thermal effect on the human body. When the radiation intensity is greater than 1 watt/square meter, most of the heat energy will invade human tissue, causing the body temperature to rise, which in turn causes physiological reactions such as burning pain.  Weapons  The small amount of kinetic energy required can be provided by the truck's battery. The weapon has been installed on a Humvee and completed  testing  in the  Nevada Desert  . Its effective range is 1 kilometer, and it can attack a single soldier or widen the beam to attack a group of 3 to 4 soldiers. The weapon can also be mounted on aircraft to cover special forces operating on the ground. The millimeter-wave band of active denial systems lies in the electromagnetic spectrum between microwaves and infrared. Due to the high cost of this technology, its development has been slow. As the cost decreases, this technology can have wider applications, especially in the fields of communications and sensors.

188.doctext: Raytheon will provide  U.S. Army missions stationed in  Afghanistan and  Iraq to detect enemy troop movements. span_4 Sensor Systems provides engineering and logistical support. Under the $76.2 million contract, Raytheon will provide technical and other support for rapid initial deployment systems for U.S. and allied forces. Raytheon Integrated Defense Systems will provide engineering services, spare parts procurement, field training and integrated logistics support services for the RAID system in the Southwest Asia theater. RAID consists of a system of infrared sensors mounted on an elevated stationary platform, allowing U.S. and allied forces to respond quickly to threat situations. Raytheon developed the system to meet the growing needs of the U.S. military for persistent surveillance capabilities.

189.doctext: The Irish Ministry of Defense has signed a €12.5 million contract with  EADSCASA  to modernize two  Irish Air Force aircraft in use since 1994 span_3 CN-235 maritime patrol aircraft. The two aircraft were  dispatched  to conduct surveillance of the  Irish Exclusive Economic Zone  and to support armed forces, police and naval operations. These missions require permanent aircraft modernization and the availability of significant resources. Therefore, the Irish government decided to replace the existing on-board equipment with the FITS complex mission system developed by  EADSCASA . FITS is a system developed entirely by  EADSCASA  that uses a variety of sensors to provide aircrews with the information they need to successfully execute maritime missions to anti-submarine warfare missions.  The Irish Air Force  The first  modernized CN-235 aircraft  will be delivered  in 2007    .

190.doctext: According to foreign reports,  Iraq fighter jets  last week   broke into the airspace of   Saudi Arabia  The United States Department of Defense span_4 Officials immediately decided to deploy additional  fighter planes and  military personnel   to the   Persian Gulf  . Although  the Ministry of National Defense  emphasized that this was a routine military shift, sources pointed out that the United States was worried that Iraq might take advantage of the oil price crisis to cause trouble and fish in troubled waters. Defense Department officials said the U.S. military will closely monitor the movements of  Iraqi  troops during the latest round of redeployments. There are currently about 20,000 to 25,000  U.S. troops   stationed in the  Middle East region. In addition, a battle group led by the aircraft carrier USS Washington is also Cruising in the  Persian Gulf area.  U.S. officials said that in the latest air force movement, a  Air Force Task Force of sixty U.S. aircraft and  a force of five thousand supporting soldiers /span_17 � will be transferred to bases   in  Kuwait and  Saudi Arabia  . A  Air Force Task Force Response Force with forty-five aircraft and a  force of 1,400 support soldiers were  dispatched to   /span_23 Incirli Air Base in Turkey. In addition, the six member states of the Gulf Cooperation Council have also decided to expand the Peninsula Shield Force, which was established after the 1990 Gulf War. The number of troops will be increased from the current 5,000 to 22,000.

The milestone was achieved by AI-005 while performing a routine reconnaissance mission in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom. The Army series of 3  Combat Aircraft fly more than 700 hours per month between 2 deployment locations, reaching 10,000 combat hours than another system Predator UAS manufactured by  GAASI  Flight hours are 4 years too early.  I-GNATER UAV is designed as a long-endurance tactical reconnaissance system to support ground forces.  Army The first  I-GNATER aircraft Deployed in  March 2004    only 6 months before contract award. Deployed  aircraft  are also being integrated with SATCOM capabilities to have beyond line of sight control. In addition,  GAASI  has recently completed the initial design review and tactical attack capabilities of its extended range/multi-purpose UAS subsystem. The system is scheduled to be launched in  April 2007   Delivery of the first  aircraft.

192.doctext: Austal Corporation has been awarded a $13.39 million fixed-price contract with the U.S. Sea Systems Command to continue providing   Westpac Express high-speed catamaran  rental service.  West Pacific Express is a high-speed catamaran built by  Ostol Company. It was originally designed as a ferry/cargo ship,  2001 span_6 was first leased  by the  United States Marine Corps   and was mainly used to transport  stationed  in  Okinawa Islands   The Third Expeditionary Force and  corresponding equipment. Although the ship will be deployed around the world, the main deployment range is still near the Okinawa Islands of Japan. The contract signed this time contains four one-year optional lease terms. If all are fulfilled, the total contract value will reach US$55.28 million. The contract will take effect from February 2007 and end in September 2007.

193.doctext: The Pentagon's Missile Defense Agency has approved a plan that could lead to the  United States deploying billions of dollars of  missile defense facilities in  space  span_3, and caused tensions between  the United States and Russia and other countries. The plan, called a space-based test bed by the  Pentagon Missile Defense Agency  , will initially include one or two interceptor missiles designed to shoot down ballistic missiles carrying nuclear, chemical or bacterial warheads. The Bush administration has spent nearly $10 billion annually on ballistic missile defense. The  Missile Defense Agency  plans to raise $45 million to begin construction of the test center in fiscal 2007. This small-scale space-based test plan will include 1-2 small interceptors without offensive capabilities. The plan will  assess the value of the  Anti-Ballistic Missile Defense Network being developed by the   United States, a  defense network built on land, the ocean, and on a modified Boeing jumbo jet equipped with airborne lasers. Other companies with large missile defense contracts include Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman and Raytheon.  Missile Defense Agency  The program will provide a new approach to missile defense, the deputy administrator for acquisition said.

194.doctext: Russia Defense Minister Ivanov said that Russian high-level officials are very concerned about the Far East military region and will take measures to provide   modern equipment for  troops   .  In 2006  ,  Russia  will deploy the   Spider missile system  in the  Far East military region  .  The Spider Missile System  is a high-precision combat and tactical missile system that can destroy anti-missile and air defense systems, ground aircraft, artillery, and civilian installations.  Missile system  The range is 50 to 280 kilometers. The missile launch weight is 3800 kilograms, and each  system  is equipped with two missiles that can carry a 480 kilogram multi-warhead. Qiao Rong

Northrop Grumman  has provided security services since 1997, installing systems on more than 40 nodes. The third satellite will be deployed in South America. Applications of this commercial service include the deployment of broadband networks anywhere, at any time. This application is also very effective for homeland security interests. 198.doctext: To help fighter pilots improve their technical skills before the aircraft carrier is commissioned,  the Indian Navy  is building a seaside training facility in Goa for  MIG-29K aircraft  and the Navy's LCA aircraft carrier. This is the third simulated flight deck in the world. Currently, only the United States and Russia have one such facility each. The work of the SBTF has already begun at  INS Hansa Naval Air Base, where  is stationed with the   Navy's fighter squadrons and  training squadrons, pilots of the existing Harrier fighter jets. The work of constructing the SBTF glide facility was handed over to Goa Shipbuilding Corporation Ltd., a defense state enterprise unit, through the Aeronautical Development Authority of India, Bengaluru. Information from GSL indicates that the SBTF will be completed next year, well ahead of the expected 2010 date. Considering that the SBTF will provide training for naval fighter pilots next year,  India will deliver the first batch of 4  meters  early next year    G-29K aircraft. This is about six months later than the expected delivery time of September this year.  India purchased 12 of the 16  MiG-29K fighter jets signed with  Russia in 2004. 199.doctext: Stationed in Iraq   United States Marine Corps  Equipped with  Jaguar heavy wheeled armored truck , and can withstand IED attacks. The  Jaguar heavy truck and other  similar American vehicles deployed in  Iraq all have a V-shaped armored floor. Can deflect the upward shock wave of a roadside bomb underneath the car. Explosive ordnance disposal teams and combat engineers use  Jaguar heavy-duty trucks  , each weighing 13.62 tons or more, depending on the model. As part of the Accelerated Defense Agency Acquisition Program,  Jaguar heavy-duty trucks  were fielded by  U.S. Marine Corps Forces in Iraq  in  fall 2004  . These vehicles provide combat engineers and explosive ordnance disposal teams with high protection against armor-piercing projectiles and anti-tank mines. Currently, the  U.S. Marine Corps in Iraq  has equipped 26  Jaguar heavy-duty trucks  . In addition, the U.S. Marine Corps has ordered 122 Joint Explosive Ordnance Disposal Rapid Response Vehicles, another similar variant of the  Jaguar heavy-duty truck . This batch of vehicles will be completed this month and will be used to equip overseas joint military explosive ordnance disposal teams.

200.doctext: The Israel Defense Forces issued a statement on October 17, saying that the  Arrow-2 ballistic missile defense system it developed will be officially put into use from now on. The system will alert and intercept any incoming  Arrow-2 ballistic missile defense system span_2Israel offensive surface-to-surface missiles. An Israeli military official said that starting from the 17th,  Israel  has become the first country in the world to put the  ballistic missile defense system  into use. He said that this is a natural link in the Israeli military's  deployment  plan for the missile system. He denied that the commissioning of the  Arrow-2 ballistic missile defense system  was related to the current tensions in the Middle East.  The Arrow-2 ballistic missile defense system  consists of radar, early warning and missile launch control systems. Its main function is to intercept short- and medium-range ballistic missiles. The system has a radar search range of up to 500 kilometers and can track and intercept 14 targets at the same time. The effective missile interception range is 50 to 90 kilometers. This system was jointly developed by  Israel and  United States in 1986. It has cost US$1.3 billion so far, of which  60% of the money Provided by    in the United States.

202.doctext: New Zealand's new Defense Minister Wayne Maiple said  Navy  that there are obvious problems with the six ships that have not yet been delivered. It is said that 70 are  stationed with the  New Zealand Navy's  new ships Otago and  Wellington in  Australia Melbourne's  Navy Soldier will return to New Zealand this week, and the New Zealand Defense Minister and the builders of the seven warships will hold negotiations to discuss how to resolve the breach of contract and several complex issues. After problems arose with the Royal New Zealand Navy ship HMS Canterbury,  the New Zealand government  decided to no longer accept  ships  built by  BAE Systems  until the problem was resolved. Although the problems with the ship are relatively complex, Wayne Maipu still believes that all problems with the contract can be solved and the  delivery  can be completed by  March 31st  next year. He said: Obviously the Ministry of National Defense, the military and the contractors all want to complete the delivery, but currently the three parties have not reached an agreement, which will take some time.

203.doctext: India's largest defense electronics laboratory -  Indian Defense Avionics Research Institute has recently reached an agreement with  EADS Defense Electronics Company to provide services to   India Domestic advanced light helicopter Dhruv  jointly developed  advanced missile warning system .  EADS Defense Electronics Company will be stationed at DARE Bangalore Center to jointly develop 36  sensor systems. These sensor systems are mainly used for  Dhruv helicopters and other Indian military aircraft . All systems will be delivered  late 2008    . MILDSAN/AAR-60 is an advanced passive imaging sensor capable of detecting and tracking ultraviolet radiation from approaching missiles, including heat-seeking, shoulder-launched and other common threats. The system has full coverage and a low false alarm rate, allowing pilots to take countermeasures within the warning time and reducing pilot workload at critical moments. The sensor can be used on a variety of rotary-wing and large-body aircraft in service. A version for fighter aircraft is under development.  The Indian Dhruv helicopter  is jointly developed and manufactured by the state-owned Hindustan Aviation Co., Ltd. and the German MBB company. It is used to carry out attack, reconnaissance, anti-tank and anti-submarine warfare missions. 40% of its components are domestically produced.  The Indian Army  hopes to purchase  deploy  300  Dhruv helicopters  in the next 8 to 10 years.

Subject: The Indian Army
Militaryforce: India Domestic advanced light helicopter Dhruv

204.doctext: The United States is using minimal Covering the area with forces ashore, we seek to create an immediate missile defense capability. The heads of the U.S. Army Space Missile Defense Command and the U.S. Army component responsible for integrated missile defense said on July 25 that  the Army is considering integrating the U.S. Theater High Altitude Area Defense System  X Band radar serves as a deployable resource that can be  deployed ashore, providing the Navy with wider sensor coverage.

205.doctext: As part of the C-130 avionics upgrade program,  Boeing  was awarded a contract by the  U.S. Air Force  to upgrade the C-130 aircrew training system. The $56.3 million contract includes updates to the first simulator and other  training equipment  needed for the  delivery  of the upgraded C-130 transport aircraft. The project team composed of Boeing, CAE and Lockheed Martin will design, develop, install and test the upgraded training system.  The U.S. Air Force  plans to deploy the first upgraded C-130 in  2009   .  Boeing C-130  Project manager Harris said that the first simulator will be installed in the C-130 flight training unit at Little Rock Air Force Base. Under the C-130 Avionics Upgrade Program, Boeing is developing major upgrades for most of the U.S. Air Force's C-130 fleet. The upgrade will use a glass cockpit display to replace the round dials of the old C-130. The upgraded C-130 will meet existing navigation and safety requirements, achieve avionics standardization for the entire C-130 fleet, improve reliability and reduce life-cycle costs.

206.doctext: Saab Aerospace Systems plans to work with another manufacturer to develop a  next-generation tactical unmanned aircraft system  based on an existing system. Saab announced in June that it will develop its Skeldar V150 vertical take-off and landing unmanned aerial vehicle system. The V150 will be developed based on the APID55VTOL unmanned aerial system purchased by Saab from CybAero and is aimed at meeting anticipated Swedish military needs. Saab’s shortlist for a manufacturer partner for fixed-wing tactical unmanned aerial vehicles has ended. Saab is currently waiting for the Swedish Ministry of Defense to make a decision on the need to update the French-made Ugglan or SperwerA systems it purchased in 1997.  Sweden needs to deploy a  new generation tactical unmanned aerial system to  support the European Rapid Reaction Force's   11th Nordic Operations Group. This means that the initial combat capabilities of the new generation of tactical UAVs need to be formed by the end of 2009 or early 2010, and Saab needs to start development work in 2007.

Subject: Sweden
Militaryforce: new generation tactical unmanned aerial system

207.doctext: Recently, the Swedish Defense Equipment Administration awarded the Bofors branch of BAE Systems a contract worth SEK 40 million, requiring it to be responsible for the detailed design phase of the  Acher vehicle-mounted howitzer  project. This phase also includes alternative projects worth SEK 50 million.  Archer 155mm self-propelled howitzer  is based on an existing commercial chassis, making system maintenance simple and low-cost. Its crew number is only three, and they can operate weapons through computers in the fragmentation-resistant crew compartment. One  Archer Cannon  has the same lethality as 6 traditional artillery pieces. The gun is a new precision artillery concept that launches smart ammunition to accurately strike targets with a range of up to 60 kilometers. Due to its advantages in accuracy, it is ideally suited for deployment into UN and EU peacekeeping missions.  Bofors Company has delivered  2  demonstration guns to the  Swedish military   for  testing  . The final development order for 24  artillery pieces  is expected to be completed in 2007-2008, and  will be delivered in 2009-2011    .

208.doctext: On September 22,  Germany’s Federal Office for Defense Technology and Acquisition and the  ARGE212A  Alliance signed an agreement regarding the  delivery of the second batch of two  new 212A ships. -class submarine contract. The ARGE Group consists of Horvaz Shipbuilding Co., Ltd. and Noschel AG. Both companies are part of Germany's ThyssenKrupp Marine Systems. Based on the use of hydrogen fuel cells, both  submarines  will be equipped with airless propulsion systems. The second batch of  German Navy submarines  will be of the same design as the first four submarines and will also be constructed of non-magnetic steel. This construction design can well meet the future deployment needs of the German Navy. In addition to the enhancements and improvements in surface and underwater sensor technology, the performance of the  Type 212A submarine  communication system has also been greatly improved. This will help  submarines  be optimally deployed for network-centric warfare, and at the same time, this type of submarine can also be deployed to special forces. The delivery of the two submarines is scheduled for  2012  and  2013 .

Object: Germany’s Federal Office for Defense Technology and Acquisition

209.doctext: Raytheon Co. wins five-year, $285 million contract for the   U.S. Army and  Marine Corps Produce and  deliver the   Improved Target Acquisition System  . From 1999 to 2004, the  U.S. Army  purchased a total of 709  ITAS ; the Marine Corps purchased this system for the first time.  ITAS  is the  Advanced Electro-Optical Target Acquisition Fire Control System  that guides TOW anti-tank missiles to attack targets with surgical precision. The aiming system significantly improves the effective range of the TOW missile, improves the weapon's ability to hit the target, and minimizes collateral damage, allowing soldiers to launch missiles from a safe distance to destroy the target.  ITAS  The second-generation front-end infrared sensor can provide all-day, all-weather and long-range reconnaissance and surveillance capabilities under various battlefield conditions.  ITAS  has equipped  U.S. troops  stationed in  Afghanistan  and  Iraq  at all stages of the conflict. and played an important role in subsequent peacekeeping operations. In addition to traditional uses,  ITAS  also has innovative uses. For example, using  ITAS  as a precision guidance system allows troops to quell urban riots without damaging nearby residential buildings, religious and cultural sites. In addition, planned product improvements also include adding long-range target positioning capabilities, allowing the missile to automatically determine the target location and display the location of troops to obtain complete situational awareness. The addition of network radios will allow situational information to be transmitted to networked systems on the battlefield.

Subject: Raytheon Co.
Materials: Advanced Electro-Optical Target Acquisition Fire Control System

210.doctext: [According to a report on the Saab website on October 9, 2006]  Saab will produce and integrate the  Super Puma helicopters for the  Swedish Helicopter Force Defense aid kit. The IDAS equipment and services provided this time are part of the upgrade of three  Super Puma, which  Sweden is preparing to  deploy Go to Nordic Combat Group.  IDAS system  Missile Warning and Countermeasures Distribution System.  Delivery  Work will begin  January 2007 .  IDAS  is used to provide electronic warfare self-protection for airborne platforms in a variety of dense threat environments.  IDAS  includes radar, laser and ultraviolet missile approach warning and countermeasures distribution capabilities. Due to its modular design, the missile can be equipped with these three sensors at the same time.

211.doctext: On November 4, a  Delta-4 rocket lifted off from  Vandenberg U.S. Air Force Base    and successfully launched a  The National Defense Meteorological Satellite Program satellite - DMSP-17  was launched into orbit. The DMSP constellation can provide professional meteorological data for  the US military  to formulate land, sea and air combat plans.  The Delta-4 medium launch vehicle took off from Space Launch Site 6 at  5:53 a.m. Pacific time. About 18 minutes later, the  DMSP-17 satellite span_7 was successfully  deployed. SLC-6 is a  Delta-4 series rocket  launch site on the West Coast, which can launch U.S. Air Force satellites to polar orbits, sun-synchronous orbits and high-inclination orbits. It can provide launch support for five configurations of Delta rockets. This launch is the second West Coast launch mission of the U.S. Air Force's Progressive Expendable Launch Vehicle Program. It is the seventh launch mission since the  Delta-4 rocket began flying in November 2002. The third mission of the medium-sized rocket. The  Delta-4 rocket performing the  DMSP-17  mission includes a universal booster, a first stage propelled by an RS-68 engine, and a first stage propelled by an RL10B-2 engine. of the second stage and fairing. The next launch mission of the Delta rocket is the Delta-2 rocket to launch the GPS satellite, which will be launched in mid-November.

Equipment: The National Defense Meteorological Satellite Program satellite - DMSP-17

212.doctext: The U.S. Army has signed a $470 billion contract with  Lockheed Martin to purchase additional  Integrated Warhead Army Tactical Missile System Block1A missiles . The missiles will be produced at the company's facilities in Dallas and Horizon City, Texas, with delivery scheduled for  second quarter 2008    .  The integrated warhead ATACMSBlock1A missile is the latest model of the US Army's ATACMS system.  The US Army has been deployed in the  Iraq war   Use this missile. The missile is equipped with an integrated warhead and has a range of up to 300 kilometers, allowing it to accurately strike high-value and time-sensitive targets. Due to the vertical attack technology used in the final stage of the ballistic trajectory,  ATACMSBlock1A missile  significantly reduces the probability of missing the target it attacks, and due to its high accuracy, it can cause little collateral damage.
