213.doctext: United States Marine Corps Commander James Conway said that the  Marine Corps needs to expand to maintain operational capabilities in Iraq and Afghanistan , and provide preparation for other hazards.  Marine Corps  The current number of personnel is about 180,000, which is sufficient to meet the needs of peacetime operations. In the event of an emergency, this scale may not be able to meet emergency needs. In addition,  stationings in  Iraq and  Afghanistan means that Marines will not be able to achieve 14 home stationings every seven months after overseas deployment. monthly goals. Conway said that there are two ways to solve the existing problem, one is to reduce demand, and the other is to expand the size of the force to meet the needs of a long-term war.

214.doctext: December 14,  Delta-2 expendable launch vehicle took off from  Vandenberg Air Force Base   ,  span_4 Launched the U.S. National Reconnaissance Office's  confidential payload NROL-21 . The rocket successfully put the  payload into orbit 58 minutes later. This marks the first successful mission of  United Launch Alliance  since its formation on December 1. The  Delta-2 rocket that performed the mission used Pratt & Whitney Rocketdyne's RS-27A main engine as the first-stage booster, and nine Alliant Technology Systems' bundled rockets booster. The second stage uses Aerojet's AJ10-118K engine. The  United Launch Alliance was formed in 2006 to join the successful Delta and Atlas expendable launch vehicle programs to provide support for the U.S. government, including the Department of Defense, NASA, the National Reconnaissance Office and Other organizations provide low-cost, efficient, safe and reliable launch services. Management, systems engineering, test and mission support headquarters are located in Denver, USA. The U.S. location in Alabama and Harlingen, Texas is responsible for manufacturing, assembly and integration. Launch locations are at Cape Canaveral Air Force Station and  Vandenberg Air Force Base  .

215.doctext: Raytheon USA is developing and  demonstrating a   space-based over-the-horizon system for the U.S. Army to counter cruise missiles, called  Joint Ground Attack Cruise Missile Defense Improved Networked Sensor System.  Raytheon Company  was awarded a $144.3 million contract to develop and demonstrate the  JLENS system  for the U.S. Army Space and Missile Defense Command.  JLENS  consists of a radar-mounted space vehicle that provides over-the-horizon surveillance of cruise missiles, particularly those  deployed within the   United States  cruise missiles outside. It will operate between 10,000 and 15,000 feet to detect cruise missiles. The system, which can be operated on the ground or at sea and is repositionable, is a large, unpowered sensor connected to the ground by a cable and capable of staying in the air for up to a month at a time. Research and development work will be completed in early 2012.

Subject: Raytheon USA
Raytheon Company
Equipment: Joint Ground Attack Cruise Missile Defense Improved Networked Sensor System

216.doctext: Stephen Johnson, a spokesman for the U.S. Marine Corps Combat Command Command, said that the Marine Corps has recommended to the  Navy  that it purchase four more  Joint High Speed ​​Ships  in the next few years.  Joint high-speed ship  is a joint Army-Navy project. It is a  high-speed ship  that can carry personnel and equipment over long distances to perform a variety of combat missions. Such ships could replace the high-speed craft currently leased by the  U.S. Navy  and provide mission-critical capabilities. According to the current project plan, the Army will purchase 5 ships, and the  Navy  will purchase 3 ships. Johnson said: In the  Navy's shipbuilding plan in the next 30 years, three  Joint High Speed ​​Ships will be purchased, but we believe that we will need more such ships in the future. . This ship is especially useful for the Marine Corps. The Marine Corps recommended to the  Navy that a total of 7  Joint High Speed ​​Ships be purchased, 3  be deployed to the  Western Pacific, 2 Ships  deployed to  Arabia, one ship  deployed to  Spain, one ship  deployed To Norfolk Naval Base. Johnson also added that  the Joint High Speed ​​Ship  would not replace the amphibious ship.  Joint high-speed ships  are just large connection platforms in the theater. They do not have the capability of amphibious warfare. The Pentagon is preparing to make a decision on the Joint High Speed ​​Ship program this month.

217.doctext: The U.S. Department of Defense stated that the  U.S. Marine Corps has awarded the MRAP vehicle project to  9 companies, and these companies will all receive a copy of the first batch span_2 Test vehicles Each order will include two 4×4 armored vehicles and two 6×6 armored vehicles, as well as joint logistics support related to these two types of vehicles. Among them, the delivery of the first batch of  test vehicles  will be completed within 60 days after the contract is awarded. Furthermore, these  9 companies  will deliver a total of   36  test vehicles  , with a total contract value of more than $34.57 million. According to reports, the  US government  will purchase a total of more than 4,100  MRAP vehicles  this time, including 1,500 4×4 vehicles and 2,600 6×6 vehicles. Upon  delivery  these vehicles will be  deployed  in regions such as  Iraq and Afghanistan  .

218.doctext: iRobot Company  announced on Monday that it has won a contract worth US$16.58 million to provide   bomb detection robots  for the  US military   in Iraq.  iRobot Corporation  has partnered with ICx Technologies to integrate its bomb detection technology into the iRobotPackBot system. The technology has been successfully tested in Iraq over the past few years. Deliveries of the equipment will begin in the first half of this year under the contract awarded by the U.S. Naval Air Systems Command on behalf of the Autonomous Systems Joint Program Office. Dyer, president of iRobot's Government and Industrial Automated Systems Division, said the order from RSJPO marks the first major  deployment of the  bomb detection robot and represents a new market application for autonomous system technology. . The robot can replace soldiers in detecting and destroying bombs, and it can be deployed not only   in  Iraq  but also anywhere in the world.  iRobot Corporation  has supplied more than 800 PackBot robots to a wide range of military and civilian customers. The company maintains close cooperation with allied countries such as France, Germany, Britain and Italy.

219.doctext: Lockheed Martin announced on February 5 that it had delivered  a  new missile warning system to the  US military   for use To provide early warning of attacks on tactical and strategic missile satellites of the United States and Canada. U.S. Strategic Command, U.S. Northern Command, and North American Aerospace Defense Command will all rely on this upgraded system to quickly and accurately identify threats and achieve coordinated response among the services. The combatant commands' Integrated Command and Control System Spiral 2 upgrade is part of the Integrated Space Command and Control contract to integrate approximately 40 systems within the Cheyenne Mountain Command Center into a common, coordinated command and control in the system. Delivery of the  New Missile Warning System  enhances the 2004  deployment  of the  CCIC2S Helix 1 Air Mission System  .  The industry-standard commercial off-the-shelf technology in the new missile warning system  will enable future integration with existing missile defense systems. The new system also includes an upgraded missile handling display for theater users.  CCIC2S  When fully deployed, it will become a virtual command center.

220.doctext: Kvichak Ship Industries has completed the production and  delivery of 10  Maritime Prepositioning Force Utility Boats for the  United States Navy . This high-speed landing craft is mainly used to replace the Navy's existing LCM-8 mechanized landing craft. It will also serve as part of the improved naval transfer system to provide maritime prepositioning support for amphibious assault missions. This type of boat is 40 feet long and 14 feet wide. It has a cruising speed of 25 knots when ballasted and a speed of 40 knots when empty. The power system consists of: 2 Komis QSM11 engines, ZF325 marine gearbox and Hamilton 364 waterjet propulsion device. In order to ensure that 30 troops, equipment and dry cargo can be transported safely and effectively, this type of boat adopts the design layout of the stern cabin, and installs a movable door at the bow for stall grabbing operations. The first boat of this type was delivered  in February 2006  .  The Navy received two boats each at its San Diego and Norfolk bases, and the remaining six boats will be  deployed at the  Military Sealift Command's Maritime Prepositioning Ships  Go up.

Subject: United States Navy
The Navy
Location: Military Sealift Command's Maritime Prepositioning Ships

221.doctext: Sikorsky Aircraft Company  has delivered the 100th  MH-60S Seahawk helicopter   to the   U.S. Navy  .  Sikorsky Aircraft Company  is a commercial division of United Technologies Corporation.  Sikorsky  Relevant sources said that the delivery of this helicopter is another important milestone in the  US Navy 's plan to purchase 250 helicopters. Since first being delivered to the fleet in  2001  the helicopter has been  deployed  and has flown more than 150,000 hours around the world. This helicopter is a multi-mission platform used by the  U.S. Navy  for logistics, troop transportation, and standard airborne mine clearance. In addition, the helicopter can also be used as an armed helicopter.

222.doctext: The Royal Australian Air Force has selected the Raytheon  ALR-673 Radar Warning Receiver System for its F/A-18 tactical carrier aircraft as part of the Hornet Improvement Program .  The Royal Australian Air Force  intends to purchase 66 sets of  ALR-673 systems  . As a kick-off and warm-up to the project,  Raytheon  also signed a $6.3 million antenna contract with the  Australian Navy .  Raytheon Company project director said: This contract is not only to provide  the Royal Australian Air Force with F/A-18 carrier-based fighter/attack aircraft  The advanced and efficient  Radar Warning Receiving System will also bring new technologies and related work content to Australia. It will be delivered to the  Royal Australian Air Force    A fully integrated, interoperable  radar warning receiving system to protect combat aircrews. The  ALR-673 radar warning receiving system installed on the Navy's F/A-18E/F carrier-based tactical aircraft successfully completed its first mission in the  Iraq Freedom War span_15 Deployment.  ALR-673  uses sophisticated digital technology to detect and identify threat radar emitters, thereby enhancing the aircraft's combat capabilities, which when combined with the Hornet's electronic equipment system, can provide  Royal Australian Air Force An advanced digital radar warning receiver.

223.doctext: The U.S. Air Force Civil Engineering Support Agency has awarded a contract worth $4.5 million to  Smith Detection Company, a provider of chemical and explosive detection and X-ray imaging systems,  The company  will  provide   portable chemical identifier--HazMatID  and  chemical detection system--APD2000 .  The U.S. Air Force  plans to  deploy  these systems to  260 bases around the world  . Operators can use these devices to identify toxic industrial chemicals, toxic industrial materials, and other unknown liquids and solids in seconds. The HazMatID portable chemical identifier can distinguish thousands of unknown or suspicious materials without the operator having to extract a sample. The system uses infrared technology to identify substances or compounds in seconds. The APD2000 is a handheld chemical detector used by military and civilian emergency responders to detect and identify hazardous chemicals. In addition, APD2000 also has gamma ray detection and long-range communication capabilities.

224.doctext: According to media reports, if  Japan is under the threat of a missile attack, a set of  Tokyo.  High-tech Patriot Enhanced Capability-3 missile interceptor. Large public areas such as squares near the palace are considered dangerous areas. However, due to their limited range, if a ballistic missile attack is considered possible, these interceptors need to be moved closer to the political and economic centers of the city to provide optimal protection. A Department of Defense spokesman said it would not provide the exact location where  PAC-3  would be deployed.  Next week,  Japan The first batch of  PAC-3  will be at  Iruma Air Base   in Saitama Prefecture, north of Tokyo. span_8 Deployment.  PAC-3  can shoot down incoming missiles in the final stages of their flight.  Japan  also plans to introduce ship-based Standard Missile-3 equipment, which can intercept incoming missiles outside the atmosphere during their mid-flight.

225.doctext: American Armor Holdings, Inc.  is a manufacturer and marketer of military vehicles, vehicle armor systems, and life safety and survivability systems. Recently, the company claimed to have received an order worth US$32 million from the  British Ministry of Defense  to provide the  Pinzgauer light tactical armored vehicle  . The vehicles will be delivered  in 2007    and the work will be carried out at Armor Holding Aerospace & Defense's Pinzgauer facility in Guildford, Surrey, UK. , in which the vehicle armor is provided by the Aerospace and Defense Group's factory in Fairfield, Ohio, USA. According to the head of Armor Holding, the company has received two orders from the  UK Ministry of Defense for  Pinzgauer armored vehicles to support  the UK    Deploy  troops. It also reflects the company's ability to successfully integrate its armor capabilities with Stewart & Stevenson's light armored vehicle program.

226.doctext: The United States expedited the ordering of  Mine-Resistant Ambush-Resistant Vehicles for  deployment in  Iraq and was awarded at the end of June 2007  British BAE Systems A contract worth US$212.4 million to order 441 vehicles again. These vehicles will be  delivered in June 2008  .  The U.S. Marine Corps has awarded a contract to the  BAE Systems Ground and Weapons Division Ground Systems Division for 271  MRAP  Category 1 vehicles , 16  MRAP  Category 2 vehicles and 154  MRAP  Category IA special command vehicles. The contract also includes 90 days of consumables, forward-deployed supplies, maintenance work shops, field service representatives and operators, and maintenance training. The U.S. Army plans to replace 17,700 Humvees with a batch of MRAP vehicles to perform specialized tasks. Since the first contract was issued in February 2007, the  U.S. Marine Corps has awarded contracts worth $1.7 billion to multiple companies for 3,765 vehicles, including  General Dynamics Land Systems Division partners Force Defense, Navistar International, and  BAE Systems. After  General Dynamics received the production order, the company announced on June 29  2007 that it would  deliver the first batch of 3 vehicles within 120 days.  MRAP vehicles, if needed,  1,000 vehicles per month can be  delivered by  early 2008.

227.doctext: Russia plans to abandon two missile bases in Ukraine, including one 70 kilometers away from a  United States  planned  radar station  . The two bases are located near the border between Ukraine and Slovakia and in Sevastopol in southern Ukraine. They will be replaced by Russian radar stations. A Russian Defense Ministry official said that two Ukrainian-owned sites leased to Russia provided use rights to the  United States  in 2005. The Russian government has submitted a draft to the House of Commons that would end the agreement, which pays about $1.3 million per year for the base. Russia stated that the  United States planned to deploy anti-missile  radar stations in the  Czech Republic and  interceptor missiles in Poland, which has threatened Russia's security. Relations between the two Cold War rivals have become increasingly tense in recent times. The base in Ukraine is similar to the base in Azerbaijan that Russian President Vladimir Putin recently suggested the United States use. Nonetheless, senior U.S. Defense Department officials said on July 9 that Russia’s proposed military base in Azerbaijan cannot replace the deployment of missile defense bases in Poland and the  Czech Republic .  The United States believes that in order to ensure the security interests of  the United States in Europe,  the Czech Republic   deploys   radar stations span_12 and the deployment of   interceptor missiles in  Poland   are both necessary. The plan has been agreed to by the  Czech Republic  and Poland, and has been approved by NATO as a whole.

228.doctext: According to Bloomberg,  Russia has allocated $2.1 billion in the 2009 extra budget for a variety of defense activities, including efforts to counter the  United States plan in  Europe  Work related to the deployment of the  missile defense system. News media quoted Russian Deputy Prime Minister Sergei Ivanov as saying that  Moscow  chose to provide a new budget after the military  conflict  with  Georgia .  The Bush Administration seeks to deploy 10  missile interception systems in  Poland   and in  Czech Republic   /span_12 Deploy a  radar base. Russian President Medvedev said in November that if  Washington moves forward with its above-mentioned plan,  the Russian government will build a new border on  its borders with Poland and Lithuania Deploy   short-range Iskander missiles on . Bloomberg also reported that an additional defense budget will be used to upgrade the Iskander missile.

Subject: Russia
Moscow
the Russian government
Location: its borders with Poland and Lithuania

229.doctext: The  Naval Science and Technology Laboratory under the Defense Research and Development Organization of India handed over  2  advanced training mines. A senior official of DRDO, Sivathanu Pillai, handed over the service records of advanced training mines to Commander-in-Chief, Eastern Fleet of the Indian Navy P. Suthan at  NSTL .  NSTL  The $1.884 million local plan was completed well ahead of the project development deadline of December 31, at only one-fifth or one-sixth of the cost of similar imported technology. The official claimed that  NSTL  has developed several types of mines and torpedoes and is currently developing  a new type of thermal engine  and  a ship-launched heavy torpedo Varunastra , the project has entered the final stage and is expected to be delivered   to the Indian Navy in mid-2009. Vice Admiral Suthan of the Indian Navy said that the navy's lack of training mines directly affects the training of soldiers, and the entry of advanced training mines into service will help solve this problem. Mine warfare is a dynamic process, and he hopes that  NSTL  will give the navy more help in other technical fields.

Subject: NSTL

230.doctext: The U.S. Air Force said Raytheon will restart production of  laser-guided Maverick missiles  to meet urgent operational needs for close air support weapons to strike high-speed moving targets with minimal collateral damage. The U.S. Air Force currently uses television-guided and infrared-guided Maverick missiles in combat. So far, only the  U.S. Navy  and  Marine Corps   have fielded  such  laser-guided missiles  .  The laser-guided Maverick missile  has been combat-proven to be effective and reliable in anti-armor and anti-moving surface targets in urban environments and close air support missions.  Maverick  is a precision air-to-surface missile carrying multiple warheads and guidance head variables. It can be used to attack small or solid moving or stationary targets; armored vehicles; surface-to-air missile bases; and important targets. The missile has a fire-and-forget capability, allowing the pilot to fire and immediately take action to escape, or engage another target being tracked by the missile.

231.doctext: Recently,  Terry Defense Systems of the United States won a contract worth US$8 million, mainly responsible for providing  M72A7 to the   United States Department of Defense Light anti-armor weapon system and its M72A9 anti-bunker ammunition. According to the contract,  Taili Defense Company will eventually  deliver 1,287  M72A7 light anti-armor weapon systems, which is a single weapon with a caliber of 66 mm. It is a portable, lightweight direct-aiming shooting weapon for soldiers, consisting of a disposable launch tube and an internal combustion, free-flying rocket pre-assembled in the launch tube. The aluminum launch tube is a lightweight, retractable, single-shot, single-use launch device, including: inner and outer cylinders, detonating device, mechanical sighting system, firing device, safety lock, integrated rear cover, and The shoulder stock and back cover of the gun sling.  The M72A7 light anti-armor weapon system was designed to meet the needs of participating in the war in Vietnam and to attack tanks developed by the former Soviet Union. Actual combat verification has shown that the weapon has the ability to attack bunkers and defensive positions. Provides robust fire support to  dismounted combat units deployed in  Afghanistan and  Iraq. The contract also includes 1,833 M72A9 anti-bunker munitions. The contract work is expected to be carried out at  Telly Defense Systems'  arsenal in Mercer, Arizona, USA, and will be completed in March 2008. The contract was awarded to the U.S. Naval Surface Warfare Center.

Subject: Terry Defense Systems of the United States
Taili Defense Company
Telly Defense Systems'
Materials: The M72A7 light anti-armor weapon system

232.doctext: The Defense Procurement and Logistics Organization of the Danish Ministry of Defense   recently  handed over  two aircraft to the  Royal Danish Air Force Tactical Air Command   span_4 Lockheed Martin's  TPS-77 mobile, long-range surveillance radar.  Radar  will be temporarily  deployed  at  Karup Air Station  . In 2005,  Lockheed Martin 's radar systems business unit won a four-year contract from DALO to provide logistics support packages for radar systems.  Lockheed Martin  planned months in advance to deliver  the  radar  to  Karup   . DALO's technical director said that these new radars will fully improve Denmark's air and surrounding area surveillance capabilities.  TPS-77  is the latest configuration of the three-dimensional solid-state radar FPS-117. This L-band tactical  radar  can provide high-quality three-dimensional surveillance data on air targets, with a surveillance range of up to 250 nautical miles and a maximum surveillance altitude of 100,000 feet.

Object: Royal Danish Air Force Tactical Air Command

Subject: Royal Danish Air Force Tactical Air Command

233.doctext: Latvian Navy representatives will receive   from  Netherlands Navy   on  September 5th in the Dutch city of Den Helder Alkmaar-class M05Viesturs minesweeper. The boat is the second of 5  minesweepers  purchased by Latvia from the Netherlands. The Minister of Defense of Latvia, the Special Ambassador of Latvia to the Netherlands, and the leaders of the Latvian and Dutch navies participated in the reception ceremony of the boat.  The Ministry of Defense of Latvia  signed an agreement with the  Ministry of Defense of the Netherlands  on August 24, 2005 to purchase 5  Alkmaar-class minesweepers  . The first  minesweeper M04Imanta  was delivered  on March 7 this year   . The purchase price of each boat is 8 million latu.  The main mission of the Alkmaar-class minesweeper  is to detect and destroy mines. It will also participate in NATO response forces, perform search and rescue operations or perform patrol missions if necessary.  Minesweeper M05Viesturs  Built in 1984, formerly named  Scheveningen  . The boat has a displacement of 595 tons, a length of 51.6 meters, a width of 8.96 meters, and a maximum speed of 15 knots. The vessel  next year  will be  deployed  to the  Sea  Joint Maritime Area Fleet.

Subject: Netherlands Navy
Materials: The main mission of the Alkmaar-class minesweeper

234.doctext: The U.S. Army recently awarded  Northrop Grumman Corporation a contract worth US$17.5 million to produce more than 500  handheld laser target locators. To help soldiers lock and identify enemy targets. The first  delivery  is scheduled for  April 2008  and the final  delivery  will be completed in  August 2009 .  MarkVII handheld target locator  It can accurately determine the enemy's position throughout the day and can be used to monitor and determine the enemy's position in air strikes or artillery strikes. The MarkVII system is currently deployed with U.S. Army forward observers and scouts, U.S. Air Force tactical flight controllers, Marine Corps forward observers and flight controllers, and U.S. Special Forces. In the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq, the system provided precise target location information to the  U.S. military .

235.doctext: The U.S. Air Force began to equip the  U.S. Air Force base stationed in   South Korea with improved and upgraded  F-16 fighter jets /span_4 .  Stationed in Gunshan   The 80th Fighter Aviation Group of the US Army  will become the first unit to upgrade its F-16 fighter jets. The  aircraft  manufactured in the mid-to-late 1980s were equipped with digital electronic equipment, a helmet-mounted target indication system, and a new generation of fire control systems during the improvement process, including advanced medium-range air-to-air missiles.  The purpose of the  US military fighter aircraft deployed in  South Korea is to attack the  US military and South Korea in the event of a conflict with North Korea or China The military provides support.

236.doctext: EADS Defense and Security  supplies  German ground forces   with a  computer-based  command and control system  worth 75 million euros.  The Defense Electronics Division of EADSDS will provide  520 sets of  power supplies  for the  German Army command and control information system - FüInfoSysH  by 2010 /span_7 and  air conditioning equipment allow the system to be installed in mobile cabins, enabling ready combat capabilities when deployed globally.  Power bank  and  Air conditioning unit  are mounted on the trailer. In addition, DE will also provide 38 deployable shelters to be used as mobile brigade combat management centers. The mobile battle management center will ensure flexible and effective battle management. Mobile studios, such as combat management centers or ground stations, have complex electronic equipment. The power supply and air conditioning solution adopted by DE's mobile studio uses the waste heat of the motor to drive the air conditioning compressor, effectively reducing operating costs.

Subject: The Defense Electronics Division of EADSDS

237.doctext: The  Novosibirsk Aviation Production Complex , which has been merged into the Sukhoi Holding Company, has completed the improvement of the current six frontline bombers Su-24 into the  Su-24M . A spokesman for the Russian Defense Industry Systems announced on Wednesday:  Next week 6  improved frontline bomber Su-24M  will be  delivered to the   Russian Air Force span_5. According to him, these aircraft will enter the  aviation units  stationed  in the  Far East  .  The Su-24M  can effectively attack ground and water targets within enemy territory all day long. The aircraft has variable swept wings and is powered by two AL-31FZ engines, with a single thrust of 11,200 kilograms. The aircraft has a two-person cockpit, a normal take-off weight of 35,910 kg, a maximum take-off weight of 39,700 kg, an effective combat load of 3 tons, a combat radius of 570 kilometers, a maximum speed of 1.35M, and a practical ceiling of 11,000 kilometers.  Su-24M  can carry a variety of weapons, including Kh-23, Kh-28, Kh-58, R-60, Kh-25L, Kh-29L, Kh-31P, and Kh-59 missiles, and the laser-guided bomb KAB-1500L.

238.doctext: Russian Rostov Helicopters  delivered the first batch of 2  Mi-28N helicopters  to the  Ministry of Defense   .  Rostov Helicopter Company  leader Boris Slyusari announced that this new helicopter has been manufactured for 4 years. Nikolay Makarov, leader of the Russian Air Force and Deputy Minister of Defense, emphasized that the troops have received long-awaited weapons and equipment, which will not only be used in wartime, but also in daily use.  The Ministry of National Defense  plans to order 10-15  Mi-28N helicopters  first, and plans to increase the number of orders in the next step. The Russian national weapons and equipment improvement plan continues until 2015. Before then,  Russian Air Force  will obtain a sufficient number of  helicopters  . First, the Torzhik Military Center will receive  helicopters  , and subsequently, other regions will also  be deployed  . The scientific research funding for the helicopter project comes from the state budget of approximately 1 billion rubles.  Mi-28N  was developed with reference to the development and use experience of the Mi-24 helicopter and other helicopters.  The helicopter  is equipped with integrated airborne radar equipment to ensure that it can operate at any time It drives and navigates day and night under complex weather conditions, and carries weapons including artillery, air-to-ground and air-to-air missiles.

239.doctext: Swiss Pilatus Company The first  PC-21 turboprop trainer aircraft equipped for the flight training program of the Republic of Singapore Air Force Basic Flying Course completed its  first flight.  Lockheed Martin won a 20-year contract in November 2006 to support basic flying courses, with training to begin in June 2008 for 19  PCs -21 trainer aircraft.  Lockheed Martin will be based for  at  RAAF Pearce Base in Western Australia near Perth for the   Republic of Singapore Air Force /span_8 The 130th Air Force Squadron   provides   aircraft, maintenance,  simulators,  courseware and  span_14 Simulator Instructor.  PC-21  will replace Aermacchi's S-211 trainer aircraft.

Location: RAAF Pearce Base in Western Australia near Perth

240.doctext: South Korea  and  U.S. forces  began a joint military  exercise  codenamed Critical Resolve last Sunday. South Korea and the United States hold military exercises every year. The content of this exercise is  if a war breaks out on the Korean Peninsula,  how the United States  will quickly deploy troops to reinforce South Korea . The joint military exercises between the two countries were code-named RSOI until 2007. This year's exercises will be carried out throughout  South Korea  and are expected to end this Friday. Also started at the same time was the field maneuver training   exercise  code-named  Harrier Eagle. During Critical Resolve,   United States reinforcements will be  deployed in the  continental United States and  Hawaii The Pacific base and  Guam base,  South Korea and  United States forces will be jointly commanded to deal with the war on the Korean Peninsula. Six thousand  U.S. Army soldiers were reinforced from the Pacific and Contiguous United States and  Twelve thousand   U.S. troops stationed in South Korea, will participate in this critical decision-making exercise. Another 9,000 US soldiers will not land on the Korean Peninsula but will be on standby at sea. Also participating in this year's military exercise are the U.S. Navy's Ohio-class nuclear-powered submarines carrying 154 Tomahawk cruise missiles, and the Nimitz-class nuclear-powered aircraft carrier with a displacement of 93,000 tons.  North Korea  strongly  condemned  and criticized  the United States  for instigating a war of aggression against North Korea.

241.doctext: Lockheed Martin   recently  signed a contract with the  Romanian Ministry of Defense  to jointly produce 17 sets of  TPS-79 multi-mission surveillance radars System.  Lockheed Martin  delivered two  prototype systems  to the Romanian Ministry of Defense  in 2002 under the Phase I contract.  Romania  will use this medium-range system to achieve air surveillance in conjunction with five existing AN/FPS-117 long-range airspace surveillance radars. Under the Phase II contract,  Lockheed Martin  will manufacture radar components and subassemblies for 17 additional  Multi-Mission Surveillance Radar Systems  .  The medium-range TPS-79 radar  can be easily transported via air base, sea platform, truck or train, and can be  deployed  in less than 60 minutes.

The Long Range Spike Anti-Tank Missile  is a fourth generation missile and is currently the only system that meets all critical requirements of the armed forces. Thanks to its universal operational capabilities, combat-proven reliability, and unparalleled high performance, the  Spike anti-tank missile is currently  equipped in multiple countries, including  Finland,  Italy,  Netherlands,  Poland,  Romania,  Slovenia /span_8 ,  Spain  and  Czech Republic . 243.doctext: The Royal Air Force is seeking a replacement for the thermal imaging/airborne laser designation target acquisition pod currently used on the BAE Systems Harrier GR.7/9 and Tornado GR.4 fighter jets. The pod is from the 1990s and is outdated.  The Royal Air Force purchased 8 to 10 sets of  Rafal for  Tornados deployed in the  Middle East 's Litening III advanced defense pod system, purchased the same number of Lockheed Martin for  deployment in  Afghanistan for the  Harrier fighter aircraft The company's AN/AAQ-33 sniper advanced target acquisition pod. In July 2006,  Rafael was awarded the contract  In 2008 to provide   for the Eurofighter Typhoon fighter  of the  Royal Air Force span_12 Litening pod. It is speculated that some of these pods may be equipped with Tornado fighter jets and are expected to be sent to  Afghanistan  in early 2009. However, army chiefs still hope to purchase the latest generation pods for use on the remaining aircraft of the  Royal Air Force .  Rafael and Lockheed Martin have competed for the supply of fourth-generation pods. The total contract value may reach US$303 million, including 30 to 40 pod systems, data links and remote observation terminal.

244.doctext: Raytheon Company signed a $7.7 million contract with the  U.S. Navy to produce low-volume AN/ASQ-235 for the  U.S. Navy Airborne mine clearance system. AMNS is a basic component of the U.S. Navy's mine countermeasures system. It is deployed on the MH-60 multi-purpose helicopter and is used to locate and destroy underwater anti-ship mines. The mine detection work is performed by the AN/AQS-20A The mine hunting system is completed. The AMNS and AN/AQS-20A mine hunting systems have improved the navy's necessary combat capabilities and can make maritime mine clearance missions safer and more effective. AMNS includes a control console mounted on a helicopter and a launch and control system with four unmanned Archerfish underwater vehicles. Operators aboard the helicopter can remotely control the Archerfish underwater vehicle and use explosives to destroy these mines.  Raytheon Company  is the lead manufacturer of the AMNS project, and its project partners also include British BAE Systems. BAE Systems will provide AMNS with the water-shooting fish mine-extinguishing device and some of the system's deployment mechanisms. Under this contract,  Raytheon will assemble,  test and deliver 3  LCS units for the AMNS for the  U.S. Navy span_7 and  provide some other  protection equipment.

245.doctext: Bell/Boeing recently won a five-year contract worth $10.4 billion to build 167 aircraft for the  U.S. Air Force and  Marine Corps V-22 Osprey tilt-rotor aircraft. The contract signed this time is the first multi-year procurement contract awarded to the V-22. According to the evaluation of the US Department of Defense, the multi-year procurement contract will save US$427 million compared with the annual procurement contract. According to this contract, the  U.S. Marine Corps and the  Air Force respectively ordered 141  MV-22 assault transports and 26 CV-22B special operations Type tilt-rotor aircraft, this batch of  V-22  is scheduled to be delivered  in 2014. At present, the order quantity of Osprey tilt-rotor aircraft has reached 299, of which 100 have been delivered.  In December last year, 12  MV-22  of the U.S. Marine Corps  were deployed for the first time   in  Iraq  span_12. According to the plan, the  US Marine Corps  will purchase a total of 360  MV-22 . The U.S. Air Force Special Operations Command is currently preparing to receive 50 V-22s that have been ordered, and has purchased an additional 50.

246.doctext: Nova Group/Tut Saliba Consortium has been awarded a $39 million fixed-price design-build contract to renovate the U.S. nuclear-powered aircraft carrier dock at  Kitsap Naval Base, Washington  . The consortium will provide all manpower, materials and equipment to first clear the existing Bravo dock and then construct a new ship maintenance dock, including the reconstruction of nearly 300 feet of dock foundation and strengthening the west side of the No. 6 Dry Dock jetty. Sheet pile walls, and reconstruction of Pier 8. An additional $83.9 million will be allocated for fiscal years 2009 and 2010, bringing the total contract value to $122.9 million. The contract was issued by the U.S. Naval Equipment Engineering Command. The pier reconstruction work is expected to be completed in April 2011. Gisep is mainly used as a submarine base.  is stationed here and most of the  United States  Ohio-class ballistic missile nuclear submarines are stationed here, 3  at sea. Wolf-class attack nuclear submarine, 2  special forces and  cruise missile nuclear submarine.  Stationed  at the base is also the  United States   Nimitz-class aircraft carrier USS Stennis  .

247.doctext: ICx Technologies Inc., a developer specializing in advanced sensor technology for homeland security, force protection and commercial facilities, recently announced that the  U.S. Military has signed a $480 million agreement with the company. US$10,000 contract to provide  with   explosive detectors and related technical services. Under a contract from the Robotic Systems Joint Program Office,  ICx Corporation is required to provide   to  combat forces   deployed in Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. span_6 FidoXT Handheld System. Following this,  the United States  began implementing sea transport of  MRAP vehicles , which significantly increased the number of  MRAP vehicles  delivered to the theater. 250.doctext: June 30,  Northrop Grumman's  latest improved RQ-4 Global Hawk batch 20 UAV   Delivered to  U.S. Air Force 9th Reconnaissance Wing at Beale Air Force Base, California.  The U.S. Air Force currently has a wingspan of  the 10th batch of Global Hawk UAVs with a wingspan of 35 meters. In comparison, the fuselage of the 20th batch of Global Hawk Wider and wingspan increased to 40 meters. Currently, 7  Global Hawks of the 10th batch  have been  deployed  at  Beale Air Force Base  . Paul Brophy, chief supervisor of the 9th Aircraft Maintenance Squadron Specialist Department, said that the 20th batch of Global Hawks also has a generator, which increases the payload capacity from 908 kilograms to 1,362 kilograms. span_10 increased by 50%. The extended wings improve the drone's lift and flight characteristics.  Batch 10 Global Hawk UAVs  are equipped with basic electro-optical/infrared sensors and synthetic aperture radar payloads, as well as limited signals intelligence capabilities. The new layout drone introduces improved EO/IR and SAR, as well as extended-range SIGINT. Northrop will also produce Block 30 and Block 40 Global Hawk UAVs, which are expected to enter service in 2011. Northrop says these Global Hawks will have enhanced multi-intelligence systems.

AN/AQS-22 low-frequency sonar can provide critical underwater warfare mission support capabilities, including submarine detection, tracking, positioning, classification, sonar interception, underwater communications, and environmental data collection. Raytheon's Integrated Defense Systems Division will manufacture, integrate,  test and deliver 15 sets of  AN/AQS-22 systems and provide multiple models of interchangeable weapons for the tested objects. components as well as aerial maintenance training facilities.  In 2006,   Navy began  deployment of   new MH-60R helicopters when  AN/AQS-22 sonar system /span_10 has started full-speed production. So far,  Thunder has delivered  16 sets of  AN/AQS to the  U.S. Navy   -22 sonar systems, but there are still 43 orders in hand. This new contract, combined with the two recent ALFS contracts, will bring the total value to US$89 million and will provide   parts  for system lifecycle support  . Work on the contract will be completed within Raytheon's Sea Power Center and ALFS's partner, DRS Sonar Systems, and the contract is expected to be completed in November 2011.

252.doctext: The U.S. Maritime Systems Command recently awarded Boeing and Insitu a $65 million contract to use the ScanEagle unmanned aerial system to provide persistent intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance services, with plans to complete the work in 2009.  The long-endurance fully automatic Scan Eagle UAV has been in service with the  U.S. Navy since 2005 and has been  deployed to  Iraq ,  Afghanistan and  Rest of the World.  ScanEagle UAVs  are deployed on 15 different classes of ships.  Scan Eagle UAV  is equipped with reliable electro-optical and infrared cameras. The camera equipped with a gimbal allows the operator to easily track static and moving targets.  Drone  Flying at an altitude of more than 16,000 feet and flying for more than 20 hours.  Drones  can also provide persistent low-altitude surveillance capabilities.  The Scan Eagle UAV  is launched autonomously via a SuperWedge aircraft catapult to perform pre-planned or operator-initiated missions.

253.doctext: EADS Defense and Security Company   recently  delivered  the last batch of 4  units to the  Royal Norwegian Coast Guard   TRS-3D Maritime Radar effectively improves the  Norwegian Coast Guard water surface safety and the ability to safely guide helicopters in severe weather conditions. Under a contract awarded in 2005, Defense Electronics, a subsidiary of EADSDS, has equipped three Nordkapp-class offshore patrol boats and one Svalbard-class Arctic offshore patrol boat with TRS-3D/16-ES self-defense multi-mode radars.  The Royal Norwegian Coast Guard 's old equipment cannot provide a stable and comprehensive situational picture, nor can it provide safe helicopter guidance information in harsh environmental conditions. Advanced technology, sensitive and stable hardware, specially customized software algorithms and EADS's more than 15 years of experience enable EADSDS to face the most challenging coastal environments with ease.  TRS-3D  is a 3-mode multi-mode maritime radar for air and maritime surveillance. It uses the MSSR2000I identification system to prompt pilots and track targets, and automatically identify ships and aircraft. Currently, more than 50  naval forces   deploy  this type of radar around the world, including German Navy light cruisers, the US Coast Guard and the Finnish Flying Patrol Squadron.

254.doctext: The  Jantar Shipyard  in Kaliningrad completed the receipt of the  sea trials  of the first of the  Sprut series of coast guard vessels  . The ship will be delivered to   the Russian Federal State Security Service  on  May 28   . The boat's  sea trial  work began  last Friday  and ended this Tuesday. The as-yet-unnamed ship will be based at the Murmansk base and its main mission will be to monitor the effectiveness of environmental legislation and combat intruders in the Barents Strait. The construction of the boat began in 2002, but financial problems caused a delay in the construction of the boat, and the entire construction work was not completed until October 2002. The boat uses the most advanced technology in its construction project, and the number of personnel on board is only 15. In addition, the boat can carry 10 inspectors and border guard representatives.  The Sprut series of ships  has a dead weight of 835 tons, a length of 66 meters, and a sailing speed of 22 knots.

This type of missile has been  deployed in the  United States Navy and  other nine-nation fleets. It can give ships self-defense capabilities and can deal with highly mobile anti-ships cruise missiles as well as surface targets and low-speed air targets.  Improved Sea Sparrow missile  Enhanced propulsion, significantly increased speed, and can deal with targets at longer distances.  The missile  also has an improved guidance system and makes full use of its improved seeker to improve strike accuracy. 257.doctext: According to a report in Jane's Defense Weekly on March 14, 2001: British BAE Systems  Royal Defense Branch received a  component from  Moroccan Army span_2 Supply contract to restore its 30 L118 105mm light artillery pieces to combat effectiveness.  Morocco also proposed the need for 6 former British Army  L118 light artillery pieces. These artillery pieces will also be provided by the  Royal Defense Company    . The British company BAE Systems has applied for export licenses for these six artillery pieces and is expected to receive approval soon. Since it is expected that  Morocco will deploy its  L118 light artillery    to the disputed  Western Sahara region, related matters has caused some controversy within the UK.

258.doctext: India officially stated that it had received its first  airborne early warning and control system aircraft on  May 25. This is between  India and  Israel.  Part of more than $1 billion in transactions.  India  gains military advantage over Pakistan by strengthening military cooperation with  Israel . Indian Air Force spokesman T.K.Singha said that  India is one of the few countries that owns early warning aircraft. The first  aircraft delivered this time by  will be delivered by  Deployed  fighter jets escort at  Air Force Base in Western India. The aircraft is equipped with the Phalcon early warning radar surveillance system. In 2004,  India  purchased three Phalcon systems from  Israel Aerospace Industries . Singha said that the remaining two are expected to be delivered   to the Indian Air Force  in 2010. The Falcon system is carried by a Russian-made IL-76 transport aircraft. The system can simultaneously track nearly 250 air targets within a radius of 800km, and has the ability to monitor ground/sea moving targets with a downward gaze.  The Indian Air Force  said the aircraft will be used to enhance security at sea, where the perpetrators of last year's Mumbai terror attacks landed in Mumbai from the sea. In 2007,  Israel replaced France as the second largest arms supplier to  India. After signing a series of arms sales agreements with  India,  span_21 Israel may even replace Russia as  India’s largest arms supplier.

259.doctext: Raytheon's  Land-Launched Advanced Medium-Range Air-to-Air Missile during flight  test at  White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico Successfully intercepted a maneuvering drone. "This test highlights the flexibility and adaptability of networked sensors and launchers to enable the military to respond to today's ever-changing threats," said Pete Franklin, vice president of national theater security programs for Raytheon Integrated Defense Systems. Together with  the U.S. Army, we have demonstrated the operational capability of land-launched  AMRAAM early variants and now have  AMRAAM  deployed to allies and in our capital Got  deployed. This brings us one step closer to an air and missile defense architecture that can link any sensor and launcher. Operated by Raytheon employees and  U.S. Army Soldiers, SLAMRAAM utilizes a geographically dispersed network to detect and track mobile unmanned aerial vehicle targets. The network consists of three advanced Sentinel radars using composite tracking lines to target weapon systems. After sending back the signal, the operator launched the  AIM-120C7 missile at the mobile drone target  at the maximum distance within the system. Preliminary test data results show that the SLAMRAAM system successfully met all test requirements. This test also continues to provide support for SLAMRAAM's low-speed initial production plan at the end of 2009.

Subject: Raytheon
Location: White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico

260.doctext: General Dynamics C4 Systems has been awarded a $21 million contract to add Internet-like capabilities to the  U.S. Marine Corps Combat Operations Center to support decision-making by Marine Corps commanders and their staff. . Through this contract, General Dynamics will upgrade the combat operations center's electronic systems, improve  Marine Corps 's situational awareness and information sharing capabilities, and improve network connectivity throughout the tactical battlefield. The revised contract, originally signed in 2002, has a total value to date of $643 million. The new system, also known as COCG, will facilitate information sharing between the  Marine Corps  combat operations center and allied forces during mission exercises and execution. The system can also provide services such as chat, email and VoIP communications. General Dynamics will also port command, control and tactical data systems based on existing hardware, as well as other software-driven infrastructure. The COCG-type system is also compatible with the U.S. Department of Defense's Network-Enabled Command Capability System. NECC brings joint tactical network and intelligence capabilities to battlefields around the world. The Combat Operations Center currently provides support to  Marine Expeditionary Forces stationed in  Afghanistan,  Iraq and  other countries  Provide support.

261.doctext: On May 26,  France  established a permanent  military base  in the Persian Gulf to ensure security in the region. The base is located in Abu Dhabi, the capital of the United Arab Emirates. There will be 400 to 500  French navy, army, and air force personnel   stationed here. The base can effectively control the connection to the Persian Gulf. and the Strait of Hormuz in the Gulf of Oman. Previously, only the United States had built  military bases in oil-rich areas. However, as the United States' influence in Arab countries declines year by year, the Persian Gulf government is considering introducing other military cooperation in the region in the next few years. partner. According to relevant data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration, an average of 15 oil tankers carrying 16.5 to 17 million barrels of crude oil pass through the strait every day. This is 40% of the world's daily shipping oil shipments and 20% of the world's daily crude oil shipments. In the  coming weeks,  France's  military base will soon begin  stationing the first batch of  warships and will become one of the key supporting forces in the fight against Somali piracy as an international naval force. Relevant Arab experts believe that the French  military base  will bring more balance to the region, improve the deterrence of Arab Gulf countries against Iran and bring stability to the region in the days to come.

Subject: France
France
Militaryforce: French navy, army, and air force personnel

262.doctext: 3e Technologies International Inc.  is a subsidiary of EFJohnson Technologies Inc. in the United States. Recently, the company received a contract worth US$700,000 from the  U.S. Navy to provide  a  virtual perimeter surveillance system. For  deployment in  major U.S. airports. According to Michael Gilbert, President and CEO of EF Johnson Technologies: Our company's VPM is a device that is very suitable for airports. We are pleased to see this system being used to monitor and detect threats against airport passengers and staff. . This order is the first time VPM has been adopted in an airport environment; we are excited about the way VPM solutions can ensure airport safety.  3eTI  is a technology company that provides security solutions for WiFi, grid network and Bluetooth wireless platforms. In early 2008, EFJ announced the acquisition of  3eTI .

263.doctext: Raytheon has been awarded a $14.7 million contract to provide depot-level maintenance for the U.S. Army's  Patriot Air Missile Defense System . The U.S. Army Aviation and Missile Command, located at Redstone Arsenal, Alabama, provided additional funding to Raytheon under an advance contract in June 2006. This is the fourth installment of the optional contract. The current total value of this single-source contract has reached US$51.9 million. Joseph Garrett, Vice President of Patriot Programs at Raytheon Integrated Defense Systems, said: "This contract provides third-tier maintenance by Raytheon field engineers U.S. Army  Deployed in the  United States  and  Overseas's  Patriot System. These services are necessary to ensure the high reliability and readiness required by the Army. Contracted services include diagnostics, maintenance, repairs, modifications and a certain level of technical assistance. Raytheon Integrated Defense Systems is a prime contractor for domestic and international Patriot air and missile defense systems and a systems integrator for the PAC-3 Patriot missile.

264.doctext: On July 16, 2009, the U.S. Department of Defense signed a new order worth US$117 million with BAE Systems for an additional 62  M777 howitzers  . According to Mike Smith, general manager of BAE Systems' Global Combat Systems Division, the additional U.S. order of  howitzers is a reflection of the  M777 howitzer and its performance in supporting current joint military operations. further affirmation.  BAE Systems' facility in Hattiesburg, Mississippi  is responsible for final integration and  testing  of  weapon systems  . The main contract management, production work and integration of the complex titanium structure and related recoil components of the M777 howitzer project are mainly carried out in Barrow-in-Furness, UK.  M777  It is the world's first artillery system developed using large quantities of titanium and aluminum alloy materials. Its weight does not exceed 4200 kilograms, which is half the weight of conventional 155mm artillery systems.  The United States and  Canada will deploy  M777   to  Afghanistan for operational use to provide for joint forces Fire support. The gun can be lifted by helicopters and has good operational flexibility, making it an ideal weapon system for performing combat missions in harsh environments such as Afghanistan.  M777  Fires deft Excalibur cannonballs. The M777 howitzer contract is primarily managed by the 155mm Light Howitzer Joint Program Office located at Picatinny Arsenal, New Jersey, USA.

Subject: BAE Systems' facility in Hattiesburg, Mississippi

265.doctext: After Russian-language websites reported that the SS-26 Stone, the only model of the  Iskander tactical missile put into service, had been equipped with a battalion-level unit at the  Kasputin Yar range,  Russia Deputy Minister of Defense for Equipment Vladimir Popovkin said on June 22, 2009 that this batch of deployed launch systems was the first  deployment Iskander  , the time is  2008.  2009  will  deploy  the second batch of  Iskander missile systems  . The  system previously  deployed at the  Kasputin Yar range for use by the Infantry Warfighter Training Center for the  Iskander system Operators are provided with training. According to Popovkin, due to the very high accuracy of the  Iskander ,  Russia  does not need to equip the missile in large numbers. It is reported that  Russia 's long-term goal is to eventually equip five Iskander missile brigades, but Popovkin did not disclose details about changes in the plan.

266.doctext: Northrop Grumman has awarded a £2.2 million contract to the  Royal Navy to provide an integrated platform management system installed on the  new Type 45 destroyer Technical support. The contract was awarded to Northrop Grumman's Sperry Marine division by BVT, the prime contractor for the  Type 45 destroyer . Sperry Maritime has been selected as the supplier of the IPMS system for the Type 45 destroyer. The system will be installed on the  HMS Valiant  for the first time. Sperry Marine will establish a testing and technical support facility at its new Malden Engineering Center in the UK. The test factory will include a complete set of IPMS system test equipment. Under the interim support contract, Sperry Maritime will also provide routine maintenance, repairs, spare parts management, upgrades and training for the HMS Valorant IPMS system. The IPMS system provides monitoring, alarm management and control of the destroyer's main engines, auxiliary equipment and other shipboard systems, as well as hazard control monitoring through networked command and control workstations at key points on the ship. The system's open architecture design also allows for the aggregation of critical data collected from combat and communications systems to the IPMS system workstation. Currently  the British Royal Navy  is  deploying  6  Type 45 anti-aircraft combat destroyers  to replace the aging Type 42 destroyers.  HMS Valiant  is undergoing its final  sea trials  .

267.doctext: DeTect announced today that the  U.S. Air Force  has ordered the  MERLIN bird strike radar system  for use at  Bagram Airfield in Afghanistan  . Company President Gary Andrews said:  Bagram 's  MERLIN system  is the first time bird strike radar technology has been used in a war zone, and a first for DeTect.  Delivery to  Bagram The MERLINSS200m system includes the  new generation MERLINSharpEye solid-state bird strike radar sensor, providing the airport with coverage in all weather conditions 8-mile, 360-degree range of bird hazard activity monitoring. Gary Andrews added: The fully self-contained military mobile range  MERLIN Systems also has many special features including Kevlar hardened electronic/technical cabin, redundant dual-pass processors, dual power supply units, military desert paint program and US military field structures . The system will be deployed at the end of  2009    and will provide real-time 3D all-round monitoring of dangerous bird activities at the airport and provide automated bird strike warnings for air traffic control.  The U.S. Air Force purchased the first  MERLIN bird strike radar system in  2003 and  installed it in the United States 6 A  Air Force Base. The  MERLIN system  was originally developed for the  U.S. Air Force  and NASA and is the most widely used bird strike radar system in the world.

268.doctext: The Brazilian Army  purchased 250  second-hand Leopard 1A5 tanks  from  Germany . The tanks will be primarily  deployed  along its 16,000-kilometer-long  land and river borders  . The project is part of Brazil's defense strategy approved at the end of 2008.  Brazil  The unit price of this batch of tanks purchased is approximately US$500,000, and  delivery  is expected to begin within 3 months. It is said that the  Leopard 1A5 tank  will become the main combat equipment of the  Brazilian Army  and significantly expand its armored fighting vehicle lineup.  Brazil  Currently  Equipment  has a batch of  Leopard 1A1 tanks , and the military plans to upgrade them to A5 configuration.  Brazil  It built a strong defense industry in the 1970s and 1980s to provide weapons to third world countries. Later, after the democratic regime came to power, the government stopped supporting the defense industry. However, current President Lula believes that if  Brazil  hopes to continue to play an important role in global affairs, the redevelopment of a strong military industry and technological research is essential.

269.doctext: The French Defense Weapons Procurement Agency has launched a purchase plan for three new-generation SDTI unmanned aerial vehicle systems with the support of the government's financial support plan. These new drones will feature lightweight wings to increase their range and durability, especially in hot environments. The drone is scheduled to be delivered in early 2010.  The improved version of SDTI  has been  displayed at the  Paris Air Show, and it belongs to the 61st Artillery of  France The team used the current operating system to demonstrate the operability of  SDTI . Beginning with the  deployment  in the  Afghan theater  in October 2008,  SDTI  completed its 100th reconnaissance mission in May of this year. Since its use by the French army in 2000,  SDTI UAV has not only been used for basic tasks such as collecting battlefield intelligence and targeting field artillery, but has also been used to protect various tasks carried out by ground troops. .

U.S. missiles will remain under U.S. control as part of a ballistic defense program, but whether they will participate in Israeli defense plans is unclear. According to reports, The United States may deploy   missile systems in  Israel   instead of the originally planned  Czech Republic and  Poland, and in response to Russia's strong opposition to the plan. Israel reports that the  United States plans to abandon its deployment of 10  interceptor missiles in  Poland   and in the  Czech Republic   Plans to deploy a  advanced radar station.  The United States has deployed a  long-range X-band radar station in  Israel   which is a key element of the U.S. missile defense array , which can provide missile warning for  Israel. The radar station was established at the Nevatim Air Base in the Negev desert in 2008 at the request of the Israeli government and is operated by 100 American staff. If the United States deploys missiles in  Israel , this radar station will be connected to the US missile defense system.

272.doctext: Recently,  Indian Navy has acquired 2 fast attack boats, which will be used to deal with maritime terrorism. The ships are built by the state-owned  Gardenridge Shipyard and  Kolkata Factory  Construction. It is reported that what was delivered on September 10 was only part of the waterjet-propelled fast attack craft contract. Indian Navy officials said the design of the fast attack craft is also effective in shallow waters and has day and night surveillance capabilities and firepower to enhance coastal security. The  fast attack boats  just  delivered  are models INCheriyam and INSCoraDivh respectively, with a length of about 50 meters, a weight of 325 tons, and a speed of more than 30 miles per hour.  The Indian Navy  is likely to acquire more than 50 fast attack craft in the next three years. Following the November 26 terrorist attacks in Mumbai,  Gardenridge Shipyard and  Kolkata Factory received  from the  Ministry of Home Affairs of India 78 fast attack craft orders, all of which will be deployed on  coastal   . 273.doctext: The Russian Air Force chief said on Wednesday that the S-500 advanced air defense system could be developed in the next few years. The S-500 advanced air defense system is currently in the blueprint stage of development by Almaz-Antei and is expected to be launched in 2012. Admiral Alexander Zelin said: This work is under development... I think this system will appear in the near future. The new system is expected to surpass Russia's most advanced S-400 air defense system and the US Patriot PAC-3 system. The S-400 Triumph/SA-22 Greyhound integrated air defense system can intercept and destroy air targets at a distance of 400 kilometers, and can intercept up to 6 targets at the same time. The S-500 is expected to have a range that can be extended to 600 kilometers and intercept 10 targets simultaneously. The system will be able to destroy supersonic and ballistic targets. Zelin said that  the Russian Ministry of Defense currently prioritizes  the delivery of   Russian S-400 air defense missile systems and may consider exporting these systems to  span_3 Other CIS countries. The Russian Air Force will establish a new defense type of air defense brigade and be equipped with advanced S-400 and S-500 air defense missile systems.  Russia has  deployed two  S-400 air defense regiments to protect  the airspace around Moscow and the central industrial zone, And in the  Far East region   deployed an  S-400 air defense battalion.

275.doctext: Boeing delivered  its second  C- 17 Globemaster III transport aircraft, completing the initial order from Qatar. General Ahmed Al-Malki, leader of the Qatar Airlift Aircraft Selection Committee, said: On behalf of the Qatar Air Force, I would like to thank the Boeing C-17 team and suppliers for their work. This aircraft will enhance our ability to conduct humanitarian assistance, disaster relief and peacekeeping missions. The aircraft will make a brief stop at Charleston Air Force Base and will be  deployed  to  Al Udeid Air Base  in Qatar. There are currently 206 C-17s in service around the world, and there are 17 customers outside the United States, including Qatar, the Royal Air Force, Canada, the Royal Australian Air Force, NATO, etc. The UAE will also purchase 4 C-17s.

276.doctext: On October 13, the  U.S. Navy announced that the first  Littoral Combat Ship USS Freedom would be deployed to the Southern Command and Central Command zones in  early 2010 , participated in the first operational  deployment ahead of schedule, while the original  Liberty first operational deployment was scheduled for 2012.  USS Liberty was built by  Lockheed Martin. After the  Navy adjusted its deployment time, the ship was launched  in early September span_8 Completed second round of  deliveries post-industrial sector availability maintenance at Norfolk Naval Shipyard. Navy officials said they hope that the early deployment of  Liberty can fill the capability gap left by the current cruise fleet or destroyer fleet in the offshore area, and draw lessons from the deployment to promote  Littoral Combat Ships /span_11 The process of integration into the fleet.

Subject: U.S. Navy
Navy
Militaryforce: Littoral Combat Ships /span_11 The process of integration into the fleet.

Materials: Littoral Combat Ships /span_11 The process of integration into the fleet.
