277.doctext: Harris Corporation has successfully completed validation  testing of the  Satellite Terminal System for personnel on  U.S. Navy frigates, cruisers and destroyers  Provides Internet access, video and other broadband services. Completion of this test moves the unit-level conversion of the Commercial Broadband Satellite program into early production. According to the contract,  Harris Corporation will  provide 55 sets of advanced  1.3-meter  satellite communication terminal systems  operating on X band and Ku band. With 10 times the bandwidth currently available on ships, the  Terminal System  will enhance Navy military satellite communications to support essential mission requirements, providing high-speed Internet access and video communications for frigates and other classes of ships.  Harris  was awarded a 5-year IDIQ contract with a potential value of US$77 million in 2008 and completed the first terminal system verification test in just 6 months. The CBSP program is a rapidly deployable capabilities acquisition program designed to reduce the time required to deliver critical and emerging warfighting capabilities. Wes Covell, president of defense programs at Harris Corporation, said: "Completion of the validation testing is an important milestone for this program, as these terminals will greatly enhance the Navy's ability to provide high data rate satellite communications to ship personnel around the world." This represents a new naval satellite communications capability that will provide state-of-the-art communications services.

Object: U.S. Navy frigates, cruisers and destroyers
Subject: Harris Corporation
Harris Corporation
Harris

278.doctext: On November 3, a  aviation team left  Andersen Air Force Base in Guam and returned to their home base of the 916th Air Refueling Wing of the Air Force Reserve Command - Seymour Johnson Base, North Carolina. Before leaving, they had been stationed at  Andersen Air Force Base    for 2 months to ensure the uninterrupted availability of  U.S. Air Force bombers and temporary F-22 fighter jets. Stay to provide support. His mission is to fly and maintain the 506th Expeditionary Air Refueling Squadron's KC-135 tanker aircraft. During this period, they flew a total of 86 sorties, accumulated more than 380 flight hours, and transported more than 250,000 pounds of fuel. After they left, they were replaced by more than 60 airmen from the Air Force Reserve Command  927th Air Refueling Wing  at MacDill Air Force Base, Florida. These soldiers will then serve with the 506th Expeditionary Air Refueling Squadron for two months. This is the  927th Air Refueling Wing's first mission deployment since moving from Selfridge Air Force Base, Michigan, to  MacDill Air Force Base in 2008.  .

279.doctext: Recently,  American Aerostar Defense Corporation stated that the company has once again received an additional procurement contract from the  U.S. Army Tank Motor Vehicles and Weapons Command Life Cycle Management Command. The contract is worth US$348 million and includes a total of 1,928  MV-7000 series medium tactical vehicles, which are divided into general transport trucks, oil transport trucks, rescue trucks and water tankers. It is expected that  delivery  will be completed in  December 2010 .  The US Army TACOMLCMC  stated that after these vehicles are delivered to the troops, they will all  be deployed  to  Afghanistan  and  Iraq  . Previously,  U.S. Army TACOMLCMC  had signed a number of bulk purchase contracts for MTV and its trailers with  American Aerostar Defense Company . For example, in May 2008,  The U.S. Army TACOMLCMC  signed a purchase contract worth US$1.65 billion with  U.S. Aerial Defense Corporation , including a total of 7,577 MTVs and trailers; in 2005,  U.S. Army TACOMLCMC  It has signed a purchase contract worth US$430 million with  American Aerostar Defense Company, including a total of 2,900 trucks.

280.doctext: Northrop Grumman completed delivery of the first three  MQ-8B Fire Scout Verticals to the  U.S. Navy    The company has completed the first year of the low-rate initial production plan of the VTUAV project. Two of the three  Fire Scouts  deployed aboard  USS SM Clnerney  for scheduled operational deployment to complete  Fire Scouts Soldier Military use assessment. Prior to the current deployment,  Fire Scout had been deployed four times  on the   USS Clnerney since December 2008, completing 110 There were 45 take-offs and landings on the ship, 45 of which were by harpoon landing, and the cumulative flight hours have exceeded 47 hours. George Vardoulakis, vice president of tactical unmanned systems at Northrop Grumman Aeronautical Systems Division, said: The performance of the  Fire Scout equipped on the  USS Clnerney continues to provide us with This understanding of real-world usage is invaluable and better equips us to support the needs of the  U.S. Navy. We very much look forward to the opportunity to work together with the crew aboard  USS Clnerney  to achieve the first operational deployment of  Fire Scout .

281.doctext: U.S. Air Force first  deployed in  Afghanistan in December Arrive at Bagram Airport on the 27th. On the same day, the  455th Air Expeditionary Wing stationed at  Bagram  established the 4th Expeditionary Reconnaissance Squadron, which will be equipped with MC- 12 aircraft are responsible for intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance missions. The MC-12 aircraft has the ability to provide real-time, full-motion video imagery to ground forces and can also be used for signals intelligence collection. By late summer 2010, the  U.S. Air Force hopes to have 30  MC-12 aircraft in combat readiness, with 24  deployed in  span_10 Afghanistan, 6  deployed in  Iraq. In addition, there will be 7 MC-12 aircraft performing training missions in the United States.

282.doctext: According to a draft environmental impact report, the  U.S. Navy  intends to build a deep-water aircraft carrier dock in the U.S.-owned area of ​​​​Guam in the Western Pacific. Due to the need to  support increasing carrier operational requirements in the  Western Pacific Region and  Indian Ocean Region, the report recommends that  the Navy, Establish a pier at Polaris Point on the eastern edge of Apra Harbor in  Guam. Once approved, the terminal will be able to accommodate Nimitz-class and Ford-class aircraft carriers in 2015. The number of days a rotating aircraft carrier can receive support in Guam will increase from 16 to 63 days, and the capacity of the existing Kilo terminal will be expanded by 4.5 times. The terminal does not include facilities for aircraft carrier maintenance and nuclear fuel refueling. Once the aircraft carrier needs emergency repairs, maintenance personnel will be immediately transported from Japan or Hawaii. The establishment of the dock is part of the United States' strengthening of military forces in  Guam. The  U.S. Army will also mobilize 8,600  Marines   from Okinawa, Japan. Deploy to  Guam and deploy 600 personnel to establish the Army Aviation and Missile Defense Task Force. The plan is to be completed in 2020 and is expected to cost about US$13 billion, of which Japan will bear US$6 billion under a price-sharing agreement.

283.doctext: A senior Indian Defense Ministry official who did not want to be named said on January 18 that  India and  Russia are about to enter into a deal worth a total of US$1.2 billion to purchase 29 aircraft span_2 MiG-29 fighter jets have reached an arms deal, which will help consolidate  Russia's position as India's main supplier of weapons and equipment. According to the official, the agreement is likely The agreement will be finalized within this week, but he refused to disclose when the two parties would formally sign the agreement. He only revealed that the total value of the agreement is US$1.2 billion, and the purchased aircraft will be  delivered to the  Indian Navy  . Prior to this,  India had purchased  16  MiG-29 fighter jets  and will  deploy them as planned On aircraft carrier.

284.doctext: In the  French Army medium-range anti-tank missile weapon system project bidding,  French Armament General Administration has selected the  American Javelin missile weapon system, and abandoned the Israeli medium-range Spike missile weapons system. Interestingly, the price quoted for the Israeli medium-range Spike missile weapon system is only half that of the  American Javelin missile weapon system .  The French General Administration of Arms and Equipment will initially purchase 76 sets of  command launch units and 260  missiles and training systems. The procurement cost will be approximately US$70 million. The above-mentioned weapon systems will be received before the end of 2010 and  delivered to   troops in Afghanistan for use. Subsequently, the  French Army  will also purchase a larger number of  Javelin missile weapon systems . There are reports that the  French Army  is expected to prepare to  deploy  the missile weapon system in the first quarter of 2011.

Subject: French Armament General Administration
The French General Administration of Arms and Equipment

285.doctext: AAI announced today that it has been awarded a $43 million contract from Lockheed Martin to design and manufacture radio frequency components for the  U.S. Navy aircraft fleet. Will be used in a new generation of automatic test equipment. AAI is a member of the Lockheed Martin team and is also the most important subcontractor for the Electronically Reinforced Automation Support System project.  The U.S. Navy hopes to deploy  eCASS    on all  aircraft carriers as well as a large number of  naval air stations  Go up. This system is critical in ensuring the mission readiness of naval aircraft in conflict zones around the world. According to the contract, AAI has agreed to design and manufacture 49 sets of radio frequency equipment for Lockheed Martin's  eCASS test station, which will be used by the  U.S. Navy   Test   all key systems including airborne weapons, airborne avionics and navigation equipment. In addition, AAI also stated that it will provide two storage locations for wire-free equipment and equipment.

Subject: U.S. Navy
The U.S. Navy
U.S. Navy
Equipment: all key systems including airborne weapons, airborne avionics and navigation equipment

286.doctext: Lockheed Martin has  delivered a  edge-cut communications system model for the second satellite of the  U.S. Navy Mobile User Target System program . MUOS supports ultra-high frequency satellite communications, which will provide guaranteed communications for mobile soldiers, including simultaneous voice, video and data. A  communications system model designed, built and delivered by  Lockheed Martin to the company's Sunnyvale facility with a wideband code division multiple access payload that integrates Advanced technology can provide 10 times the satellite link capability compared to traditional UHF satellite communications. The model also includes a UHF payload provided by Boeing Defense Space and Security, and in the coming months  Lockheed Martin will complete final validation  testing of the system model  . As expected, the MUOS satellite, together with the ground-based system provided by General Dynamics C4I Systems, will enter orbit in  2011  and be handed over to the US Navy.

287.doctext: The French Arms Procurement Agency ordered 187 small armored vehicles from  Panhard Universal Defense Company. This order is part of a total of 933  PVP combat vehicles signed in September 2004. the last part. Up to now, a total of 506  PVP tanks  have been delivered to the  French Army; according to the plan, this type of tank will be launched in  2011 Delivery completed in  year. This PVP tank is manufactured in two industrial factories: the Marolles-en-Hurepoix and Saint-Germain-Laval factories. In total, the PVP tank project cost Panhard and its suppliers approximately 1 million work hours, with an initial delivery contract for 200 units per year from 2007 to 2012. Due to the agreement with the economic revitalization plan structure, in 2009 and 2010, the order delivery has been changed to provide 300  PVP tanks  per year. This PVP combat vehicle is an advanced 4x4 vehicle planned to be equipped with artillery and engineering unit headquarters, as well as some special paratroopers, mountain infantry regiments, logistics and reconnaissance units.  PVP tanks have been deployed in  at the end of 2009  in  Lebanon, and have been deployed since  in February 2010 /span_12, is  deployed in  Afghanistan.

Subject: French Army
Date: in February 2010 /span_12, is  deployed in  Afghanistan.

288.doctext: United States President Obama urges Congress  to fund   $205 million to help  Israel accelerate the development of  new short-range anti-missile defense System. The so-called Iron House project is designed to intercept rockets and artillery shells coming from the Gaza Strip and Lebanon. Although it will still be several years before full  deployment at the  Israeli border, Israeli officials emphasized that the  Iron House System will be deployed in several locations in 2010 . It is reported that  Israel  has been working on the iron house project for several years. U.S. officials saw the test of the modified project and decided to invest in accelerating its production. Earlier, during the visit of the US Vice President to  Israel , the two sides issued a declaration to strengthen relations between the two countries.  January 2010,  Israel completed the  anti-missile system   test, the next stage is to deploy it in the army . The Iron House is produced by the Israeli state-owned enterprise Rafael Advanced Defense Systems. It uses small radar-guided missiles to counter Katyusha short-range missiles with a range of 5-70 kilometers, as well as mortar shells. The money will be added to the annual cost of  United States  aid to  Israel . A Pentagon spokesman said the investment from Congress would be the first direct investment by  the United States  into the  Iron House System . It is reported that  the U.S. military   provided  support to   Israel   2.55 billion US dollars in 2009, It is expected that  2012 will increase to  3 billion US dollars, and from  2013-2018 it will reach  3.15 billion US dollars.

289.doctext: The U.S. Air Force  will soon be equipped with 226-kilogram-class guided bombs that use a composite warhead to destroy targets with as little collateral damage as possible. The first batch of 50  Mk82 precision damage bombs will be  delivered in January 2011   , and then at least 750 will be produced using  carbon fiber damage combat Ministry's  bomb.  The U.S. Air Force  has released a market survey seeking a contractor that can quickly deliver a composite warhead capable of meeting the needs of U.S. regional commands in the Middle East and parts of Asia. In August the Air Weapons Center will award a contract to produce 125 to 175 warheads for the  test  project. If the test is successful, the previous option contract to produce 400 to 800 warheads will continue to be implemented.  The Air Force  also purchased a low-collateral damage version of the  Boeing Company  130-kilogram class small-diameter bomb, called a total-destruction munition. Precision damage bombs are twice the size of total damage munitions, but will reduce damage outside the precision strike area in the future. The new composite warhead BLU-129/B will be assembled into the  Mk82 bomb , which will be used with the Joint Direct Attack Munition and the additional laser guidance component JDAM. Earlier this year, the Senate provided an additional $35.5 million for overseas emergency military operations in the fiscal year 2010 budget for the development, testing and equipment of precision damage projects.

290.doctext: There have been recent reports that  Israel  intends to dispatch  nuclear-armed  Dolphin-class submarines  to patrol  Iran's coastal areas  . Relevant experts had widely suspected that  Israel  had equipped this German-made submarine with cruise missiles capable of carrying nuclear warheads.  Germany provided  3  Israel   in  1998  and  2000   Dolphin-class submarines, and plans to  deliver 2 more boats in the  next 2 years. Yiftah Shapir, director of the Military Balance Project at the Institute of National Security at Tel Aviv University, said,  Israel has never mentioned the role of its submarines, whether they are used for cruising or performing strike missions, but the international community believes that  Israel's submarines are part of its deterrent force.

291.doctext: The Washington Post reported that  the United States  is about to launch a missile defense system in southern Europe as part of its measures to strengthen regional defense. An anonymous Pentagon official said that the U.S. Department of Defense is in further negotiations with Turkey or Bulgaria on an agreement to deploy important  radar ground stations . The placement of the X-band radar is the first phase to ensure the system is operational by 2011. In September 2009,  United States President Obama scrapped former President Bush's missile defense plan and prepared for  2013 deployment previously in the  Czech Republic     Radar station , deploying  10  long-range ballistic missile interceptors  in  Poland   . The defense plan angered Russia, which it considered a threat to its security, but  the United States  insisted on continuing with the plan. The U.S. military also cooperates with Israel and forms an alliance with the Persian Gulf to build and upgrade its missile defense capabilities.  The United States established a  radar ground station in Israel in 2008 and hopes to deploy it in  Arab countries    another  Radar station. The Washington Post stated that the radar can provide early warning of any Iranian missile launches.

292.doctext: Recently, the Canadian government announced that Thales Canada's  Bushmaster armored vehicle  has been qualified to bid for the next phase of the tactical armored patrol vehicle project.  Bushmaster armored vehicle  is a highly mobile armored vehicle with outstanding ballistic protection, mine protection and improvised explosive device defense capabilities. It has been proven to save the lives of soldiers many times in close combat. This model is currently in service with  Australia,  Netherlands and  other NATO allied forces, and is  deployed in  Iraq span_6 and Afghanistan. The Bushmaster family of protected vehicles includes patrol vehicles, command vehicles, ambulances, reconnaissance and target acquisition vehicles, direct fire support vehicles and mortars and other variants, and is suitable for a variety of tasks and applications including logistics support. Among them, the base vehicle can choose various weapon systems, such as remote-controlled weapon stations, aiming and display systems, and vehicle integrated electronic systems. The C4I system can be selected to improve vehicle performance. In addition to signing a non-exclusive teaming agreement with DEW Engineering and Development to be responsible for the assembly of the  Bushmaster armored vehicle, the Canadian branch of Thales will also focus on maximizing the development of local products and subsequently Months to meet potential supplier needs in Canada. Thales' first formal supplier meeting will be held in Halifax, Canada, from September 9 to 10, 2010. Thales, DEW Engineering and Development and many Canadian suppliers will not only provide the Canadian government with a local manufacturing solution, but will also create and sustain Canadian jobs for 25 years.

293.doctext: American L-3 Communications Company announced on September 13 that it had delivered the last  Freedom Project  MC to the  U.S. Air Force   -12W intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance aircraft , the aircraft delivery contract was completed in response to urgent operational requirements. The final delivery actually took place on  August 31 when the last aircraft flew from the  L-3 Company mission complex in Texas to the American Air National in Mississippi. Guard training ground.  The U.S. Air Force  received the first of the 37  MC-12  it purchased in March 2009.  Since June 2009, these aircraft have been  deployed to  Southeast Asia, and have been  deployed for the first time to  Iraq /span_13 and  Afghanistan.  L-3 Company  said it delivered all 37 ISR aircraft in less than 24 months, with each aircraft delivered earlier than contracted.

294.doctext: On November 5, 2010, Northrop Grumman Corporation of the United States signed a cost-plus-fixed-fee contract worth approximately US$75.69 million with the  U.S. Army Aviation and Missile Command Contracting Center. Provides protection against rocket, artillery and mortar systems for  U.S. Army forward operating bases in  Iraq and  Afghanistan. Contract work will be performed in the following locations: Bagram, Afghanistan; Baghdad, Iraq; and Huntsville, Alabama, United States. Contract work is expected to be completed by May 5, 2011. After more than five years, Northrop Grumman has played a vital role in the research and development, integration, deployment and logistics maintenance of  C-RAM system . The company worked closely with the  U.S. Army, allowing the  C-RAM system to be developed from the concept stage to completion in less than 18 months, and played a role in the Iraq War. important role.  C-RAM systems  have been deployed by   to multiple forward operating bases in  Iraq  and are currently being fielded in  Afghanistan  .

295.doctext: The Sri Lanka Navy  joins the nine-day joint military  exercise  . The military exercise started on  November 21, 2010 . The exercise will provide naval units with the opportunity to practice amphibious operations and improve military skills.  Navy  Deploying landing troops and combat materiel from the sea, the Special Boat Squadron conducts special operations alongside the Sri Lanka Army Special Forces. Naval exercises will include  embarkation and disembarkation of troops and combat materiel,  movement from sea to target areas during warfare,  amphibious assaults and landings on enemy territory span_6.  The Navy will  dispatch 1  tank landing ship, 1  universal landing craft, and 2  high-speed gunboats /span_11, 5  high-speed attack boats, 23  high-speed arrow boats and several  water jet boats will participate in this exercise.

Subject: The Sri Lanka Navy

296.doctext: A C-17 transport aircraft arrived in Afghanistan, and the M1A1 main battle tank rolled out of the cargo bay  U.S. Air Force A C-17 transport aircraft airlifted the first Marine Corps M1A1 Abrams tank to  Afghanistan, the transport aircraft belongs to the  816th Expeditionary Airlift Squadron stationed in  Southwest Asia. During the nine-year war in Afghanistan, this was the first time the  Ministry of Defense had  supplied a 68-ton  main battle tank, with more tanks to follow. C-17 arrived in  Afghanistan. Gen. Richard Mills, commander of Marine Corps Forces Southwest Afghanistan, said the tanks will increase the military's firepower in non-mountainous operations. Equipping  M1A1 tanks  in landlocked countries requires joint support from sea and air transportation. The C-17 transport aircraft is the last link in the entire process of transporting  tanks . The first  tank  arrived on November 25th.

297.doctext: The U.S. Navy successfully completed the first phase of  testing of the  USS Independence Littoral Combat Ship Mine Countermeasures Mission Package on  December 10 /span_3, this phase will further advance  the Navy's   developmental  testing in 2011. The comprehensive testing aboard Independence included the installation and removal of all mission modules and systems. The Littoral Combat Ship mission module project manager said that the successful integration of the mine countermeasures mission package on the USS Liberty has given them great confidence in entering developmental testing. The first phase of the mine countermeasures mission package test verified the full mission cycle from the reconfiguration of vertically replenished MH-60S Seahawk helicopters to the mission package carrying organic airborne mine countermeasures equipment; equipment in mobile support containers; MH-60S helicopter deployment or recycling, including installation, built-in testing and repair of towing cables. The mine countermeasures mission package reset verified the movement of the system from storage, built-in testing and return to storage. Combat system connectivity, launch and recovery antenna communication link performance were also verified. Initial operational capability of the mine countermeasures mission package is expected to be achieved in 2013.

Subject: The U.S. Navy
the Navy's
Equipment: USS Independence Littoral Combat Ship Mine Countermeasures Mission Package

298.doctext: The Australian Navy has awarded a contract to BAE Systems for its  deployment in  Cairns and  Darwin The  Heavy Landing Craft provides in-service support services.  The Australian Navy has a total of 6  LCH , which are all-welded scull ships that can transfer cargo and supplies from ships anchored near the shore to the dock or transport cargo to the beach. . Its maximum cargo capacity depends on the fuel loading, floating between 140 tons and 180 tons. The usual load is 175 tons. At this time, its endurance is 1,300 nautical miles. When the load is reduced to 150 tons, its endurance will be increased to 2,280 nautical miles. Under normal load conditions, it can carry 3 tanks, 23 trucks or 13 armored personnel carriers. All 6  LCH  are currently in service, 1 is deployed in  Darwin , 3 are deployed in  Cairns , and the other 2  Deployed in  Sydney. The contract, valued at $1.5 million, includes contract administration, configuration management, systems engineering and maintenance engineering for LCH. The contract is initially valid for 3 years, with the option to extend for another 3 years after expiration. BAE Systems will ensure that  Australian Navy 's  LCH  achieves specified performance to ensure that it can carry out the mission required by  Australian Navy .

299.doctext: The Russian Air Force  begins the  deployment  of Russia's Kamov Design Bureau's  Ka-52 attack helicopters  and expands the number of other helicopters it owns. On December 28, the 334th Strategic Deployment Center of the Air Force in Torzhok received the first three of the 12  Ka-52  ordered by the Russian military. This batch of Ka-52s is produced by the Russian Progressive Manufacturing Plant in Rseniev. In addition,  the Russian Air Force also received 10  Mi-8AMTSh transport helicopters delivered by  Russia's Ulan-Ude Manufacturing Plant   span_7. This batch of  Mi-8 series helicopters   were deployed  at the  Korenovsk Airport  on the coast of the Caspian Sea. These 10  Mi-8AMTSh helicopters are the second batch delivered to the  Air Force  . The first batch was completed in  2009  Delivery. At the same time as the helicopter was delivered, the  military  also purchased a batch of training equipment.  At the end of December 2010, Zhukovsky-based  Dinamika Company delivered  two  Mi-8MTVs to the  Air Force   -5 flight simulator. One of them is already in service at the Syzran Air Force Academy, and the other will  be deployed on January 7 of this year    in Budennovsk in the Caucasus  7th Aerospace Defense Brigade Air Base.

300.doctext: The U.S. Naval Sea Systems Command awarded ITT a $16.7 million contract to produce 425 C-band systems and related parts and equipment. The C-band system is an upgraded vehicle-mounted system installed by the  U.S. Military  to prevent the detonation of radio-controlled improvised explosive devices. This contract brings the total number of C-band systems produced to 1,121 units and the total contract value to $39 million. The original contract was signed in April 2010. The C-band system will work with the currently  fielded  of  Counter-RCIED Electronic Warfare Vehicle-mounted Receiver Jammers  to address a range of electronic warfare threats in a wider spectrum and wider frequency range. This upgrade will provide additional functionality while long-term development of the next generation anti-IED system matures. The CVRJ and C-band system programs meet an urgent operational need for the Department of Defense to increase production of systems to prevent the detonation of radio-controlled improvised explosive devices. These  counter-IED devices are being used by  the U.S. military in various armored vehicles and other military transportation equipment, and are  deployed in  Iraq and military operations in Afghanistan.

Subject: U.S. Military
the U.S. military
Militaryforce: Counter-RCIED Electronic Warfare Vehicle-mounted Receiver Jammers

301.doctext: Lockheed Martin   announced that its  satellite command and control system   recently  launched the multi-payload space test project STP- It was put into operation during the S26 mission and successfully completed the  launch of  STPSat-2 . The architecture was jointly developed by  Lockheed Martin  and the U.S. Air Force Space and Missile Systems Center's Space Research and Development Test Directorate. The second  MMSOC system  is being deployed by the 50th Air Wing at Schriever Air Force Base in Colorado and will be put into use during the launch of the ORS-1 Space Operations Response Satellite in early 2011. MMSOCGSA adopts  Lockheed Martin's  HORIZON satellite command and control architecture to enhance satellite operations, provide a wide-ranging satellite ground architecture, and achieve unique technology demonstrations and space response operations.  The U.S. Space Research and Development Test Agency is responsible for developing,  testing and evaluating the United States Air Force's  space systems, executing advanced space development and demonstration programs, and delivering them Quickly transformed into practical applications. The Space Research and Development Test Directorate, located at Kirtland Air Force Base, New Mexico, provides research development, test and evaluation of space combat response programs.

Subject: The U.S. Space Research and Development Test Agency

302.doctext: Oskosh Trucking Company has delivered 75 of its  new medium tactical transport vehicles to the  U.S. Marine Corps   , come to  equip the   sea prepositioning ship USS Ensign John Bobo . There will be more than 1,100  MTVRs   configured in  and 14  deployed  in  prepositioned in  global strategic need areas On board the ship. These vehicles are ready for use when  deployed   Marine Expeditionary Force  conducts combat operations in forward areas.  Oskosh Truck Company  has been building the  MTVR  since September 1999. In April 2001, the company received official approval to start mass production of  MTVR , that is, entering the third node.  MTVR  The load capacity is 7.1 tons when driving off-road and 15 tons when driving on the road. Colonel Allen Coulter, commander of Marine Corps Blount Island Command, said:  MTVR  has a load capacity of well over 5 tons, which will increase our operational flexibility. Construction of the highly mobile  MTVR  is part of the  Marine Corps  plan to massively modernize the fleet. Whether transporting personnel and supplies during combat, or transporting food and emergency supplies during peacekeeping operations,  MTVR  will have a high degree of transport mobility, a gap that older medium-sized vehicles cannot cross.  MTVR  It can keep up with any kind of land military vehicle in battle, and can even keep pace with the M1 tank.

303.doctext: In October 2010, Lockheed Martin reported that  U.S. Army was deployed in  Iraq and  Afghanistan    Its first  enhanced TPQ-36 counterattack target acquisition radar.  EQ-36 radar  is the latest advanced radar of the  US military . It can  detect  , identify, track and locate enemy indirect fire such as mortars, artillery, rockets and more in 360-degree or 90-degree mode. The new radar system will provide  U.S. forces  and eventually replace the existing legacy  TPQ-36  and TPQ-37 medium-range fire positioning radars. Lockheed Martin reports that the  TPQ-36 radar requires six soldiers to operate, while the TPQ-37 radar requires 12 soldiers to operate, compared with the  EQ-36 radar system  Only 4 soldiers are needed.  EQ-36 radar  is expected to start full-speed production in 2011, and the production line for the  US military  is expected to end in 2017.  EQ-36 Radar  faces competition from several fronts, but currently fire positioning operators have shown strong interest in  EQ-36 Radar . Forecast International is updating its  Enhanced TPQ-36 System  market research report as part of the Electronic Systems market study.

Subject: U.S. Army

304.doctext: Boeing announced yesterday that the  EA-18G Growler airborne electronic attack aircraft  has made its first  deployment with the   U.S. Navy  .  EA-18G electronic attack aircraft  is the only air combat platform that can provide full-spectrum airborne electronic attack capabilities, and also has the positioning and self-defense capabilities of the F/A-18E/F Super Hornet.  EA-18G  It is developed on the basis of the two-seat F/A-18F fighter jet. It adopts a highly flexible design and can take off and land from the deck of an aircraft carrier or a land-based airport. It is replacing the AEA platform currently used by the  US Navy  - the EA-6B Prowler electronic attack aircraft, which has been in service since 1971.  EA-18G electronic attack aircraft joined the  Naval Aircraft Formation in  2008,  was delivered   VAQ-129 training Squadron. Boeing serves as the weapons system integrator and prime contractor for the  EA-18G electronic attack aircraft . Other members of the team include Northrop Grumman, Raytheon and General Electric Aircraft Engines.

Militaryforce: EA-18G Growler airborne electronic attack aircraft

305.doctext: SAC Ben Stevenson/Crown Copyright  UK The only two  Hunter R1 electronic intelligence aircraft will be retired from service within six weeks,  Royal Air Force /span_2's 51st Squadron marked the aircraft with XV249 markings to celebrate the aircraft's more than thirty years of service. The 51st Squadron's emblem bears the image of a goose. The 51st Squadron has been equipped with  Hunter R1 aircraft  since 1974, and currently  Hunter aircraft   are deployed  in the  Middle East  to support the NATO-led International Security Assistance Force in Afghanistan.  The Royal Air Force describes the role of the  Hunter aircraft as follows: For ISAF and ANSF ground forces to plan and complete missions, the  Hunter R1 aircraft collects intelligence is priceless. At the same time, the first three  Royal Air Force  RC-135 Air Seekers are being modified at the  L-3 Communications Company factory in Texas. , the aircraft can be converted into a rivet joint aircraft for the United States Air Force. The UK Defense Equipment and Support Agency hopes the first aircraft, which will have its engines removed, will be delivered  late 2013    . The British Air Force retired its last Hunter MR2 aircraft last year, and its replacement MRA4 aircraft was also cut down.  R1  is the last Hunter type still flying.

306.doctext: The Royal Danish Air Force recently confirmed that its F-16 fighter jets  flying missions in  Libya were  released for the first time   Bomb. On March 17, the United Nations Security Council passed Resolution 1973, requiring a series of measures to be taken against  Libya , including the establishment of a no-fly zone. Two days later, a Danish Air Force contingent consisting of four F-16 fighter jets arrived at the Sicilian Air Force Base in Sicily. In a combat information briefing on March 23,  the Danish Air Force stated that its F-16 fighter jets have currently flown 12 sorties,  supporting   the United States-led ?#22885;Desai Dawn?#20316;Operation War. Eleven of the sorties were air-to-ground missions, and it is believed that precision guided bombs were dropped during the missions. However,  the Danish Air Force  refused to disclose the details of the target or the results of the attack.  Danish Air Force   Deployment  of  personnel  at  Sigrila Air Base  will likely reach 120 personnel.

307.doctext: According to well-informed sources, the Indian Navy has more demand for UAVs manufactured by Israel Aerospace Industries Includes a modified Heron or Heron-TP system carrying naval sensors.  Assessment  Work has begun. In January this year, the  Indian Navy established its second UAV squadron, using existing Heron and Searcher II UAV systems produced by  IAI Facing more combat needs. In recent weeks, there have been signs that more contracts will be awarded to  IAI  . In addition to providing   UAVs to the  Indian Navy  ,  IAI Company also supplies  the Indian Navy More equipment is provided, such as  Barak-8 air defense missile system.

308.doctext: On August 20 and 24, 2001,  Indian Navy  will add a modern domestically produced corvette INS Kollis and  high-speed attack craft INS Tarasa  respectively. INS Koli is the third Kola-class guided missile corvette and will serve in Kolkata;  INS Tarasa is the third Trikat-class high-speed attack boat, which will serve in  Andaman  and  Nicobar Islands served. The guided-missile corvette USS Kohli is named after the weapon of the Indian god of thunder, which means thunderbolt. It has a displacement of 1,300 tons, is powered by two diesel engines, has a maximum speed of 25 knots, and has an endurance of 2,500 nautical miles without receiving supplies. In addition, the ship also carries a Cheetah helicopter. The USS Corley is equipped with modern weapon systems, including ship-to-ship missiles, long-range naval guns and anti-aircraft missiles. Modern sensors and electronic equipment also greatly increase the overall performance of its weapons.  Tarasa  is a 46-meter-long high-speed attack boat with a displacement of 260 tons and a speed of more than 25 knots. The boat is equipped with modern Indian domestic reconnaissance systems and multi-sensor naval guns and weapons. The boat will be  deployed in  Andaman and  Nicobar Islands coastal areas and will be used for maritime security patrols, anti-smuggling, and anti-smuggling. And shoulder the mission of protecting marine resources in the Indian Special Economic Zone.

309.doctext: Iranian Defense Minister Ahmed Vahidi announced on April 7 that a new  cruise missile  production line will be launched in the current Iranian year. Vahidi also said that the Ministry of Defense will launch new space, maritime and electronic projects this year.  The Iranian Ministry of Defense officially delivered it to the  Navy   on  January 3 this year  Designed and designed by the Marine Industry Organization of the Iranian Ministry of Defense manufactured  domestic cruise missile systems which, according to Vahidi, are equipped with positioning and navigation systems and  deployed on the  Iranian coastline The missile system will enable the Navy to detect and destroy a variety of targets at sea. Western countries are very concerned about Iran's military capabilities, especially its nuclear program. The United States, some allies and the International Atomic Energy Agency are concerned that Iran is trying to build nuclear weapons, but Iran denies this. Iran also possesses a series of short- and medium-range missiles that can hit targets in the region, including Israel and U.S. military bases. Iran has independently developed weapons since 1992 and is now able to produce a large number of military weapons on its own, including tanks, missiles, jets, unmanned combat aircraft and torpedoes.

310.doctext: On April 15, 2011,  Thales's French TDA weapons subsidiary signed a contract worth US$50 million with the Weapons and Tactical Systems Division of  General Dynamics. Provides  120mm rifled mortar shells. The contract is primarily to satisfy General Dynamics' contract with the  U.S. Marine Corps  to provide  120 mm mortar shells  for the Expeditionary Fire Support System program. The Expeditionary Fire Support System program began in 2004 to provide the  U.S. Marine Corps  with fire support weapons that can be transported by landing craft or lifted by CH-53 helicopters and MV-22 Osprey tilt-rotor aircraft. The  Expeditionary Fire Support System  is now  deployed  in  Afghanistan  for operational use by the  U.S. Marine Corps . According to the relevant person in charge of Thales's French TDA weapons subsidiary, this contract reflects the good cooperative relationship between  company and General Dynamics. The two parties will jointly provide expeditionary equipment for the  US Marine Corps The fire support system project  provides the most suitable  120mm rifled mortar shells.

311.doctext: The U.S. Department of Defense has awarded a $14.14 million contract to  Sirax Technologies  for the  U.S. Army 's  Light Countermortar Radar System   provides   fallback components.  LCMR  is a small arms locating radar system designed to locate enemy mortar launch locations. According to the contract requirements, the  radar spare components provided by  Silax Technology Corporation will be equipped with the  U.S. Army Forces. The contract is planned to be completed in  March 2012. Completed before March 23. In April 2010, the  U.S. Army  announced its requirements for the production of the LCMRTPQ-50 system, which stated that the TPQ-50 system is an improved radar system. Bidders demonstrate system performance for government agencies before the contract is awarded. The Army plans to announce a five-year production contract in fiscal year 2012 and plans to purchase a total of 310 systems, with the first batch of products to be delivered within 12 months after the contract is signed.  LCMR  is the latest weapon locating radar equipped by the  U.S. Army and Marine Corps. Its electronically scanned antenna can provide uninterrupted omnidirectional detection and detection of incoming mortar shells at close range. track. The radar was funded by the U.S. Special Operations Command and began development in 1999. The main contractor is  Silax Technology Corporation . The prototype was completed in fiscal year 2001, and the pre-production version was subsequently deployed in  2002    to  Bagram Air Base  north of Kabul, Afghanistan.

312.doctext: Lockheed Martin has delivered its first  production F-35 Lightning II Joint Strike Fighter to the  U.S. Air Force   span_3, this milestone was reached several years later than originally planned; however, the timetable for the aircraft to reach initial operational capability has not yet been determined. On May 5,  U.S. Air Force  officials received the production F-35A numbered  AF-7  at the Lockheed Martin Fort Worth Assembly Plant. The aircraft then flew to  Edwards Air Force Base, California  to participate in a specialized airframe structure flight  test  program. This milestone comes nearly 10 years after Lockheed Martin won the development and production contract for the JSF project in 2001. At the beginning of this year,  the US Air Force  still planned to establish the first F-35 operational squadron in 2016. However, the latest development schedule shows that the development and testing work will not be completed until the end of  2016, which means that  F-35A  will not reach initial operational capability until at least 2017;  The U.S. Air Force has not yet made adjustments to the latest  F-35  development schedule. While the last of a total of 13  F-35  flight test aircraft are still being assembled, eight  production F-35s  have already rolled off the production line. However, the US Department of Defense estimates that the cost of the first three low-speed initial production batches of  F-35  will be 15% higher than originally planned.

313.doctext: ALR-67 radar warning receiver  Maintains stable demand in the international market and can be used for newly manufactured aircraft and upgraded F/A-18 fighter jets. The United States is purchasing the system for all of its F/A-18E/F fighter jets and is expected to deploy the system on 213 aircraft by 2019. Australia is also purchasing the system for its 24 new F/A-18F fighter jets as well as for upgrading older aircraft. Other customers of the system include Canada/Finland and Switzerland. In April 2010,  Raytheon Company received an $89.5 million contract from the  U.S. Navy to continue the production of  ALR-67 radar warning receivers.  Provided to international customers of the U.S. Naval Air Systems Command and Foreign Military Sales. Deliveries on this contract will begin in  January 2012  and are expected to be completed in December 2012.  Raytheon   November 2010 reported that it had delivered  its 500th  unit to the  U.S. Navy   ALR-67 radar warning receiver.

Subject: Raytheon Company
Materials: unit to the  U.S. Navy   ALR-67 radar warning receiver

314.doctext: American Science and Engineering Corporation was awarded a contract by the  NATO Advisory, Command and Control Directorate to  provide the first set of  Z-backscatter vehicle X-ray scans System.  NATO has deployed  the  Science and Engineering Corporation 's  OmniViewGantry  at multiple  checkpoints   ,  ZPortal  ,  SmartCheck  and  Gemini System .  Z backscatter vehicle system  is a highly mobile scanning system that can be used for security protection. The system will be used for cargo, vehicle, package and people scanning.

Subject: American Science and Engineering Corporation
Science and Engineering Corporation
Object: NATO Advisory, Command and Control Directorate

315.doctext: General Dynamics C4 Systems has received an order from the U.S. Department of Defense to produce JTRSHMS radios for the AN/PRC-154 Infantry Radio and  AN/PRC-155 Manpack Radio  . The low-rate initial production order, initially valued at approximately $56.4 million, calls for the production of 6,250 infantry radios and 100  manpack radios  as well as accessories, training and related equipment supplies.  The JTRSHMS Network Radio  will be the first terrestrial radio deployed by the  U.S. Army    that fully meets JTRS requirements. Defense Department documents state that the  Army  plans to purchase more than 190,000 infantry radios and approximately 50,000  manpack radios  . The JTRSHMS infantry radio will provide soldiers on the battlefield with secure mobile voice, video and data communications capabilities, providing functionality similar to commercial cellular networks. The initial 100  manpack radios  will be used for further operational  testing  to support full-rate production. Under the LRIP order, General Dynamics and Thales Communications will produce the infantry radios, while General Dynamics and Rockwell Collins will produce the  manpack radios  .

316.doctext: After completing an eight-month combat deployment, the  EA-18G Growler aircraft used by the  U.S. Navy Electronic Attack Squadron VAQ-132 safely returned to base on June 9 . During this combat deployment, the EA-18G performed combat missions in the areas of responsibility of the U.S. Central Command and the U.S. Africa Command. VAQ-132 personnel and aircraft supported CENTCOM operations in Iraq and then quickly moved to AFRICOM  to support   NATO  operations in Libya. Several additional  EA-18G aircraft were  dispatched along with  Electronic Attack Squadron VAQ-141  to the  USS George W. Bush, this is also the first sea-based deployment of the aircraft.  VAQ-141 Squadron will perform missions in the Mediterranean and Persian Gulf. The third  Electronic Attack Squadron VAQ-138  was recently  deployed  to a  land-based location  .  EA-18G  is the only air platform with full spectrum airborne electronic attack capabilities.  EA-18G  is replacing the U.S. Navy’s current AEA aircraft, the EA-6B Prowler. . Boeing is the weapons system integrator and prime contractor for the EA-18G project. Other project members include Northrop Grumman, Raytheon and GE.

317.doctext: Der Spiegel reports that  Germany  has agreed to provide  Israel   with   Dolphin-class submarines  that are said to be capable of carrying nuclear weapons.  Israel  has been working on this for years. According to reports, German Defense Minister Thomas de Maiziere met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Israeli Defense Minister Ehud Barak in  Israel  last week. He promised that  Germany  would  provide financial subsidies of   135 million euros  .  Dolphin-class submarine  Built in Kiel, Germany. Experts say this type of submarine has the longest cruising range among diesel-electric submarines. Some reports say the submarine can carry nuclear weapons.  Germany  has been providing  submarines of this type to  Israel   since the  late 1990s . After the first Gulf War, in order to compensate Israel for enduring Iraq's missile attack on Jerusalem and to strengthen Israel's strategic capabilities,  Germany donated  Israel    Two  submarines were acquired.  Germany  also provided a one-third cost subsidy to  Israel  for the subsequent purchase of three additional  submarines . There are foreign reports that  Israel  will use  German submarines  as a secondary strike force, aiming to maintain its nuclear capabilities when its homeland is attacked. Its main combat target is Iran or any future imaginary enemy with the ability to destroy Israel. According to reports, this type of submarine is equipped with electronic intelligence equipment and dozens of crew members. The existing submarines are  stationed  in the  Persian Gulf waters  close to Iran.

318.doctext: The Swedish Army plans to equip its latest batch of  RG32M patrol vehicles purchased from  BAE Systems with the Australian W&E Prad Engineering Plant  span_3Remotely controlled weapon station. The Swedish Defense Equipment Administration has ordered 60  MR550 remote control weapon stations, which will be  delivered at the end of 2011. All delivery work is expected to be completed in early 2012 .  Sweden has more than 100  RG32M patrol vehicles equipped with  MR550 series remote control weapon stations, some of which have been  deployed During military operations in  Afghanistan.  MR550 Remotely Controlled Weapon Station  Weighing less than 400 kilograms, it uses a double-layer armored partition that combines two materials. The protection level can be upgraded from STANAG4569 level I to level III. The manually operated ring mounting bracket of the weapon station can rotate 360°, with a high and low firing range of -30° to +60°. The weapon station can be equipped with a variety of weapons, including M2HB 12.7mm heavy machine gun, Mk19 40mm automatic grenade launcher, HK 40mm grenade machine gun, M249 5.56mm machine gun and MAG-58/M240 7.62mm general purpose machine gun.

Subject: BAE Systems
Materials: MR550 series remote control weapon stations

Subject: Sweden
Militaryforce: MR550 series remote control weapon stations

319.doctext: US-based Navmar Applied Sciences Corporation last week received a $148.8 million contract from the  US Department of Defense to provide  with   military applications UAVs and  persistent surveillance UAV sensor payloads are  deployed to  Afghanistan and other areas. On July 27,  Navmar Company  received a contract worth US$74 million to develop Helios drones and advanced persistent surveillance sensors.  Navmar  has previously developed the Shark II and Sand Shark small drones for military reconnaissance and surveillance. On July 29, the company received another contract worth $74.9 million to develop a persistent surveillance drone system. Both contracts are part of the Small Business Innovation Phase III research program, part of the Navy's 92-170 and N94-178 research programs and the Air Force's AF083-006 research program, both to be completed by July 2013. The Navy's 92-170 project studies lidar identification demonstration and verification, and the Navy's N94-178 project studies disposable airborne multi-parameter environmental detectors. The Air Force's AF083-006 project studies low-cost intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance drones.

320.doctext: Japan will  dispatch a  Aegis-class destroyer to  support   United States counter-terrorism action. A spokesperson for the Japan Self-Defense Force said that  Japan  has not yet determined how many warships and members of the Self-Defense Force will be dispatched to assist. He said: If the motion to dispatch the Self-Defense Forces is passed, this will be the first time  Japan  has sent troops to a combat zone since World War II. Because  Japan  only provided economic support during the 1990 Persian Gulf War, it was criticized by all parties.  Japan's current  support plan includes providing  warships providing  fuel,  food and  Warship Parts for  United States warships on the high seas. The Japanese warships will not carry any weapons or warheads. Japan's first Prime Minister Junichiro Koizumi announced yesterday that he would consider amending the basic law to allow the Self-Defense Forces to play a more active role in foreign conflicts.

321.doctext: The U.S. Navy has successfully completed the deployment and recovery of the  Long Range Multi-Mission Undersea Vehicle, which is equipped with the  AN/AQS-20A mine hunter developed by Raytheon Company Sonar. This  test  was the first to verify the  deployment of a   unmanned, remotely operated underwater vehicle  from the  USS Independence Littoral Combat Ship  .  AN/AQS-20A is a mine warfare sensor  used for  submarines  to detect anti-ship mines in front, side and below. The solution can be deployed by a variety of search platforms, using sonar and electro-optical sensors to provide high-resolution images of mines. The U.S. Navy's unmanned undersea vehicle project manager said that this test verified the performance of the long-range multi-mission undersea vehicle and  AN/AQS-20A mine hunting sonar and verified its performance and reliability in a combat environment. . He added that improvements to the  AN/AQS-20A  will take our minehunting capabilities to new levels as it becomes available on helicopters and  long-range multi-mission undersea vehicles  Deployed, we will effectively expand our capabilities and protect the safety of the fleet.

Subject: The U.S. Navy
Equipment: AN/AQS-20A mine hunter developed by Raytheon Company Sonar
AN/AQS-20A is a mine warfare sensor

322.doctext: The United States Air Force Air Combat Command announced that the  Batch 30 RQ-4 Global Hawk manufactured by Northrop Grumman has reached initial combat capability.  The 30th batch of Global Hawk has reached initial operational capability, which means that the high-altitude long-endurance reconnaissance UAV has completed the initial operational  test and evaluation in the development plan and can support Used in real-time combat. Although it was recently announced that  the 30th batch of Global Hawks had reached initial operational capability,   the United States Air Force confirmed earlier this year that this batch of Global Hawks is still continuing Perfect key requirements. Prior to the release of the Initial Operational Test and Evaluation Report,  Batch 30 Global Hawks had reached operational status and were  supporting   Japan disaster relief and  NATO provided critical intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance during operations over Libya. In addition,  Block 30 Global Hawk  is replacing the Block 10 Global Hawk drones in use at Central Command. Currently, there are 9  Global Hawks of the 30th batch   stationed  overseas.  Batch 30 Global Hawks  are now equipped with Raytheon's enhanced integrated sensor suite, which includes electro-optical/infrared and synthetic aperture radar. Next year, the  Batch 30 Global Hawk will change its layout and add Northrop Grumman's airborne signals intelligence payload to the existing EISS to perform multi-source intelligence missions .

Subject: The United States Air Force Air Combat Command

323.doctext: Satellite builder  Boeing Space & Intelligence Systems announced Aug. 22 that  July 16 will be launched from  Canaveral Air Force Base by  span_3 Delta-4 rocket   launched  the second  United States   GPS2F satellite  which has begun in-orbit service. After the on-orbit  verification was completed,  GPS2F-2  was named  SVN-63  and joined the constellation composed of 31 GPS satellites. Currently, GPS Constellation is operated by the  50th Space Company and the  2nd Space Operations Squadron based at  Schriever Air Force Base . Boeing will also build 10 GPS2F satellites. Boeing said that in the next few months,  the U.S. Air Force  will determine the  launch  time of the third  GPS2F satellite . Compared with previous GPS satellites, the hardware of the GPS2F satellite is more advanced. This new type of satellite has a stronger anti-interference signal and can also transmit L5 civilian signals. L5 civil signals can be used for commercial, aviation, search and rescue operations, etc.

324.doctext: The U.S. Navy has awarded a contract to  Northrop Grumman Corporation to  provide the   Advanced Threat Warning Sensor. To upgrade the Navy's large aircraft infrared countermeasures system to protect aircrews and aircraft against battlefield threats. Carl Smith, vice president of infrared countermeasures programs at Northrop Grumman, said the multi-function ATW sensor provides a four-in-one capability, providing missile warning, laser warning, hostile fire detection and sensors in a single sensor package Video and other functions. The latest upgrades will improve warfighters' threat detection capabilities and anticipate threats such as heat-seeking missile attacks, small arms fire, medium-caliber machine gun fire, anti-aircraft artillery and unguided rocket attacks. The integrated sensor reduces size and power consumption, significantly improving the affordability of four independent subsystems. According to the contract,  Northrop Grumman  will provide 24 sets of ATW sensors and 5 processors for the CH-53 helicopter for the DoNLAIRCM project. The ATW sensor will be adapted and compatible with current  deployments  of the  DoNLAIRCM missile warning system  .

325.doctext: The U.S. Nuclear Defense Administration  today announced that it has successfully  installed   radiation detection equipment at the  Sihanoukville port in Cambodia. and put into use. This set of professional equipment provided by  NNSA  now enables Cambodia to scan 100% of import and export containers containing potentially dangerous nuclear and other radioactive materials. The United States says this is a joint effort with countries around the world to prevent nuclear terrorism. A major achievement of doctrine. The United States and Cambodia reached an agreement in 2009 under the  NNSA 's Great Port Initiative, in conjunction with the U.S. Counter-Terrorism Committee Secretariat and  U.S. Customs Service in the  Port of Sihanoukville, Cambodia /span_7 Install radiation detection equipment to prevent, detect and disrupt the passage of illegal nuclear and other radioactive materials through the port.  NNSA  plans to deploy   radiation detection equipment in  100 large ports around the world  . Currently, 39 of the set goals have been completed .  Sihanoukville Port implements the Grand Port Initiative as part of  NNSA ’s Second Line of Defense program, which involves working with local governments to install radiators at mainland ports, airports and seaports Testing equipment and related communication equipment.

326.doctext: Based on the current urgent combat needs,  the French Navy  decided to purchase 9 sets of  Sea Cobra Optoelectronic Surveillance and Tracking Systems  from the British company ChessDynamics. The  Sea Cobra electro-optical surveillance and tracking system evolved from the British Army's  Cobra system, which will eventually  be fielded in the  French Navy /span_5’s 9  A69-type light frigates and 4  Durance River-class integrated supply ships/command ships. In January 2011, in an international competition, the French shipbuilder DCNS selected the  Sea Cobra system . The total value of the contracts signed exceeds 2 million euros. In addition to performing inshore patrol missions, counter-piracy operations and other maritime security missions, the  Sea Cobra system  can also be deployed on commercial vessels.  ChessDynamics Company announced the signed contract at the International Defense Security Equipment Exhibition on September 13. The company stated that the  Sea Cobra system has been developed and will be delivered on time  , also said that the system has passed the  sea trial on the   French Navy two-class warships.

327.doctext: The South African Army Infantry has  deployed the latest  M6 60mm long-range mortar system recently developed by the South African company Denel. The gun is currently being deployed Invest in the global market.  M6 long-range mortar system includes: 60mm mortar with long barrel and related series of ammunition; mortar fire control computer; observation station equipped with laser range finder, The laser rangefinder is linked to the mortar fire control computer; and the mobile command post. The observer mortar fire control computer, mortar fire control computer and mobile command post all use the same personal digital assistant with embedded GPS. The laser rangefinder used in the system is equipped with an embedded compass and is used to perform target acquisition and shooting calibration tasks.  The M6 ​​Mortar  can engage targets quickly and with improved accuracy, requiring less ammunition to destroy known targets. The mortar is equipped with a complete series of 60mm ammunition developed by Rheinmetall's Dinel Ammunition Branch. The maximum range when firing 60mm grenades is 6,000 meters. In addition,  Daniel Ground Systems is supplying the  South African Army   with  a  support package that includes technical support equipment and Training equipment.

328.doctext: Spain and  United States announced that  Spain will provide a   base for  United States ships  , supports NATO's missile defense system. NATO Secretary General Rasmussen, Spanish Prime Minister Zapatero and US Secretary of Defense Panetta jointly announced the agreement reached on October 5. NATO defense ministers held a meeting at NATO headquarters on October 5 and 6. According to the agreement,  United States 4  Aegis ships will  be stationed at    Spain Rota Naval Base . This is part of President Obama's phased missile defense adaptation plan. According to this plan,  the United States will deploy   sea-based anti-missile missiles in the  Eastern Mediterranean   and then in  Romania  and  Poland   deploys   land-based systems  . Panetta called this a step in the right direction for the U.S.-Spanish security partnership, showing that the  United States  is still helping allies and taking responsibility for its defense commitments with Europe even as domestic budgets tighten. Previously,  the United States  had reached anti-missile agreements with  Romania  ,  Poland  and Türkiye. Panetta said the ships will also participate in other missions, including maritime exercises.  Spain  official website stated that the stationing of  United States  ships will create about 1,000 jobs.

329.doctext: Raytheon's Missile Systems Division has selected Mercury Computer Systems' commercial off-the-shelf RACE series multi-computer system to  test the   SM-3 missile lightweight exoatmospheric Projectile kinetic energy warhead. The SM-3 missile is used for sea-based theater ballistic missile defense, and its kinetic warhead is used to intercept incoming ballistic missiles outside the Earth's atmosphere. The upper part of the SM-3 missile includes a third-stage rocket motor, a GPS navigation segment and a kinetic energy kill warhead. Raytheon's SM-3 kinetic energy warhead project director said that Mercury Computer's digital signal processing system adopts a scalable structure that is very important for software code reuse. Through this design, existing software and computers can be used The structure supports advanced discrimination algorithms to create correct image scenes during simulated flight tests.  The United States is developing the SM-3 missile as part of the Navy's theater-wide system. The  NTW system is based on LEAP technology, standard missiles and existing infrastructure. It will be launched in   Deployment on  Aegis ships. The U.S. Navy will have forward-deployed theater ballistic defense capabilities through  Aegis ships  deployed around the world, including the Aegis Combat System, Vertical Launch System and Standard Missiles on board the ships. This NTW capability complements the regional TBMD capabilities in the Aegis system, which includes linear search/track processor enhancements to the AN/SPY-1 radar supported by Mercury Computer's RACE series of multicomputer systems.

Subject: Raytheon's Missile Systems Division
Equipment: SM-3 missile lightweight exoatmospheric Projectile kinetic energy warhead

330.doctext: Taiwan's first  high-speed catamaran guided missile patrol ship   Tuojiang   Recently was launched at  Yilan County Longde Shipyard   and the terminal outfitting started. It is expected to be put into service in early 2015.  Tuojiang adopts a high-speed wave-piercing catamaran type, with high maneuverability, strong strike power, and good stealth. It has a large anti-ship missile load and a long range. It is equipped with 8 Xiongfeng-3 supersonic anti-ship missiles. ship missiles and 8 Xiongfeng-2 subsonic anti-ship missiles.  Tuojiang  Hull number PGG618, with a full load displacement of over 500 tons, a maximum draft of 2.3 meters, a maximum speed of 38 knots, an endurance of 2,000 nautical miles, and a crew of 34. The ship's main weapons include a 76mm main gun, four 12.7mm machine guns, and a 20mm Phalanx close-in defense system. It does not have a helicopter hangar, but it can take off and land helicopters of about 10 tons. The propulsion system is four water jet propellers. .  In the future  the Taiwan Navy will build 9-12 ships of this class and  deploy in  Taiwan's coastal waters and  South China Sea Region, replacing the Jinjiang-class patrol ship.

Militaryforce: high-speed catamaran guided missile patrol ship
Subject: the Taiwan Navy

Subject: the Taiwan Navy

331.doctext: U.S. Navy The Nimitz-class nuclear-powered aircraft carrier USS Theodore Roosevelt fired an air-towed unmanned unit during the combat system ship certification test  exercise  Tested the  close defense weapon system.  Close Defense Weapon System in the shooting exercise project,  A radar-guided 20mm M61 Vulcan Gatling six-barreled machine gun can successfully track and drag Learjet at a speed of more than 250K The drone opened fire. Theodore Roosevelt Combat System Close Defense Weapon System Chief Petty Officer Timothy Butler of the CS-7 Division said:  The Close Defense Weapon System is the USS Theodore Roosevelt's response to intruding anti-ship missiles The last line of defense. The air-towed unmanned unit is used to simulate the profile of an incoming missile and enable operators of close-in defense systems to use and test the capabilities of the equipment. During a firing exercise performed when a warship begins an inspection deployment, Navy fire command equipment control sergeants use local and remote control stations to activate the  Close Defense Weapon System  and fire at the target. The combat system ship certification test is designed to enable ship sergeants to improve their combat readiness while becoming familiar with weapon systems and equipment functions.

332.doctext: In late July, the United States filed formal charges against  Russia   for testing a   land-based cruise missile, believing that the move violated the 1987 Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty. The bilateral treaty bans any missiles with a range of 310 to 3,400 miles. But  Russia  does not accept any of the accusations. Last Wednesday, Poland joined NATO and the United States in protesting against  Russia . NATO Secretary-General Andersen Rasmussen pointed out in a statement that the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty remains a key factor in maintaining Euro-Atlantic peace, and he called on  Russia  to make constructive efforts. The Polish Ministry of Foreign Affairs also issued a formal statement, stating that the "Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty" is the basis for arms control and nuclear disarmament, and violating the treaty will seriously damage European security. On the U.S. side, the chairman of the House of Representatives Arms Leading Group made a recommendation, requiring the  United States to restart research and  deploy  land-launched cruise missiles with a range between 310 and 3,400 miles span_8 and  ballistic missiles.  Russia  In terms of Russia, the Putin government not only denied the accusations made by the United States, Poland and other countries, but also accused the United States of seriously violating the treaty by its anti-missile systems and drones and other arms projects.

333.doctext: The Russian Ministry of Defense stated that the third of six  ALROSA-class diesel-electric submarines will  be launched on August 28 at the  Russian Naval Shipyard   Get into the water. According to the plan of the Russian Navy General Staff, six  ALROSA-class submarines  will be built before 2016 and will then serve in the Black Sea Fleet. Because the  ALROSA-class submarine is almost undetectable when underwater, it is called an ocean black hole by the U.S. Navy. The delivery of this class of submarine is an important part of the Russian Navy's return to the Mediterranean strategy,  Russia   recently  deployed  a  permanent mission force  Mediterranean    .  The ALROSA class is an improved version of the Kilo-class submarine. It has advanced stealth performance, expanded combat range, and can attack land, surface and underwater targets. It is mainly used in relatively shallow waters. Perform anti-ship and anti-submarine missions in waters. This class of submarine can carry a crew of 52, has a maximum underwater speed of 20 knots, a cruising range of 400 nautical miles, and an endurance of 45 days. The boat is equipped with 18 torpedoes and 8 ship-to-air missiles.

334.doctext: The Jiangxi Province UAV Industry Technology Innovation Strategic Alliance, led by  Nanchang Hangkong University, was recently approved to be established. Previously, the  multi-rotor plant protection drone developed by  Nanchang Hangkong University The man-machine has been successfully  tested and put into trial production. According to reports, the  multi-rotor plant protection drone jointly developed by  Nanchang Hangkong University and Jiangxi Gaoan Jinlong Biotechnology Co., Ltd. has been used in  Fujian, Test flights have been successful in  Zhejiang,  Hebei and other places, and it has now entered the small batch trial production stage. In September 2013,  Nanchang Hangkong University 's self-developed G20 drone won third place in the competitive category of the Second International Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Innovation Awards. Luo Ming, the relevant person in charge of the UAV Research Institute of Nanchang Hangkong University, introduced that the establishment of the UAV Industry Technology Innovation Strategic Alliance aims to explore the establishment of a long-term and stable industry-university-research cooperation mechanism, improve the industrial chain and innovation chain, and promote UAV-related Industry technological progress and industrial upgrading. After the establishment of the alliance, it will strengthen the development of common, critical and cutting-edge technologies in the drone industry and further promote the transformation and application of scientific and technological achievements. Source: China Aviation News Network

Subject: Nanchang Hangkong University
Nanchang Hangkong University
