335.doctext: The South Korean Navy  the ninth KSS-2 class diesel-electric submarine  was launched at the  Hyundai Heavy Industries shipyard    . The South Korean Navy stated that the launch ceremony of the Shin Seok was held  on September 7  at  Hyundai Heavy Industries' Ulsan Shipyard   . According to data from Jane's World Navy, the boat started construction in 2014 and is the last of the Sun Yuan-class submarines. It has a total length of 65 meters, a width of 6.3 meters, and a displacement of 1,800 tons. Currently, five Sunwon-class submarines have been commissioned into the Korean Navy, which are characterized by AIP power systems. Shin Seok is the sixth KSS-2 submarine built by Hyundai Heavy Industries. South Korea's Daewoo Shipbuilding & Marine Engineering produces the other three submarines in the class. The KSS-2 boat is powered by two MTU diesel engines and Siemens polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cells and can submerge for 2 weeks without relying on air. Each submarine can carry 40 crew members, with a maximum diving depth of 400 meters, a surface cruising speed of 12 knots, and an underwater cruising speed of up to 20 knots. The boat is equipped with bow sonar, flank sonar and towed array sonar systems. The boat can deploy naval mines, has eight 533mm launch tubes, and can deploy weapons such as White Shark heavy-duty torpedoes, Harpoon anti-ship missiles and land-attack cruise missiles.

Equipment: the ninth KSS-2 class diesel-electric submarine
Subject: Hyundai Heavy Industries shipyard
Hyundai Heavy Industries' Ulsan Shipyard

Equipment: the ninth KSS-2 class diesel-electric submarine
Subject: Hyundai Heavy Industries shipyard
Hyundai Heavy Industries' Ulsan Shipyard

336.doctext: Japan's "World Daily" reported that  North Korea is secretly building a  nuclear submarine. The size of the  submarine is not yet clear, but the Kim Jong Un regime hopes that the boat can   deployed within  3 years. According to the 38 Degrees North website,  since 2014,  North Korea has secretly  test-fired the  Pukguksong-1 submarine-launched ballistic missile /span_8 . Such submarines can move  Pukguksong-1 submarine-launched ballistic missiles  more quietly and imperceptibly into the high seas, evading existing missile defense systems in the United States, Japan and South Korea. The news has not been confirmed yet. If the news is true, it will mean that the North Korean Navy has taken another step forward. According to analysis,  North Korea  currently has 50 to 60 diesel-electric submarines operating. Compared with nuclear submarines, such submarines are noisier and easier to detect.

337.doctext: India  successfully  tested  a  short-range supersonic cruise missile  jointly developed with Russia. Indian Defense Ministry officials said the missile was launched off the coast of  East Odisha  by a naval ship in the Bay of Bengal. This 8-meter-long  missile  has a range of about 300 kilometers and a flying speed of 2 times the speed of sound. It can be launched from surface ships, submarines, aircraft and land-based platforms. This missile has been tested twice before, but this is the first time it was launched from a ship. The missile will give the Indian Navy new capabilities and Indian defense ministry officials said the missile could be deployed  next year    . The missile was developed by a company formed in 1998 by defense organizations of India and Russia, whose close military cooperation has returned to what it was 50 years ago.

338.doctext: The U.S. Navy  successfully used  laser weapons  to shoot down four drones in a  recent   experiment  . This experiment once again brought back memories of President Reagan's Star Wars missile defense plan in the 1980s. At this week's air show in Farnborough, England, the United States announced the successful test of a  laser weapon system  off the  California coast  . The technology, developed with Raytheon, uses just regular  industrial lasers  . "Scientific American" magazine commented on this technology and said that compared to Raytheon's earlier experiments that used static targets as targets, the technology for shooting down drones on surface platforms is more advanced. Raytheon's Mike Bowen told a reporter from USA Today: This is an important day for  laser weapons , but it is a disastrous day for drones. However,  laser weapon systems  will not be  deployed  anytime soon. Even if the next few  tests  are successful, it will be several years before this technology can be used in actual combat

339.doctext: PAKFA fighter   Active phased array radar  forward antenna  Hoy Company  has started Russian  fifth generation fighter  PAKFA The  active phased array radar   test flight of the prototype T-50   . The test flight used the third  T-50 . The first round of ground and air test flights showed that the radar showed stable and powerful performance in both air and ground working modes, which is enough to compete with the most existing ones. Comparable to advanced radar systems. In addition, the  fifth-generation fighter 's  optical system   test  has also begun. The  Active Phased Array Radar  of  PAKFA/T-50  was developed by the Tikhomilov Scientific Institute of Instrument Design company in Moscow. The radar uses various Russian-made components and nanotechnology. The radar has the characteristics of increased detection range, simultaneous multi-function, identification and classification of clusters and single targets, multi-target precision strike, communication support and electronic countermeasures.

Human_Trig: test flight of the prototype T-50
Subject: Hoy Company

340.doctext: Recently, the British Ministry of Defense announced  the Royal Navy a brand new   AgustaWestland Wildcat HMA2 production helicopter  Pictures of first flight. The helicopter in the picture is numbered  ZZ397 . It was built at  Yeovil Production Base in the UK and was delivered  in mid-December 2012   span_7 to the  Royal Navy. The British Ministry of Defense stated that the Wildcat maritime attack helicopter will be used for anti-ship, armed protection and anti-piracy tasks, and also has anti-submarine warfare capabilities. Under a contract worth more than 1.6 billion euros,  AgustaWestland will produce 28 and 34 Wildcats for the  British Royal Navy and the Army respectively, and Initial operational capabilities were formed in 2015 and 2014 respectively. The company will also provide training and support services for the helicopter under a €250 million contract signed in 2012. On the international market, the Wildcat helicopter designated  AW159  has also made a mark. In January 2013, this type of aircraft won its first export order.  The Korean Navy purchased 8 aircraft worth US$560 million. The contract is expected to be signed in the near future,  2015 Start  Delivery.

Subject: Yeovil Production Base in the UK

341.doctext: Lockheed Martin  recently successfully  tested  its  DAGR guidance kit  for a 2.75-inch caliber rocket in the field for the first time. Held at  Eglin Air Force Base , the latest test  demonstrated  the vehicle penetration and time-delay detonation characteristics of the  DAGR .  Lockheed Martin engineers fired a  DAGR -guided rocket with a real warhead at a stationary truck, which penetrated the vehicle before detonating. Through the side of the vehicle. The DARG system can be quickly and seamlessly integrated onto all rotary-wing platforms that fire Hellfire missiles, including Cobra, Apache, Kiowa and Tiger helicopters. DAGR is designed to be compatible with M299 series transmitters. The launcher provides the ability to launch a variety of Hellfire missiles, providing a cost-effective multi-mission capability for a single platform. During the guided flight test,  DAGR  demonstrated its precision strike and target maneuvering capabilities many times, hitting short-range and long-range targets within 1 meter of the laser indicator point. This will increase warfighter capabilities. At short range, the  DAGR  can easily hit vehicles with top speeds of 60 miles per hour.

342.doctext: Lockheed Martin  received a $26 million contract from the  U.S. Navy  to produce enhanced laser-guided training missiles. The contract includes a one-year base order and a four-year option order. Under the contract,  ELGTR products  will be available by  the end of 2019  .  Lockheed Martin  will  deliver the   ELGTR  and refurbish the reusable shipping containers. The optional contract will continue production of laser-guided training munitions until 2023.  Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control Branch ELGTR program manager said,  ELGTR  provides the  U.S. Navy with the required training capabilities. to cope with challenging tactical mission environments. The entire tactical team, from weapons operators to ground maintainers to aircrews, can benefit from an end-to-end training program.  Lockheed Martin has provided /span_14 received more than 160,000  ELGTR/LGTR .  ELGTR  Can be mounted on F-16, F/A-18, AV-8B and various foreign fighters. In addition to  ELGTR  accidents,  Lockheed Martin  also designs and produces the combat-proven Paveway IIplus laser-guided bomb components and model direct attack munitions. More than 75,000 sets of  laser-guided bomb assemblies and 7,000 sets of  dual-mode laser-guided bomb assemblies   have been delivered to the  U.S. Navy,  Marine Corps,  United States Air Force and 23  international customers.

343.doctext: The U.S. Navy announced yesterday that it has selected Lockheed Martin's  S-band radar  based on L-band radar technology as the radar for the future surface ship program DD. U.S. Navy Acquisition Secretary John Young said: The selection of  S-band radar  is the product of careful consideration. What we pursue is that every penny of investment must meet both short-term and long-term goals.  Northrop Grumman  is the prime contractor of the DD program, and Raytheon is the electronic systems integrator of the program. Last year,  Northrop Grumman  and Raytheon defeated a design team composed of Lockheed Martin and General Dynamics. The DD's primary mission is to provide fire support to joint and allied forces through precision strikes. It is also capable of attacking submarines and can perform a variety of missions against air threats. L-band radar is used for close-range sea search and close-range situational awareness. For its  new solid-state S-band radar,  Lockheed Martin has  tested a small prototype that enhances its Aegis Weapon system radar missile defense and other mission capabilities. The U.S. Navy also said that this S-band radar can also be increased in size and used in the planned next-generation cruiser program CG. According to relevant sources, the contract for the  S-band radar program will be signed soon.  The US Navy still wants to award the  DD first ship in fiscal year 2005. The construction contract is for delivery in  FY11  .

344.doctext: The U.S. agency responsible for protecting troops in Iraq from improvised explosive devices is funding the refurbishment of the U.S. Army's fleet of Humvees with improved armor. According to the head of the Joint IED Countermeasures Organization, the organization's budget is $184 million provided by the  Army   for new armor, and in  early 2006 had  provided   US$20 million. More than 5,000 Humvees, including M1114 and M1115 models, have been refurbished with transitional styles of new armor components.  JIEDDO  is seeking the award of a contract to purchase 1,400 portable jammers designed to jam radio signals that trigger improvised explosive devices. A company is testing the system, and if the test is successful, it will be awarded the contract by the end of September. According to the person in charge of  JIEDDO , the number of IED attacks in Iraq has increased in recent months, but the number of successful attacks has remained stable, with more than 1,000 IED attacks in August. Explosive formed projectiles have a disproportionately lethal impact compared to IEDs. EFP can cause an explosion inside the powder cover, causing the disc-shaped metal plate to break away from the powder cover. The impact of the explosion turns the metal plate into a projectile that can penetrate armor. EFP is found mainly in Shia-controlled areas of Iraq and is also used by Hezbollah guerrillas.

345.doctext: [Global Network Reporter Ma Yan] According to a report on the Navy Times website on October 27, after two naval aircraft crashed one after another, the U.S. Naval Aviation Command ordered a one-day safety grounding of undeployed troops. According to reports, the grounding order aims to improve the operational risk management and risk mitigation of naval aviation.  Last Friday, a US Navy  T-6B trainer aircraft crashed in  Alabama   ,  Resulting in the death of  two   pilots    .  A few days before this accident, a  F/A-18E Super Hornet crashed in  California  , The pilot ejected and parachuted to escape. For U.S. Naval Aviation, the new fiscal year, which began on October 1, got off to a bad start. The Naval Safety Center reported that there were no aviation-related fatalities in fiscal year 2020, the first time the center has recorded such a good result since it began tracking such accidents in 1922.

Date: A few days before this accident
Subject: F/A-18E Super Hornet
Result: The pilot ejected and parachuted to escape

346.doctext: ITTExelis  successfully passed the technology maturity stage of the U.S. Navy’s next-generation jammer project. The next-generation jammer to be installed on the EA-18G electronic warfare aircraft can attack the enemy's integrated air defense system and paralyze the enemy's communication and command capabilities. The manager of the electronic systems department of Exelis said that the next generation jammer will enable the US military and allied forces to control the electromagnetic spectrum on future battlefields. To ensure that the technology meets the needs of the next phase of the program,  Exelis  has maintained close contact with the U.S. Navy over the past 33 months. In the technology maturity stage,  Exelis Company has successfully designed, developed and  tested a large number of  important subsystems. The technologies involved include advanced interference control Receiver technology, digital radio frequency storage technology and center band aperture technology, etc., these technologies have been effectively verified in the laboratory environment.  Exelis  also verified the effectiveness of the power generation system and control system, and completed the wind tunnel  testing  of the  concept demonstration cabin . Work in the technology maturation phase was primarily completed in Clifton, New Jersey, and Bohemia, New York.

347.doctext: South Korean military officials said that  North Korea  has made great progress in miniaturizing  nuclear warheads  and will be able to install nuclear warheads on ballistic missiles in the next two to three years.  North Korea  These new risk assessments posed by its nuclear program have forced South Korea to review its military strategy. If  North Korea  attempts a nuclear weapon, South Korea must strike preemptively against its opponent.  In December 2012  ,  North Korea  successfully  launched the   Unha-3 satellite launch vehicle  .  On February 12, 2013  , the outside world believed that  North Korea  conducted its third underground  nuclear   test  . Although the long-range ballistic missile technology tested by the  Galaxy-3  would not be used to attack South Korea, it violates United Nations non-proliferation sanctions against  North Korea that prohibit any ballistic missile technology. . Citing data collection and analysis by South Korean intelligence agencies, the South Korean Institute for Defense Analyses said that  North Korea ’s third underground nuclear test was a successful explosive test, and it will only take them a few years to equip missiles in the future.  North Korea  can effectively control nuclear weapons by conducting one more nuclear test. It is expected that the fourth nuclear test will  test   nuclear warhead  and explode, thus achieving possession of nuclear weapons.

348.doctext: On the 25th,   India's first  domestic attack nuclear submarine Arihant  successfully  test-fired A  missile without a warhead. This test launch is the result of the joint efforts of  Indian Navy  ,  Indian Defense Research and Development Organization  ,  Bhabha Atomic Research Center  . The test firing was directed by India's Strategic Forces Command. Previously, the submarine had completed the critical dive  test  and almost fully achieved its design and expected performance indicators. But before the  Arihant submarine  is put into service, the missile test is still the critical last step. Although the details of the submarine's missile test are currently unknown, considering that it will participate in the international fleet review in 2016, it is speculated that the submarine should have actual combat capabilities by then. The missile tested this time is the B5 missile developed by  India’s Defense Research and Development Organization , with a range of 800-1,000 kilometers. In the future, the submarine may be equipped with missiles with a range of 3,500-4,000 kilometers. It is reported that  Indian Navy  plans to build 6  Arihant nuclear submarines  .

Subject: Indian Navy
Indian Navy
Indian Defense Research and Development Organization
India’s Defense Research and Development Organization
Bhabha Atomic Research Center
India
Equipment: India's first  domestic attack nuclear submarine Arihant

349.doctext: Yonhap News Agency reported that  North Korea   28th was apparently conducting a  submarine-based ballistic missile  test launch, but it ended in failure. , there is no indication that the missile successfully ejected from the submarine and took off. If this test launch is confirmed, it will be the first  May   North Korea to conduct a  submarine-based ballistic missile   test launch In another attempt, Pyongyang said a test in May was successful, but this was not verified by any independent party. Yonhap News Agency quoted a South Korean government source as saying: No missile was found flying, only fragments of the protective cover were found, so the launch was probably unsuccessful. South Korea's Defense Ministry declined to confirm the report, citing that it does not comment on intelligence matters.  North Korea May's  ballistic missile test launches alarmed both the United States and South Korea about the possibility of  North Korea advancing military capabilities, especially when  North Korea is pursuing a nuclear weapons program. But a senior U.S. military official and unofficial rocket experts expressed doubts about the authenticity of the May test photos released by  North Korea . They believe the photo may have been altered. Some experts say the  missile  may have been launched from a specially designed underwater barge rather than a submarine.  North Korea  It will be years before such technology is available. But South Korea said it believed the missile was launched from a submarine and flew about 150 meters out of the water.  North Korea  has violated United Nations sanctions banning it from developing missiles and conducting nuclear tests.  North Korea  is working to miniaturize nuclear weapons and mount them on  ballistic missiles  , but it will take years to master the technology.

350.doctext: The Netherlands'  Royal Navy  will receive its first  improved Walrus-class submarine  ,  S803 Sea Lion  . The submarine's  launch  and current readiness to enter service mark an important milestone in the  Walrus-class submarine  life extension program. As the platform system integrator for this project,  Nevesbu Company  carried out all necessary engineering improvements including new systems, submarine shipboard equipment, etc.  Walrus-class submarine  The life extension project began in May 2013 and aims to extend the service life of the submarine until at least 2025 and increase operability in coastal waters. According to the plan, the next submarine,  S808 Dolphin  will be ready to be launched in  March 2016   . The Walrus-class submarine fleet consists of four submarines, including S802 Walrus,  S803 Sea Lion ,  S808 Dolphin  and S810 Sea Whale. The submarine was built by Rotterdam Shipbuilding and Norwegian Shipbuilding and Ship Repair. The Walrus-class submarine of the Royal Netherlands Navy is 67.6 meters long, has a submersible speed of 20 knots, and a range of approximately 11,500 miles when cruising at 9 knots. The boat is equipped with four 21-inch Honeywell MK48Mod4 and or Mk48ADCAP torpedoes and can carry 40 mines instead of torpedoes. In January this year, Saab teamed up with Damen Shipyard to bid for the Walrus-class submarine replacement program.

351.doctext: After passing several deep-sea diving training and weapons launch  tests in the past five months,   India's first  nuclear-armed submarine Arihant span_3  It is now fully prepared and can be officially transferred to the naval fleet as soon as the order is received. Several officials closely related to the implementation of the Arihant missile submarine project have confirmed to TOI that the domestically produced submarine is now fully operational, as verified by a number of weapons tests conducted secretly over the past few months  The submarine  performance.  Arihant submarine is the first of  India's five-ship ballistic missile submarine program and was built in  Visakhapatnam Deep Sea Diving  Experiments. Officials told the Times of India that the Russian submarine support ship Epron arrived in India in October last year and has been accompanying the  Arihant  to complete deep-sea diving and launch tests. Epron is a Prut-class submarine rescue ship and one of the Russian ships that recently participated in India's second international maritime review. India currently does not have ships in the submarine salvage category, which are crucial when testing submarine weapons.

Equipment: India's first  nuclear-armed submarine Arihant span_3
Subject: India

352.doctext: U.S. Ambassador Samantha Power said on Thursday that due to  North Korea's fourth  nuclear   test and  rocket launch  test , the United Nations draft resolution will impose the toughest sanctions on North Korea, Samantha Power said: The world will not accept your nuclear proliferation. The 22-page proposal would make all goods entering and leaving  North Korea  subject to inspection. The sanctions will ban the supply of aviation fuel, including rocket fuel, and blacklist more individuals and entities linked to  North Korea's  nuclear and ballistic missile programs. Seven weeks after  North Korea claimed to have conducted its first  hydrogen bomb   test, Power told  North Korea: This is what you did We will continue to work diligently and collectively to stop your nuclear program. Security Council diplomats told Fox News on Wednesday that the United States and China agreed to the draft resolution, and senior Western diplomats said a vote on the resolution would be held this weekend. The United States, Russia, the United Kingdom, France and China, as permanent members, have veto power on any resolution.

353.doctext: India  has secretly  tested  the  submarine-launched medium-range ballistic missile K-4  . India's Daily Express News on March 8 quoted an unnamed defense source as saying that  K-4 missile   March 7 was positioned underwater. The  pontoon was launched at a depth of nearly 9 meters. According to reports, the DRDO was tight-lipped about the secret test. Although the results of the test are not yet clear, sources said the powerful gas generator successfully ejected the  missile  and the takeoff went smoothly. A defense scientist said that the  K-4 missile  will complement the K-15 missile with a range of 750 kilometers. The Arihant nuclear submarine, which may soon be in service with the Navy, will be equipped with 4  K-4 missiles  or 12 K-15 missiles.  The K-4 missile  will undergo 3 to 4  tests  before entering naval service.  K-4 missile  It is about 12 meters long, 1.3 meters in diameter, weighs about 17 tons, and can deliver a 2-ton warhead up to 3,500 kilometers. The missile uses solid rocket propellant. The secret K-project work has been very covert for the past nearly two decades and the DRDO's priority is to make the missile system lighter and faster with both cruise and ballistic variants.

354.doctext: According to Russian state news reports,  Russia  purchased the  Union 40 UAV  from the United Arab Emirates and has begun flight tests.  Russian Defense Industry  said the  tests  were conducted at the  Akhtubinsk Flight Test Center  under the management of the Russian Ministry of Defense.  The Joint 40 UAV  is a  medium-altitude long-endurance UAV  produced by the UAE Adcom Systems Company, which can perform surveillance and combat missions. In July 2013, the Russian News Agency reported that  Russia planned to purchase at least 2  Joint 40 UAVs for use in the  Joint 40 UAVs originally scheduled for February 2014. span_9 tested, but the program was delayed by the Department of Defense.  United 40 UAV  adopts an S-shaped fuselage and tandem wing design. The manufacturer claims this wing design makes it easier to turn under the influence of gravity.  The power propulsion system of the drone  includes two 115-horsepower engines.  The UAV  has two ammunition pylons under each wing. Each pylon can carry 100 kilograms of ammunition. This UAV has a wingspan of 17.53 meters, a maximum take-off weight of 2,000 kilograms, a flight life of 100 hours, and a maximum flight altitude of 8,000 meters.

Equipment: The power propulsion system of the drone
Subject: Russian Defense Industry

355.doctext: Russian Radioelectronics has begun  testing of an electronic warfare system capable of  jamming airborne targeting systems in the event of an air attack. to protect ground targets.  Radio Electronics Technologies Inc. announced that  The company has begun factory  testing of the  Ground-Based Electronic Warfare Assembly. Ability to protect troops and civilian facilities from air attacks. These tests will be completed within  2016 . As early as November 2015,  Radio Electronics Technology Company  had developed a land-based system with this capability and had the technology to attack various targets. This system is not only effective against triangular target targeting but also against other methods of positioning, such as interval difference positioning and stage positioning. The system adopts a modular structure and uses the latest design algorithms such as radio electronic interference architecture. The frequency bandwidth and combat effectiveness of these jamming modules are significantly improved. The developers stated that the final system structure will effectively inhibit any existing targeting systems and targeting systems under development used on airborne platforms.

356.doctext: The Russian Ministry of Defense announced that the sixth and final  Kilo-improved Korpino submarine   was launched and will join the Russian Black Sea Fleet .  The submarine Korpino  was launched in a ceremony at the  St. Petersburg Admiralty Shipyard . At the ceremony, the deputy commander of the Russian Navy stated that Russia currently plans to purchase Type 636.3 submarines for the Pacific Fleet, and will build more submarines of this type for the Northern Fleet and the Baltic Fleet in the future. The Type 636 submarine is an improvement on the Type 877 submarine, 24 of which were built between 1979 and 1994. The Type 636 submarine is slightly longer than the Type 877 submarine. Significant improvements have been made in the main engine, onboard systems, weapons, vibration and noise reduction. The submarine is equipped with torpedoes and uses a torpedo launch tube  to launch   Cruise missile.  The Russian Ministry of Defense  stated that the 636.3 submarine has an underwater speed of 20 knots, an endurance of 45 days, a crew of 50, and an underwater displacement of 4,000 tons.

357.doctext: US media reported on May 27 that  Russia   conducted a test launch from the  Plesetsk launch site   on the 25th The test of the  Nudor missile, which can rise directly to destroy satellites in orbit, was apparently successful. The launch was monitored by US reconnaissance satellites. It is said that this test launch is the second time that  Russia launched the   Nudol missile after    launched it in November 2015. The successful test launch of this type of missile marks another milestone achievement for  Russia in the development of weapons that can destroy US navigation, communication, and intelligence satellites.

358.doctext: Rendering of India's domestically produced nuclear submarine According to a report by The Times of India on June 3, 2009, after experiencing a series of setbacks, India's nuclear submarine project has finally made progress. First,   Indian Navy's first indigenous nuclear submarine is expected to be  launched on August 15th   for preliminary testing; Second,  Russia has agreed to lease the  Akula-II Nerpa attack submarine   at the end of  this year  To  India on a 10-year lease. Nuclear-powered submarines have more advantages than conventionally powered submarines. Conventional diesel-electric submarines need to frequently surface to replenish oxygen to recharge their batteries, while nuclear-powered submarines can operate underwater for a long time. Therefore, when a nuclear-powered submarine is equipped with a nuclear warhead missile, the submarine becomes the most difficult nuclear platform to detect and attack. This capability is crucial to  India because  India  The commitment of no first use of nuclear weapons requires  India to have a strong nuclear counterattack capability. The introduction of nuclear submarines has enabled  India  to achieve its goal of having an operational nuclear triangle, i.e. launching nuclear weapons from three environments: water, land and air.

Equipment: Indian Navy's first indigenous nuclear submarine
Subject: Indian Navy

Human_Trig: at the end of  this year
Subject: Russia

359.doctext: Rendering of India's domestically produced nuclear submarine [according to strategypage website report on August 31]   India The first  nuclear submarine INS Arihaut   in  July   Launched  , but the reactor has not been installed, and installation of the reactor may take another year or so. It's unclear what state  Arihaut 's reactor will be in. What is known is that the  Arihaut  does not travel under its own power, and it is apparently not equipped with weapons and possibly other major systems. Once  Arihaut  has a working reactor and weapons system, it will undergo up to two years of  testing  and sea trials before entering official service.  Arihaut  is based on the Russian Charlie II submarine, which has a vertical launch tube and is long enough to launch cruise missiles. The leased Russian Akula II submarine will be mainly used as a training ship for India's new nuclear submarine force. India will apparently build five new nuclear submarines, and their nuclear power section is developing compact light water reactor technology so that the reactor can be installed on the submarine. Compared with the standards of other nuclear submarines, the 85MW reactor makes  Arihant  underpowered, and  Arihant  is designed to have a maximum speed of 55km/h.

360.doctext: Data map: Russia's RSM-54 intercontinental ballistic missile Xinhuanet Moscow, March 4  Russia   Tula nuclear submarine   4th Successful  Test firing of an  RSM-54 intercontinental ballistic missile, the warhead accurately hit the intended target at the Kula test site on the Kamchatka Peninsula in Russia's Far East. According to Russian media reports,  At 7:50 Moscow time on the 4th, the  Tula nuclear submarine successfully  tested from the waters of the  Barents Sea Shoot this  RSM-54 intercontinental ballistic missile. The Russian Federal Space Agency said on its official website that  Russia  successfully completed the test launch mission. This test launch also proved the high quality and reliability of the missile system.  The RSM-54 intercontinental ballistic missile  is a three-stage liquid fuel missile designed and produced by the Russian Makeev Design Bureau. The missile is a third-generation intercontinental ballistic missile that was equipped with the then Soviet Navy submarines in 1986. From 2002 to 2005,  Russia  modified the  RSM-54 intercontinental ballistic missile , bringing it to the highest technical level of land-based and sea-based missiles. Itar-Tass news agency reported that the  RSM-54 intercontinental ballistic missile  has huge technological potential and can deal with possible military threats before 2030. In July 2007, then-Russian President Vladimir Putin signed an order for the Russian Navy to equip the improved  RSM-54 intercontinental ballistic missile .

361.doctext: [According to a report on the marketwatch website on July 6, 2018] A senior South Korean congressman said that  North Korea  is believed to be developing a new type of ballistic missile nuclear submarine capable of launching nuclear weapons. Evidence collected by South Korea's military shows that  North Korea  is working on submarines off its east coast. Satellite images showed signs of worker activity and material transfers at Sinpo Port, where the submarine appeared to be under construction at an indoor facility. A spokesman for South Korea's Defense Ministry said he could not disclose details of relevant intelligence activities, but he stressed that South Korea and the United States will continue to monitor military facilities in  North Korea . In 2014,  North Korea  announced its submarine-launched ballistic missile program for the first time.  North Korea  is believed to have conducted 4 to 6  KN11 submarine-launched ballistic missile  launches  tests  .  The 2016   test launch of 's  missile  flew 482.8 kilometers, indicating that the program is underway.

362.doctext: [According to a report on India's "Defense World" website on September 22, 2020]  On September 20,  The U.S. Navy launched an attack on the Farallon-De Medinilla Range near Guam  Test-fired the  Tomahawk cruise missile. The  Tomahawk cruise missile was launched from the  U.S. Navy guided missile cruiser USS Antietam . The test was part of the Valiant Shield 2020 exercise, which is the  United States  Field training  exercises every two years, focusing on  joint training at sea. 363.doctext: On November 3, local time,  Russia's United Aviation Manufacturing Group announced that the  improved Tu-160 bomber equipped with a new engine completed its  first flight , flight altitude is 6,000 meters, flight time is 2 hours and 20 minutes. △The picture comes from RIA Novosti. The company pointed out that during the test flight, the  improved airborne avionics equipment was  tested and the performance of the new engine was evaluated. This time The test flight was a complete success.  Tu-160  It is the fastest and longest-range strategic bomber in the world, and is an important part of Russia's aerial nuclear strike force. In recent years, Russia has deeply improved the  Tu-160 bomber. The improved and upgraded  Tu-160  will have brand-new flight driving equipment, airborne integrated communication system, radar and electronic countermeasures equipment. .

364.doctext: [According to a report on the German Aviation Magazine website on October 5, 2018]  The American electric aircraft startup Zunum  selected the Safran Ardiden3 helicopter propulsion system as the power plant for the hybrid regional aircraft ZA10. The ZA10 aircraft is currently in the research and development stage and will become the first model of the future hybrid regional aircraft series. The aircraft plans to use two power sources. In addition to battery drive,  Safran's Ardiden series turbines  will be used to drive a 500-kilowatt generator. Currently,  Zunum Corporation uses a Rockwell Turbine Commander 840 as a flight test bed and plans to conduct the first flight using battery power  test next year  . At the same time,  Zunum Corporation  will conduct ground  testing  of the  hybrid system  . In early 2019, further upgrades to the propulsion system were completed and gradually tested to prepare for flight. It is expected to conduct  hybrid system  flight  testing  at  the end of 2019  . The ZA10 finalization and construction plan will be completed in early 2020. The aircraft has a total of 12 seats and a maximum range of 1,125 kilometers using hybrid power.  Zunum  said the new aircraft will strive to achieve groundbreaking operating costs of 8 cents per seat mile or $250 per flight hour, reducing energy consumption by 60% to 80% compared with conventionally powered aircraft of the same size.

365.doctext: The Russian Academy of Television Science has developed a domestically produced all-round camera to record the work of Russian astronauts in space. Onboard testing of the camera on the International Space Station will take place next year. The institute announced:  The camera system will undergo automatic acceptance testing. The access inspection will be performed by  Energy Rocket Systems Company and will be  tested on the comprehensive test bed  .  2017  Flight  Experiments  in  Space  . The Russian space camera is called  Automatic Video Observation System  and is a wearable helmet with cameras on both sides. The signal from the camera will be sent to the star receiver on the Russian segment of the International Space Station and from there via the communication channel to the flight control center in Korolev. As the Television Science Institute said, the cameras are expected to provide effective monitoring of astronauts' extravehicular activities.

366.doctext: Russian Advanced Research Foundation  begins  testing of   smart bullets  in controlled mode. At present, the design and experimental testing in unmanaged mode have been completed, and work in this direction will continue to be actively promoted. Next, flight  tests  in controlled mode will begin. As early as last year,  Russian Advanced Research Foundation  planned to test  smart bullets  with the goal of hitting a target 10 kilometers away.  Smart bullets  are  automatically guided bullets  with automatic guidance function. After being launched, they can change the direction and adjust the path according to the target position.

367.doctext: Finnish Electricity Company Teollisuuden VoimaOyj  announced on December 19, 2017, that  Olkiluoto Nuclear Power Plant Unit 3 EPR Reactor started the hot function  test . These critical pre-operational tests ensure that coolant loops and nuclear safety systems are functioning properly before fuel is loaded. TVO said the tests are expected to last several months to simulate the temperatures and pressures the reactor system is subjected to during normal operation. TVO noted that this was the first unit-level  test  of a  nuclear power plant  in which the nuclear and turbine islands were operated together.  The Reactor  During this phase several different  tests  will be carried out at different pressure levels. The temperature of the water is increased using heat generated by the reactor coolant pump. TVO said that after successfully completing the hot functional test, it will be possible to obtain the operating license for Unit 3 and continue preparations for commissioning.  The EPR reactor of Olkiluoto Nuclear Power Plant Unit 3 The contract was signed in 2003 and construction started in 2005. It was originally planned to be completed in 2009. The current plan is to start commercial power generation from the end of 2018 to May 2019. . The unit launched a four-week cold function  test in  June 2017 to confirm that safety-related components and systems are installed correctly and can operate under cold conditions. , and verify the sealing of the primary circuit.

The Boomerang vehicle family currently includes two models: the K-17 infantry fighting vehicle and the K-16 armored personnel carrier. In April 2015, the  Boomerang  was first  disclosed  during the  Russian Victory Day parade rehearsal  . The K-17 is equipped with an electric unmanned turret. There is a 2A42 30mm automatic cannon installed on the turret, and a 7.62mm PKT parallel machine gun is installed on the left side of the main weapon. Two Kornet-EM anti-tank missile launchers are installed on both sides of the turret. The K-16 is equipped with a small unmanned turret equipped with a sensor array and a 12.7 mm machine gun.

369.doctext: The United States Government during the  Cold War tested its  nuclear weapons in the  Marshall Islands   , Colombia, USA Newly published peer-reviewed research by university scientists shows that radiation levels there are significantly higher than at the  Fukushima nuclear power plant in Japan where the worst  nuclear   accident in history occurred span_7  and  Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine. Scientists collected soil samples from four islands. On one of the islands, they found that the concentration of radioactive particles was 1,000 orders of magnitude higher than normal. Scientists also discovered plutonium-238 on Nunn Island in Rongelap Atoll, about 100 miles from Bikini, Njebi and Lennet Islands. This isotope is not a product of radioactive fallout but is commonly associated with nuclear waste, raising the possibility that Nunn Island could be used as a nuclear waste disposal site. Scientists have also tested fruit on several islands and found radioactivity levels higher than safe levels in countries affected by nuclear fallout, including Russia, Ukraine, Belarus and Japan.

Subject: nuclear
Location: Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine

Despite the impact of the COVID-19 epidemic,  Cochin Shipyard  and  Indian Navy  jointly promoted the completion of all major milestones before the sea trial of  Aircraft Carrier  on time. In this test, the four LM2500 gas turbines, main gearbox, shaft system, controllable pitch propeller and their integrated control system on the  INS Vikrant  were tested. In addition, major auxiliary equipment and systems such as rudders, air conditioners, compressors, centrifuges, all 60 critical pumps, electrical systems, fire protection systems, deck machinery and internal communication equipment were also tested. With the successful completion of the mooring test,  Vikrant  has entered the final stage, and it is expected to conduct  sea trials  in  the first half of 2021  .

371.doctext: Raytheon Company officials recently said that in order to study the company's  Extended Range Guided Munition, the company has conducted some preliminary  tests and is currently conducting Chogn has newly activated some key supply bases and is preparing to test   complete projectiles  in late 2008   . In addition, the company will use funds received in FY07 to develop a  universal projectile guidance system that will be used for  testing ERGM and Excalibur, the Army's  span_8 GPS-guided 155mm artillery shells. Last summer, the Defense Subcommittee of the White House Appropriations Committee recommended cutting ERGM investment in half for fiscal year 2007, but in the end  the Navy  overturned this recommendation. According to the FY07 defense budget,  Raytheon  received $16.3 million for ERGM research and development, including $4.4 million in additional investments. Half of the additional investment will be used for the ERGM project and half will be used for the projectile universal guidance project. The projectile universal guidance project can reduce the investment of the Army and  Navy  and reduce the unit price of the two types of projectiles mentioned above. ERGM is a project of great concern to the  U.S. Navy. The  Navy and  Raytheon Company will launch  in 2008 in  Baisha Test Site conducted  complete projectile launch  test. Before that,  Raytheon Company had to complete a large amount of related test work.

372.doctext: Progress Energy Corporation is preparing to  test   the Shearon Harris Nuclear Generating Station in Wake County  this Wednesday  New emergency alarm.  Testing  will take place  between 10 and 11 a.m. .  New siren  The installation cost is 2.5 million US dollars and it is equipped with a backup power supply. A single charge of the backup power supply can make the siren sound continuously for 4 days. The Hillon-Harris Nuclear Power Plant has sirens set up within a 10-mile radius emergency planning area. The emergency planning area involves several counties surrounding the nuclear power plant, home to 74,000 residents, a fourfold increase from when the nuclear power plant began operation 21 years ago. The current  alarm  does not have a backup power supply, and there have been three system  failures  in the past 18 months, the most recent one occurring in January this year. If the  new siren  is tested successfully, it will be officially put into use on April 1 this year.

373.doctext: CFM International  is studying to further reduce the mass of the Leap-X engine to ensure that its baseline design meets airworthiness requirements. The feasibility of reducing the thickness of composite blades and fan casings is currently being investigated. Internal analysis determined that the current design based on the GEnx series scaled technology is sufficient to meet the bird impact and blade fly-out tests required for certification. By using composite materials instead of metal materials, the total weight of the 18-blade Leap-X fan is reduced by approximately 76kg. To increase its strength,  CFM  also needed to change its production process. GEnx blades still use the popular double-layer stacking process. Leap-X uses a three-dimensional braided resin conversion molding process to enhance its strength.  CFM  is building a  eCore2 demonstrator  to  test   Leap-X engine  components. Compared with the eCore1 test device, the high-pressure turbine of the new demonstrator has an additional stage. The first low-pressure and high-pressure biaxial joint test will begin at the end of  this year . Snecma has begun durability  testing  of the 180cm  diameter fan  developed from the Mascot project.

374.doctext: According to a report on the Indian Space Research website on December 1,  the Indian Space Agency successfully  tested the upgraded  at its  Liquid Propulsion Test Site  Liquid propellant Vikas engine.  Vikas engine  will serve as the second stage of India's Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle, as well as the second stage and four bundled stages of the Geostationary Satellite Launch Vehicle. The engine room pressure of Vikas developed is 58.5 bar. It uses UH25 as fuel and nitrogen tetroxide as oxidant. In the months leading up to this trial, extensive short-term testing of the upgraded engine has been carried out to examine the interaction between various parameters to ensure stable  engine  combustion. After the test is successful, this upgraded  Vikas engine will be used as planned to conduct the second phase of the GSLV development flight  test, which is expected to be in  2002 conduct.  The newly developed engine  can increase the GSLV's ability to launch payloads into geostationary transfer orbit by about 150 kilograms.

375.doctext: DCNS successfully completed the overhaul of the  Brazilian Clemenceau-class aircraft carrier Sao Paulo  in Rio de Janeiro. The working team of  DCNS Company conducted diagnosis and  test on the  Aircraft Carrier Steam Catapult and succeeded in accordance with the requirements of  Brazilian Navy Restored  Catapult ability.  Steam catapults  are a key element of the carrier's capabilities, and  USS São Paulo 's  steam catapults  have conducted more than 5,000 launches.  São Paulo is the  French original Foch. In September 2000,  Brazilian Navy was introduced from the French Navy and officially became  on November 15, 2000. span_12 Brazilian Navy's  Sao Paulo aircraft carrier.  USS Foch entered the dry dock construction stage in 1957,  three years later   was launched, and was finally towed to Brest to complete subsequent construction work , the aircraft carrier entered service in 1963 and did not withdraw from the French Navy until 2000, when the French nuclear-powered aircraft carrier Charles de Gaulle entered service. After a long period of maintenance and upgrades,  Foch  was transferred to the  Brazilian Navy  .  The USS Sao Paulo aircraft carrier  is 265 meters long, has a full load displacement of nearly 33,000 tons, and can carry 18 Skyhawk carrier-based aircraft. The aircraft carrier's two  steam catapults  can accelerate a carrier-based aircraft from standstill to a speed of 270 kilometers per hour in 2 seconds.

376.doctext: Finnish waste management company Posiva  said it has started construction of  heavy-duty closure doors for a demonstration repository tunnel at its final repository and waste packaging plant in Olkiluoto. The underground facility is called  Onkalo . The  enclosure doors  exist to be waterproof and are scheduled to be constructed within six months and will be pressure  tested  once completed. Engineer Petri Koho from  Posiva  said that the pressure test can verify whether the water can flow through the connection surface between the  closing door  and the bedrock,  closing door  Next step The development is likely to be similar to this one under construction. The project will continue until the fall of 2016.  Posiva  will further verify whether the  closed door  meets the design requirements and can be implemented in industrial production.  The closed tunnel   test  is called Poplu and is part of a joint effort by  European countries  to test the final repository containment technology.

377.doctext: US Aerospace  and  defense company  Orbital ATK Corporation   recently announced the successful completion of the mission at  NASA Langley Research Center  The 3D printed  hypersonic engine combustion chamber was  tested locally. The burner manufactured through the powder bed fusion material manufacturing process underwent various high-temperature hypersonic flight  tests  within 20 days, including the longest propeller wind tunnel test. As one of the most challenging components of the  hypersonic propulsion system , the scramjet combustion chamber endures extremely harsh working environments. The purpose of the testing is to ensure that PBF-produced components have adequate performance to meet mission objectives. According to ATK, the testing facility met or exceeded all requirements. The company says it uses a material manufacturing process to create objects layer by layer, fully incorporating design features and integrating components that simply cannot be produced using traditional manufacturing techniques. "This burner would have been impossible to build a few years ago, and this successful test will encourage our engineers to continuously explore new designs and use these innovative tools to reduce costs and production time," said the deputy director of ATK's Missile Products Department.

378.doctext: AVX and  Karem received  funding from the  Army despite not winning the Joint Multi-Mission Rotorcraft program bid span_4  supports  in conducting a series of critical experiments on its design proposals.  Karem  has received investment from the  Army  to build a full-scale tilt-rotor system based on its optimized tip speed rotor and conduct ground tests. The system includes a two-stage variable speed reducer, engine, nacelle and rotor. The rotor has a diameter of 36 feet and adopts a rigid rotor design. Rotor tower testing is planned to begin in 2019.  AVX  is expected to receive approximately US$11 million from supplementary projects in the 2017 fiscal budget to build a 1/2 scale, powered  coaxial rotor compound thrust helicopter concept model, the rotor is 28 feet in diameter and is equipped with canard stub wings and 2 ducted rear propulsion fans. The model will be  tested  in a 40-by-80-foot wind tunnel  at the National Full-Scale Aerodynamic Complex at NASA's Ames Research Center.

379.doctext: The U.S. Navy completed two  tests of Raytheon's  BlockIV Tactical Tomahawk cruise missile  last week span_3. According to the military statement on September 16, the first product acceptance test was completed at the  Naval Surface Warfare Center . The test verified the  missile 's ability to be launched while ensuring the safety of a land-based test stand, while testing the entire system including rocket propulsion, engines, and guidance and navigation systems. During the test, the  Naval Surface Warfare Center Functional Test Range  completed a simulated launch mission with a  Tactical Tomahawk missile  with a warhead. The second  test  was completed  last week  during the cruise of the destroyer USS Stethhem.  Tactical Tomahawk missile  was successfully launched and completed the land attack mission. This test marked the first time that the  Block IV finished missile  was put into use. After launch, the  missile  entered a cruise flight state and completed a flight mission of 674 nautical miles under the guidance of the GPS navigation system. Last month, the  Navy  awarded Raytheon a $1.6 billion, multi-year production contract for full-rate production of the  Tactical Tomahawk missile , which also includes a Foreign Military Sales program to the United Kingdom. According to the contract, Raytheon will produce 2,200  Tactical Tomahawk missiles  , of which 2,135 will be supplied to the  US Navy  and 65 will be supplied to the United Kingdom. The production work is expected to be completed in 2011.

Location: Naval Surface Warfare Center Functional Test Range

380.doctext: China Aviation News: Through the continuous efforts of  the R&D team of the Aviation Industry First Flight Institute, the  Pathfinder UAV recently completed 12 rounds of fully automatic medium-speed and low-speed Slide  test and take the next step.  The Pathfinder UAV is a general-purpose unmanned transport aircraft designed and modified by the First Aircraft Research Institute on the basis of the mature platform of the Kittyhawk 500 general-purpose aircraft. The aircraft inherits the excellent qualities of the prototype and retains The economical and efficient layout of the original aircraft has been greatly improved and improved in system performance. The flight control system has been independently developed and equipped with advanced ground station data links, laying the foundation for long-term development in the future. In this stage of taxiing tests, the  R&D team focused on the verification of functions such as automatic throttle, automatic correction, and automatic braking, and completed 8 taxiing tests with a length of 300 meters at a speed of 30 to 70 kilometers per hour. interval. The test results show that the fully automatic taxiing function of the flight control and management system is reliable and operates stably, basically achieving the expected goals, and accumulating valuable experience for subsequent high-speed test taxiing.  Pathfinder The final assembly and system integration were completed from March to June 2018.  In July the full system closed-loop  test of the prototype and ground station was completed.  span_8 August completed the prototype and ground station full system function  joint test,  September completed the engine test run and onboard full system function  test /span_11, taxiing tests will begin in October. This project independently developed a UAV flight control system for the first time and conducted third-party evaluation, filling the professional gap and laying a solid foundation for subsequent UAV development. Source: China Aviation News Network

381.doctext: North Korea   conducted its fourth  nuclear   test in January this year;  June 22 , and  test-fired two  medium-range ballistic missiles. The international community strongly condemned  North Korea for launching  missiles and rockets, but strangely, only  North Korea tested  missiles Such strong condemnation, while other countries, even Iran's missile test did not attract so much attention. To be sure,  North Korea 's nuclear weapons program makes its  missile  development seem even more threatening. Missiles are an important part of nuclear weapons, so the proliferation of missiles should also be of great concern. Major nuclear powers are constantly conducting missile tests to expand their offensive capabilities. It can be said that the advanced and precision-guided missiles of major countries have stimulated other countries to develop nuclear weapons. At the same time, nuclear weapons also drive the development of advanced missiles. The combination of the two maximizes its destructive power, so many believe that deterrence is more reliable. Then again, missiles equipped with conventional warheads could be considered an alternative to nuclear weapons. South Korea, for example, has invested a lot of resources in developing ballistic and cruise missiles, aiming to compete with  North Korea 's nuclear weapons program. In any case, missile proliferation should not be narrowly limited to itself. Nuclear weapons include nuclear warheads and delivery systems, and the two are inseparable. Whether intentionally or unintentionally, this basic fact is often ignored in nuclear disarmament. Nuclear nonproliferation efforts that ignore missile proliferation are doomed to be in vain. Missile proliferation is the hidden driving force behind nuclear proliferation.

382.doctext: The German emerging company E-volo Company has conducted a dynamic flight test of the  VC200 Volocopter aircraft, and  tested the aircraft in an unmanned manner. VTOL aircraft to collect data for improved designs. The first manned  flight of the  prototype took place  at the end of March this year in  E-volo  in  Karlsruhe near the headquarters. For unmanned dynamic flight at higher speeds, the vehicle is flown remotely in a specific test area in Bavaria.  VC200  is equipped with 18 battery-driven propellers, which are mounted on a fixed, spider web structure above the cockpit. All two-blade propellers have a fixed pitch, and the flight control system controls the speed of each engine individually to adjust thrust. During the test flight, the forward flight speed of this 450-kilogram aircraft reached 68.9 kilometers per hour, the lateral speed reached 51 kilometers per hour, the climb rate reached 4 meters per second, and the maximum altitude reached 100.6 meters.  E-volo Company  stated that the goal of the flight test was to determine the power requirements of  VC200  at different maneuvers and speeds. To explore the vehicle's performance, the fly-by-wire flight control system's automatic position and altitude maintenance and maneuver limiting functions were disabled during some tests.

383.doctext: South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff stated that  at about 5:30 local time on August 24, 2016,  North Korea approached  the Sinpo coast of South Hamgyong Province  Launched a  submarine-launched ballistic missile in the eastern waters of the peninsula. The missile flew about 500 kilometers and entered Japan's air defense identification zone about 80 kilometers away. It is said that this is also the fourth  submarine-launched ballistic missile  launched by North Korea after Kim Jong-un came to power. The actual flight distance is a major breakthrough compared with the previous ones, and there is substantial progress in technology. Later, Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said in the morning that the  submarine-launched ballistic missile launched by  North Korea fell within Japan's air defense identification circle for the first time, which posed a major threat to Japan's security and seriously damaged it. It is an inexcusable act of violence that affects the peace and stability of the region. However, some analysts believe that  North Korea  tested a   submarine-launched ballistic missile two days after South Korea and the United States launched the Ulchi Freedom Guardian joint military exercise. This move may be mainly to protest against joint military exercises between South Korea and the United States.

Date: at about 5:30 local time on August 24, 2016

384.doctext: National Security Technologies Corporation  announced that the  Anti-Submarine Warfare Continuous Tracking Unmanned Vehicle  developed for DARPA will begin operating  testing  . ACTUV will set off from the coast of San Diego, California in January 2017. It will mainly  test   the sensors, mission control software and hardware and autonomous systems of the unmanned ship  . The unmanned ship was named  Sea Hunter  on April 9, 2016. It is 130 feet long, weighs approximately 325,000 pounds when fully loaded, and has a maximum speed of 31 miles per hour. The ship is almost fully autonomous and can also be remotely controlled or piloted by seafarers when needed. Although designed as an unmanned boat, some hull personnel can enter for maintenance, and there are life-saving devices on the deck. Sea trials will include multi-way point mission execution without human intervention and a remote supervisory control station designed for remote control of the ACTUV from shore or from a control vessel. In addition,  Sea Hunter  will serve as a test bed for air-towed naval systems.  Sea Hunter  ACTUV is jointly funded by DARPA and the Office of Naval Research and is designed to track enemy submarines for long periods of time under unmanned operating conditions. Although the ship is currently equipped with a temporary crew cabin, subsequent tests will still be unmanned on board.

Subject: National Security Technologies Corporation
Equipment: Anti-Submarine Warfare Continuous Tracking Unmanned Vehicle

385.doctext: According to Yonhap News Agency,  North Korea  announced that the nuclear missile test conducted on  February 12, 2017  was successful. The Korean Central News Agency stated that  North Korea  successfully  test-fired  the  Pukguksong-2 strategic missile system  . The Korean Central News Agency stated that the surface-to-surface missile uses solid fuel and a new engine and has the ability to evade maneuvers. Kim Jong-un reportedly attended the launch. On February 13, the U.S. Department of Defense declined to comment on the emerging details of the missile test. Regarding the question of whether to confirm that  North Korea ’s test was successful, Defense Department officials responded by referring to the test description of  North Korea . According to reports, the missile was launched from  an air force base in North Pyongan Province  and flew several hundred miles before falling into the Sea of ​​Japan outside Japan's exclusive economic zone. The missile test was met with protests from Japan and South Korea, both of which said  North Korea 's actions violated United Nations Security Council resolutions.  In the past few months  North Korea   has launched several  missiles, including its largest nuclear test in September last year. triggered condemnation from the international community.

Subject: North Korea
North Korea

386.doctext: After arriving at the  San Diego homeport  in early December 2016, the  USS DDG1000  will begin its first  sea trial  to test its combat system components.  Naval Sea Systems Command Commander Vice Adm. Tom Moore said that  the ship will sail for a few days, engineers will collect some data, and then  the ship will return A six-month  sea trial post-availability maintenance was carried out, and then a comprehensive sea trial was carried out to test the entire combat system.  This week's sea trials were also an opportunity to test solutions to lube oil cooler failures on a  DDG1000  bound for San Diego from  Bath Steel Co.  During the process, two lubricating oil cooler failures occurred. Regarding the lubricating oil cooler solution, Moore said that engineers have already conducted tests at the dock, but only when the ship is operating at full power can the final test of the feasibility of the solution be made.  DDG-1000  Officially entered service on October 15 and joined the U.S. Navy. This class of ship can launch Tomahawk missiles and torpedoes, improved Sea Sparrow missiles and standard series missiles. It is also equipped with an AN/SPY -3X band multifunctional radar with powerful detection capabilities.

387.doctext: According to the U.S. Naval Sea Systems Command, the  U.S. Navy successfully  tested a type of  close-in missile that can be used to protect littoral combat ships from the threat of unmanned craft swarms for the first time. Range missile. Testing was completed on  February 28 when the  Navy launched multiple  Lockheed Martins from the  Freedom-class Littoral Combat Ship USS Detroit The company's AGM-114L Longbow Hellfire missile was tested on the anti-ship missile module of the  Littoral Combat Ship. This test was the first time the Littoral Combat Ship anti-ship missile module fired a missile, and it was also the first time  LCS  launched a  missile  vertically. These missiles will work with the ship's 30mm Viper small-caliber naval gun and 76mm naval gun to fight against unmanned boat swarms. SSMM is a key component of the anti-ship mission package. The success of this test allows the  US Navy  to quickly and safely conduct deployment tests and accelerate the  deployment  of relevant capabilities onto ships.  The Longbow Hellfire  is the third missile being considered by the  US Navy  for the long-lag anti-ship mission package. In 2011, the  Navy said it might use Raytheon's Griffin IIB missile; in 2014, the  Navy said it would consider the  Longbow Hellfire missile . Before the Griffin missile, the  Navy  and the Army were also jointly developing a general-purpose missile to replace the previously discontinued non-direct-aiming vertical launch system.

Subject: U.S. Navy
Navy
US Navy
US Navy
Navy
