388.doctext: According to the British Navy News Network  June 12 report,  The British Royal Navy's new generation fishery protection vessel  HMS Tyne  was launched today at  VT Company 's  Woolstone Shipyard   launched  . After undergoing corresponding  sea trials , this new offshore patrol vessel will officially join the British Fisheries Protection Squadron at the end of this year.  VT Company  will invest 60 million pounds to build 3  River Class Fishery Protection Vessels  ,  Tyne  is the first one.  VT Company  The construction of this batch of fishery protection ships is mainly  leased  to  British Royal Navy . The initial lease period is 5 years. This will also be the first time the  Royal Navy  has leased a fisheries protection vessel from a  private enterprise  . After five years, the British Ministry of Defense will either extend the lease, return the ships to  VT Company , or simply purchase these ships. During the initial 5-year lease term,  VT Company  will be responsible for all maintenance and support services to ensure their operational performance.  HMS Tyne  had better stability and accommodations than her sister ships of the Island class which she was about to replace.  River-class ship  is 80 meters long, has a relatively long working deck, and can accommodate 7 containers. The ship can also carry additional stores, workshops and medical facilities, as well as small equipment. The main tasks of these vessels are fishery protection and ensuring the safety of gas and oil installations. In addition,  VT Company  also designs export-oriented fishery protection vessels that can perform various patrols and domestic humanitarian assistance tasks.

389.doctext: Russia Deputy Minister of Defense Yuri Borisov said at a meeting of the Simonov Experimental Design Bureau that  Russia’s heavy attack drone is the country  The test may be completed in 2018, after which procurement will begin under the framework of the national armament plan until 2025. Borisov also pointed out that the prototype has completed its  first flight  . He said: I think they can finish the relevant work next year and submit it to national trials. The Russian army will receive  heavy-duty drones  for the first time. Borisov added: We will consider the issue of state procurement starting in 2018 and prepare to purchase Tongren UAVs starting in 2018. If the national test of  heavy UAV  can be completed in 2018, the Russian Ministry of Defense will also purchase it. The performance of these UAVs is not inferior to the UAVs currently equipped by the armies of other countries around the world.

390.doctext: The United States  has been conducting  testing  of  hypersonic missiles  , which can fly at speeds of up to 1 mile per second. This project was completed in cooperation with  Australia . The missile can fly at least 5 times the speed of sound and can reach speeds of 3,836mph-7,700mph. Australian Defense Minister Payne said that in the latest phase of the international hypersonic flight research test program, a  hypersonic missile  was successfully carried out at the Woomera test site in  southern Australia  Test flight. This round of testing ended on July 12. BAE Systems Australia announced in a statement that this successful flight test was the most complex of all international hypersonic flight research tests to date. The $54 million project is jointly undertaken by the US Air Force, Boeing, the Australian Department of Defense's Defense Technology Group, BAE Systems and the University of Queensland. The International Hypersonic Flight Research Experiment, which originally included NASA, was launched eight years ago.

391.doctext: American Airlines Jets   July 31 announced that the company successfully  tested a  variable thrust solid rocket motor . During the 50-second test, all test objectives for this flight weight engine were achieved.  Aerojet  is working closely with Raytheon in the United States to develop next-generation propulsion systems for tactical missiles.  Aerojet 's goal is to demonstrate a new technology that allows the thrust of a  rocket engine  to vary in response to commands from a missile's guidance system. A missile equipped with a  variable-thrust rocket engine can either fly quickly toward a target or slow down to greatly increase the missile's range or provide better object perception. The speed can also be changed for optimal performance.  Aerojet will also conduct a series of  tests designed to verify the performance and reliability of this new technology, setting conditions at high and low temperatures and additional thrust Carry out  test below.

392.doctext: On April 18, 2018, the  Sea Venom/ANL missile jointly developed by Britain and France was tested at the  Idu Levant test range in France by the French Armament Administration.  Panther helicopter carried out the second development  test firing. The test highlighted the post-launch locking capability of the  Sea Venom/ANL missile, and also verified the missile's low-altitude sea-skimming flight capability, the effectiveness of the data link between the missile and the helicopter, and the use of an infrared seeker The ability to automatically navigate images.  MBDA Company  Frank Bastart, head of the Sea Venom/ANL missile project, said that the company has  tested  a series of performance limits of the missile.

Location: Idu Levant test range in France
Subject: MBDA Company

393.doctext: The U.S. Department of Energy announced that  France's Framatome's  Accident Tolerant Fuel is currently in progress at the  U.S. Idaho National Laboratory Advanced Test Reactor  test. The fuel is being developed under a U.S. Department of Energy program with the goal of commercializing accident-tolerant fuel by 2025. The company is testing two new concepts at the Idaho National Laboratory: a chromium-plated cladding to prevent damage and oxidation of the fuel cladding at higher temperatures; and a fuel pellet doped with chromium oxide that would These pellets will last longer and perform better under accident conditions. Testing 26 micro-fuel rods in a special test circuit that simulates commercial light water reactor coolant conditions, the fuel performance data will help the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission qualify the fuel. The experiment will continue through January 2021 and is expected to join other accident-tolerant fuel rods developed in the  U.S. Department of Energy's  Accident-Tolerant Fuels Program later in 2018. These  fuels  will then be tested using the  Idaho National Laboratory Transient Reactor   Test  facility to determine their safe operating limits.

394.doctext: A  Russian missile  that the United States cannot currently defend against could be ready for combat as early as 2020, according to people with direct knowledge of U.S. intelligence reports. An anonymous source told CNBC that  Russia  has successfully conducted three  test launches  of this  air-to-ground hypersonic missile  . U.S. intelligence reports indicate that  hypersonic missiles were  tested 12 times on  Russia's  MiG-31 fighter jets , but work is currently underway to install the missile on strategic bombers.

395.doctext: The U.S. "Aerospace Daily" reported on August 15, 2002: According to a  U.S. Navy spokesperson, they recently stated that they plan to launch a launch of  Predator drones  next spring  Conduct a new control  experiment  . The control test involved maneuvering a  Predator drone  in the air from a control station set up on a manned aircraft. A Navy spokesman said that the manned aircraft platform for this test will be a P-3 aircraft. The purpose of the test is to verify a new control mode for the  Predator UAV so that it can be used in emergencies. The use of  Predator Drone can also make the scope of application of  Predator Drone wider. It is reported that this test will comprehensively test the take-off, landing, flight mission control and other contents of the  Predator UAV on the P-3 aircraft. It will also  verify the new U.S. military Developed  tactical control system.

396.doctext: According to a report by the U.S. Department of Defense on August 15, crane technical staff from  U.S. Naval Surface Warfare Center Command recently arrived in Japan to begin  testing   U.S. Navy Seventh Fleet Flagship USSBlueRidge 's  latest troop protection equipment. NSWC crane technical experts demonstrated the various capabilities of the clear warning device. This system is a device located between the 50-caliber naval gun mount and the aircraft flash equipment.  UWD  The main function is to warn small ships entering unwelcome territory and advise them to leave quickly.  UWD  is designed as a more effective way to warn intruder ships. A single ring-shaped horn warning device is often misinterpreted by intruders in many cases, and it is easy to interpret the warning signal as an invitation message. The new system is being tested and will be ready for deployment on   BlueRidge  within 10 days  . Crane technicians will also train seafarers aboard the  BlueRidge  on how to use the system.  UWD  will conduct sea trials on  BlueRidge  for 6 months.

Subject: U.S. Naval Surface Warfare Center Command
Location: U.S. Navy Seventh Fleet Flagship USSBlueRidge

Subject: U.S. Naval Surface Warfare Center Command
Equipment: U.S. Navy Seventh Fleet Flagship USSBlueRidge

397.doctext: According to the Russian Ministry of Defense, the Russian military successfully  tested  and launched   a new anti-missile missile  . According to the news,  The combat service class of the Russian Aerospace Forces Air Defense and Anti-missile Defense Force successfully conducted another  new anti-missile missile at the  Saryshagan training ground /span_5 Test firing. Andrei Prikhodko, deputy commander of the Russian Aerospace Forces' air and anti-missile defense forces, said that after a series of tests, the  new anti-missile missile accurately confirmed its inherent characteristics and successfully completed its mission to designate Hit imaginary targets with precision. The Ministry of National Defense pointed out that the anti-missile system will be installed in the Air and Space Force and will be used to defend against attacks by air and space offensive weapons, as well as complete missile attack early warning systems and outer space surveillance tasks. This is the fifth  test of the  anti-missile missile. The first four were on  November 24th last year and  on February 12th this year. ,  April 2nd,  July 20th.

Equipment: and launched   a new anti-missile missile

398.doctext: Currently, the Bryansk, a D-class IV ballistic missile nuclear submarine of the Russian Northern Fleet, is parked in the dry dock of the Zvezdochka shipyard, which is located in Severodvinsk. The overhaul will take several years and will depend heavily on financial funding. The Bryansk boat entered service with the Northern Fleet in 1990. Previously, Zvezdochka Shipyard also repaired two D-class IV boats - Verkhoturye and  Yekaterinburg .  Yekaterinburg   was  launched again from the overhaul room  this year , and  will soon  conduct  sea trials  .  Russian Navy  There are 7 D-class IV boats in service, and they are currently the core of the Russian Navy’s strategic power.

Human_Trig: launched again from the overhaul room
Subject: Russian Navy

399.doctext: August 25th to September 22nd, under the  support of  MBDA Company,  French Army Technical Service ,  The French General Administration of Arms and Equipment conducted a  evaluation MMP medium-range missile in  Djibouti  . The operational evaluation was designed to test the suitability of the MMP weapon system in semi-desert conditions.  Testers   Test-fired  9  missiles  in total, and all of them successfully hit the target. Two of the  missiles were  launched by naval commandos from the  Armored Multipurpose Assault Boat and hit ground targets and sea targets respectively, verifying  MMP  reliability in hot environments and its operational performance.  MMP  is the first weapon system of its kind to be launched from an armored multipurpose assault craft. Djibouti has climatic conditions similar to those in the Sahel-Saharan region, and the MMP weapon system is expected to be used in Operation Barkhane Dunes in the coming weeks.

Subject: French Army Technical Service
The French General Administration of Arms and Equipment
MBDA Company
Object: The French General Administration of Arms and Equipment

400.doctext: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo  December 1, 2018 said that  the Iranian government just  test-fired one  capable of carrying multiple missiles Warhead medium-range ballistic missile. Pompeo said that the  ballistic missile tested by  Iran can hit parts of Europe and the entire Middle East, which violates the United Nations Security Council's call for  Iran not to Pursue resolutions on any activities related to nuclear-capable ballistic missiles or even related to such ballistic missile launch technology.  Iran A senior official stated on December 2, 2018 that  Iran’s missile program did not violate United Nations resolutions and that its missile program was defensive in nature and denied that Its missiles are capable of carrying nuclear warheads. At the same time,  Iran  did not confirm or deny that it conducted a  new missile   test launch  .

Subject: the Iranian government
Equipment: capable of carrying multiple missiles Warhead medium-range ballistic missile

401.doctext: The U.S. Army tests the  new long-range artillery at  Yuma Proving Ground U.S. Army Secretary Mark Esper said,  U.S. Army A   long-range artillery weapon being tested at  Yuma Proving Ground  , called the  Extended Range Cannon.  The U.S. Army said in a statement posted on Twitter that the  Extended Range Cannon increases soldiers' firepower and reflects the  Army's highest Modernize priority long-range precision strike capabilities. The existing 155-meter artillery shell has a maximum range of about 30;  The new extended-range cannon weapon  has a design range of more than 70 kilometers, and the new ammunition may exceed 100 kilometers.  An upgraded self-propelled howitzer platform  is being  tested  at the  Yuma Proving Ground  as part of the Extended Range Cannon Program. This improvement increased the total weight of the weapon by 454 kilograms and added a 1.8-meter barrel. The extended-range cannon system also features a redesigned cab and a new breech design.  Extended range cannon  Currently fired from the M109A8 58x caliber self-propelled howitzer.

402.doctext: On December 12, 2018,  The Israeli Ministry of Defense announced the successful  test firing of the new generation Namor tracked armored infantry fighting vehicle. Spike anti-tank missile system.  The Spike anti-tank missile system  will be equipped with the turret of the Eitan wheeled armored vehicle and the Namor tracked infantry fighting vehicle. The Namor tracked infantry fighting vehicle is equipped with two spike anti-tank missile launchers at the rear of the turret. The new turret features a new fire control system, with missiles stored within the turret's armor that can be erected in seconds to allow the crew to perform firing operations from inside the vehicle.  The Israeli Defense Ministry  stated that the firing test of the anti-tank missile was only the first phase of the test. The Namor is a tracked armored personnel carrier designed and developed by  Israel Ordnance Company .  The latest Namor is based on the Merkava IV main battle tank  and was revealed in  2008    .  July 2017  ,  The Israeli Ministry of Defense   disclosed  the  Namor infantry fighting vehicle version  .  Namor IFV version  Equipped with an unmanned turret equipped with a 30mm automatic cannon.

403.doctext: Brazil The Combat Aircraft Project Coordination Committee recently revealed that it plans to  later this year implement the  F-39 Gripen fighter equipped with a full set of flight test instruments   First flight.  The successful development of the F-39 Gripen fighter  will enable Brazil to reach the highest level in the world in terms of sensor integration and combat decision support capabilities, further consolidating the strength of the Brazilian Air Force. Currently, the single-seat version of the aircraft is undergoing final assembly at the  Linköping factory in Sweden . In addition, the preliminary design review of the aircraft's two-seat fuselage is ready, and the final design of its front fuselage is also in progress. The entire  F-39 fighter jet  procurement contract project includes a total of 36 new multi-purpose combat aircraft, which will be  delivered  starting from  2021 .

Subject: Brazil
Equipment: The successful development of the F-39 Gripen fighter

404.doctext: U.S. Army  The director of the Long-range Precision Strike Modernization Project revealed that the first flight  test  of the  Precision Strike Missile  that will replace the Army's tactical missile system has been postponed to the end of 2019. Currently, Raytheon and Lockheed Martin are competing for the project, and each company's products were originally expected to conduct first tests at the White Sands Proving Ground in the summer of 2019. Now, due to a  accident occurring in a  supplier's equipment used by both companies, and due to extreme weather that cannot be repaired in the near future, the test has been postponed to  November 2019. December. It is reported that the entire project also faces other challenges, such as the problem of the seeker when used as an anti-ship precision strike missile, and the problem of test site selection if the range exceeds 499 kilometers.

405.doctext: U.S. Air Force Space Command’s Pearl White Demonstration Project is scheduled to launch  after August 16, 2019 aboard Rocket Lab’s  Electron launch vehicle The  launch was conducted from the  Rocket Lab Launch Complex 1 complex near Mahia, New Zealand. The goal of the project is to design, develop,  launch  and operate two  6U CubeSat test satellites  in 2019 as an on-orbit test platform for emerging technologies. The demonstration will test new technologies, including thrust, power, communications and towing capabilities, to test potential applications for future spacecraft. The spacecraft will operate in a low Earth orbit with an altitude of about 540 kilometers and an inclination of about 45 degrees. The two  CubeSats  were built by Virginia-based Tiger Innovations and are designed to last one year. Tiger Innovations will operate the spacecraft throughout the program life under the direction and supervision of  Air Force Space Command  .

Subject: U.S. Air Force Space Command
Air Force Space Command
Location: Rocket Lab Launch Complex 1 complex near Mahia, New Zealand

406.doctext: U.S. Navy The latest first-class aircraft carrier USS Ford   recently  completed a  dock fast cruise   drill  . The fast cruise was conducted after completing 15 months of post-sea trial maintenance at the Newport News Shipyard.  The entire crew  participated in this fast cruise exercise. The training director of the ship said that the fast cruise is an opportunity for the crew to gain practical experience. During the five-day period, the crew can test the knowledge and skills they have learned in a simulated maritime environment and adjust their mentality. After that, the ship Crew members will also regularly conduct damage control, seamanship, navigation and life-saving skills training in similar environments to prepare for service.  The Ford aircraft carrier  is expected to leave Huntington Ingalls Industries' Newport News Shipyard at the end of this month to begin  sea trials  to verify the performance of the aircraft carrier system after PSA. There are reports that  Ford  currently has only three advanced weapons elevators that have passed verification, so they will be postponed to 2024. (Wang Shanshan, China Shipbuilding Industry Comprehensive Technical and Economic Research Institute)

Subject: U.S. Navy
Equipment: U.S. Navy The latest first-class aircraft carrier USS Ford

407.doctext: According to a report on the US C4ISR website on December 3, 2019,  The US Department of Defense  is completing a prototype request for proposals for testing 5G military purposes at two selected military bases. The specific content of the request includes: 5G dynamic spectrum sharing  testing at  Hill Air Force Base, Utah to seek solutions to  airborne radar systems and   5G cellular systems co-existence solutions; testing of  smart warehouses and asset management at Marine Corps Logistics Base Albany, Georgia, to find ways to improve Marine Corps warehouses using 5G technology Solutions for job efficiency, accuracy and safety. The final letter of request will be issued through the National Spectrum Alliance.  The U.S. Department of Defense plans to issue two more prototype requests for proposals for 5G testing. It plans to conduct augmented reality/virtual reality testing at Joint Base Lewis McHhord in Washington and the Navy in San Diego, California  Base conducts  smart warehouse   testing.

408.doctext: The Press Office of the Russian Ministry of Defense stated on December 25, 2019 that  Russian Navy   Type 21631 Thug-M-class corvette Ingushetia has arrived in the  Black Sea Successful completion of national  trial. During the test, the ship-based artillery system was successfully used to conduct fire strikes on sea and air targets, and a  Club missile  was  test-fired  . During the test, the  power plant, steering gear, auxiliary machinery, communication and navigation device, and other shipborne weapon systems were also operated  tested and inspected in various modes. The ship's seaworthiness, controllability, stability, etc. have verified the inherent capabilities of all systems, machinery, and weapons and equipment. The ship will hold a flag-raising ceremony later this month and then join the Black Sea Fleet. The Thug class is a series of light frigates developed by the Zelenodolsk Design Bureau for the Russian Navy. The Thug-M class with a displacement of 900 tons has a larger and more complex weapon load and is equipped with the most advanced missile system. The 74-meter-long ship is equipped with one A-190 100 mm naval gun, two AK-630M anti-aircraft guns, eight Club anti-ship missiles, four Igla-1M anti-aircraft missiles mounted on 3M47Gibka launchers, and 14.5 mm and 7.62 mm machine gun.

409.doctext: According to a report on the official website of Raytheon Company on March 17, 2020,  Raytheon Company has completed the  U.S. Army  low-layer air defense and anti-missile sensor radar antenna array  The first round of  testing. The test was conducted in a  climate-controlled indoor test site  and completed the calibration of the  LTAMDS main antenna array  and the performance evaluation against the simulation target. Thereafter, the antenna array will be mounted on a precision-machined chassis for further integration and  evaluation, and  tested against real targets at the  outdoor test site  . This test is less than five months after  Raytheon Company  won the U.S. Army's low-level air defense and anti-missile sensor project, and it is a milestone event in the project. The low-level air and missile defense sensor system is a next-generation radar system capable of dealing with advanced threats such as hypersonic weapons. It has a main antenna array and two secondary antenna arrays. These radar antennas work together to enable operators to detect and respond simultaneously. Multiple threats from all directions, ensuring there are no blind spots on the battlefield.

Subject: Raytheon Company
Raytheon Company
Equipment: low-layer air defense and anti-missile sensor radar antenna array

410.doctext: Russia plans to conduct about 10 test launches of  Zircon hypersonic missiles  Russia Military industry sources disclosed to TASS that during the national test,  Russia span_2 There will also be about 10  test launches of the  Zircon hypersonic missile, which will be completed in  2020-2021. About seven or eight test firings are planned from the frigate Admiral Gorshkov against ground and sea targets. Two to three additional  test launches  will be completed aboard the  Severodvinsk nuclear submarine  , including at least one underwater test launch.

411.doctext: The head of U.S. Northern Command said on Monday that a series of next-generation command and control system  tests hoped to be conducted in June will be postponed due to the impact of the new coronavirus,  The U.S. Air Force will not hold the second  Advanced Combat Management System test until at least  August or September.  The U.S. Air Force conducted the first  demonstration of the  Advanced Combat Management System in  December 2019, using multiple operating platforms. Including the F-35 Joint Strike Fighter, F-22 fighter jets and the Navy destroyer USS Thomas Hutner - testing a variety of experimental technologies designed to allow the services to connect and share data more seamlessly. The U.S. Northern Command level participated in the first test and played an important role in the second test. U.S. Strategic Command and U.S. Space Command will also join it. The U.S. military hopes to connect all platforms into a network so that data can be transmitted immediately between platforms and automatically guide weapons to target the enemy. This concept is called joint all-domain command and control, and the U.S. Air Force believes that  Advanced Combat Management The system is the key technology to realize joint global command and control.

Subject: The head of U.S. Northern Command

412.doctext: United States  Lockheed Martin   is working hard to develop high-performance beam directors to equip tactical fighter jets with laser weapons within the next five years. The company's  new beam director  design underwent its first  test firing  on an Army system. Offensive laser weapons used to shoot down enemy aircraft must have a longer range strike capability. In addition to output power, they also place higher requirements on the precise direction of the laser beam. The laser beam needs to be accurately maintained at the exact same position. This causes the laser beam to heat the target and destroy it quickly. This work relies on the  beam guide. It first extracts sensor data on the current position of the target and shooting platform, uses advanced software to accurately predict where the beam needs to reach, and adjusts the specially designed reflector to make the laser To reflect in the right direction, the  beam director must be calculated and adjusted many times per second.  Lockheed Martin   completed 62 flights over the  past eight years   testing to optimize laser focus and stability while establishing A new Directed Energy Systems Integration Laboratory. The lab will test a 50kW laser next year and a 150kW laser by 2024. By then, beam control technology can achieve considerable accuracy to achieve the goal of using laser weapons on fighter jets by 2025.

Subject: Lockheed Martin
Date: completed 62 flights over the  past eight years

413.doctext: On October 7, the U.S. Navy Aegis combat system ground test station received a new air defense and anti-missile radar array.  AN/SPY-61 radar arrived at the  Naval Combat Systems Engineering Development Station in  Morristown, New Jersey for  testing . The Combat Systems Engineering Development Station, also known as the cruiser in the wheat field, has served as a ground test station for the Aegis combat system since 1977. Radar array testing will ensure that the software and hardware achieve the expected results according to the specifications. Testing the  SPY-6 radar  in a controlled environment on the ground will allow Aegis to troubleshoot and correct problems in a timely manner before the radar is deployed on ships. The new radar will replace the Lockheed Martin AN/SPY-1D radar.  The U.S. Navy will equip the  Arleigh Burke-class III destroyer   with   SPY-6 radar developed by Raytheon Company , and is planned to  2024   equip the first ship  Lucas being built at Ingalls Shipyard.

Equipment: SPY-6 radar developed by Raytheon Company

414.doctext: The Russian Ministry of Defense said in a statement released on November 26 that  Russia in the  White Sea removed the  Admiral Gorshkov frigate successfully  test-fired a  Zircon hypersonic missile. The missile flew at a speed of more than Mach 8 and hit a target in the Barents Sea after flying 450 kilometers. The Northern Fleet troops operating in the Barents Sea are responsible for the security sealing of the test firing area.  Russia  last  test-fired the   Zircon missile  in  October 2020  . After completing various  tests  the  Zircon hypersonic missile  will enter service on Russian Navy submarines and surface ships. In addition to the sea-based version, President Putin has previously mentioned the development of land-based Zircon hypersonic missiles. It is estimated that the  Zircon hypersonic missile  has a maximum speed of 10,700 kilometers per hour and a flight distance of more than 1,000 kilometers.

415.doctext: On November 17, 2020,  The French Armament Directorate successfully conducted a  sea venom counterattack at the  Levant Island test site The last  test launch of a ship-to-ship missile.  Sea Venom is a  anti-ship missile jointly developed by Britain and France in accordance with the "Lancaster House Agreement". It was developed by  MBDA Company. It will soon be equipped with British AW159 Lynx helicopters and French H160M helicopters, and is expected to initially form combat effectiveness in the British Navy in 2022. The  missile  has previously been  tested  on its low-altitude sea-skimming flight, post-launch lock-on and pre-launch lock-on capabilities.  Sea Venom  The main target is offshore fast attack boats with a displacement of 50-500 tons.  Missile  The warhead weighs 30 kilograms and has a range of 20 kilometers. After determining the precise aiming point, it can also damage larger ships. In addition, it can also hit static land-based targets.

416.doctext: Euromissile Corporation has completed the qualification launch test of the Sea Venom missile  The  Sea Venom/ANL anti-ship missile developed by Euromissile Corporation has completed the qualification launch  test, and The final  launch was successfully conducted on  November 17 at the French Armament General Administration test base located in  Iledu Levant.  Sea Venom anti-ship missile  is a cooperation project carried out by Britain and France under the defense cooperation agreement. It plans to start equipping the AW159 Wildcat helicopters of the British Royal Navy and the H160 M Guépard ship-based helicopters of the French Marine Corps. The final qualification test is to test the missile's target identification capabilities in a harsh maritime environment. Previous tests have tested the launch envelope, delivery envelope and engagement mode of  missile , including low-altitude sea-skimming flight, post-launch locking, pre-launch locking, closed-loop operation and fine-sighting mode.

Subject: The  Sea Venom/ANL anti-ship missile developed by Euromissile Corporation
The  Sea Venom/ANL anti-ship missile developed by Euromissile Corporation

417.doctext: India tested its indigenously developed  Dru Astra at the Integrated Testing Range   in Chandipur,  Odisha Anti-tank missile. The missile was launched from a ground launcher and underwent three flight  tests  in direct-aiming and top-attack modes, achieving the required indicators.  Dru Astra is a customized upgraded version of the Nag-Helina helicopter-borne anti-tank missile. It was developed by the National Defense Research and Development Organization. It uses laser and TV image guidance and is used to destroy the enemy's medium and long range. Targets include main battle tanks, armored vehicles, and fortifications. The missile first detonates the explosive reactive armor on the outside of the tank, and then its main charge penetrates and destroys the tank's inner armor.  Drew Astra anti-tank missile  will greatly enhance the combat capabilities of the Indian army.

418.doctext: The U.S. Army  tested its  Extended Range Cannon Prototype  by  firing   M982A1 Excalibur guided artillery shells  . During the test, 3  artillery shells  were fired, and only the third one directly hit the target 70 kilometers away. In this round of testing, the Army used the XM1299 prototype gun, which was upgraded and improved on the BAE Systems M109A7 Paladin self-propelled howitzer. The gun has a caliber of 155 mm and a barrel length of 9.1 meters. During the test firing of the Excalibur shells, correction software was used. During testing  Army  also evaluated different propellant configurations. Over the past few years, the  U.S. Army has been looking for ways to close the gap between its field artillery and competitors like Russia, and its  2020 finalized  Extended Range Howitzer The results of 's  tests show that we are one step closer to achieving this goal.

Subject: The U.S. Army
Army
U.S. Army
Equipment: Extended Range Howitzer The results of

419.doctext: On June 2,  Israel Aerospace Industries announced the completion of two  test launches of the  Rolla surface-to-surface tactical missile , successfully hit sea targets at 90 kilometers and 400 kilometers respectively.  Rolla is a sea-to-surface and surface-to-surface long-range ballistic missile system that can be launched from the sea or land; it uses anti-jamming GPS/INS guidance with a circular probability error of 10 meters; it carries a weight of over 200 kilograms fragmentation warhead. The test was conducted with the support of the Israeli military. In addition to verifying the minimum and maximum range of the missile, it also  tested  some of the system's electronic components and parts that help improve the system's firing accuracy and algorithms; the missile tested came from the combat missile production line and was part of the company's system demonstration for new customers, equipped with a land-based quadruple launcher and command trailer; it was launched at a location on the high seas to comply with the requirements for such tests Security requirements.

420.doctext: Russia The Ministry of Defense issued a statement saying that  Russia   last week successfully  tested the  Crossbow-DM remote-controlled weapon for the first time. Station The ability to engage moving targets at night.  Crossbow-DM remote control weapon station The total weight is about 250 kilograms. The main weapon is the 6P49 Cord 12.7 mm machine gun with a rate of fire of 600 rounds/min. The aiming distance for ground targets and flying targets is 2000 meters and 1500 meters, carrying 450 rounds of ammunition. In order to improve the safety of the vehicle, 4 smoke grenade launchers can be installed on the  weapon station . The fire control system includes the PC-SUIPTSYU.201219.026 shooter sighting system and a TV camera. The detection and identification distance of the target drone in a narrow field of view is not less than 2,500 meters. The working distance of the laser rangefinder is 100 to 3000 meters.  Nu-DM remote control weapon station has been installed on the following armored vehicles for  testing: Typhoon armored personnel carrier, Tiger-M light armored vehicle, MT-LB multi-purpose tractor and ANT-1000R robot system, etc., and was equipped with the Russian Army in 2016.

Subject: Russia
Equipment: Crossbow-DM remote-controlled weapon for the first time. Station

Subject: Russia
Equipment: Crossbow-DM remote-controlled weapon for the first time. Station

421.doctext: Boeing Company and  U.S. Air Force have completed the development stage of  JDAM guided bombs on  F-16 fighter jets span_4 Test flight. In September 2002,  The Boeing Company signed an engineering and manufacturing development contract worth US$45 million with the  U.S. Air Force to transform the 500-pound MK82 and BLU-111 conventional bombs into For  JDAM guided bombs. The EMD test flight plan has been implemented since  last December. First, it used a variety of different carrier aircraft to conduct flight tests. It is currently continuing to be integrated on the  F/A-18 fighter jet  Test A comprehensive test will also be conducted on the B-2 bomber, the main carrier aircraft of the bomb. According to the plan, the  MK82JDAM guided bomb  and its internal bomb rack will be installed on the B-2 bomber in 2004.

422.doctext: The U.S. Army believes that it is feasible to replace  CH-47 helicopters with  T408 turboshaft engines  The U.S. Army thinks that it can be used by general aviation The T408 turboshaft engine upgrades the Boeing CH-47 Chinook helicopter fleet. This is the  U.S. Army after 7 months of flight  testing on the  CH-47 helicopter with a  new engine conclusion drawn. Currently, the  U.S. Army is scheduled to conduct its final  test flight on  May 26 at  Fort Eustis, Virginia  .  The U.S. Army  stated that integrating the  T408 turboshaft engine  into the  CH-47  presents some difficulties and requires some modifications to the helicopter airframe. Honeywell also developed and demonstrated the T55-714C engine to the  U.S. Army and believed that this type of engine did not require modifications to the fuselage, but  the U.S. Army did not mention Honeywell. Nivel's demonstration work.

423.doctext: On July 7, 2021,  The French General Directorate of Arms and Equipment conducted a test named  HELMA-P at the  Biscaos Shooting Range The anti-small drone laser weapon prototype   was tested with a view to putting it into use during the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris. The French Armed Forces Minister's Office said the demonstration was the first of its kind in Europe.  Siles Company in Orleans, France designed the  HELMA-P prototype with  French government's  funding. This laser weapon can protect sensitive areas such as French military bases, nuclear power plants, and large gatherings from interference and destruction by small drones. During the test firing, a box-type laser weapon placed on a tripod was able to detect a small drone 3 kilometers away. The laser beam emitted by this weapon could damage or blind the drone's camera system within a range of 1 kilometer. .

Subject: The French General Directorate of Arms and Equipment

424.doctext: RANKIN submarine, the sixth and final Collins-class submarine will join the  Australian Navy Fleet, serving at the Royal Australian Navy's Stirling Fleet Base, and will be launched on March 29 A celebration ceremony was held on the day. This class of ship was built by  Australian Adelaide Submarine Company, with a length of 77.8 meters.  Rankin was keel-laying on May 12, 1995.   November 7, 2001   Launched,  March 26, 2003   Delivered to   Australian Navy  . Its displacement is 3050 tons, 3350 tons.  Collins-class submarines  have performed well in Alaska, Japan, Hawaii and other waters, leaving a good impression on the US Navy.

425.doctext: The U.S. Navy completed a series of  tests to verify the latest improvements to the  Zeus equipped on the latest  Arleigh Burke-class guided missile destroyer Shield Weapon System performance. In particular, the performance of the  Aegis Weapon System 6 Basic Phase 1  produced by Lockheed Martin Naval Electronics and Surveillance Systems-Moorestown Company was examined.  Aegis Weapon System 6 Basic Phase 1  adopts commercial off-the-shelf technology and equipment and combines it with traditional equipment manufactured to military standards. These commercial off-the-shelf devices include computers, servers, routers, display systems and peripherals. This test is an important stage in testing the development of  Aegis Weapon System 6th Basic Phase 1 , mainly testing the compatibility and performance of the commercially available equipment used. The success of this test laid the foundation for the development of the next-generation system-the Aegis Weapon System Basic Type 6 and Phase 3. This system can enable the newly built destroyer to have joint coordinated operations and regional tactical missile defense capabilities. Joint coordinated operations capabilities allow ships and aircraft to share sensor and target information, allowing missiles launched from one ship to be tracked and controlled by other ships. This sensor network has improved tracking capabilities for all aircraft and missiles.  The joint cooperative combat performance of the Aegis Weapon System Basic Type 6 Phase 1  is planned to be  verified  in mid-May 2000  . (with pictures)

426.doctext: The Greek Navy took delivery of a  small supply tanker Prome on  July 8 at the  Eleusis Shipyard near Athens Hughes. This small supply tanker is almost a replica of the Italian Navy's Etna-class supply ship. It will soon begin  sea trials  and is expected to enter service before October. The small supply tanker is capable of carrying 6,350 tons of natural gas and 2,100 cubic meters of ammunition or supplies, and can accommodate medium-sized helicopters. On the same day, the second  SuperVita-class fast attack missile boat Daniolos of the  Hellenic Navy was also  launched at the shipyard and will Entered service in May 2004. The first ship of the class, the Rosen, will enter service at the end of this year, while the third ship, the Christalidi, is under construction in the shipyard. The Greek Ministry of Defense awarded a $226 million contract in early July this year to build two more fast attack missile boats of this class.

Subject: The Greek Navy
Hellenic Navy
Equipment: SuperVita-class fast attack missile boat Daniolos

427.doctext: The  Joint Helmet Cueing System developed by Vision Systems International as part of the MLUM3 guidance fleet program has been  tested on Denmark's  F-16 fighter jets . The first international flight of the advanced helmet-mounted display technology was carried out by four  Royal Danish Air Force test pilots and Operational Test and Evaluation Group pilots  .  The performance and accuracy of the Joint Helmet Cueing System  and its integration into the F-16 were completed by Lockheed Martin and were praised by the Royal Danish Air Force test team.  June 2003 Conducted MLUM3 early use  evaluation at  Leeuwarden Air Force Base in the Netherlands and also flew the  Joint Helmet Cueing System /span_8 . The Netherlands, Belgium, Denmark and Norway participated in this joint exercise and identified the F-16 improvements and upgrades. Added advanced technology weapons systems. Air Force pilots from participating nations donned  Joint Helmet Cue System  helmets and flight-tested the system throughout the qualification process. All pilots who flew the  Joint Helmet Cue System  during a 3-week early use evaluation process overwhelmingly liked its performance, accuracy and durability. Ken Stansell, president of Vision Systems International, said: “This latest experience further demonstrates Vision Systems International’s capabilities in advanced helmet cueing systems. The company is a joint venture between EFW Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Israel's Elbit Systems, and Rockwell Collins.

428.doctext: The Australian Department of Defense has announced that the Australian Navy's six Collins-class submarines are officially operational. This important milestone recognizes the submarine's performance. Some aspects of this class of submarines will still need to be adjusted in the future, but the fact that the submarine can be put into operation means that the submarine has currently met the requirements for combat capability. The Ministry of National Defense stated that  the Navy is very confident that the submarine will withstand future combat missions and upgrades and modifications, and claimed that the Collins-class submarine is currently the world's best conventional submarine with excellent performance in terms of endurance, shock resistance, stealth and It has good performance indicators in terms of noise and other aspects. Part of the Australian government's modification work has been completed, including upgrading and modifying the current submarine's combat system, and improving the ship's sonar performance and reliability, while also being able to utilize the technology and experts of the  U.S. Navy , to replace and upgrade combat systems, anti-surface warfare and anti-submarine warfare heavy torpedoes. This is a milestone for the program and for the  Navy  to have world-class naval combat capabilities. This class of ships was built by  Australia's Adelaide Submarine Company, with a length of 77.8 meters. The last ship,  Rankin, was keel-laying on May 12, 1995. ,  November 7, 2001   Launched  ,  March 26, 2003   Delivered to   Australian Navy  . Its displacement is 3050 tons, 3350 tons.

429.doctext: According to defense officials,  India  on June 12  test-fired the  BrahMos cruise missile which was jointly developed with Russia. /span_3, missiles carrying conventional warheads can hit ships at sea. The  missile  test was conducted at the  Chandipur Test Range in the Bay of Bengal  in eastern Odisha, India.  BrahMos missile  has a range of 280 kilometers. Since the first  test  of  June 2001 , it has been conducted many times so far.  India  said some countries are interested in purchasing the 8-meter-long  BrahMos missile  which can be air-launched or ground-launched. Since India's new government came to power on May 22, its rival  Pakistan  has conducted two  test launches of nuclear warhead-capable missiles    .

430.doctext: U.S. officials said on July 20 that  Pakistan  and U.S. officials met for the first time to discuss safety issues regarding Pakistan's civilian nuclear reactor program. Senior officials from Pakistan's nuclear agency held three days of talks with the chairman of the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission and other officials in Washington. The talks reflect the close cooperation between the United States and  Pakistan  and  India , including on civilian nuclear programs.  In 1988,   India   Pakistan  After the two countries  tested   nuclear weapons , the United States cooperated with them It just stopped.

431.doctext: Taiwan's Ministry of National Defense officials stated that  the United States  has approved  Taiwan 's test launch of the  Patriot PAC-2 missile .  Taiwan  was the first region outside the  United States  to  test-fire the   Patriot missile  .  Taiwan  is preparing to test launch such missiles  next year  . However, the details of the test launch are still being discussed.  Taiwan  purchased 200  Patriot PAC-2 missiles  from  the United States . This is an improved version of the Patriot missile used by the US military during the 1991 Persian Gulf War. Taiwan's Ministry of National Defense requested that the test launch in  Taiwan  be mainly to test the accuracy of this type of missile in subtropical areas. Prior to this,  Taiwan  had already conducted  test launches  in  United States . Taiwanese officials said last week they would test-fire Patriot missiles. He said that the purchase of  Patriot missiles  is mainly to strengthen  Taiwan ’s defense capabilities to counter mainland China’s Dongfeng missiles.

432.doctext: The U.S. Navy awarded the contract on Monday to  Bath Iron Company, a subsidiary of General Dynamics. The contract is worth US$26.6 million and will be mainly used for the  U.S. West Coast. span_2 The Arleigh Burke-class destroyer is undergoing maintenance and upgrade work during the post-sail repair period of  sea trials. The final repair work after the sea trial will be carried out by Bath Steel Company's Southwest Sea Trial Maintenance Team. It will mainly carry out final repair and upgrade of DDG93 and is expected to be completed in April 2005. The  sea trials  of  DDG92  will be carried out by another team at  Bath Steel  and is expected to be completed by July 2005. Post-trial post-trial repair work includes engineering and management services; material procurement and personnel recruitment for system upgrades and corrections to government-responsible parts; performance of special trial post-trial work items, including testing and maintenance Sea trial; Additional tasks after completing emergency maintenance. According to relevant personnel of Bath Steel Company, being able to obtain this contract reflects the Navy's full trust in the company's ability to work during the final repair period after sea trials. Two other missions are scheduled for  DDG87  and  DDG90 . The  sea trial and the tail repair work have been completed is another  Bath Steel Company /span_11 and examples of their team’s ability to work.

433.doctext: Boeing  plans to start production of the forward fuselage of the U.S. Navy's new EA-18G aircraft on October 22. Production of the forward fuselage will take place at the St. Louis plant, beginning just in time for the scheduled completion of the initial design review. The initial design review was followed by a critical design review in April 2005. Northrop Grumman began production of the center/rear fuselage at its El Segundo plant in July. A test aircraft of the EA-18G is named  EA-1  and is planned to be assembled at the St. Louis factory of  Boeing Company  and will be launched in  September 2006  First flight. The EA-18G is derived from the F/A-18F Super Hornet strike fighter and will be used to replace the aging EA-6B aircraft.  The U.S. Air Force  has begun flight testing of an improved  Theater Airborne Reconnaissance System  that includes Lockheed Martin's synthetic aperture radar. The first  test  of the system was conducted at  Edwards Air Force Base  using a  F-16 aircraft  and was successful. The government-funded trial will continue until next spring. The addition of synthetic aperture radar to BAE Systems' theater airborne reconnaissance system is expected to enable the pod to operate in severe weather.

434.doctext: Lockheed Martin  begins wind tunnel  testing  of the  Micro Surveillance Attack Cruise Missile  . The missile is a small air-launched cruise missile that can be launched outside enemy air defense areas and patrol over the battlefield. It is planned to complete a series of 66-hour wind tunnel  tests   this weekend  to test the aerodynamic design performance of the missile. Flight testing then took place in  2005 .  SMACM missile was developed with the company's own funds as a scaled-down version of the JASSM missile because the JASSM missile cannot fit into the weapon bays of two new US stealth fighter jets - the F/A-22 and F-35. Inside.  SMACM missile weighs 63.5 kilograms and is 1702 millimeters long; JASSM missile weighs 1021 kilograms and is 4267 millimeters long. Both have the same range, more than 371 kilometers, but the combat of  SMACM missile Ministry is small.

435.doctext: The U.S. Air Force  has begun  tests  of its primary cluster bomb against maritime targets, claiming successful hits against small ships in initial tests.  CBU-105 sensor-detonated munition  Developed by Textron Systems, it is mainly used to deal with ground cluster armored targets. The  modified CBU-105  developed by the company itself can also deal with ship targets while retaining its lethality against ground targets. The modification work added new software algorithms so that a single Skeeter warhead can identify enemy targets in the sea background, even in high sea state levels. The above changes are extremely simple and, if funded, could easily be integrated into the production line of sensor-detonated weapons. thrown from a  modified  sensor-detonated weapon  during a  test in  February 2005 The submunitions successfully penetrated the hulls of two small armored transport ships, proving the basic concept. More demanding tests will be conducted in the second half of 2005 to deal with mobile ships. The U.S. Navy has expressed interest in  modified sensor-detonated weapons . The sensor-detonated weapon sea trials are one of the initiatives demonstrating the  Air Force's growing interest in the ability to engage moving targets,  November 2004,  U.S. Air Force Using modified JDAM bombs, they successfully  attacked multiple  small ships and a  large ship. The U.S. Air Force is considering a maritime strike capability as a second phase requirement for its small bomb program.

436.doctext: Earlier this year  the Ballistic Missile Defense Organization signed a $127 million contract with the  Lockheed Martin-Boeing-TRW consortium for  space-based lasers 's integrated flight  test, a test site for the  space-based laser will be selected this summer. In the next few years, it is planned to  test TRW's  hydrogen fluoride laser, design, manufacture and test experimental beam controllers and beam directional reflectors, and develop supersonic low-temperature generators . Beam steering technology will largely borrow from the Airborne Laser program. A series of architectural studies will also be conducted to explore how to maintain space-based laser systems.

437.doctext: The  RQ-8 fire reconnaissance drone of the American Northrop Grumman Corporation successfully  Test firing The  Mark66 90mm unguided rocket was launched. This was the first live-fire test of an unmanned helicopter airborne weapon. This shows that in addition to intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance missions, UAVs can also perform attack missions. The test supports the U.S. Navy and Army's interest in mounting weapons on fire reconnaissance drones. After the drone took off, it sailed 16 kilometers and fired its first rocket. During the launch of the first rocket, the drone flew at a speed of 64 kilometers per hour. When  launched  the second  rocket , the drone was flying at a speed of 83 kilometers/hour. Weapons installation, mission planning and execution all went according to plan. Successful testing and information acquisition are key to the development of Navy and Army fire reconnaissance drone-borne weapons capabilities.

Subject: The  RQ-8 fire reconnaissance drone of the American Northrop Grumman Corporation
The  RQ-8 fire reconnaissance drone of the American Northrop Grumman Corporation

438.doctext: Pakistan's missile development has achieved another major breakthrough.  On August 11th  ,  Pakistan's military  announced that Pakistan successfully  test-fired  its first self-developed cruise missile that day. Major General Sultan, spokesman of the Pakistani military, said that the land-based cruise missile named  Babur has a range of 500 kilometers, can carry nuclear warheads, and can fly close to the ground, so it has a strong Guard against radar surveillance capabilities. Regarding the agreement between  India and Pakistan  last week to provide advance notice to each other of  missile   tests, Major General Sultan pointed out , since the agreement limits ballistic missiles, the cruise missiles tested this time are not restricted by the agreement, so there is no need to notify India in advance. Pakistani officials spoke highly of this test launch, believing that it showed that Pakistan has joined the ranks of the few countries that have the ability to develop cruise missiles. Pakistani President Musharraf was even more pleased to say that this move was a milestone in the improvement of Pakistan's nuclear capabilities. Pakistani public opinion believes that although the specific performance parameters of the  Babur missile have not been announced, it will definitely become an important weapon against India in the future, and the nuclear attack capability of the cruise missile will also enhance Pakistan’s Nuclear deterrence.

439.doctext: The latest test ship of the U.S. Navy has reached   San Diego  on  August 1 , marking the end of the Navy's A critical step in the development process of naval combat ships.  Sea Warrior is a 262-meter-long aluminum catamaran ship that will be used as a maritime demonstration and platform for various technologies that the  Navy hopes to apply in the Littoral Combat Ship. test.  Sea Warrior  plays a very important role in the development of the Littoral Combat Ship. The Marine Corps is also very interested in the ship, and 10 of the Sea Warrior's 26 crew members are Marines. The Office of Naval Research is primarily responsible for experimental ship concept development.  Sea Warrior  adopts a catamaran design and can pass through four-meter-high waves at a cruising speed of 50 knots. The ship has a tail springboard and a crane, which can be used for launching and salvaging SEAL or Marine Corps ships. The flight deck can carry two H-60 ​​bombers and unmanned aerial vehicles. The ship will be equipped with cruise missiles with 100 times the firepower of ordinary combat ships.  Sea Warrior  is testing manning, automation systems and autonomous navigation systems. Starting from August 2,  Maritime Warrior  will begin to receive c4i equipment and masts one after another. After a month of  trials and  sea trials, the ship and crew will be  deployed at the  Port of San Diego The  Third Fleet conducts joint training, and the ship will use the 32nd Street Naval Base as its home port.

Subject: The latest test ship of the U.S. Navy

440.doctext: The U.S. Navy  will hold a three-day technical conference on unmanned boat development and anti-submarine warfare in Washington from October 18th to 20th. The meeting will be a U.S. government-industry discussion covering control systems, sensors, unmanned operations and modifications to small boat designs to support the Littoral Combat Ship mission requirements. Unmanned boats can perform anti-submarine warfare and other combat missions. Recent unmanned vehicle development work includes Spartan advanced concept technology demonstration and anti-submarine mission module unmanned vehicle advanced development model. The  U.S. Navy  conducted  trials  of the  Unmanned Boat Platform  and will discuss the results in this forum.  The United States also plans to award a new 24-month contract to develop, manufacture and  test 2  unmanned boat platform prototypes and related Supported devices. Key government agencies participating in the unmanned craft meeting include: Littoral and Mine Warfare Mission Module Program Office's Program Executive Office, Space and Maritime Warfare Systems Center, Naval Undersea Warfare Center and Naval Surface Warfare Center.

441.doctext: Aurora Flight Sciences USA's  GoldenEye-50 unmanned aerial vehicle system completed its first high-speed coordination during its recent envelope expansion  test flight Bank and turn flight.  The Golden Eye-50 UAV made its first flight in  July 2004   and was completed in April this year after extensive hovering test flights. The first automatic conversion flight from hovering to level flight. Since then, the aircraft has completed more than 36 such conversion flights and demonstrated its combat capabilities to the US Army and the armed forces of NATO countries. John Lanver, president of Aurora, said that in the near future, small groups of the U.S. Army, Navy and Marine Corps will be able to use the aircraft's unique capabilities to penetrate enemy isolated areas and conduct intelligence collection activities.  The GoldenEye-50  is small enough to fit into the back of a Hummer High Mobility Multipurpose Wheeled Vehicle. Because it can cover a larger area using high-speed wing-level flight, its range is longer than that of vertical take-off and landing UAS of similar size.

442.doctext: After Katrina  Hurricane,  October 25  NASA Stennis Space Center resumed its main work for the first time—— Test  Space Shuttle Main Engine. Engineers successfully ignited a  test  of a  engine . The ignition test took 520 seconds, which is the time it takes for the space shuttle to enter orbit. The  engine  test on the 25th showed that  Stennis Space Center  and the region are recovering from storm damage. The test on the 25th was the continuation of a series of verifications of the advanced health management system, which monitors engine performance. If abnormal vibrations are detected in the turbopump, the system will shut down the  engine  . This is a major improvement to reduce the risk of the space shuttle's main engine. Other engine components were also tested and validated, such as fast-response temperature sensors.

443.doctext: Rosbalt news agency reported that  Russia  has started  tests  of the world's largest  nuclear-powered icebreaker  --  50 Years of Victory  . Testing was conducted in  ports  rather than on the open sea. Major work on the  icebreaker  has been completed, including the installation of the nuclear reactor and steam generator.  Experts  prepare to load nuclear fuel in January 2006. Then perform  open sea   testing  and transfer the ship to the user. This icebreaker was originally named  Ural  and is a modern second-generation  Arktika-class icebreaker  . The ship is 159 meters long, 30 meters wide and has a tonnage of 25,000 tons. Construction work was halted in 1993 due to lack of funds, but was restarted and completed a few years later.

444.doctext: Lockheed Martin and  Netfire LLC joint venture   recently at the  U.S. Air Force Eglin Air Force Base Proving Ground , successfully conducted the first  standby attack missile booster test projectile flight  test. The missile is an integral part of the non-line-of-sight launch system, developed by  Lockheed Martin. The NLOS-LS system includes  standby attack missiles, precision attack missiles and command launchers, developed by  Lockheed Martin span_8 The Netfire LLC joint venture formed by Lockheed Martin and Raytheon is responsible for development and management. The LAM missile was developed by Raytheon and has passed the preliminary design review this fall. It is planned to be launched in A critical design review will take place next year. The NLOS-LS system is part of the U.S. Army's Future Combat System. This is the first flight test of the LAM missile using the new square body. The preliminary test data obtained verified the adaptability of adding a booster to the new square body, which is necessary for the LAM missile to be able to load the required fuel. It is critical to ensure that the standby flight time reaches 30 minutes. This  booster bomb   test flight was successful. It complemented the recently completed tests of the LAM missile's warhead, turbojet engine and lidar seeker, further demonstrating that LAM The missile is ready to move into the development stage.

Subject: Lockheed Martin
Lockheed Martin
Netfire LLC joint venture
Location: U.S. Air Force Eglin Air Force Base Proving Ground

445.doctext: Swedish company Saab has received a contract worth SEK 150 million from the Swedish Defense Equipment Board to install  IRIS-T air-to-air missiles into  Gripens equipped by the Swedish Air Force. fighter aircraft to enhance the close air combat capabilities of the  Gripen fighter aircraft in future multinational combat operations. The contract work includes the integration of the  IRIS-T air-to-air missile on the  Gripen fighter aircraft, which will then be flown by  Saab  Test to test the adaptability between the missile and the carrier aircraft. According to the plan,  Saab Company will conduct the first launch test of the aircraft  IRIS-T air-to-air missile in  2007 and complete the required missile launch by the end of the same year  Test, the installation synthesis was officially started until the installation synthesis task was completed in 2009. The  IRIS-T air-to-air missile  was jointly developed by six European countries: Germany, Greece, Italy, Sweden, Norway and Spain. It is designed to replace the US-made Sidewinder air-to-air missiles equipped on fighter jets in European countries. In addition to Sweden's  Gripen fighter aircraft , fighter jets from Germany, Greece, Italy, Norway and Spain will also be modified with the air-to-air missile, and helmet sights will also be modified to further enhance close air combat capabilities. .

Equipment: Gripens equipped by the Swedish Air Force. fighter aircraft

446.doctext: According to Brazilian media reports, the  Brazilian Navy  has begun  testing  the main equipment of the  low-power pressurized water reactor  to be used on future nuclear submarines. According to Brazilian newspapers, the tests were conducted at the  ARAMAR Testing Center  120 kilometers from São Paulo. The primary loop is tested, which is the reactor vessel and its internal systems, such as pressure regulators, cooling pumps, steam generators and related auxiliary equipment. Recently, we have also successfully assembled primary circuit equipment. According to  the Brazilian Navy , the manufacturing work of the main equipment of the secondary circuit has been completed. These include: 4 turbine generator sets, 2 conjoined main condensers, 4 condensate water extraction pumps and 4 feed water pumps. The equipment testing laboratory  is currently being advanced to test the performance of the   turbine generator  set. According to the original arrangement, the manufacturer was to hand over the submarine, named Cheta, to the Northern Fleet this year. The Cheta, with a displacement of 13,000 tons, has a top speed of 35 knots and can sail 600 meters underwater. The former Soviet government designed and built this submarine in 1991, but due to lack of funds, it The trial date has been repeatedly postponed, and it is reported that the authorities still owe about US$5 million in fees, resulting in many equipments not being installed.

Local media reported that the missile has a range of 25 kilometers and can carry 55 kilograms of ammunition and nuclear warheads.  India  has  tested  such missiles on several occasions.

450.doctext: Arnold Engineering Development Center in the United States Recently, the center's J-1 test chamber  is testing General Electric's  F118-100 engine for the B-2 Phantom stealth bomber  . The test was part of General Electric's engine life extension project. The project, in turn, falls under the Air Force's Component Improvement Program, which replaces components on F118, F110 and F101 engines with common core systems. The purpose of the life extension project is to improve the maintenance supportability of the three engines while maintaining performance. So far, so far, said Mark Cross, senior project engineer at the Aerospace Test Alliance. We commissioned it very successfully and achieved 145% of the trial target in the first trial, exceeding our normal expectations.  Arnold Engineering Development Center  also completed the  test  of the  F118-101 engine  ahead of schedule, which is the power plant of the U-2 aircraft. Mark Cross also said, I would like to thank the J-1 test team, who worked together to successfully complete the F118-101 engine test project ahead of schedule. 451.doctext: North Korea has completed the fuel filling of the  Taepodong-2 long-range ballistic missile with a range that can reach the United States. It is likely to be the first time in  8 years Major  test firing. On June 18, U.S. officials reported:  North Korea  Satellite images of the launch site on the east coast show that liquid fuel tanks have been installed on the missiles. Fueling is the final step in preparing a liquid-fueled missile for launch, leading to speculation that  North Korea  will test-fire the missile. The report also states that the booster rocket has been installed on the launch pad. The Taepodong-2 is a three-stage missile. It is certain that the first stage is composed of the Nodong missile, which is a single-stage, short-range rocket; the second stage may be the Nodong missile; and the third stage may use solid fuel. U.S. officials are convinced that  North Korea  has enough plutonium for at least six nuclear weapons and has already produced a small number, but the number of nuclear weapons is still increasing.  August 1998  ,  North Korea   launched   Taepodong-1 missile  over Japan.

452.doctext: The South Korean Defense Acquisition Planning Agency revealed on Monday that  South Korea is seeking to purchase 48  advanced air defense missiles from the United States and is preparing to  equip them in the country Onboard the  Aegis KDX-III destroyer being built. According to a spokesperson for DAPA, negotiations to purchase Raytheon Systems' Standard-2 Block IIB missiles are ongoing and the contract is worth approximately $111 million. The SM-2 missile can effectively intercept cruise missiles, air-launched anti-ship missiles and attack aircraft.  The South Korean Navy  has built three 3,000-ton KDX-I destroyers and five 4,000-ton KDX-II destroyers, and plans to build another KDX-II destroyer in October this year. Three 7,000-ton  KDX-III destroyers  are planned to be launched  in 2012    and will be equipped with new missiles as their main air defense systems. The U.S. Defense Security Cooperation Agency notified Congress of the proposed foreign military sales to  the South Korean government  last week.

453.doctext: South Korean media disclosed on July 12 that  on July 5  North Korea   tested a   missile  which made the regional situation even more tense. , a   U.S. Navy carrier strike group will arrive   sometime during the week of July 17  span_7 Korea. South Korea's Yonhap News Agency quoted a US military officer as saying that the  aircraft carrier strike group  led by the USS Enterprise nuclear-powered aircraft carrier will visit Busan starting on July 16. A spokesman for U.S. Forces Korea said he was unable to comment on the report due to security reasons. South Korea's Yonhap News Agency reported that the  aircraft carrier strike group  includes Aegis destroyers capable of tracking missile flights, as well as cruisers and nuclear submarines. According to information disclosed to Yonhap by a US military officer, the  Aircraft Carrier Strike Group  will stay in Busan for four days. This is a planned visit and has nothing to do with the missile crisis.  North Korea openly defied international warnings and test-fired 7  missiles on July 5, including the long-range Taepodong-2 missile. For this type of missile, Some experts analyze it as being able to hit parts of the United States.

454.doctext: A senior North Korean official pointed out in a speech at the United Nations General Assembly that  North Korea's development of nuclear weapons is legitimate defense. He also accused Washington of using nuclear non-proliferation and terrorism to violate the sovereignty of  North Korea .  North Korea rarely expresses its position on its nuclear weapons program on international occasions. Vice Foreign Minister Choe SuHon said in this speech that  North Korea’s nuclear deterrent is only for legitimate defense purposes. This is in the interest of national peace and security. He also said that as long as the United States still imposes economic sanctions on  North Korea ,  Pyongyang  will not be able to end its nuclear program through six-party talks.  Pyongyang  announced in  February 2005   that  had produced a  nuclear weapon  but did not conduct a nuclear explosion test.  In July 2006,  North Korea ignored the warnings of the international community and  tested  7  ballistic missiles, including large The Cave-2 long-range missile is designed to prove its ability to strike the West Coast of the United States.

In the test,  Pacific Missile Range   fired  a  dumb ballistic missile  and  Navy aircraft  launched one  Dumb cruise missiles conducted a second attack and simultaneously attacked a US cruiser in Lake Erie. The ship launched a total of 2 interceptors, of which SM-3 was used to destroy ballistic missiles, and  SM-2  was used to deal with  cruise missiles   The test  was successful . President Bush asked Congress to authorize a 20 percent increase in funding for the Missile Defense Agency in fiscal year 2007, to $9.3 billion, primarily for development,  testing and  fielding including  Aegis and the terminal high-altitude area defense system.

456.doctext: Baltiisky Zavod shipyard  said Wednesday it has begun sea trials of the world's largest  nuclear-powered icebreaker  under construction since 1989. The  Baltiisky Zavod shipyard in St. Petersburg, Russia, said the  50th anniversary icebreaker will be towed along the narrow Neva Sea to the  port of St. Petersburg  A series of  tests will be conducted to check its operability, while speed performance  tests will also be conducted on the  high seas. Citing news from the  shipyard , the media reported that experts will also test the  icebreaker 's navigation and communication systems, water purification and antifreeze equipment, and other equipment that cannot be inspected offshore. The improved Arktika-class icebreaker has a length of 159 meters, a width of 30 meters, a dead weight of 25,000 tons, and a designed icebreaking capacity of 2.8 meters deep. It has a crew of 138 people. Russia's nuclear-powered icebreaker fleet is operated by Murmansk Shipping Company. The fleet currently consists of five Arktika-class and two Taymyr-class inland river icebreakers.

457.doctext: On December 1,   the U.S.   amphibious dock transport ship USS Green Bay  sailed away from Northrop Grumman's Avondale Shipyard, Begin the ship's  maiden voyage. This juncture marks the completion by a  United States  government and industry team of  USS Green Bay , the fourth ship in the San Antonio-class amphibious transport dock ship.  Green Bay  will first sail to its home port of San Diego. In January 2009, it will go to Long Beach, California to officially enter service. After entering service,  Green Bay and its crew will begin a series of  sea trials to rigorously  test the   ship's systems span_10 and complete important certifications.  USS Green Bay will conduct ship certification tests for missile and naval gun combat systems. During the test,  USS Green Bay will launch rolling missiles and test-fire 30 mm caliber missiles. Mk46Mod2 naval gun and test the ship's detection and interception capabilities. Other certification tests include well deck certification and voyage supply certification. The San Antonio-class amphibious transport dock ships currently in service include the USS San Antonio and the USS New Orleans. At the same time, the  Mesa Verde  is undergoing maintenance after the new ship  sea trial  in its home port of Norfolk.

Subject: the U.S.

The boat was built by the Severodvinsk-based Northern Machinery Building Plant. Participating in the sea trial were  submarine officers and soldiers and shipyard staff  . Submarines need to undergo  tests  under various conditions both underwater and on the surface. Northern Machinery Manufacturing Plant has not built a nuclear submarine for three years. In the past, the plant could build 5-6 nuclear submarines per year. In the past 60 years, Northern Machinery Manufacturing Plant has built a total of 170 submarines, 135 of which are nuclear submarines.  Cheetah  Construction began in 1991 and is a third-generation multi-purpose nuclear submarine. This type of nuclear submarine is recognized as the quietest nuclear submarine made by Russia.  Cheetah nuclear submarine  It has a displacement of 12,770 tons, a maximum speed of 35 knots, a diving depth of 600 meters, and a crew of 60-70 people. The boat can be equipped with 24 nuclear cruise missiles with a range of 3,000 kilometers.

The Yuri Dolgorukiy submarine is a Borei-class nuclear missile submarine built by the  Sevmash Shipyard  in the northern region of Arkhangelsk. The nuclear submarine is equipped with Bulava missiles, which are upgraded from Topol-M missiles. The submarine is 580 feet long, has a hull diameter of 42 feet, has a submersible speed of approximately 29 knots, and can carry 16 ballistic missiles. The other two Borei-class nuclear missile submarines, Alexander Nevsky and Vladimir Moromakh, are currently under construction at the  Sevmash shipyard, which will also build a fourth. 460.doctext: India  has announced that it has the capability to launch nuclear missiles from submarines and announced that it has successfully developed and  tested  the  submarine-based cruise missile Sagarika  . By establishing the  Sagarika missile  capability,  India  has completed the construction of the triad of nuclear weapons systems.  Last Saturday,  India's  Defense Research and Development Organization responsible for developing the  Sagarika missile was in  New Delhi   held a missile development celebration event. Sources said the  Sagarika missile  has a range of 1,000 kilometers and can be used on naval submarines. This missile may be used in advanced technology ship programs. The ATV program is  India's own  nuclear-powered submarine program, which is expected to be realized next year.  The Sagarika missile  has passed three successful  tests  , marking that  India  has a triad of air-based, land-based and sea-based nuclear weapons strike capabilities.

461.doctext: NASA's Dryden Flight Research Center is currently reviewing the feasibility of returning to flight one of the only two  F-16XL test aircraft with arrow-shaped wings,  F-16XL  After being stored in flight-ready condition for a decade, NASA is blowing away the dust and pumping air into the tires. The agency expects to award  Lockheed Martin a contract to conduct a cost study to modify and return the single-seat F-16 Mitigation research.  Upgraded aircraft - It made its first flight in  1982   - It is very similar to the 40th batch of F-16 aircraft of the US Air Force and is easy to maintain. . In 1996 and 1997, NASA used two aircraft in a high-speed research project to study sonic boom and laminar flow control technology, but the project was canceled in 1999. General Dynamics initially built two  F-16XL prototypes  to compete in the US Air Force's supersonic cruise demonstration project, but the McDonnell Douglas F-15E won the competition. If the aircraft improvements are priced appropriately and are approved by  NASA Headquarters , then the  F-16XL aircraft  will resume flying at the end of this year. In the meantime, a series of taxi  tests  are planned, which do not require  headquarters  approval.

462.doctext: Lockheed Martin Information Systems and Global Services has been awarded a $10 million cost-plus-fixed-fee contract to provide distributed network systems development, engineering and  testing  A  reliable acoustic path vertical line array sensor system. As part of the U.S. Navy's distributed network, these RAPVLA sensor systems will be used by surface ships for deep-water anti-submarine warfare, and Navy tactical ships will use pontoons to deliver these sensor systems. The work will be performed at Lockheed Martin's locations in  Virginia,  Florida,  North Carolina and  Connecticut  Plants in 4 states are expected to be completed by September 2010.
