463.doctext: Subject to FAA approval,  early next year the   Miami-Dade Regional Police Department in Florida will  test using Honeywell's  culvert Road fan micro drone. The vertical takeoff and landing drone will be used during SWAT force operations. In addition, the  Houston Police Department in Texas has completed the  verification flight of a  Insitu ScanEagle fixed-wing drone. The test was restricted to a radius of 3.2 kilometers and an altitude of less than 300 meters in accordance with FAA permission. The flight took place in a remote location in  the western suburbs of Houston  and the aircraft remained within visual and ground radar surveillance, while the drone's radio transceiver was tracked by Houston air traffic control. While more UAV demonstration flights are possible, Insitu said the police department will not put them into actual use until regulations are in place to ensure the safe integration of drones into airspace.

Subject: Miami-Dade Regional Police Department in Florida

464.doctext: The FAA is testing a new system at  Las Vegas Airport   that improves detection of hazards in dry weather conditions. Explosion detection. This system is called a  light detection and ranging system  .  November 30th  The final stage of the LIDAR  test  was completed. During the test, more than half of all possible wind shear types were detected. In the field of dry microexplosion, LIDAR detected 91% of mutations. Microbursts are usually related to thunderstorms. More than 40% of airports in the United States have installed terminal Doppler radar systems. Most microbursts can be detected when there is rain, but when the rain cannot reach the ground, especially in dry weather conditions at high altitudes or These systems are powerless against microbursts generated between two mountains. The FAA says there are four major U.S. airports with such weather conditions. LIDAR uses a narrow scanning beam of infrared light pulses, which are reflected back when encountering dust particles in the air. The frequency of the pulses changes based on the speed of the dust particles, while TDWR measures microbursts based on the speed of raindrops. The FAA believes that LIDAR together with TDWR can detect microbursts more accurately.

465.doctext: Russian Air Force Colonel Alexander Drobeshevsky, Assistant Commander-in-Chief, announced to RIA Novosti reporters that the modernized  improved  Su-24 frontline bomber  /span_1 will make its  first flight on  January 21 at the  Pereyaslavka Airport of the  Far Eastern Air Defense Group span_6. Assistant to the Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Air Force A. Drobeshevsky pointed out that preparations for the first flight are currently underway.  December 24, 2007 The first batch of  improved Su-24 frontline bombers   arrived at   Pereyaslavka Airport . Within the framework of the replacement of Russian combat aircraft, the improved frontline bomber was equipped with the Far East Corps for the first time. This batch of frontline bombers is an improved type, and its performance is more complete than that of the previously equipped frontline bombers.

466.doctext: Alenia Airways  has demonstrated the in-flight refueling capability of the  Eurofighter Typhoon  in a series of  trials  . At that time, an Italian Air Force C-130J refueling the Typhoon took off from Decimomannu Air Base in Sardinia. In the aerial refueling test, the Italian-made  two-seat Typhoon fighter  was used to conduct 5  test flights . This type of Typhoon belongs to the equipment production aircraft 2 configuration aircraft. Among them, the Typhoon had a clean layout during one test, and the Typhoon was equipped with an auxiliary fuel tank during the remaining tests. In total,  Alenia  stated that eight wet contacts were achieved during the C-130J’s in-flight refueling of Typhoon fighter jets.

467.doctext: News from People's Daily Online on March 12: According to the British "Jane's Missiles and Rockets" report in March, ATK's  Aero Engine Company has successfully supplied ground-based interceptor missiles for the US National Missile Defense Program   The solid propellant rocket motor completed a static ignition  test. The engine is being developed by Boeing, the prime contractor for the NMD program. It is a thrust reversal type of the graphite epoxy engine 40 of  ATK Company  used in the Delta-II rocket, and will serve as the first stage booster of the three-stage NMD ground-based interceptor missile. This test run completed the development and qualification stages of the engine and nozzle.  The next mission to be completed in the near future  is the final  test  of this  thrust vector control system  which must be completed before the entire engine can be flight qualified.  ATK Corporation  estimates that if the NMD program continues, total solid motor sales will exceed $200 million over the next eight years.

468.doctext: United States USS Independence Littoral Combat Ship was successfully  launched at  Ostow Shipyard. At this time,  Austria Stu Shipyard is celebrating its 20th anniversary. This epoch-making trimaran has undoubtedly added a festive atmosphere to the plant.  Independence  The keel was laid in January 2006. During this launch, operations on the Mobile River were coordinated, and  Independence  was transferred via rails to a floating dock. The Liberty has a large flight deck, can carry out the operations of two H-60 ​​helicopters at the same time, and can carry the H-53, the largest helicopter in the U.S. Navy. This is impossible to achieve in U.S. Navy warships of the same displacement. This is the advantage brought by the Liberty's trimaran shape.  Independence  will be docked near the  Ostow Shipyard  until the installation and  testing  of the  shipboard combat system  are completed. Sea trials will begin  at the end of 2008 .  The U.S. Navy is planning to expand the existing fleet to 313 ships.  Independence may become a ship type selected by the  U.S. Navy .  The U.S. Navy  plans to build 55 littoral combat ships. Pentagon officials believe that the  U.S. Navy is very powerful in blue water, but there are gaps in offshore areas, green water or brown water. The littoral combat ship has a smaller draft and faster speed, which can just To fill this gap, littoral combat ships not only account for a larger proportion of the U.S. Navy fleet, but also have high importance.

470.doctext: India Thirty years after embarking on its Advanced Technology Submarine program and undertaking an 11-year construction period, the first indigenously built  nuclear submarine   was held The  launching ceremony was completed.  Arihant , with a displacement of 6,000 tons, was developed based on a Russian design and has been launched at the  Indian Shipbuilding Center . Including investment in the project after the  Indian   nuclear   test was launched, the development and construction costs of the  Arihant  have to $62.4. Military officials said the boat is still at least two years away from being commissioned. Some officials have suggested that the  Arihant  will ultimately become a technology demonstrator rather than a truly operational strategic asset. At this ceremony, officials said that  Arihant  will begin operations for the first time and verify all equipment and systems, after which its port and sea trials will also begin.  Submarines  will become an important part of India's strategic nuclear deterrence, which includes a series of platforms of the army, navy and air force. The submarine is capable of carrying 12 submarine-launched missiles and may also be equipped with Sagarika missiles.

471.doctext: After experiencing a series of setbacks, India's nuclear submarine project has finally made progress. First,  the Indian Navy's   first indigenous nuclear submarine is expected to be launched on  August 15 for preliminary  tests; Second,  Russia has agreed to lease the  Akula-II Nerpa attack submarine   at the end of  this year To  India on a 10-year lease. Nuclear-powered submarines have advantages over conventional-powered submarines. Conventional diesel-electric submarines need to frequently surface to replenish oxygen to recharge their batteries, while nuclear-powered submarines can operate underwater for a long time. Therefore, when a nuclear-powered submarine is equipped with a nuclear warhead missile, the submarine becomes the most difficult nuclear platform to detect and attack. This capability is crucial to  India because  India  The commitment of no first use of nuclear weapons requires  India to have a strong nuclear counterattack capability. The introduction of nuclear submarines has enabled  India  to achieve its goal of having an operational nuclear triangle, i.e. launching nuclear weapons from three environments: water, land and air.

Human_Trig: at the end of  this year

According to news from Russia's "Pravda", if the  Bulava missile test launch continues to fail, the entire research and development plan will be stopped, and the new Borei-class nuclear submarine will be modified to be equipped with canoe ballistic missiles . So far,  Russia has conducted a total of 12  test launches of the  Bulava missile, six of which failed, and two in July The failure of the test resulted in the resignation of the engineer in charge of the development of the  Bulava missile at the Moscow Thermal Engineering Bureau.  The failure of the  test on 15 July  dealt a serious blow to the  Russian  authorities, as  Russia  was involved in the project A lot of money and energy have been invested in it.

The reason for the postponement is that the analysis of the reasons for the failure of the previous  test launch  is still incomplete.  Russia  hopes that the  Bulava missile  can become an important triad nuclear strike force of  Russia  like the Topol-M missile. However, the development of the  Bulava missile  encountered a series of setbacks, with 6 of its 11 test launches failing. But some analysts believe the actual number of failures is much higher. For example, Russian military expert Pavel Felgenhauer said that only one of the 11 test launches of  Bulava  was completely successful.  Bulava  Future development has been questioned by some legislators and Defense Department officials, who have suggested that the focus should shift to existing canoe submarine-launched ballistic missiles. The Bulava submarine-launched ballistic missile  can carry up to 10 reentry warheads and has a range of more than 8,000 kilometers. 477.doctext: The French Ministry of Defense issued a communiqué on the 13th stating that  France  recently completed its fourth  test launch of the   electronic jamming-resistant Astel air defense missile . The communiqué stated that  May 31 conducted a test launch at the   France Landes missile test center at a distance of  missiles span_6 Flying objects appearing in a dense formation 15 kilometers from the launch site. Each flying object is equipped with an electronic jammer. After launch, the  missile  was not affected by electronic interference, flew to the designated target, and destroyed the target. The communiqué stated that the  Astor missile is a  new type of anti-electronic interference missile developed based on the future surface-to-air missile system plan jointly implemented by  France and Italy. Air missile. This plan includes  ship-to-air anti-missile systems and  land-based medium-range surface-to-air missiles that will be used to  equip France's  Charles de Gaulle aircraft carrier System. Astor missiles will also be used to equip  France  and Italy's Envoy-class frigates and Britain's Type 45 destroyers.

480.doctext: A senior Russian Navy official said on July 23 that  Russia will resume  Bulava ballistic missiles in  August or September  Test firing.  Before the end of this year  , a total of 3  test launches  will be conducted. Sources close to the government committee investigating the failure of the latest  Bulava test launch  said the failure was caused by a faulty engine nozzle, which was not a design flaw but a manufacturing flaw. The problem is that the  missiles  are not built correctly. Since the last  test launch  failed,  Russia  has suspended  Bulava missile  test launches pending the outcome of a government committee investigation.  Bulava missile  has failed 7 out of 12 times. Some analysts say the number of failures is actually even higher. Russian military expert Pavel Felgenhauer believes that in fact only one  test launch  was completely successful.

X2 test pilot Kevin Bredenbeck said at the end of the third phase of test flights of the project that the pitch stability of  X2  should be improved. In the third stage of test flight, engineers also successfully reduced the main rotor speed by 5% during flight to delay the occurrence of blade tip stall, which is another key technology to increase flight speed. In order to improve the pitch stability of  X2 , engineers increased the area of ​​the vertical stabilizer by 0.46m2 and conducted another test flight to verify its effect. Pino said that the key goal of the project - a cruising speed of 250kt - will be achieved in three or four flights after the flight test begins. Pino also said that the noise level of the ducted fan of  X2  is very gratifying, and customers are very satisfied after watching the test flight of  Sikorsky plans to use the  X2  to bid for the Army's armed reconnaissance aircraft program. 483.doctext: The Peruvian Navy has signed a 3.4 million euro contract with Rheinmetall to order two  multi-munition soft-kill decoy target systems, which will be  installed on two ships  Aguirre-class frigate aboard. According to relevant reports, the  Peruvian Navy  will upgrade 6 of the 8 Cavajal-class and  Aguirre-class frigates  and adopt a large number of domestically developed technologies. But because the  Peruvian Navy  has very limited funds, only two ships have been able to undergo comprehensive upgrades, including sensors and weapons equipment. The remaining ships are expected to receive performance-improving upgrades only for specific parts. The core of the project is to upgrade the frigate using the  new Varayoc combat management system, which was developed by  SIMA Company and is already on board the  Kavajal  Trial for two years. Currently, the  Peruvian Navy has begun to use the  Varayoc system to replace the outdated Alenia IPN-10 combat systems on the other two frigates, and will subsequently replace the combat systems on other ships. .

484.doctext: Project 10412 patrol boat  Trigulav built by  Russia   Almaz Shipyard for the Slovenian Navy has gone to  Russia Novorossiysk Naval Base and is expected to arrive in early November.  Trigulav  The patrol boat left  Almaz Shipyard  on October 9. The boat underwent  sea trials  in  early October  and was received.  Almaz Shipyard won the construction contract for the boat in July 2008, and started keel laying in September of the same year.  It was launched on July 21, 2010   span_10. Project 10412 patrol boat was developed by the Central Ship Design Bureau of Almaz. From November 11th to 12th, the boat will depart from the Novorossiysk Naval Base and leave the territorial waters of  Russia , heading to the Adriatic Sea to serve in the 430th Division of the Slovenian Navy.  Trigulav  The patrol boat is the second ship of the Slovenian Navy.

485.doctext: Europe's Airbus will use an off-the-shelf  A320 variant with shark-shaped winglets for its first flight  by the end of the year   /span_3's new hairstyle benchmark.  Airbus  Fernando Alonso, senior vice president for flight and integrated testing, said that the first production of the  Shark A320  is scheduled to enter service in 2012, and the aircraft can save 3.5 % of fuel, will be used as a reference for NEO models. The NEO type is planned to be launched 2 to 3 years after the  Shark type  enters service. However, Alonso emphasized that there are currently no plans to re-engine the  Shark A320  as a NEO aircraft. The NEO is aerodynamically similar to the  Shark A320 , but will be powered by the advanced CFM International Leap-X engine or the American Pratt & Whitney geared fan engine, both of which can improve fuel consumption. down by more than double digits. The NEO model is scheduled to enter service at the end of 2015. Although the Sharklet will be tested on the MSN1, an old A320 aircraft that has been in service for 23 years, Alonso said that most of the research and development work must be carried out on the first production  Sharkjet . He said: MSN1 is too old, and the new aircraft will improve the wing structure to adapt to shark-type winglets. The old experimental aircraft, which began flying tests in Toulouse in 1987, will be replaced with a new fuselage.  Air New Zealand  became a customer of the  Shark A320  in 11th last year.  Delivery  is planned to start at the end of  2012  .

486.doctext: Russia Deputy Prime Minister Sergey Ivanov said at a press conference that six more successes are needed before the  Bulava submarine-launched ballistic missile can enter service  Test firing. One test launch was by the new nuclear submarine Yuri Dolgoruki, and the other five were qualification  tests  . Ivanov clearly stated that the missile would be tested six times. According to official sources, the first test launch will take place  this year , with the other five planned for  next year . It is clear that the  missile  did not have a design error, Ivanov said, commenting on the cause of the previous failure, that, as I said before, the accident was attributed to a manufacturing defect. Ivanov explained that 620 companies are involved in the production of  missiles , but less than 20 companies are affiliated with Roscosmos. To eliminate the possibility of defective products, every company needs to arrange for inspectors.  The Bulava submarine-launched ballistic missile is expected to become the core of the Russian Navy's nuclear force, and the Yuri Dolgoruki nuclear submarine carrying the  Bulava missile is ready .

489.doctext: According to a report on the "Defense Daily" website on August 30, a spokesperson for the US Air Force said that  the F-22 fighter jet last week found a slight oil pressure abnormality in one of its subsystems.   span_2 Naval Air Station Point Mugu, California performed an emergency landing.  On August 23  , after the Lockheed Martin aircraft landed safely, Air Force officials discovered that a connector in one of the accessory devices installed on the F-22 aircraft was loose. It said the connection was tightened and we waited for clear weather to fly back to  Edwards AFB  . It will not affect the test flight program.  Raptor 5 test aircraft  There is no documentation and it is prohibited to fly in severe weather conditions. It is one of the five  F-22 test aircraft responsible for test flights at  Edwards Air Force Base. It is mainly used to  test   F-22 's  avionics system. 492.doctext: The U.S. Air Force  and  The Boeing Company  are testing a solution to correct a power issue on the first  GPSBlockIIF satellite  . The satellite was launched into orbit on May 27, 2010.   The M-coded signal of the satellite  is now turned off  and will not be turned on until the problem is confirmed to be resolved. M-coded signals minimize interference to military activities. Sources familiar with the project revealed that the  fault  was discovered during ground  testing  of another  GPSIIF satellite . The U.S. Air Force Space Command, which oversees GPS operations, declined to discuss the issue. The U.S. government issued a notice to GPS users on April 6: The government needs to shut down non-operational M-coded signals indefinitely during testing. Lieutenant General Sheridan, the former US Air Force space program executive officer, said: The power problem is not the first  failure  since the  GPSIIF satellite  entered orbit.  In 2010  , the second  GPSIIF satellite  had a nuclear detection payload cross-linking problem,  and therefore the launch was delayed  . The second  GPSIIF satellite  underwent software repairs and is scheduled to be launched on July 14, 2011. In the summer of 2010, although DLR personnel detected residual errors when combining the three main signals from the  GPSIIF satellite, U.S. Air Force officials concluded that the navigation of the  GPSIIF satellite Timing signal operation is up to standard.

493.doctext: The first  test launch of this year's  Russian   Bulava missile  took place on  June 28 in  Barents test site, the information comes from representatives of the Russian defense industry system. Previously  Bulava missiles  were launched from the Dmitry Donskoy nuclear submarine. This year's test launch was carried out from the Yuri Dolgoruki nuclear submarine. It was the first time that the  Bulava missile  was launched from this type of submarine. So far, the  Bulava missile  has conducted a total of 14  test launches  , of which 7 were successfully launched. Because it was necessary to find out the reasons for the unsuccessful launch, the next test launch was postponed several times.  The Bulava intercontinental ballistic missile  is Russia's  new three-stage propulsion solid fuel missile , mainly used to equip Russia's new Borei-class submarines.  Missile  It can carry 6 to 10 separately guided supersonic nuclear warheads and can change its flight trajectory and route.  Bulava strategic missile  Developed by the Moscow Institute of Thermodynamics, it has a maximum range of 8,000 kilometers, a launch weight of 36.8 tons, can carry 6 to 10 nuclear warheads, a length of 11.5 meters, and a carrying weight of 1,150 kilograms.

494.doctext: At 8:30 a.m. on August 2, 2011, at  Edwards Air Force Base,  AF-4 test aircraft appeared during ground maintenance A  fault occurred. According to a news release from the Joint Strike Fighter Program Office, after a problem occurred with the integrated power system package, personnel on board the aircraft safely shut down the engine in accordance with standard operating procedures.  All 20 F-35 test aircraft have suspended flight after the integrated power system package failed.  It is reported that the government and contractors are investigating the cause of the entire incident. The program office has temporarily suspended the operation of the aircraft. They believe that prudent action must be taken until the F-35 engineering, technology and system safety teams fully understand the cause of the incident. This is the second time in 2011 that the F-35 test aircraft has been suspended due to power problems.  In March 2011, two engines of a  F-35 test aircraft experienced  failures at the same time, shortly after  takeoff. After landing, the investigation revealed that there was a vulnerability in the maintenance procedures.  June 2011,  F-35C test aircraft also suspended flight for 6 days due to software  problem  . This software problem will cause the wing There was a problem with the folding device, which may cause the flight control surface to lock.  The F-35C test aircraft has solved the problem and resumed flight on June 23, 2011.

495.doctext: The Navy's  new anti-ship missile defense radar system has performed well in  testing of  off the coast of Australia and  Hawaii and is now available Navy Initial combat use. This new phased array radar system has been  installed  on the Anzac-class frigate  HMS Perth . The radar can detect, track and guide missiles against multiple targets simultaneously. Australian Defense Minister Jason Clare inspects the radar on  HMS Perth  during a training exercise off the coast of Western Australia  . Clare said that this is Australia's latest  radar equipment  that can track and destroy multiple targets at the same time, so the combat capabilities of the Anzac-class frigates equipped with this radar will be greatly improved. The radar uses core technology from CEA Technologies and represents a huge success for Australia. Australian Navy Vice Admiral Reg Riggs said that the  USS Perth frigate had just completed the  system at the U.S. Navy's Pacific Missile Test Range in  Hawaii After the test was a complete success, he returned to China. Test results show that  the new radar system  is able to withstand attacks from modern ship-based cruise missiles. This will significantly improve the performance of the Anzac-class frigates.  HMS Perth is the main test ship of the project.  The new radar system After the successful test on the ship, the government will soon conduct tests on the other seven Anzac-class frigates. upgrade.

497.doctext: On August 21,  Iran  displayed a variety of  new weapons and equipment at the National Defense Industry Day commemoration event, including A.  Short-range surface-to-surface ballistic missile Conqueror 110 .  Two weeks ago,  Iran successfully  test-fired a  Conqueror missile, which accurately hit the target. The capabilities have been improved and the range has been upgraded to 300 kilometers. According to past reports, the previous version of the  Conqueror-110 missile  has been in service for 10 years and has a maximum range of about 200 kilometers. Iranian Defense Minister General Ahmed Vahidi said: The  missile  uses solid fuel for propulsion and is the most accurate and advanced  surface-to-surface ballistic missile  . Over the past decade, it has played a prominent role in promoting the defense capabilities of  the Islamic Republic of Iran . Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad emphasized that defensive progress is to defend the integrity of mankind and does not mean launching an attack on others. I have no doubt that our defense capabilities can stand up to the oppressors and will thwart their plans.

498.doctext: The  CT-CV weapon system developed by the Belgian Cockerill Company was successfully  tested and launched the  Falarivk105 new anti-tank guided missile  , the missile was developed by  Belgian CMI Defense Company and has been  exhibited at  2010   European Sartori Defense Exhibition  . The artillery-launched missile capability will greatly enhance the combat effectiveness of the  CT-CV weapon system  and enable precision strikes against short-range and long-range targets. The weapon system is equipped with conventional anti-tank ammunition, artillery-launched missiles and heavy machine guns.  Falarick105  is a 105mm caliber missile specially developed for the Cockerill CV artillery. Its laser beam guidance system allows it to attack both stationary and moving targets, as well as helicopters and fortifications, with a range of 5 kilograms. The equipped tandem hollow charge warhead can penetrate armor up to 550 mm thick.

499.doctext: Today, the British Navy's second  Astute-class attack nuclear submarine Ambush  is preparing to leave the shipyard to begin  sea trials . In the following days, the 7,400-ton submarine will leave its construction shipyard, the BAE Systems shipyard in Barrow-in-Furness, Cumbria, and sail to Clyde, Scotland. naval base. The Astute class is quieter than previous submarines. Although the Astute class submarine is 50% larger than the current Trafalgar-class submarine, it still has the ability to maintain stealth and stealth combat in most environments. After visiting the  submarine  and the shipyard, the Minister of Defense Equipment, Support and Technology revealed that he hopes that  HMS Ambush  can enter service in the Royal Navy next year.  Ambush submarine started laying the keel on October 22, 2003,  January 6, 2011   was launched,  October 2011 On the 7th the first  dive was successfully completed.

500.doctext: A senior Iranian military officer announced that  Iran  will launch its first indigenously designed and built  semi-heavy submarine  in the coming months. An Iranian rear admiral said on Friday that the submarine would be displayed  before the end of the current  Iran  calendar year    . The major general also said that  Iran is currently manufacturing many light submarines. Relying on its own professional knowledge and skills,  Iran’s performance in submarine construction and maintenance is much better than that of world-renowned submarines. , especially  semi-heavy submarines. In addition,  Iran  has  launched  many destroyers including  Jamalan  and is developing domestically produced destroyers. To ensure that the Iranian navy has sufficient strength to ensure the safe navigation of its ships on the high seas. Currently,  Iran  has launched advanced submarine programs of different categories, such as Fatah-class submarines, Ghadir-class submarines, Soar-class submarines and Whale-class submarines. Among them, the  Ghadir-class submarine made its first  appearance in  2007. It has a displacement of 120 tons and has excellent shallow sea combat capabilities. It can operate for a long time in Perform missions along the coast and launch attacks with torpedoes. In recent years,  Iran  has made significant breakthroughs in its national defense capabilities and has certain production and development capabilities in important military equipment and systems. For example, in September 2012, the Iranian Navy completed its own modification of the Jino-class submarine Tariq.

502.doctext: At the  Central Military District Test Site,  Russia conducted a month-long  test of the  new stealth coating, including Three types of coatings: de-icing, radar absorbing and purification/radiation protection, successfully completed the first phase of major testing.  The new coating  is suitable for all armored vehicles including the Armata main battle tank, and the vehicles participating in the test include: T-72 main battle tank, BMP-2 and BMP-1KSh infantry fighting vehicles. In the night test, reconnaissance systems such as unmanned vehicles and foreign-produced night vision systems were used. Two of the three samples were able to almost completely reflect the visible and infrared spectrum. In addition, the  new coating  was tested in off-road environments such as water and muddy uneven roads, and the color matching of its materials also met the  Russian Armed Forces  standards. The developers have revealed the recipe for the  new coating ; testing is important to adjust the composition of the coating and add new components. A car requires 25 to 50 kilograms of paint, and the adhesion and performance of the  new coating  on the equipment surface will be tested in six months. However, some experts in the development of main battle tanks in the United States and  Russia  still express some doubts about the low signature signal of the new generation T-14 Armata tank to radar and thermal imagers. Equipment based on the Armata tracked heavy-duty standard platform includes T-14 main battle tanks, T-15 heavy infantry fighting vehicles and T-16 armored rescue vehicles. Transport vehicles, loading and unloading vehicles, minelayers and bridge erecting vehicles will also be developed. , it is expected that the first  advanced armored vehicle prototype will be delivered to   troops in  2016  .

504.doctext: Boeing  has canceled plans to add a unique sloping tail to prototype and production versions of the  F-15  stealth Silent Eagle.  F-15SE  The flight test prototype will be equipped with radar absorbing materials, and the conformal fuel tank will be changed into a weapons bay.  Last March  the eye-catching sloping tail scheme that was unveiled  at  St. Louis   has been abandoned.  Weapon firing  trials  will begin later this year  . In July or August, an  F-15  with a modified internal weapons bay will test-fire an AIM-9 or AIM-120 missile.  Boeing  also confirmed that  F-15SE  will be given priority to the South Korean government. South Korea plans to launch a fighter jet bid early next year, and Lockheed Martin's F-35 is also under consideration.  Boeing introduces the  F-15SE  as a new concept that gives the fighter a first-day configuration capable of breaching protected airspace without detection ability. 505.doctext: ITT Corporation will be  made public for the first time at the  U.S. Army Annual Exposition on  October 10-12, 2011 The latest  infrared countermeasures system - quantum cascade laser jammer. Different from BAE Systems' Boldstroke system, this system contains three boxes. The brown box houses the quantum cascade laser. The black and transparent box is the indicator/tracker for beam aiming. Behind it is the computer control box. The coil uses fiber optic lines for transmission. laser beam. Therefore, the laser and the indicator/tracker are independent of each other, allowing the operator to freely switch lasers during flight without readjusting the aiming system, ensuring the aiming accuracy of the laser. The ITT system's designators/trackers will be placed on both sides of the aircraft, allowing it to locate approaching missiles from any direction. A single laser provides the designation/trackers on both sides with lasers via rugged light pipes and fiber optic lines installed inside the aircraft. bundle. The system is equipped with a universal pointer to provide nearly full coverage tracking, eliminating the need to install a second laser and saving weight. In addition, IRCM uses a new type of quantum cascade laser that is more compact and powerful than traditional diode lasers and harnesses it as a controllable energy source.  ITT Corporation has completed flight  testing on a  U.S. Army UH-60 Black Hawk helicopter with an existing  missile warning system , to test the capabilities of the system, the test location is  Naval Air Engineering Station Lakehurst, New Jersey.

506.doctext: China Post EMS   Amphibious UAV   Today  successfully conducted a test flight in  Jingmen, Hubei   . Previously,  July 2017, a  SF Express   large drone video taking off over water was also  exposed online span_8, which attracted a lot of attention.  China Post  is the logistics company with the largest number of rural outlets in China. It has started trial operations of drone mail routes since 2016. Logistics drones will help rely on  China Post  existing network resources to expand the scope of logistics and distribution in vast remote areas that are not densely populated and involve mountains and rivers. It is worth mentioning that since this year, not only JD.com has obtained written approval from Shaanxi Province for drone airspace covering the entire territory of Shaanxi Province, but also  SF Express at the end of March received approval from the East China Regional Administration of Civil Aviation of China. Issued the first domestic drone aviation operation license. This means that China’s drone logistics distribution has officially entered the legal operation stage, and commercial operation is just around the corner. Source: China Aviation News Network Image source: Provided by EMS insiders

507.doctext: Delivery site At 13:48 on September 26, 2019, an  ARJ21 aircraft painted with China Dream took off from Nantong Xingdong International Airport and landed at Chengdu Shuangliu International Airport at 16:20. This is the 14th  ARJ21 aircraft delivered by  COMAC to  Chengdu Airlines. This ARJ21 aircraft with the nationality number  B-603P  was purchased by ICBC Financial Leasing Co., Ltd. and leased to Chengdu Airlines. This is also the 12th time for  ARJ21 aircraft  to be delivered through sale and leaseback. The aircraft has an all-economy class layout with a total of 90 seats. It adopts the Chinese Dream livery for the first time, which shows the economic development and brilliant achievements made since the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, reflects the colorful Chinese Dream, and marks the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China. Offering. On-site, organized by  Production and Operation Support Department, Marketing and Sales Department of COMAC,  Shanghai Aircraft Research Institute,  Shanghai Aircraft Company,  The customer service company,  flight test center and others form an aircraft delivery team to coordinate all parties to complete relevant inspections and  testing. Before delivery, this  ARJ21 aircraft completed a delivery  test flight mission in  Nantong to test the capabilities of each system of the aircraft. The customer confirmed that the test data is valid. After customization and other processes, it passed the CAAC certification and successfully obtained the civil aircraft standard airworthiness certificate. So far,  ARJ21 aircraft  has safely carried more than 510,000 passengers. Source: COMAC website

508.doctext: Russia's United Aircraft Manufacturing Corporation  plans to sign a contract for the batch delivery of  T-50 fifth-generation fighter aircraft  in 2017-2018. Relevant people in the Russian aviation industry said that  T-50 fighter jets are preparing to enter mass production, and  United Aircraft Manufacturing Corporation is also formulating  2017   Agreement to deliver   the Russian Ministry of Defense the first batch of 12  fighter aircraft.  T-50  formerly known as  Sukhoi Aviation Multi-Purpose Frontline Fighter,  completed its  first flight in 2010,  It was officially released  on display at the 2011   Moscow Air Show.

Subject: Russia's United Aircraft Manufacturing Corporation
United Aircraft Manufacturing Corporation
Date: It was officially released  on display at the 2011

509.doctext: May 17, 2017,  Indian Navy successfully  test-fired   from  Calcutta-class Cochin destroyer Barak-8 medium-range air defense missile. The test verified the integrated collaboration effect of  missiles , fire control system and India's independently developed shipboard combat management system, and also demonstrated the air defense combat capabilities of  destroyer . In addition, during the test, the  missile  also achieved high-precision tracking of low-altitude and high-speed air targets at a longer distance.  Barak-8 missile  is an advanced air defense system jointly developed by India's Defense Research and Development Organization and Israel Aerospace Industries.  Missile  It is 4.5 meters long, has a warhead mass of 60 kilograms, and uses a dual-pulse solid propulsion system developed by DRDO. The missile weapon system also includes a multifunctional surveillance and early warning radar for detection, tracking and missile guidance.  Israel Aerospace Industries signed a defense contract of more than $1.6 billion with India to provide  advanced  medium-range air defense missiles to the  Indian Army   and missile defense systems. The missile will be produced by Bharat Dynamics Limited, Lascent Boro India, Bharat Electronics Limited and other Indian companies. It is expected that the  Barak-8  will be produced mainly in India to save costs.

Subject: Indian Navy
Equipment: from  Calcutta-class Cochin destroyer Barak-8 medium-range air defense missile

510.doctext: At the  Army-2017 International Military Technology Forum,  Russian Military Industrial Corporation conducted a review of the  K-17 Boomerang 8×8 Infantry Fighting Vehicle for the first time. Live fire  demonstration. The vehicle made its debut  during the Victory Day in April 2015  military parade  and will replace the old BTR series armored vehicles currently in service in the Russian Armed Forces. Currently, the  Russian Armed Forces   testing  of the  Boomerang armored vehicle  has two variants: K-16 and  K-17  . Among them, the K-16 is an armored personnel carrier equipped with a remote-controlled weapon station equipped with a 12.7 mm heavy machine gun;  K-17  is an infantry fighting vehicle equipped with a 2A42 30 mm automatic cannon and a PKTM A remote-controlled weapon station for the 7.62mm parallel machine gun. Two sets of Kornet-EM anti-tank laser missile launchers from the Tula Instrument Design Bureau are installed on both sides of the turret.  Boomerang Armored Vehicle  The body can withstand attacks from small arms and shell fragments; it is covered with ceramic armor that can withstand 14.5 mm armor-piercing projectiles and 152 mm shell fragments. The vehicle is amphibious and is propelled in water by two propellers located at the rear of the vehicle body. Standard equipment includes air conditioning, nuclear, biological and chemical protection systems, night vision devices, computerized fire control systems and central tire inflation and deflation systems. The car is also equipped with cameras that provide a 360-degree view to the vehicle's occupants.

Human_Trig: during the Victory Day in April 2015  military parade
Subject: Russian Military Industrial Corporation

511.doctext: Russian Deputy Minister of Defense Yuri Borisov said on August 30 that  the Russian Ministry of Defense is expected to sign the purchase of  fifth-generation fighter Su-57  in 2018 Under the contract, the Air and Space Force will begin receiving these advanced aircraft in 2019. Borisov made this statement at a press conference on the results of the Army-2017 International Military and Technical Forum. The deputy defense minister said that visitors to the forum showed their extreme capabilities in the latest Russian aircraft including the Su-34, Su-35 and the fifth-generation fighter aircraft, which has been named  Su-57  great interest. We are now considering signing a contract to purchase production  fifth-generation fighter aircraft  in 2018, and the relevant forces will receive these aircraft in 2019.  Su-57  made its first flight in  2010    . It was reported earlier that the  test  design work of this most advanced fighter jet will be completed in  2019  and delivery to troops will begin at that time. For example, United Aircraft Corporation CEO Yuri Slyusari said that the pre-production batch of aircraft includes 12 aircraft. Victor Bondarev, Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Aerospace Forces, previously stated that  fifth-generation fighter jets  will be delivered to aviation units beginning in 2018. The Army-2017 International Military and Technical Forum was held in Kubinka outside Moscow from August 22 to 27.

512.doctext: U.S. Army used  Raytheon research and development during the Maneuver Fires Integrated  Exercise at the  Fires Center of Excellence The advanced high-energy microwave and laser ATV intercepted and destroyed 45 drones. The exercise brought together military and industry leaders to demonstrate ways to bridge the capability gap between long-range fires and mobile short-range air defense. Among them,  Raytheon Company 's  high-power microwave system  intercepted multiple drones, a total of 33 drones, 2 or 3 at a time.  Raytheon's  high-energy laser system identified, tracked, and intercepted 12 air-mobile Class I and II drones and destroyed six fixed mortar shells. Thomas Bussing, vice president of Raytheon Advanced Missile Systems, said: "The speed and cost of each engagement of directed energy weapons is extremely revolutionary when it comes to protecting troops from drone attacks." We have invested decades perfecting  high power microwave systems  . We will soon have a significant advantage against this type of surge threat.  Raytheon Company and  U.S. Air Force Research Laboratory are working together on a $2 million contract to  test and  demonstrate Verify the  high-power microwave system and its anti-drone capabilities.  Raytheon Company  Ben Allison, director of the high-energy laser system product line, said: Customers need a solution, and a fast solution. So we combined what we learned with field-proven components to quickly deliver a small, self-contained, and easy-to-deploy counter-drone system.

513.doctext: Russia begins mass production  Su-57 fighter jet Pictures released by the Russian United Aircraft Corporation in the media indicate that Russia is mass-producing the aircraft plant in Kommoorsk-on-Amur  Su-57 stealth fighter. The KnAAZ aircraft factory only completed the  Su-57  assembly line in September this year to complete the order for 76  Su-57 fighter jets  signed in 2018. The contract value is approximately US$2.7 billion.  Rostec President Sergei Chemesov pointed out last week that by the end of this year we will be able to mass produce  Su-57  equipped with first-stage engines, all The performance indicators can meet the standards of fifth-generation fighter jets.  UAC  previously stated that it has delivered  nearly 10  prototypes  to the  Russian Ministry of Defense   for test flights by Air Force pilots   use. It is reported that users from other countries can also purchase  Su-57 , and Algeria has expressed its intention to purchase. It is expected that the  production version of the  Su-57   will be  exhibited 2021   Moscow Air Show  .

514.doctext: Australia  The Defense Minister has officially unveiled the command established for the $3.27 billion  Wedgetail Airborne Early Warning and Control aircraft  . The new headquarters at Williamtown base near Newcastle is also home to the restructured 2nd Air Detachment, which flies the  Wedgetail  mission. Australian Defense Minister Hill pointed out that the establishment of the command is of great significance to the Wedgetail project, Williamtown Air Force Base and the local industry. It is the first tangible result of the Wedgetail project being delivered for use. In the three years since the project officially started, the project's development speed and cost control have been better than expected. The establishment of the headquarters also marks the beginning of a long-term cooperation with the Hunter region. It is the first phase of a $149 million Air Force base development project that also includes construction of hangars and parking areas for the  Wedgetail  and improvements to runways and taxiways. The  Wedgetail AWACS  will enhance  Australia's  combat capabilities by providing air and maritime surveillance.  Wedge tail early warning aircraft  It uses Boeing 737 as its body and is equipped with a variety of advanced mission systems and radars. The aircraft will have better flexibility and mission capabilities than similar platforms currently in service. The first  wedge tail early warning aircraft  has been spray-painted with the logo of the Second Air Force Detachment. According to the plan, the first  Wedgetail   May will make its first flight in  Seattle   , and the first batch of  will be two The aircraft will be delivered to the   Royal Australian Air Force in  November 2006  .

Subject: Australia
Equipment: Wedgetail Airborne Early Warning and Control aircraft

Subject: Australia
Materials: Wedgetail Airborne Early Warning and Control aircraft

515.doctext: Russia's Sukhoi Equity Company revealed its  new Su-35 single-seat fighter jet, which is intended to serve as the series-produced 4th-generation Su-30 fighter jet and the 5th-generation Su-30 fighter under development. A transitional aircraft between generations of fighter aircraft.  Cockpit Technology Demonstrator   with fixed base simulator capability is on display at  Farnborough Airshow   this week  .  The Su-35  is Russia's first fighter jet with an all-glass cockpit. It also uses thrust control rod and joystick technology and a new engine with thrust vectoring nozzles. In  New Su-35  the number of control devices in the cockpit will be reduced from 300 on the Su-27 to 150.  All avionics equipment for the Su-35 aircraft  will be produced in Russia. The aircraft is scheduled to make its first flight in  2007    and is expected to be delivered in 2009. Trying to bring  Su-35  to market is Sukhoi's second effort. In the early 1990s, this type of aircraft was envisioned as the Su-27 multi-purpose single-seat aircraft. However, because of its legacy avionics system, the workload for a single pilot was too heavy, so the Department of Defense put the planned acquisition on hold.

Subject: Russia's Sukhoi Equity Company
Equipment: All avionics equipment for the Su-35 aircraft

516.doctext: Northrop Grumman has delivered the first  integrated communications and navigation system to flight status to   Lockheed Martin F-35 project team and identification systems. The system has successfully completed safety  test flights and will be deployed on the first  F-35  this summer equipped with the  mission system span_6 on  test flight. After all functions are developed, Northrop Grumman's  Integrated CNI System  will provide F-35 pilots with functions equivalent to more than 40 avionics systems. By using software-defined radio technology, the  Comprehensive CNI System  can simultaneously support multiple key functions and significantly reduce system size and weight. Roger Fujii, vice president of network communication systems of Northrop Grumman's Information Systems Division, said that this is the beginning of the  Integrated CNI System  mass equipment  F-35 . We have used this system in CATBird The performance demonstrated on the test bed is very satisfactory, and it is believed that this system will bring a new generation of communication performance to combat aircraft.  Integrated CNI system uses 500,000 lines of source code and is integrated into the software system of the joint tactical radio system. The functions provided include: UHF/VHF receiving and transmitting, IFF transponder, radar altimeter , tactical air navigation, and system hardware and software diagnostics.

517.doctext: On March 22,  Northrop Grumman  held a ceremony to entertain the wife of the commander of the U.S. Pacific Fleet and accompanied her to visit the construction status of the  USS California submarine .  Construction of the USS California  is 75% complete. The completion of the construction of the pressure hull this spring is a milestone. The completion of the pressure hull marks the start of hull assembly. This is the last module-level milestone, which means that ship system integration and  testing work is about to begin, with preparations for  the second half of this year submarine  launch Prepare.  USS California  is the eighth Virginia-class submarine, built by  Northrop Grumman Corporation .  Submarine  The keel was laid in May 2009. Once   is delivered to the   Navy in 2011,  USS California will become the most modern and sophisticated attack submarine in the world. The underwater overlord of the 21st century.  Northrop Grumman  cooperates with General Dynamics Electric Boat to build  Virginia-class submarines .

Northrop Grumman Corporation

518.doctext: On September 22, Mrs. Donna Willard, sponsor of the  USS California submarine , visited Northrop Grumman. During her visit, she met with the submarine's crew and builders and visited the site where the  submarine  was named. California will hold a naming ceremony on November 6.  Northrop Grumman Newport News Shipbuilding Bob Bolden, head of the ship construction department, said that  USS California submarine has been 86% completed and is scheduled to be  Launched this fall  , we are now approaching this milestone in the construction process.  The launch of the submarine  marks the beginning of a series of water transport  tests  . During the waterborne testing, the  submarine 's systems and compartments were transitioned to operational capability in support of 's  sea trials  in 2011  .  USS California is the 8th Virginia-class submarine. It was built by  Northrop Grumman Newport News Shipyard. The keel was laid in May 2009 and is planned to be completed in  Delivered to   U.S. Navy in 2011.  USS California  will be the world's most advanced attack submarine, capable of providing great underwater advantages.  Virginia-class submarines  were built jointly by  Northrop Grumman Corporation  and General Dynamics Electric Boat.

519.doctext: Designers from Russia's Ramenskoye Instrument Manufacturing and Design Bureau  demonstrated the latest  universal pilot at the  Moscow Air Show cockpit, and plans to use it on Su and MiG series aircraft. Kavinsky, the chief designer of the design bureau, said that this cockpit can be used to improve the Su-27 and MiG-29 series aircraft equipped by the Air Force to fourth-and-a-half-generation and super-four-and-a-half-generation aircraft, and enable these aircraft to continue to be used for 15 years. -20 years.  New cockpit  The new onboard computer can ensure target identification, select and use weapons, avoid enemy attacks, etc. The Su-30MK aircraft that Russia provides to foreign countries are equipped with this kind of cockpit, and only Russian-made equipment is used in the cabin. It is said that  pilots  from six countries currently equipped with Soviet and MiG aircraft have  tested  this kind of cockpit and are very satisfied with it.

520.doctext: Engineers and pilots at Edwards Air Force Base and Eglin Air Force Base  are conducting experiments to combine the missions of the two aircraft and complete operational and development testing in one test. Five  F-16s  and aircrews from the 85th Test and Evaluation Squadron at Eglin Base arrived at  Edwards  from July 22 to 29 . Together with 2  F-16  of the 416th Flight Test Squadron, the operational  test of the core avionics system upgrade of  F-16M4.2-plus  was completed  . The test results will be applied to the improvement of future upgraded models.  The F-16  is designed as a multi-role fighter with high maneuverability in air-to-air combat and air-to-surface attack. There are several types of  F-16  used in the United States, including Block 40 and Block 50. The main mission of the 40th batch  F-16  is to conduct air-to-surface attacks, while the main mission of the 50th batch of aircraft is to destroy and suppress enemy air defenses. The M4.2-plus avionics upgrade integrates two combat capabilities into one fighter. This upgrade will be completed through a spiral development. The flight test content includes the evaluation of hardware upgrades to the weapon system and multi-functional information release system, as well as understanding the latest radar detection technology.  Test personnel will also integrate operational and development testing to conduct   F-16M4.2-plus  avionics package A  assessment was conducted.

521.doctext: The U.S. Navy collaborated with the  Missile Defense Agency  to complete the  second generation  Standard Missile-3BlockIB  's  deployment, and the  United States segmented adaptation plan has also officially entered the second phase. The missile completed its initial operation  testing  last year  . In 2009, the  United States announced a new, more flexible approach to providing  the United States and Europe with the ability to withstand missile attacks, proposing a segmented adaptation plan,  Standard Missile-3BlockIA  was deployed in  March 2011   , marking that the program has achieved the first phase of combat capability. The Quasi-Missile-3 project has completed 26 successful interceptions, and currently more than 180 missiles of this type have been  delivered  to  the United States  and  Japan .

Subject: The U.S. Navy collaborated with the  Missile Defense Agency

522.doctext: The U.S. Navy's  Littoral Combat Ship is undergoing its first simultaneous  deployment of multi-mission  MH-60R Seahawk helicopters and  MQ-8B Fire Scout Unmanned Helicopter.  Helicopter Maritime Strike Squadron 35, Division 1   joined the  Littoral Combat Ship earlier this month for its first  deployment span_8 to  Western Pacific. Doug Kay, director of  HSM-35 Division 1 , said: "I am confident in the capabilities and readiness of our division.  HSM-35 Division 1  will consist of 1  MH-60R  and 1  MQ-8B  . Fire Scout will expand the range and endurance of the  MH-60R  and enhance its maritime situational awareness. The branch being deployed will consist of 24 personnel capable of effectively operating and maintaining the  MH-60R  and  MQ-8B  . Such aircraft are very important to current and future LCS operational concepts. LCS will routinely deploy one  MH-60R  and one  MQ-8B  as part of the ship's surface combat, anti-submarine warfare and mine countermeasures mission packages. As the next generation anti-submarine hunter and counter-attack helicopter, the  MH-60R  is key to the Navy's helicopter operations concept.  MQ-8B Fire Scout provides situational awareness, precise target support and supplementation for  MH-60R , thereby expanding  MH-60R  maritime situational awareness ability.

Subject: The U.S. Navy
Date: joined the  Littoral Combat Ship earlier this month

523.doctext: [According to a report by the US Seapower Network on February 25, 2020] Lieutenant Travis Callahan, spokesman for the US Naval Aviation Command, said that the US Naval Aviation Command has changed the ship-based airborne early warning squadron to air  command and Control Squadron. The Air  Command and Control Squadron  will retain the VAW abbreviation used since 1950.  The U.S. Navy carrier-based airborne early warning squadron is mainly composed of  E-2 early warning aircraft,  E-2 early warning aircraft during the  1965 Vietnam War /span_5 Deployed as a radar early warning aircraft  capable of detecting and tracking air targets and providing radio voice commands and data links, enabling fighter jets to intercept enemy aircraft or cruise missiles. In the following decades, with the development of airborne radars and sensors,  E-2 early warning aircraft  added tasks such as combat management, strike control, ground force support, and rescue coordination. The E-2D advanced Hawkeye early warning aircraft currently being produced by Northrop Grumman will also have modern capabilities such as coordinated operations and naval integrated fire control. Currently, the  U.S. Navy has a total of 10  command and control squadrons, and 4  are stationed at  Point Mugu Naval Air Station in California, 1  stationed at  Marine Corps Air Station Iwakuni, Japan, 5  stationed at  Naval Norfolk, Virginia base.

Subject: The U.S. Navy
U.S. Navy
Location: Marine Corps Air Station Iwakuni, Japan

524.doctext: The United States and the United Kingdom signed an agreement to jointly deploy the Queen Elizabeth Aircraft Carrier Strike Group  United States and  United Kingdom The defense ministers have formally signed the agreement, and the two countries will jointly  spring 2021 span_3 Deployment of   Queen Elizabeth Carrier Strike Group. The U.S. Marine Corps Combat Attack Squadron 211 and the Navy's  HMS Sullivan  guided missile destroyer will participate in the first deployment of the British Royal Navy's  HMS Queen Elizabeth , according to statements from the two countries. The U.S. Marine Corps' VMFA-211 Squadron will participate in the Carrier Strike 21 deployment along with the Royal Air Force's 617 Squadron Dam Breakers. The U.S. Marine Corps is helping to bolster Britain's carrier air wing until Britain can field more F-35B squadrons. VMFA-211 Squadron boarded the  HMS Queen Elizabeth in September 2020. The ship participated in the strike group exercise and the NATO Joint Warrior exercise in October 2020. On January 4, 2021, the United Kingdom announced the Queen Elizabeth aircraft carrier battle The group forms initial combat capability. In the above-mentioned exercise,  Sullivan and  Dutch frigate Ewertsen were in the battle group to escort  aircraft carrier   .

525.doctext: The Australian Government awarded  Daronmont Defense Technologies a three-year, approximately $15 million contract on February 24 to develop and develop coastal surveillance for defense and customs applications. The  new over-the-horizon radar is needed and  provides  related support. The radar is a  High Frequency Surface Wave Radar  and will be  deployed  in  Northern Australia  to monitor Australia's northern coastline. The radar can detect surface ships and low-flying aircraft beyond the horizon, unlike conventional radar systems that are limited by the horizon.  Daronmont Defense Technology Company's technology will enable the over-the-horizon radar to perform large-scale coastline surveillance missions 24 hours a day, allowing the  Australian Government to better Protect fisheries resources and offshore oil and gas facilities, and better combat smuggling and illegal immigration. The radar will also aid in search and rescue operations and early storm warnings. The radar program is a joint investment project between the Australian Customs and the Department of Defense and will be managed by the Australian Defense Armament Agency.

526.doctext: March 27, 2003, a Prowler  EA-6B electronic warfare aircraft   took off from the  United States aircraft carrier USS Constellation successfully The ground launched a  high-speed anti-radiation missile. The  EA-6B  was performing a close air support mission when the pilot received the mission to launch the  HARM missile . Currently, the  USS Constellation Strike Group   is deployed  in the  Northern Arabian Gulf  . After taking off from the USS Constellation aircraft carrier, the  EA-6B electronic warfare aircraft  went to the designated airspace south of Baghdad to perform its mission. While performing a jamming mission in their designated combat area, the pilot received an emergency order to launch  HARM missiles to  support the other three   performing missions in nearby airspace.  Fighter   .  At that time, these three  aircraft were planning to  attack   Iraq three  ground targets in the area Air missile launch site. U.S. Navy officials pointed out that this is the first time that the Lancer fleet has successfully launched a  HARM missile  from a  EA-6B electronic warfare aircraft  to support the U.S. military in Iraq.

527.doctext: KVH Industries announced today that it has been awarded a $6.4 million contract to supply   the U.S. Navy MK54 torpedoes     TG-6000 fiber optic gyro inertial measurement device  . Deliveries of this contract are expected to begin in  first half of 2010  and run through 2011.  KVH Corporation 's  TG-6000 Inertial Measurement Unit  is used to measure the velocity and 3-axis acceleration of navigation equipment on  torpedoes  or other platforms.  The inertial measurement device adopts the three-axis fiber optic gyroscope of  KVH Company, which provides an all-fiber design and patented digital signal processing technology, with high reliability and excellent accuracy. and performance, excellent vibration resistance, shock and acceleration resistance. In addition to the fiber optic gyroscope, the  TG-6000  also includes three accelerometers. This comprehensive inertial measurement device provides excellent performance, high reliability, low maintenance, and easy system integration, making it ideal for various fields, including manned and unmanned aircraft navigation, air and underwater navigation systems.  TG-6000  is also an excellent sensor component in the most stringent and stable pointing applications.  The MK54 lightweight torpedo  is the next generation anti-submarine warfare weapon. It is deployed on surface ships, helicopters and fixed-wing aircraft to track, identify and attack underwater targets. Currently  deployed  on  all U.S. Navy surface and air anti-submarine platforms  , as well as the navies of 25 countries.

Subject: the U.S. Navy
Location: all U.S. Navy surface and air anti-submarine platforms

528.doctext: Russian President Medvede said that  Russia  has no intention of using its naval base on Ukraine's Crimean Peninsula to attack other countries.  Russia and  Ukraine recently signed an agreement for the  Russian Black Navy Fleet to be deployed at the  Sevastopol Naval Base   /span_4 The period of stationing will be extended by 25 years. The naval base lease treaty previously signed between  Russia  and  Ukraine  was valid until 2017. In response to a question raised by a student at Kiev University about whether  Russia might use the military base to attack neighboring countries, Medvedev said,  Russia would not do so and international relations The system will ensure this very well.  Russia  would not violate international law because there would be no benefit to  Russia . Medvedev said that the  Russian Black Sea Fleet is stationed in  Sevastopol not only for  Russia but also for  Ukraine, It is important for Europe and for NATO as a whole because it will ensure stability and security for the entire region. The disintegration of the Warsaw Pact in the late 1980s and early 1990s disrupted the balance of military power in the region and led to changes in the political map of Europe and the occurrence of many military struggles in the region. Medvedev said that in order to extend the lease period of the Black Sea Fleet base,  Russia provided  Ukraine   with  a gas discount worth  worth $40 billion.  .

529.doctext: U.S. Navy aircraft carrier  The  Carrier Strike Group  led by the USS Eisenhower was deployed by  on  July 4 span_4 to  U.S. Navy Sixth Fleet area of ​​responsibility. Prior to this, the  USS Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group  was deployed in the U.S. Navy’s Fifth Fleet. During the deployment of the Fifth Fleet, the  USS Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group successfully completed a 112-day mission in the North Arabian Sea, which mainly included providing services to the  United States and other federal countries Provides sustainment and air  support for Operation Enduring Freedom in Afghanistan. During this period,  Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group  and Carrier Air Wing 7 completed 8,400 attack sorties and 26,100 hours of air combat support.  The Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group left its home port of Norfolk on January 2 this year and began its deployment mission. During its deployment to the Fifth Fleet and the Sixth Fleet, the aircraft carrier group mainly performed Operation Enduring Freedom. Support missions and maritime security operations in the area.

532.doctext: Slovakia  and  Italian Alenia Marchi  appraisal contract, ordering 2  C-27J Spartan transport aircraft  . Slovakia selected the C-27J in December 2008, when the bidding also included the Airbus C-295. The final contract was signed on October 29, 2014, and the contract also included relevant personnel training and service guarantees. The aircraft were delivered in  2016  and  2017    respectively. The new aircraft will replace the An-26 transport aircraft currently in service in the Slovak Air Force. In  January 2006 a  An-24   crashed, killing   42   people span_12  Deaths  , including among peacekeepers returning from Kosovo, have led to Slovakia's determination to replace its Soviet-era transport aircraft. The Slovak military chose the C-27J in the hope of increasing its contribution to NATO and ensuring interoperability with NATO equipment. Alenia Maki has sold 78 C-27Js to 12 countries.

533.doctext: According to Singapore's "Lianhe Zaobao" report on July 18, Indian investigators have found two black boxes of the plane from the wreckage of the crashed  Boeing 737-200 passenger plane, which contained the sounds in the cockpit. Audio and flight data recording. This will provide important clues to the investigation into the cause of the plane crash. An official from India's Civil Aviation Authority said the data in the two black boxes could be decrypted as early as a week later. This 20-year-old United Airlines  Boeing 737-200 passenger plane was  early morning on July 17 near the  Patna Airport in the northeastern Indian city   crashed in a residential area of , and also caused   8   local residents   on the ground to die . Witnesses on the ground said that  one of the  engines  appeared to  burst into flames  before the plane crashed  . Indian officials believe that the visibility at the time was very good and everything was normal when the pilot contacted the control center. From this point of view, it is difficult to determine the cause of the accident. This is the first crash for United Airlines since its establishment in 1996. The company is a division of state-owned Air India.

Subject: Boeing 737-200 passenger plane
Boeing 737-200 passenger plane
Location: Patna Airport in the northeastern Indian city

534.doctext: Two weeks ago,  An Egyptian plane   crashed,  causing  148   people   Died  After two weeks of searching, one of the plane's two black boxes was finally found by a French underwater robot in the deep waters of the  Red Sea and handed over to  Egypt. The black box was found in 1,022 meters of water and appeared to have been severely damaged, but the French submarine captain said the black box was still intact. The black box is bright yellow in color and is designed to withstand 6,000 meters of water for 30 days without being damaged. The location of the second black box has been determined and attempts are being made to salvage it. The successful location of the black box was aided by the use of new acoustic ranging buoys on Wednesday and precise seafloor maps provided by a French marine survey vessel that were used for the first time in practical use. A French submarine rushed to the site of the plane crash the week after it crashed, and eventually an underwater robot retrieved the black box.  The French Comex Salvage Company is using another underwater robot to  help to salvage the first Two black boxes.

535.doctext: A   Mitsubishi /  Lockheed Martin   F-2B aircraft during a  test /span_4  crashed after takeoff during the flight. The plane caught fire after taxiing on the ground.   2   crew members   were injured span_9  . The multi-role fighter was originally planned to be  delivered  to the  Japan Air Self-Defense Force  . According to media videos, the plane was taking off from the  Nagoya runway  when it suddenly crashed to the ground.  Mitsubishi Corporation  said the flames were extinguished 10 minutes after the crash. All the people on board were company employees and were immediately sent to the hospital after the incident. Their injuries were not serious.

Human_Trig: crashed after takeoff during the flight
Subject: F-2B aircraft

536.doctext: Negotiations between Italian airline Alenia and the Slovak Ministry of Defense on the procurement of C-27J transport aircraft will enter an advanced stage of negotiation. Slovakia has selected the C-27J Spartan to meet its future tactical transport aircraft needs and is said to be purchasing at least two. Alenia Company is full of confidence in this negotiation and is very confident that an agreement can be reached in the short term. The Slovak Ministry of Defense also stated that the focus of the negotiation agenda will focus on payment conditions and compensation matters, and said that the Italian company that was finally selected has promised to provide industrial compensation of 100% of the contract value. Slovakia began bidding for a new tactical transport aircraft to replace the An-26 transport aircraft in August last year. EADSCASA participated in the bidding with the C-295, and Boeing and Lockheed Martin also expressed interest. According to the Slovak Ministry of Defense, the purpose of this purchase is not only to enhance the transportation capabilities of the Slovak armed forces and troops stationed abroad, but also to obtain a permanent transport fleet suitable for Slovak citizens. Currently, Slovakia lacks available transport capacity to support emergencies. In addition, this acquisition is also driven by the country's need to modernize its three services after entering NATO in 2004. Because in  January 2006, on the way back from the peacekeeping operation in Kosovo, one of its  An-24  crashed in  Hungary     To   42   persons   died  .

537.doctext: On November 28, a  French Navy  F3 standard Rafale M fighter jet began a close-range mission in the  Arabian Sea  crashed during an air support mission. The pilot ejected safely and was rescued by a helicopter. This Rafale M fighter jet is deployed on the French  Charles de Gaulle nuclear-powered aircraft carrier, which arrived in the   Arabian Sea on November 25   span_8, where the  NATO Task Force   Support mission is performed. The aircraft carrier is equipped with 10  F3 standard Rafale M fighter jets. These aircraft were only delivered to the French Navy at the beginning of this year. This is the first time they have carried out combat missions. Since November 25, Has flown approximately 20 takeoffs and landings. The French navy is investigating the cause of the accident. At present, it is not clear what weapons the crashed Rafale M was carrying.  The F3 standard Rafale fighter is equipped with a new generation reconnaissance pod, a Damocles target designation pod, a rover ground-to-air data link, a near-real-time battlefield situation display and a 30mm aerial cannon, with complete Ground mission capabilities. However, the Navy's M-types are not yet equipped with the Damocles target designation pod.  Last year, the French Navy lost two F2 standard Rafale M fighter jets, of which  one   pilot   was killed,  span_17 In 2007, a  Rafale fighter jet of the French Air Force  crashed during a training mission,   the pilot   Loss of life   , these accidents were attributed to pilot negligence.

Subject: F3 standard Rafale M fighter jet
F3 standard Rafale M fighter jets

538.doctext: A delegation led by Indian Navy Chief Verma has arrived in Russia with the aim of promoting the delivery of three Talwar-class frigates to be built by Yantar Shipyard.  Indian Ministry of Defense  News,  Russia  hopes to increase the price of  Talwar class frigates . The total price of the contract signed in 2006 was US$1.6 billion. The first ship was originally scheduled to be delivered   in April, but it is currently uncertain. The Talwar-class frigates will be equipped with eight BrahMos supersonic cruise missiles jointly developed by Russia and India. Verma will also have first-hand information about the crash of a Russian  MiG-29K fighter jet  last month.  On June 23, a Russian  MiG-29K trainer aircraft crashed in  Astrakhan   , All   two   crew members  on board were killed   . Before the investigation is completed, Russia decided to ground all  MiG-29 aircraft  . The Indian Navy is still waiting for a report from Russia on the accident. In 2004, India ordered 16  MiG-29K fighters  at a price of US$650 million, which were planned to be used on the aircraft carrier Gorshkov. In early 2010, another 29 aircraft were ordered at a cost of US$1.5 billion.

539.doctext: Indian Defense Minister Anthony reported to Parliament that 15  new Russian-made MiG-29K carrier-based aircraft  have joined the  Indian Navy . The MiG-29K will be  deployed  on the  aircraft carrier Vikramaditya , formerly the  Admiral Gorshkov . Anthony also said that India has signed a contract to purchase an additional 29 MiG-29Ks to strengthen the air combat capabilities of the Indian Navy. In 2004, India ordered 16 MiG-29Ks at a price of US$650 million for use on the  Russian-made aircraft carrier Vikramaditya . In early 2010, India ordered another 29 MiG-29Ks at a price of US$1.5 billion.  INS Vikramaditya was being refitted in Russia  June 23, 2011, crashed in  southern Russia   The  MiG-29K trainer aircraft is part of the aircraft carrier deal.

540.doctext: Royal Navy   HMS Montrose  successfully  launched   a Harpoon anti-ship missile  with a range of over 800 miles The target ship sank within a few minutes.  The Royal Navy  continues to conduct exercises and tests on  ships  to build a world-class naval force with strong combat capabilities.  HMS Montrose  deployed at  Devonport Naval Base to participate in the week-long  Joint Warrior military  exercise  Harpoon anti-ship missiles were launched during this period. The missile is 15 feet long and 1 foot in diameter and is launched from a  Type 23 frigate . After being boosted by the rocket engine, the turbojet engine on the missile ignites, causing the missile's flight speed to reach Mach 0.9. One of the purposes of launching the missile was to conduct pre-deployment training for the  USS Montrose  and also to evaluate the missile's combat capabilities against challenging targets.  USS Montrose  Captain James Parkin said: The successful launch of the Harpoon missile proves that the crew has extremely high combat qualities and is able to perform various combat missions.

541.doctext: Earlier this year, a  United States Air Force  HH-60  crashed in   Norfolk    span_4, investigators said multiple bird strikes caused its crash. The helicopter is part of the  56th Rescue Squadron, which is  based at  Leckenhuss, Suffolk, UK,  1 On July 7th   the helicopter  crashed in a nature reserve  near the  seaside village, killing   4 people   The crew member   died  when the helicopter was undergoing  low-altitude  night dual-plane formation flight training. Brigadier General Jon Norman, chairman of the investigative committee, said he found clear and convincing evidence that multiple bird strikes caused the pilot and co-pilot to lose consciousness and disabled the helicopter's balance and flight stability systems. Reports indicate that a  helicopter  flew toward a flock of geese, startling them and causing them to fly out of the wetlands. At least three geese hit the cockpit windshield, knocking the pilot and co-pilot unconscious. There was also at least one  wild goose   that struck  the  helicopter gunner  and also made him  unconscious  . There was also a wild goose that hit the nose of the aircraft, causing the  helicopter  stability system to not work properly. Within 3 seconds of impact, the helicopter tilted left and hit the ground.

542.doctext: Data map:  United States The Army's enhanced version of the Warrior unmanned attack aircraft. span_2  On the morning of the 2nd,  crashed  in  southern Afghanistan  . The US military said in a brief statement that the aircraft crashed while performing a reconnaissance mission, but the cause of the crash is not yet clear. The statement said the U.S. military would investigate this matter. There are currently  about 33,000 US troops   stationed  in  Afghanistan , accounting for about half of the total foreign troops stationed in Afghanistan. Unmanned reconnaissance drones are widely used to conduct reconnaissance and bombing of militant strongholds.

543.doctext: The U.S. Navy's Unmanned Patrol Squadron 19  has temporarily suspended flight operations to investigate the  MQ-4C Mermaid Poseidon  crash landing in  California . Dave Hecht, spokesman for Naval Air Forces Atlantic, revealed:  On the 12th,  Mermaid Poseidon was in Ventura County,   California During the operational  test at the Naval Base, problems were encountered during the flight, and the operator decided to fly the aircraft back to the base. During landing, the aircraft's engines were shut down but the landing gear was not extended.  The aircraft  lands on its belly on the runway. No one was injured and no collateral damage occurred. The Navy is still investigating the cause of the  malfunction  and assessing the loss of the  aircraft . Hecht confirmed that the accident is expected to cost more than $2 million  , meaning it will be classified as a Category A flight accident. Established in October 2016 at Naval Air Station Jacksonville, VUP-19 is the U.S. Navy's first  squadron  composed entirely of drones. The squadron is part of the 11th Patrol and Reconnaissance Wing, and operates  Jacksonville in partnership with the wing's P-8A Poseidon,  performing   maritime surveillance Task.  The U.S. Navy plans  to deploy the first batch of  combat-type Mermaid Poseidon to  Guam  before the end of this year ,  Drones in  California are undergoing pre-deployment  trials work.
