544.doctext: The Navy  is using a stealth defense system  consisting of radar, sonar and imaging equipment to protect   ships and ports  from terrorist attacks. The coastal defense system, developed by CompuDyne, combines information from sensors to alert crews of intruders and protect offshore vessels, shore facilities and other potential targets such as oil rigs. According to sources from the company, the  Navy began signing a contract with the company in October 2000 to develop a defense system to protect ships, mainly due to  terrorism in  span_5 Yemen  stationed in   American   DDG67  conducted a  attack  resulting in  17  span_10  crew members   died and  39   crew members   were injured. As a result, the ship almost sank and had to be shipped back to the United States for repairs. The command center of the defense system is mainly based on personal computer-controlled imaging and radar, and can present the situation in front of the crew with overall images and photos. Sensor information is depicted and recorded in the form of digital pictures. Sonar is used primarily in systems to detect intruders near offshore facilities. Since all naval ships are equipped with sonar systems, they do not need to be installed. (Yu Hong, CSSC Institute)

Human_Trig: consisting of radar, sonar and imaging equipment to protect
Subject: The Navy

545.doctext: The U.S. Air Force has begun an investigation into the first crash of a  B-2 bomber  worth more than $1.1 billion. The crashed  B-2 stealth bomber was a  U.S. military   deployed at  Andersen Air Force Base, Guam 4 B-2 One of the bombers. The aircraft crashed  on February 22  shortly after taking off from the base   . According to the U.S. Pacific Air Forces Command, the two pilots ejected safely and are currently in good condition. The four B-2 bombers stationed at the base were originally scheduled to end this round of deployment, and their missions were replaced by six B-52 bombers. The U.S. Pacific Air Forces Command confirmed that there were no weapons or ammunition on board.

546.doctext: U.S. Air Force B-2 Phantom bomber   February 23 crashed at  Andersen Air Force Base, Guam   span_4 After  all B-2 bombers were temporarily grounded. The cause of the accident is under investigation. A spokesman for the 509th Bomb Squadron said that after a crash, the most prudent approach is to temporarily ground the aircraft. A spokesman for Pacific Air Forces Command said the two pilots of the plane ejected safely, but one of the pilots was receiving treatment at a hospital in Honolulu. The crashed B-2 bomber had a record of 5,100 flight hours and was one of four B-2 bombers preparing to return to Whiteman Air Force Base. These  4 B-2 bombers   have been deployed  to  Guam  for 4 months.

Subject: U.S. Air Force B-2 Phantom bomber
Result: all B-2 bombers were temporarily grounded

547.doctext: The U.S. Air Force has completed the  July 21, 2008   B-52 aircraft crash resulting in  30 miles off Guam     Crew 6  People  All  Fatalities   Investigation of the accident. The wreckage of the crash showed that the tail trim mechanism of the  aircraft  was set at a nose-down state of 4.5-5 degrees. But without survivors, voice communications or other information from the plane's instruments, investigators were unable to determine what caused the erroneous setting. However, despite the lack of data, investigators said there was conclusive evidence that incorrect horizontal tail trim mechanism positioning was the cause of the  aircraft  crash. Other factors that contributed to the accident were:  The aircraft  was making a descending left turn, flying at a low altitude, and the crew was late in realizing the seriousness of the situation. But accident investigators tried to avoid assigning blame to the crew, saying it was very difficult for even experienced pilots to identify, assess and recover from the rapidly induced conditions caused by the position of the horizontal tail trim mechanism. The aircraft belongs to the 20th Bomb Squadron, 2nd Bomb Wing, and is based at Barksdale Air Force Base, Louisiana. At that time, the aircraft was stationed at   Anderson Air Force Base in Guam according to the routine arrangements of the  Air Force.  The aircraft was on a training mission when the accident occurred. , and prepare to participate in the Guam Freedom Day celebrations.

Subject: Air Force
Location: Anderson Air Force Base in Guam

By then, the  South Korean Navy  will  dispatch  its  Songwon-class submarine  and  KDXII-class destroyer  to participate in the exercise. Along with the South Korean Navy, the  U.S. Navy  will  deploy   multiple ships  to participate in the maritime exercise, including an aircraft carrier from the U.S. 7th Fleet. Since the  South Korean guard ship Cheonan was attacked by  North Korea torpedo  and  sank,  South Korea Strengthened naval cooperation with  the United States.

549.doctext: This publication comprehensively reported that  India, which is currently in a state of hostility with Pakistan over the Kashmir issue, has continued to strengthen its military armaments.  Recently used the Republic Day military parade rehearsal in  New Delhi  Displayed  the  latest weapons of the three armed forces.  India  held a large-scale parade for Republic Day on January 26. The three armed forces dispatched multiple troops and the latest weapons to rehearse for the parade. For the Army, the  Armored Forces main weapons  T-72 tanks and  155mm field guns were  unveiled respectively. , and displayed the latest  surface-to-air missile and radar systems. A  Agni-2 long-range missile  which was developed by Indian defense scientists and has a range of 2,200 kilometers and can be equipped with a nuclear warhead was publicly displayed for the second time.  The Air Force  participated in the   day. The parade included Russian-made  fighter planes and  MiG-35 attack helicopters span_16.  Navy   displayed   Russian-made submarines  and pictures of planned aircraft carriers. Last year, the Indian Ministry of Defense announced a number of military development plans to research and manufacture newer weapons for the navy, army and air force.

550.doctext: U.S. Navy   Arleigh Burke-class guided missile destroyer  USS John Finn   in April after completing its first  deployment Return to San Diego on the 2nd. The ship is a member of the  USS Theodore Roosevelt Carrier Strike Group , whose primary mission is to conduct maritime security operations to ensure a free and open Indo-Pacific. In February of this year, the  John Finn participated in a dual-carrier operation with the  Theodore Roosevelt Carrier Strike Group and the USS Nimitz Carrier Strike Group, demonstrating two carrier strikes Group joint combat capabilities. Rear Adm. Doug Verisimo, commander of the Ninth Aircraft Carrier Strike Group, said that the performance of the  John Finn during its first deployment was amazing, seamlessly integrating into the strike group and exceeding all expectations. people's expectations and crossed the Taiwan Strait last month.  USS John Finn departs with the  Theodore Roosevelt Carrier Strike Group and is scheduled to  deploy to the  Indo-Pacific region . Source:  United States Navy  .

551.doctext: "Aviationnow.Com" reported on September 27: A senior Bush administration official said on Wednesday that  the United States is currently deploying troops and working with its allies to collect intelligence, so  in the near future /span_1 A  air strike against the  Taliban terrorist organization is unlikely. After meeting with NATO allies in Brussels, US Deputy Secretary of Defense Paul Wolfowitz said in an interview that  the United States does not want to just show the world the  US military The bombing capability is recognized by the whole world at this point. The Bush administration is currently launching its military deployment in the Gulf region in an orderly manner.  Persian Gulf Currently  deploys more than 100  U.S. military  fighter jets, including B-1B Lancers, F- 15 Eagle and F-16 Falcon, as well as two aircraft carriers and an armored unit. The current munitions and equipment in the Gulf region are enough for the  US military  to use twice its military strength. Wolfowitz said,  The US military is currently under a lot of pressure. This pressure comes from many domestic people who are eager for military strikes. As for military strikes,  the US military still needs to be serious. plan.

552.doctext: The second Borei-class strategic nuclear submarine  Alexander Nevsky  will begin  sea trials  in the next few days.  Alexander Nevsky submarine has passed  mooring tests,  US Navy and  Shevmash Shipyard On  September 30th it was decided to start sea trials. After completing sea trials in the  White Sea  the submarine will  be delivered to the   Pacific Fleet  on a date yet to be determined.  Alexander Nevsky submarine  Construction began in 2004 and  was launched in 2010    .  Alexander Nevsky submarine  is the second Borei-class strategic nuclear submarine in service. The first Borei-class submarine  Yuri Dolgoruki  completed sea trials   earlier this year    December   delivered to   Pacific Fleet .  Alexander Nevsky submarine  is an upgraded version of the Yuri Dolgoruki submarine. The Borei-class submarine will replace the Delta III-class strategic nuclear submarine in the Pacific. There are currently two Borei-class submarines under construction at the  Shevmash Shipyard in Severodvinsk , namely the Vladimir Monomakh and the St. Nicholas submarines.

553.doctext: According to Russian defense industry sources, sea trials of the  Russian Navy   Borei-class Alexander Nevsky submarine  have been postponed due to bad weather. Similarly,  Yurido Ergoruki , the lead submarine of the Borei class, will not conduct a test launch of the Bulava missile. Previously, foreign media said that the submarine would conduct a test launch of the Bulava missile from October 20 to 22. Both submarines are currently docked at the  Sevmash Shipyard  . As soon as the weather improves,  Alexander Nevsky submarine  will immediately head to the  North Sea   to start sea trials . Since  the launch of   in November 2010, the  Alexander Nevsky submarine has been docked at the  Sevmash Shipyard nearly a year.  Yurido Ergoruki submarine is expected to be delivered to   Russian Navy in  2011   The main work of this stage is to carry out  testing of the  Bulava missile system. The results of the test will affect whether the  Bulava missile system  and the  Yurido Ergoruki submarine  are put into service.

554.doctext: The U.S. Army Intelligence and Information Warfare Management Service  awarded a contract to  SRC Corporation  to develop an omnidirectional weapons location radar system. The contract lasts for 32 months and is worth approximately $9 million. Under the terms of the contract,  SRC  will develop and design the  OWL system and produce a technology demonstration prototype for  evaluation in  2013 .  The OWL Radar System will be a state-of-the-art, affordable weapon locating radar system that provides the U.S. military with unprecedented accuracy to detect, track and locate mortars, artillery and mortars through a variety of threat trajectories. The location of the rocket launch site.  OWL Radar  is a multi-mission capable system that provides surveillance capabilities covering a hemispheric area.  SRC Company  is known for its high-tech development capabilities and is a leader in rapid prototype development. Its lightweight counter-mortar radar has been selected as one of the ten greatest inventions of the U.S. military. In addition,  SRC Corporation successfully develops and  tests cutting-edge systems, including the  U.S. Army Enhanced Multi-Mission Radar,  Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency's Vegetation Penetration radar and  the U.S. military’s advanced ground electronic warfare system.

Two missiles have been loaded in the submarine, one is ready to be launched towards Kamchatka, and the other is a fake missile to test the effect of underwater salvo on the submarine. According to foreign news, the Yuri Dolgoruki ballistic missile nuclear submarine was originally scheduled to conduct a missile test from October 20 to 22, but the launch was postponed due to bad weather. The first batch of Borei-class ballistic missile submarines  Alexander Nevsky was also ready to go to sea for the first time, but the bad weather in the White Sea delayed the start of its  sea trials . The Yasen-class lead boat  Severodvinsk attack submarine  is also expected to continue  sea trials  at the  shipyard  under clear weather conditions.  Northern Machinery Manufacturing Plant  must prepare for three submarine tests at the same time, so the time is very tight. Among them,  Yuri Dolgoruki ballistic missile nuclear submarine and  Severodvinsk attack nuclear submarine will be delivered  this year     Navy  .

556.doctext: French DCNS company  will officially  Chasing Wind-class offshore patrol boat  officially  deliver  to  French Navy .  Ingenuity Offshore Patrol Boat is a self-financed project of  DCNS Company, incorporating many major technological innovations.  DCNS Company used it in less than two years The boat was built in just a matter of seconds. After entering service, the  Ingenious offshore patrol boat  will perform operational tasks at sea 220 days a year, and its crew will rotate every four months. In the next three years,  the French Navy will conduct comprehensive  tests of the boat and its advanced equipment and systems, including: commando boat launch slide, panoramic ship Bridges and single-sealed masts with 360-degree views, telecommunications conference facilities, and long-distance acoustic installations. These advanced high-tech equipment enable the ship to better complete current and emerging maritime security tasks. The delivery of the boat once again proves  DCNS Company 's ability to design and build innovative ships, and to keep a tight schedule and strict budget control during the construction process.

557.doctext: The fifth British Royal Navy  Type 45 destroyer HMS Defender built by  BAE Systems recently left Scotstoun Shipyard and headed to  the west coast of Scotland Start Its first phase of  sea trials.  The Defender was launched on  October 21, 2009.   trials to test its speed, maneuverability, electrical power and propulsion systems. In addition,  Defender  will undergo  weapons system   testing  . After sea trials,  Defender  will return to Clyde to continue integration and testing, and will conduct second-stage sea trials in early 2012. The ship is planned to be delivered   to the British Royal Navy  in the second half of 2012   .  The Type 45 destroyer  will become the backbone of the  British Navy  air defense force in the next 30 years. The ship can perform a wide range of missions, including counter-piracy and anti-smuggling operations, disaster relief efforts, surveillance operations and high-intensity combat operations. This class of destroyers can deal with multiple targets at the same time and can defend aircraft carriers and other ships from powerful threats from the air. The ships will provide the  Royal Navy  with specialized air defense capabilities for maritime and joint operations worldwide.

558.doctext: The European Union  and the  United States  conducted their first joint exercise to test their emergency response capabilities for cyber incidents such as cyber attacks. During the 2011 Cyber Atlantic   exercise, two scenarios were tested: the first one was  trying to gain control over the cyber security of the  European Union countries. Attacks on organizations obtaining and publishing sensitive online intelligence; the other is  attacks on monitoring and data collection systems in EU power station equipment. The exercise was led by an EU-US Cybersecurity and Cybercrime Working Group, which was established in November 2010 to deal with new threats to global networks. At the summit in Lisbon in November 2010, EU and US leaders agreed to establish working groups and established four expert groups focusing on the following four different areas: cyber incident management, public-private cooperation, perception enhancement, and cyber security Bo crime. Sony Playstation, the  European Union  Emissions Trading Mechanism, the European Commission, and the European External Action Service have all been attacked by cyberattacks recently. European Commissioner Neelie Kroes said on November 3 that recent high-profile cyber attacks demonstrate that global threats require global action to deal with them. The exercise provided valuable experience to experts on both sides of the Atlantic.

Subject: The European Union

559.doctext: Russia's United Shipbuilding Corporation   Admiral Shipyard  signed a contract with the Ministry of Defense to build the  Igor Belousov lifeboat  . According to the  United Shipbuilding Group office, the vessel will be launched  in 2012    and  delivered in 2014   span_8  Navy  . Currently,  Admiral Shipyard  has completed the construction of the hull and is undergoing outfitting work. The contract signed this time stipulates the specific work in the near future and the future, the installation of various systems, and the necessary equipment and instrument prototypes on the ship. The first ship of Project 21300  Igor Belousov  was designed by Diamond Design Bureau. The hull is made of high-strength steel developed by Prometheus Structural Materials Research Institute. Construction of the ship began in 2005 but was delayed due to funding issues. The lifeboat has a displacement of 5,000 tons and a speed of up to 15 knots. It can provide rescue personnel for accidental submarines underwater or on the surface. It can provide high-pressure air, electrical energy and life-saving equipment for submarines and surface ships. It can also conduct search and reconnaissance of accident targets, including forming an international marine life-saving force.  Igor Belousov lifeboat  It is divided into two types: manned deep-water rescue and unmanned remote-controlled underwater rescue.

560.doctext: Raytheon   tests  the  Advanced Extremely High Frequency Satellite Terminal  .  Raytheon 's  Army Classified Mobile Anti-jam Reliable Tactical Terminal  interoperates with Advanced Extremely High Frequency satellites on the battlefield. The first Advanced EHF satellite, launched in August 2010, is currently undergoing extensive operational testing. During the test, the  Army Classified Mobile Anti-jamming Reliable Tactical Terminal demonstrated the ability to communicate with Advanced Extremely High Frequency satellites using extended data rate waveforms that outperformed previous EHF satellite systems. The transmission rate is increased by 5 times. In addition, the  Army Classified Mobile Anti-jamming Reliable Tactical Terminal  also features backward compatibility with early EHF satellites, demonstrating data exchange performance at low and intermediate data rates. The terminal has been mass-produced and equipped for military use.  Raytheon Company  has delivered  364 sets of  Army confidential mobile anti-jamming and reliable tactical terminals  to the  U.S. Army   .

561.doctext: According to a senior  Russian Navy official, the  Bulava missile  's last  test launch in 2011 has not yet been scheduled Sure. There have been numerous reports over the last week about the timing of the missile test, but the official said no official decision has been made so far. The time for the test launch of  missile  will be determined by the Russian President in December, and the Naval Command is currently providing various proposals for this. This is a crucial matter for the  Russian Navy, because the  Bulava missile is the strategic nuclear weapon of  Russia in the next 15-20 years . The president has the prerogative to decide whether weapons systems enter service and determine the direction of the nuclear triangle. Before entering service,  submarines  and  missiles  must undergo joint sea trials.  Yuri Dolgoruki submarine has completed  sea trials and will next be combined with  Bulava missiles  Sea trial.  Last week the  submarine Yuri Dolgoruki returned to Severodvinsk after completing all mechanical and system  tests naval base.

In Brazil, the mission systems developed by DRDO will be integrated with the aircraft, and these systems are currently undergoing ground integration and evaluation in  India  Bangalore. AEW&C aircraft can detect enemy aircraft or drones and provide information relay for ground bases. The most critical mission system component is the active phased array radar developed by DRDO.  In 2013  , two sets of AEW&C systems will be delivered to the Indian Air Force after detailed  testing  and evaluation. In addition, the Indian Air Force also plans to purchase two more Falcon early warning aircraft based on the IL-76 platform. Previously,  India  had purchased 3 aircraft of this type.

563.doctext: The Japan Air Self-Defense Force  has completed  testing  of the  Patriot-3 system  , developed by Raytheon, during annual military exercises. The exercise included target engagement and successful test firing of the  Patriot air and missile defense system  under a tactical mission arrangement.  JASDF 's annual  military exercises  lasted from  October 8 to November 19  and involved approximately 380  JASDF  personnel Participated in this year’s mission. During the ASP, Patriot Fire Force members  performed multiple missions against a variety of targets  and Raytheon provided corresponding support services. Japan is one of 12 countries selected to conduct combat testing of the Patriot, a key component of the air and missile defense program. Raytheon is the domestic and international prime contractor for the  Patriot air and missile defense system  and the systems integrator for the Patriot Advanced Capability-3 missile. Raytheon and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries have signed a licensing agreement, under which Mitsubishi Heavy Industries becomes Japan's Patriot prime contractor and manufactures enhanced guided missiles and related ground equipment for Japan.

564.doctext: The U.S. Navy plans to conduct a test launch from a  submarine  during the  2012   Pacific Rim   joint military exercise   Aviation Environment Company’s disposable folding-wing drone   .  The Navy also awarded a contract to  Raytheon to develop submarine-launched unmanned vehicle technology that would allow submarines at periscope depth to launch using their garbage disposal components Drone.  Submarine-launched unmanned vehicle  is responsible for bringing the  drone  to the water and helping it eject and take off. This contract is a continuation of the submarine beyond visual range capability project and requires the development and production of 5  submarine-launched unmanned vehicles and  supporting drones,  Raytheon Company  In  2008 a  submarine-launched unmanned vehicle and its  supporting drone  were conducted on the side of a surface ship.  Demonstration  . According to the concept of submarine beyond visual range capabilities,  Submarine-launched unmanned vehicles and electric-driven drones are stored integratedly on the submarine. When used, they are ejected outside the submarine through the submarine's garbage disposal device. Initially, The own counterweight sinks to a safe distance from the hull, then detaches from the counterweight and inflates the floating raft. The floating raft controls the floating speed through pulse inflation. As it surfaces, the  submarine-launched unmanned vehicle  deploys a floating anchor to provide stability and extends a weathervane to determine wind direction. Then the launch tube tilts to 35 degrees and ejects the  folding-wing drone .  Raytheon upgraded the  folding-wing UAV, conducted shore  testing and produced it for tactical development exercises, according to demonstrators and approvers. 5  submarine-launched unmanned vehicles and 7  supporting drones.

565.doctext: As 2012 approaches, the  Indian Navy , which has always regarded Pakistan as an opponent, has begun to promote modernization efforts to cope with the increasing influence of other countries in the Indian Ocean. According to forecasts,  Indian Navy ’s blue ocean strategy and warship procurement projects will bring investment opportunities worth approximately US$12 billion.  The Indian Navy  has currently placed an order for a new stealth submarine, and a refurbished  Russian aircraft carrier  will also be commissioned in 2012. An Indian official said that in 2012,  India will continue negotiations with  Russia on leasing nuclear-powered submarines, and the two countries will also jointly develop fifth-generation fighter jets and multi-purpose transport aircraft ,  Gorshkov aircraft carrier will also be delivered  in December 2012   .  The Indian Navy's  missile defense system has also been improved through the import of Israeli Barak missiles.  India  also plans to test   nuclear missiles  on its submarines  which have been in development for a decade.

566.doctext: Airbus Military Aircraft Company  The fifth and final  production A400M aircraft  joins the Grizzly flight test fleet.  On December 20th , the aircraft's  first flight  was successful and lasted 2 hours and 10 minutes. The aircraft is numbered  MSN6 . The first flight crew is two experienced pilots and three test engineers. The take-off weight is 125 tons. As of  the end of December,  Grizzly Fleet has completed more than 2,500 hours of flight  testing, and a total of 3,700 flight hours need to be completed before the first aircraft is delivered. .  The practicality of MSN6  will play an important role. It is the first aircraft produced according to the required configuration and will be used to complete electromagnetic interference tests and cargo compartment development tests, as well as extreme cold weather tests and verifications. The aircraft will complete 300 hours of functional and reliability testing to conduct test verification before  A400M  is put into service. The Grizzly fleet will launch a large number of test projects in 2012, including increasing the proportion of military tests, and preparing for the delivery of the first aircraft in  2012-2013  .  Delivered   French Air Force 's first  A400M transport aircraft , numbered  MSN7 , which is currently in the final assembly stage.

567.doctext: The U.S. Navy  recently completed the development and testing phase of its  networked weapon, the Joint Standoff Weapon C-1 .  JSOWC-1  is the first networked weapon of the US Department of Defense.  At the end of 2011 completed  testing at Point Muguhai, California span_5. This also allows the weapon to enter the comprehensive testing stage ahead of schedule. This medium-range air-to-ground precision-guided gliding weapon uses a GPS/inertial navigation system and a terminal-guided imaging infrared seeker to provide soldiers with a new strike capability in anti-ship operations. The recent free flight test  demonstrated  the effectiveness of  JSOWC-1  against moving maritime targets, verifying that weapon parameters meet performance requirements. The weapon hit a 17-meter-long ship 27.78 kilometers away. The test also demonstrated command and control of the weapon in flight, verifying the ability to hand over control to a third-party platform.  In 2012  ,  JSOWC-1  will also conduct 2 free flights  tests  and 2 ground flights  tests  . After the comprehensive testing phase is completed, the project will enter operational  testing  in  2013  .

Each  PK patrol boat  is equipped with a  LM500 gas turbine , which uses a combination of diesel engine and gas turbine, with a rated power of approximately 5,600 horsepower. 570.doctext: Northrop Grumman  says it has begun flight  testing  of the first  Multi-Function Active Sensor Radar  . The radar will be used on the U.S. Navy's MQ-4C wide-area maritime surveillance drone. Following completion of ground station testing last November, the sensor has been integrated into the company's  Gulfstream II test aircraft  and is ready for flight  testing  . Northrop Grumman said that the first BAMS drone wing has been delivered. In the next few months, the  MFAS radar  testing process will be broken down into radar integration, mode integration, and technology improvement and data collection.  MFAS sensor  uses a rotating sensor that incorporates electronic scanning technology to provide flexible mode switching between various monitoring methods.

571.doctext: Raytheon Company of the United States  has officially restarted production of the  AGM65E2/L laser-guided Maverick missile . Prior to restarting production,  the U.S. Air Force and Navy conducted a development test/operational use test program using F-16, A-10, F/A-18 and AV-8B aircraft platforms  Tested 15  Laser-guided Maverick missiles, attacking stationary targets and moving targets respectively. These targets include frigate-level ships, small speedboats, tanks, infantry hidden in bunkers, and vehicles moving at a high speed of 110 kilometers per hour.  AGM-65E2/L laser-guided Maverick missile  The restart of production is based on a contract awarded by  Raytheon  in late 2011. The contract requires the company to  provide  15  AGM-65E2/L  , with delivery starting  at the end of 2012  . According to  Raytheon  , U.S. allies can also purchase the  AGM-65E2/L laser-guided Maverick missile  through foreign military sales agreements.

572.doctext: Russian Infantry Testing  Future Soldier System    Russian Army 5th Special Infantry Brigade Soldiers in  February 2012 In the second half of the year, a combat  exercise was conducted at the  Alabino military base outside Moscow, and   tested the new C4ISR system  Strelets system , equivalent to the Western soldier system.  Strelets System  Weighing 2.4 kilograms, it includes a small receiver and inertial navigation system to provide target location and blue force tracking data. The system can be used within a 1.5-kilometer range while maintaining radio contact, allowing each soldier to act as a relay station to extend the distance over which deployed troops can maintain communications. The system also improves the protection capabilities against interference and data transmission when being interfered by a large number of enemy forces. It can also be equipped with a laser identification identification friend or foe subsystem.  Strelets system  adopts an open architecture design and can be connected to a variety of reconnaissance, control, aiming and target designation devices, radars, range finders, direction finders and drones.

573.doctext: The U.S. Army said it will conduct Network Integration Assessment 12.2  Exercise in  May 2012   Test One A Web-based  system . The system incorporates real-time combat data and intelligence accumulation. The Combat Data and Intelligence Aggregation Project will provide commanders with real-time intelligence to immediately plan and adjust operations. Combat data refers to current event information, such as location information and ongoing activities of both the enemy and ourselves. Intelligence refers to data and analysis collected over time about the enemy and the environment. This system, known as the  Combat Data and Intelligence Integrated Prototype System , will be integrated into the larger NIE architecture to support formal operational testing of the Warfighter Tactical Information Network Increment 2. Using a rugged laptop equipped with the  P-OIC System , Soldiers can log into the web-based Ozone framework and access specialized software required for their specific mission.

574.doctext: Reports say the  F-22 Raptor was finalized on  March 15, 2012 at  Lockheed Martin in  Georgia Marietta factory  first flight. The company's test pilot Bret Luedke piloted the  aircraft  with Air Force serial number  10-4195  for an initial airworthiness flight of approximately 1.5 hours. After final preparatory training and exterior coating of the aircraft, the  Raptor 4195 aircraft will be delivered  in early May    to Alaska  3rd Flying Group at Elmendorf-Richardson Base. The Elmendorf-based Raptors are being flown by pilots from the active-duty 90th and 525th Squadrons and the 302nd Air Force Joint Reserve Squadron.

575.doctext: The Israeli Air Force is  testing a self-developed  helicopter control monitoring system. The purpose of this system is to monitor the fatigue status of helicopters in order to implement more effective Anti-fatigue methods. With industry unable to provide a solution, a team of engineers from the  Israeli Air Force designed the new system, which is currently undergoing flight  testing and is planned to  upon completion  Installation of all helicopters belonging to the Israeli Air Force. Helicopter pilots are currently required to report all maneuvers that may cause fatigue, but combat exercises have proven this method to be ineffective. Israeli Air Force engineers also developed an ingenious patch: installing an electronic chip on parts of the fuselage that are prone to cracks to provide early warning of cracks.

Prior to review by the Navy Board of Review and Inquiry, builder sea trials will test the  ship  and the performance of its systems to identify possible construction errors. The ship completed the first phase of builder's  sea trials  in  October 2011  . During the two-day sea trial,  Marinette Shipping Company conducted comprehensive tests on the ship to inspect the  propulsion device and  ship maneuvering and auxiliary systems. After completing the acceptance test, the  USS Fort Worth  will be delivered to the   US Navy  in June this year   . A combat ship is a fast, agile, mission-specific ship designed to deal with asymmetric attack threats from mines, submarines and high-speed surface ships. The Milwaukee is being built by  Marinette Ship Company; Coro Both the Nadeau and the Jackson were built at the Austal Shipyard in Malby, Alabama, USA.

578.doctext: On April 13, 2012, the first F-35 fighter jet manufactured for a foreign user - the  BK-1 F-35B Lightning II fighter jet manufactured for the United Kingdom was launched in  span_2 Lockheed Martin's test pilot Bill Gigliotti successfully completed the 45-minute  first flight. During the first flight, test pilots checked a series of functions of the aircraft. Next, the aircraft will complete a series of manufacturer's own and  government functional checks  test flights before being  delivered to  UK Ministry of Defence . The latter will place the aircraft at  the U.S. Air Force 's Eglin Air Force Base, where it will begin training flights and operational  trials   later this year  . The first  F-35  produced for  Netherlands  left the factory on April 1.  The Netherlands  will use a conventional takeoff and landing aircraft, called the  AN-1 , for training and operational testing of pilots and maintainers.  AN-1  will undergo functional fuel system inspections before transitioning to the ground flight line and will undergo flight  testing  in the weeks thereafter.  The Royal Netherlands Air Force  will continue to be at the forefront of flight testing and pilot training, and will remain in the field of advanced fifth-generation fighter aircraft.

NASSCO  has delivered  the first 13 dry cargo ammunition ships of this class to the  US Navy   . During the launch ceremony, the  U.S. Navy  will also christen the boat.  The T-AKE class dry cargo ammunition ship  adopts international maritime technology and commercial ship design, including the application of an integrated electric propulsion system, which will minimize operating costs during its 40-year service life. During the 12-year-long T-AKE project,  NASSCO  implemented more than 20,000 methods to reduce project costs and improve project quality.  The T-AKE class dry cargo ammunition ship  has a cargo capacity of more than 10,000 tons and a maximum cruising speed of 20 knots. 580.doctext: Indian Garden Ridge Shipbuilding and Engineering Company  has laid the keel for the  1320-ton offshore patrol vessel  ordered by the  Mauritius Coast Guard . The shipyard began construction of the ship in late 2011 and said the ship will be launched  within the next 12 months   . The ship is India's first  naval ship  built for the export market. The shipyard is expected to deliver the ship in  July 2014    ahead of the delivery time specified in the contract. India and  Mauritius began discussing matters related to the contract in 2007, and finally reached an intergovernmental agreement in July 2010, and signed it with  Gardenridge Shipyard in March 2011. A construction contract worth US$58.5 million was awarded. The Indian government provided US$10 million to invest in the project, while the remaining US$48.5 million was loaned to Mauritius through the Export-Import Bank of India. The ship is 74.1 meters long, 11.4 meters wide and has a draft of 3.5 meters. It is designed based on the Vikram-class offshore patrol ship of the Indian Coast Guard. However, there are several obvious differences with this ship. In the middle of the hull, because  Mauritius  requires a 13-meter-long landing craft, the design must be adjusted. The propulsion system uses two MTU16V4000M53 diesel engines to drive two adjustable-pitch propellers, with an estimated speed of 20-22 knots. The cruising range is 5,000 nautical miles and the battery life is about 4 weeks. The ship's crew is 62 people. The ship's flight deck can carry medium-sized helicopters.

581.doctext: The U.S. Navy  has agreed to participate in the Indian Navy's light fighter program, participating in testing and providing feedback to the  Indian team . Following Russia and Europe, the  US Navy Aircraft Carrier Adaptability Test Team  has become the latest advisory team to join the LCA project. The LCA project faces many problems, one of which is that the weight of the prototype exceeds the weight requirement for aircraft carrier-based aircraft by 500 kilograms.  The US testing team  is expected to resolve this issue. According to Indian media reports, the  US testing team  will provide free services. In 2011, the European Aerospace Defense Group joined the LCA project to help developers reduce the weight of the aircraft. At the same time,  Russia's Gromov Research Institute conducted  tests on the  Kaveri engine on a  I-76 engine test aircraft  and completed 55 hours of testing.  The Indian Navy LCA-NP1 aircraft , also known as the  Tejas fighter  ,  just completed its  first flight  a week ago  .

582.doctext: The Brazilian Navy successfully conducted a test launch of the  Exocet MM40 missile   aboard the  Ihauma-class multi-purpose frigate Barroso , the successful test launch indicates that Brazil has the ability to develop anti-ship missile engines. The  demonstration  is part of Brazil's $38.68 million Exocet MM40 missile upgrade program.  The test missile is equipped with an engine produced by Brazil's Avebras Aerospace Industry Corporation. This test launch demonstrates and confirms the performance of the  missile at its maximum range. . The missile warhead weighed 165 kilograms. Under the guidance of the inertial and active radar guidance systems, the  missile  flew 70 kilometers at a maximum speed of Mach 0.93. The commander of the Brazilian Navy said that the test was a major recent success for the  Brazilian Navy . The warhead of the test missile was replaced with a telemetry component from Maitron to provide real-time relevant parameters of the missile under test, such as turnover rate, pressure and cruise trajectory. This test launch confirmed the propulsion technology of the  Exocet MM40 missile , making mass production possible. Through a partnership with the European Missile Group, the missile engines produced by Avebras can be used in missiles produced by other countries in addition to domestic use.

583.doctext: Bombardier Aerospace today announced that its new  C Series aircraft hydraulic system has been installed on  Aircraft 0 - the company's ground system test tower. The  hydraulic system  will be used together with the  electrical system  installed earlier this year to conduct  testing  of the integrated system verification of the C Series family aircraft before the first flight. It is now possible to operate the aircraft's flight control surfaces, thrust reversers and landing gear actuation systems, an important milestone.  Hydraulics  The successful installation was supported by hydraulic work package supplier Parker Aerospace and other structural and systems suppliers who provided piping components.  Aircraft 0  Also known as the fully integrated aircraft systems test area, it is located within the  Bombardier Mirabel factory in Quebec , 40 kilometers north of Montreal.  This year  various systems will be installed for ground verification  testing  in preparation for the  first flight  .

584.doctext: According to "Aviationnow" on November 8, 2001:  Pratt & Whitney Canada completed the first  test run of the  PW625F engine demonstrator. This is the company's first  test run The beginnings of a new family of turbine engines being designed for small aircraft. After 5 hours of testing,  PW625F  reached the maximum takeoff thrust of 1113daN, and the engine's operating characteristics were much better than expected. The engine reached the milestone on time, clearing the way for  first quarter 2002  flight  testing  on the company's  Boeing 727 aircraft  . The company launched the PW600 series engine demonstrator program in August 2000, and reached an agreement with Raytheon in July to explore the possibility of the PW625. The thrust range of the PW600 engine series is 445~1113daN. The demonstrator plan will shorten the development cycle for future model development. After type development begins, production engines can be delivered within 36 months.

585.doctext: C-295  with winglets is undergoing wind tunnel testing  Airbus Military Aircraft Company 's latest disclosure will affect the  C-295 medium transport aircraft  and  span_3 Special aircraft conduct some enhanced flight  tests. These aircraft are equipped with winglets to improve efficiency and are equipped with anti-ship missiles. In the next 12 months, the company will conduct comprehensive  tests of the  Helmet Display Enhancement System and equip it with an airborne inert gas excitation system to improve the battlefield survivability of twin turboprop engines force.  C-295  will also be equipped with Marte anti-ship missiles to meet customer market demand for deterring maritime piracy threats. The Chilean Navy has proposed that  C295  needs to be equipped with Mk46 torpedoes to meet its anti-submarine warfare needs. Marte anti-ship missiles may also be installed on this type of aircraft. OBIGGS may be installed at the location of the wing fuel tank. Ground testing of the system has been completed and flight testing will be conducted in the fourth quarter of this year. The  demonstrator aircraft equipped with winglets will be  tested in 2013  . The performance of this type of aircraft in take-off, climb and cruise will be effectively improved. , possibly through modification of existing aircraft.  Airbus Military Aircraft Company  said that the installation of new systems comes from customer needs, and it will continue to install airborne early warning and control systems, provided by Israel Aerospace Industries. In addition,  Airbus Military Aircraft Company  is developing  C295  and CN235 armed transport aircraft.

586.doctext: The  Baltic Shipyard  in St. Petersburg, Russia, will start building components of the Mistral-class amphibious ship in August. According to the contract signed between Russia and the French company DCNS in 2011, part of the structure of the amphibious ship will be built in Russia. This will help the  Russian Shipyard  to update its production facilities and improve work skills. In this way, with the help of French STX shipbuilding experts,  Baltic Shipyard  will manufacture the amphibious ship. The third  Mistral-class amphibious ship Dixmode built for the French Navy was  launched at the end of 2011   ,  STX  Preparations for building the first amphibious ship for Russia began. The first two  Vladivostok and  Sevastopol amphibious ship are expected to be launched in  2014 and  2015 span_11  Delivered to   Russian Navy , about 80% of the construction tasks of the first ship will be completed at  STX Company , about 20% of the construction tasks Completed in the Baltic Sea; according to the agreement,  Baltic Shipyards will triple the construction ratio of the second ship. Both ships are being assembled in French shipyards, and subsequent negotiations for the two ships are still ongoing in Russia.

587.doctext: Russia's Little Star Ship Repair Center is renovating the  Sindhurakshak diesel-electric submarine for the  Indian Navy and will soon be  launched .  Ship Maintenance Center  Representative said that after launching, the  submarine  will first undergo mooring  test  and then  sea trial  . Delivery to the   Indian Navy  is planned for   by the end of  this year. In June 2010,  Little Star Ship Maintenance Center  signed a maintenance and modification agreement for  Sindhurakshak Submarine  with the Indian Ministry of Defense. The work plan is to last for 27 months.  Little Star Ship Maintenance Center  is an enterprise specializing in the maintenance and effective utilization of nuclear submarines. Since 1997, it has modified four 887ЭКМ diesel-electric submarines for the  Indian Navy .  Sindhurakshak  is the fifth submarine converted for  India . Type 887ЭКМ diesel-electric submarines are mainly used to fight enemy submarines and surface ships, protect naval bases, shore and sea lines of communication, and perform reconnaissance and patrol operations. The Type 887ЭКМ diesel-electric submarine has a displacement of 2,300 tons, a length of 72.6 meters, an underwater speed of 19 knots, a diving depth of 300 meters, a crew of 52, and a self-sustainability of 45 days. This type of submarine is equipped with six 533mm torpedo launch tubes. After modification, it is equipped with Russia's modern Kraber-S cruise missile with a range of up to 200 kilometers, as well as India's USHUS sonar and CCS-MK radio communication system. .  Sindhurakshak submarine  was built for the  Indian Navy  at the Admiralty Shipyard in St. Petersburg in 1997.

588.doctext: On June 26, 2012,  the Korean Navy  confirmed that it would use Rolls-Royce's  MT30 gas turbine engine  as the power plant for the second batch of newly built FFX-class frigates. The second batch of FFX-class frigates plans to build 8 ships, which will be built by Daewoo Shipbuilding & Marine Engineering. The first ship has been determined to use  MT30 gas turbine . A spokesperson for Rolls-Royce declined to disclose the price of the contract as negotiations are ongoing, but a contract is expected to be signed by the end of July.  The first batch of FFX-class frigates purchased by the Korean Navy are two  LM2500 gas turbines provided by  General Electric Company    .  MT30 gas turbine  was previously only used on large ships and the USS Liberty littoral combat ship. Two new British aircraft carriers and the US Navy's DDG-1000 destroyer also use this type of gas turbine. This type of engine selected by the  Korean Navy will be built in  Britain and  tested. It will be shipped to South Korea in mid-2014. Before being installed on the ship, Hyundai Heavy Industries will complete the integration of the power system, including air intake, exhaust and supporting equipment. South Korea's second batch of FFX frigates adopt a hybrid design, using  MT30 gas turbine  and an undetermined diesel engine. A spokesman for Rolls-Royce said that Rolls-Royce will also participate in the bidding for propellers and other equipment for South Korea's second batch of FFX-class frigates.

589.doctext: On July 5, 2012, Australian Defense Minister Stephen Smith and Defense Materiel Minister Jason Clare announced that  the Australian Navy had ordered the second  amphibious assault ship HMS Adelaide /span_1 Officially  launched at  Navantia Shipyard in Spain. The Australian government has purchased two new Canberra-class amphibious assault ships for the Australian Defense Force. They will become the two largest warships of the  Australian Navy  and one of the most advanced amphibious combat platforms in the world. The new amphibious assault ship is larger than the previous aircraft carrier Melbourne of  Australian Navy , with a total length of more than 230 meters, a depth of 27.5 meters, and a displacement of 27,500 tons. Each ship can carry more than 1,100 joint combat troops, 100 armored vehicles, 12 helicopters, and is equipped with a 40-bed medical area. As a subcontractor of BAE Systems Australia,  Spanish Navantia Shipyard will be responsible for the hull construction and outfitting of the two amphibious assault ships, and then transfer them to Australia, where BAE Systems will be located in  Shipyard in  Williamstown, Australia  completed superstructure integration and  installation of  combat and communication systems. The hull of the first  amphibious assault ship USS Canberra will arrive in Australia at the end of this year, after which it will undergo the integration of the superstructure, the installation of  combat and communication systems, and  commissioning /span_13 etc., is expected to be delivered to the  Australian Navy in  2014   .

590.doctext: Lockheed Martin and  LaserMotive recently  demonstrated an  innovative laser charging system that can span_4 The flight time of the Stalker drone has been extended to more than 48 hours, and the durability of the original flight has been increased to 2400%.  Stalker  is a  small silent drone  used by the US Special Forces since 2006 to perform intelligence surveillance and reconnaissance missions. The indoor flight  test  was conducted in a  wind tunnel . During the test, an improved  Stalker UAV was installed with  LaserMotive 's dedicated system, which allows it to wirelessly transmit energy over long distances and use laser light to provide the UAV with A constant source of power. The conclusion of the test showed that the drone battery stored more energy after the test than at the beginning of the test, exceeding the endurance target originally set by the team. "This test is one of the final steps in bringing the  laser charging system  to the battlefield," said Tom Nugent, president of LaserMotive. By charging during flight, the system will expand drone capabilities, improve durability and give drones new missions. Our next step will be to conduct charging tests of  Stalker drone  outdoors.

591.doctext: After a delay of approximately six months,  Lockheed Martin has begun deliveries  of its latest batch of  F-35 Joints to the  U.S. Department of Defense   Attack Fighter. Marillyn Hewson, chief operating officer of Lockheed Martin, said that the  Department of Defense has  received 3  conventional take-off and landing F-35A  and 1  Short takeoff and  vertical landing F-35B aircraft . The initial small batch production of 3 batches of aircraft is scheduled  at the end of 2012  and  delivery  will be completed. There are 17 aircraft in this batch, including 2  F-35B  from  Britain  and 1  F-35A  Netherlands   ,  US Air Force 's 7  F-35A  and  US Marine Corps 's 7  F-35B  are both Already rolling off the company's Fort Worth assembly line. LRIP3 batch aircraft are awaiting formal acceptance in accordance with the DD250 process. The four new aircraft will join  Eglin Air Force Base 's existing fleet of 12 aircraft. Six of the  F-35A aircraft   this summer  will be used for combat commonality  evaluation ; pilots will fly the aircraft to test the pilot training program. The results of this assessment will be used to determine whether the Air Force agrees to begin formal pilot training, which is not expected to begin until 2013.

592.doctext: The first of the four new missile patrol boats ordered by the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force  Hayabusa is being outfitted at the  Japan Mitsubishi Corporation Shimonoseki Shipyard. It is planned to be delivered  in March next year . The ship was  launched on June 13  by means of a crane barge  . The new ship’s power system uses an LM2500 gas turbine, with a maximum speed of 45 knots.  Hayabusa class  will be equipped with Otto Breda 76/62 high-speed cannon, four SSM-1B anti-ship missiles and two 12.7 mm machine guns.

594.doctext: The U.S. Army and  Raytheon   recently  completed the  warhead   of the new Accelerated Improved Interceptor System Test. Once equipped, AI3 will be able to provide combatants with a new level of protection, that is, it can effectively destroy threatening targets such as incoming rockets, artillery shells, and mortar shells. Such a land-based system could draw on mature technologies from many of  Raytheon's  programs, such as the Sidewinder air-to-air missile and Small Diameter Bomb II projects. AI3 will be equipped around 2014 and will save the lives of more soldiers. This successful test proved that the warhead equipped by  Raytheon Company  for AI3 can meet various design indicators. The test marks a key milestone in AI3's 18-month development plan, which has seen six different warheads evaluated. AI3 is a rapid acquisition program being managed by the Army's Counter Rocket, Artillery and Mortar Program Directorate and the Program Executive Office Missiles and Space Division. The testing of these warheads met or even exceeded all test objectives, clearing the way for system integration and testing in  2012 and ensuring that  Raytheon Company can meet the timeline Provide the  Army   with  such  weapon systems which are in high demand.

595.doctext: Pall Company  announced on August 15 that the U.S. Office of Naval Research has authorized the company to conduct a multi-phase project to develop an advanced marine desalination system to cope with the difficult task of coastal waters.  Pall Corporation  will detail water treatment systems for Navy ships to increase freshwater power generation and reliability while reducing energy and maintenance requirements. Whether participating in exercises at sea or returning to shore, warships require highly reliable water treatment systems to meet their fresh water needs. In addition, traditional desalination technology is often unreliable due to its high degree of energy and resource intensity. Coastal seawater treatment is particularly difficult due to the presence of very high concentrations of suspended solids as well as biological and organic pollutants.  The U.S. Navy  is also limiting the use of chemicals on ships, using throttling methods at land-based desalination plants.  Pall Company will provide  mature  hollow fiber microfiltration and reverse osmosis membrane products to the  Navy   to solve these problems . In the first phase of the six-month project,  Pall Company  researchers will use the latest membrane technology to design a solution capable of producing 15 cubic meters of drinking water per day. The second phase of the project will last for one year, with  Pall Corporation  developing a  prototype system  and testing it  on the ground  . In the final phase of 18 months,  Pall Corporation will  test a  fully compatible system on a  ship for a period of 18 months 6 months.

Subject: Pall Company

Yuri Dolgoruki submarine completed  December 2011 including  test launch of   Bulava missile including a series of  sea trials. The second Borei-class submarine  Alexander Nevsky will also be further  sea trials in  November  Bulava missile  test firing. The Borei-class submarine will become the core of Russia's strategic nuclear deterrent force and replace the Type 667 submarine.  Russia plans to build a total of 8 submarines of this class, each of which will be equipped with  Bulava. Submarine-launched missile. It is said that  the Type 885 Yasen-class former submarine Severodvinsk  will be put into service at the end of this year, and the boat is currently undergoing  sea trials  .

597.doctext: The U.S. Air Force said on the 20th that it will begin using  Boeing Company's new  surveillance satellite to track space debris and other satellites operating in space. It has been nearly two years since the first surveillance satellite was launched into space. The Air Force Space Command said the new space-based surveillance satellite system has achieved initial capabilities and is ready to support the needs of the  U.S. military  after a delay in linking an electronic device onboard the spacecraft. The system is the only space-based sensor that detects and monitors debris, satellites and other space objects independent of weather, atmospheric and day and night factors. These factors limit ground systems. New space-based surveillance satellite systems greatly enhance the ability to provide timely, critical information that warfighters need to make decisions. The surveillance satellite was launched in  September 2010   .  Boeing Company  predicted that it would begin its mission within 60 days, but due to the electronics on the satellite Problems with the equipment delayed its initial operational capability date.  The Air Force began maintenance work in May 2012 and subsequently successfully  tested the  software and restarted the  satellite . The satellite will help the  military  better track other satellites in orbit and thousands of pieces of space debris.

598.doctext: The U.S. Army awarded  Lockheed Martin  a $64 million contract to develop technology for the Joint Air-to-Surface Missile. The 27-month extended technology research project includes three phases: design of the  JAGM guidance system ,  testing  and  demonstration .  JAGM guidance system  includes seeker, front cowl and shell.  Lockheed Martin's  JAGM missile's  guidance system leverages knowledge from some of the proven precision-guided weapons on the battlefield today, including the Hellfire , longbow and javelin, a company spokesman said. Our  JAGM weapon systems  provide significant performance improvements to meet warfighter needs and save lives.  Lockheed Martin has successfully designed and  tested two guidance modes on the  JAGM missile: Precision Strike Semi- Active laser guidance mode, and all-weather fire-and-forget millimeter wave guidance mode on the Longbow. A single, inexpensive advanced missile  JAGM  will provide warfighters with flexible operating modes, greater combat effectiveness and survivability.

599.doctext: Sources said on Tuesday:  Russia's AdmiralteiskieVerfi shipyard  provided  Vietnam  with a  Kilo-class Type 636 diesel-electric submarine  that has been launched. The boat is the first of six  submarines  ordered by  Vietnam . In December 2009, Vietnamese Prime Minister Nguyen Tan Dung announced a contract worth nearly US$2 billion for six  submarines  signed by both parties. Relevant people from the AdmiralteiskieVerfi shipyard said earlier today: The first boat will be launched on  Tuesday , and will soon be followed by  sea trials, as planned The boat should be delivered to   customers  by the end of   . All six  submarines  will be delivered  by 2016    .  Kilo-class Type 636 submarine  has a displacement of 3,100 tons, a maximum speed of 20 knots, a maximum diving depth of 300 meters, and a crew of 52 people. The boat is equipped with a 533mm torpedo launch tube and is equipped with torpedoes, mines, and Kaliber3M54 cruise missiles.

600.doctext: The Royal Navy's sixth and last  Type 45 Valorant-class anti-aircraft destroyer HMS Duncan left the shipyard on  August 31 on the  west coast of Scotland The first phase of  sea trials begins. During the three-week sea trial, the  BAE Systems-built  Duncan will  demonstrate its  power and propulsion system /span_7 Verify.  The first three Type 45 destroyers  are already in service with the Royal Navy, and the fourth one also started performing tasks in the fleet earlier this year. The fifth ship has successfully completed the second and final stage of  sea trials  and will enter service in early 2013. The  USS Duncan destroyer  with a displacement of 7,500 tons was launched  in 2010    and is scheduled to enter service in the first half of 2013.  The Type 45 destroyer  will become the backbone of the British Royal Navy's air defense force in the next 30 years or more. This type of ship can perform a series of tasks including anti-piracy, anti-smuggling, disaster rescue, surveillance and high-intensity air defense operations. Each destroyer can engage multiple targets at the same time and can protect the aircraft carrier or fleet of ships against the strongest air threats in the future. This class of ships will also provide professional air defense combat capabilities for global maritime and joint operations.

601.doctext: The Swedish Defense Procurement Agency will deliver the first modernized  Visby-class corvette Visby   to the Swedish Navy   . The Commander of the 41st Corvette Squadron of the Swedish Navy said that before the  Visby corvette is officially put into use, a series of  tests will be conducted. Currently  Sweden The Navy is training 43 sailors on the operation of the  ship and its systems.  Visby-class corvettes  were built by  Kockum Company  and are mainly used to perform anti-mine and anti-submarine warfare missions, as well as provide support for anti-surface ship operations. This type of corvette is 73 meters long, 10.4 meters wide, has a displacement of 640 tons, a maximum cruising speed of 35 knots, and is equipped with a set of anti-submarine warfare equipment, a 127 mm caliber rocket-propelled grenade launcher, depth bombs and torpedoes.  Visby corvette was originally delivered  in June 2002    to the  Swedish Navy , second and third The third and fourth ships were both delivered in  2006   , and the fifth ship was launched in  August 2006    . All five  corvettes  will be refitted and delivered in 2014.

602.doctext: U.S. Navy   September 6 Successfully completed  F/A-18E/F Super Hornet  and  EA-18G Growler Electronics Fighter   New mission computer  flight  test , which will improve the performance of both fighter aircraft. The new  Advanced Mission Computer Type 4  improves computing performance and enhances imaging and mission processing capabilities. Newly added systems include a distributed target designation system, an infrared search and tracking system and a touch-screen display system. The F/A-18E/F and EA-18G mission system director said that the  Type 4 Advanced Mission Computer  gives pilots the computing power to change the rules of the battlefield. The test flight was conducted at the  Navy China Lake Air Combat Weapons Station. The  Advanced Mission Computer was tested for 90 minutes on the  F/A-18F . Test whether it meets key security and system indicators.  The Navy  will also organize subsequent  tests  .  Boeing  will deliver  the first  Type 4 Advanced Mission Computer  to the  Navy   in 2014.

New Type 4 Advanced Mission Computer  increases computing power and image and task processing speed.  The fighter  will incorporate these efforts to support new systems, including distributed targeting systems, infrared search and track, and new high-definition touchscreen displays. The AMC test was conducted at  Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake, California . The test flight lasts for 90 minutes and tests whether it meets key safety and system requirements. There are also other testing plans.  Boeing will deliver the first batch of  Type 4 AMC-equipped  Navy   in  2014  Super Hornet and  Growler  . General Dynamics Advanced Information Systems is  Boeing's  main AMC supplier.  The F/A-18E/F Super Hornet  is a low-altitude observation, multi-purpose aircraft. 604.doctext: The U.S. Navy's second  Joint High Speed ​​Transport Ship JHSV2 Choctaw City was launched on  October 1, 2012 in  Mobile, Alabama    launched, reaching a key milestone in the ship's construction process. A total of 10 joint high-speed transport ships are planned to be built. They will be built by  Austal Shipyard in the United States . They are a general-purpose, non-combat transport ship that will be used to quickly transport troops, military vehicles and equipment in theaters. Henry Stevens said: As the second Pioneer-class joint high-speed transport ship, the successful launch of  Choctaw City is an important milestone for the entire project.  Choctaw City  was built based on the experience of the JHSV1 Pioneer, so it was more complete than the Pioneer when it was launched. The Joint High Speed ​​Transport Ship was designed to commercial standards with only limited modifications to suit military use. The ship can transport 600 tons of supplies and sail 1,200 nautical miles at a speed of 35 knots, and can work in ports and channels with shallow drafts. The ship also has an aviation flight deck that can support aircraft flight operations day and night. There are three cities in the United States named Choctaw City, located in Mississippi, Alabama and Oklahoma.  After delivery of   U.S. Navy Military Sealift Command ,  JSHV2  will officially become a U.S. Navy ship, with a core crew of 21 to operate and navigate the ship.

It is mainly used for  testing of the   KC-46A tanker span_7 comprehensive avionics and software testing. 608.doctext: As reported by Defense Data on December 3, 2001,  DRS Technologies Inc.  has been awarded a new contract from EDOM. Technologies Inc. to manufacture and  test the   BRU- 57 Smart bomb rack components and parts. The bomb pylon is installed on the U.S. Air Force's F-16 Fighting Falcon attack aircraft. Technologies, DRS Technologies will manufacture and  test  cable and wire harness assemblies , and system synthesis electronics. This new contract strengthens EDO.M Technologies -.  DRS Technologies  technical capabilities, making it the leading supplier of mission-critical combat multipliers for the F-16 fighter jet.

609.doctext: According to a report by International Defense Daily on November 23, 2001: Boeing completed a concept study on the Precision Joint Direct Attack Munition. Last week, a spokesman for Boeing said, Future versions of the weapon will require a  seeker. Precision  JDAM  will provide attack aircraft with the ability to engage fixed and moving targets. Precision  JDAM  Initial plans said the weapon would be integrated into the F/A-18 aircraft being developed by  Boeing  for use by the Navy.  JDAM  is an iron-cased bomb equipped with a tail assembly and a GPS guidance system.  Boeing  will keep the cost of precision  JDAM  under $40,000. The current cost of  JDAM  is about $20,000. The exact  JDAM  required  seeker  would be a low-cost  seeker  . This  seeker  will increase the circular probability error of the weapon to more than 3 meters.  The U.S. Air Force  and  The Boeing Company  are preparing to  evaluate  the proposed  seeker  option.  The Boeing Company  About Precision  JDAM  A contract for the design, development,  testing  and initial production will be signed early next year.  The U.S. Navy has  tested a  seeker that can withstand direct attack munitions, during a  demonstration test , the seeker enables the weapon's accuracy to reach 1 meter in the event of GPS guidance failure. The cost of DAMASK is estimated at $20,000, but the seeker does not meet the needs of attacking mobile targets.

610.doctext: U.S. Navy The tenth  Virginia-class submarine USS Minnesota is built at Huntington Ingalls Industries'  Newport News Shipyard   Launch. The submarine's construction work is currently about 92% complete. After being launched, the submarine will undergo final outfitting and  testing  work.  Newport News Shipyard Vice President said that the construction progress of  USS Minnesota is about one year ahead of schedule, and the construction time used is about 600,000 hours, which is higher than that of the same class. There were fewer submarines in the first few.  The USS Minnesota submarine is 377 feet long, has a hull diameter of 34 feet, can accommodate 134 crew members, and has a submersible speed of 25 knots. It is a multifunctional stealth nuclear-powered submarine that can complete tasks including anti-submarine and anti-ship , special missions, intelligence collection, surveillance and reconnaissance. In addition, the boat can also provide support for mission operations in shallow and deep water areas. The boat is equipped with the AN/WLY-1 underwater warning/countermeasures system and the AN/BLQ-10 electronic support system, which can perform full-spectrum radar processing, automatic threat warning and situational awareness. Due to the use of a nuclear reactor device, the boat does not need to be refueled during its operational life, which will greatly reduce the submarine's life cycle maintenance costs and extend the submarine's endurance.  The USS Minnesota submarine was officially named on October 27 and is scheduled to be delivered  at the end of the first quarter of 2013     U.S. Navy .

613.doctext: General Atomics Aeronautical Systems has partnered with  NASA Dryden Flight Research Center to develop and test it on a  Predator B UAV New command and control satellite link capabilities. Under the no-cost Space Ace agreement signed in September,  NASA  and  General Atomics  will upgrade the  MQ-9 Predator B drone  span_6Command and control system enables aircraft to operate in more remote areas. After the upgrade, the  drones  will be used to conduct system  testing  and flight  evaluation  to achieve the goals of both parties.  Dryden Flight Research Center Chief Scientist Bob Curry said that this new capability will allow Ikhana to support  NASA  scientific research missions at high latitudes, especially many important Geophysical research. In recent years,  UAVs  have demonstrated traditional applications in airborne research in the Earth sciences, particularly where their long endurance allows crews to travel deep into remote harsh environments.  General Atomics  said that in addition to advancing science, the  NASA  flight research will also pave the way for opening the national airspace system to  drones  .  The Predator B UAV will conduct marginal ice area observations and process  tests in  the summer of 2013, and  NASA  will  Provide   related systems and engineering and technical personnel to support the Ikhana mission and observe changes in  Arctic ice areas.

614.doctext: December 11th,  US Navy   F-35C Lightning II test machine numbered CF-5 in Texas, USA   test flight was successful in Fort Worth, State. The aircraft was the last  F-35C test aircraft for the Patuxent River Naval Air Station Integrated Test Force,  The main function of the test machine is to verify the suitability of aircraft and warships and to conduct high-angle-of-attack tests.  The F-35C Lightning II fighter is very different from the F-35A and F-35B. The aircraft has a larger wing surface and enhanced landing gear, which makes the  aircraft Able to withstand the effects of catapult takeoff and deck landing on an aircraft carrier. Prior to formal delivery to the fleet, the  F-35C  has been undergoing flight  testing  and related evaluation at  Naval Air Station Patuxent River  .

615.doctext: This hydraulic test is the 9th round of testing according to the 2012 construction schedule, of which 7 tests were completed by the 9th workshop of the Russian Admiral Shipyard.  In 2013  the shipyard will face new challenges - accelerating the construction of 2 series of  submarines  and conducting another 10 hydraulic  tests  . Currently,  Russian Admiral Shipyard is building three improved Kilo-class submarines for  Russian Navy. The first submarine  Novorossiysk was The keel was laid in August 2010, and it is planned  to be launched at the end of 2013   . The keel of the second Rostov-on-Don was laid in November 2011, and the keel of the third Starskol was laid in August 2012. In total, the  Russian Navy  will receive  6  Kilo-class submarines  in  2017   and form a fleet. The shipyard is also responsible for an order for six Kilo-class submarines to be exported to the Vietnamese Navy, with a contract value of approximately US$2 billion. Construction of the first boat Hanoi started in 2009 and entered the floating construction stage in August 2012.

616.doctext: Airbus Military Aircraft Company has completed the key functions and reliability of the A400M  test. The aircraft used is the  developmental A400M Grizzly 5 , which meets this standard The  production aircraft can fly up to 15 flight hours per day. Due to problems with European Propeller International's  TP400-D6 engine  , the  flight test launched in the middle of this year was stalled for several months, but the function and reliability testing has accumulated 300 flight hours. The work resumed in early November and lasted 26 days and 52 flying hours, with two flights per day. In addition, it takes 6 days to perform routine maintenance work. Completing functional and reliability tests is an important task node.  Airbus Military Aircraft Company will apply for civil type certification from the European Aviation Safety Agency and initial combat capability approval from OCCAR more quickly. This will Both tasks will be completed in the first quarter of 2013, and the first  production A400M  is planned to be delivered to the French Air Force before the end of June 2013. Alonso, director of flight test and system testing at Airbus Military Aircraft Company, said: The flight crew is very satisfied with the performance of the A400M onboard system and engine.  The company  is very confident in obtaining military and civilian type certification in the future.  Next year   France  will  receive  3  A400M  ,  Turkey  will  receive  /span_15 1 frame.

617.doctext: United Engine Manufacturing Corporation  announced that the   test  of the  engine for the  MiG-29K/KUB carrier-based fighter  was successfully completed. A company spokesman said:  Turbofan engine  The development work will be completed in the autumn. The test was conducted in accordance with the requirements of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation.  RD-33MK  Developed by the Klimov Design Bureau for the  carrier-based fighter MiG-29K/KUB , starting in 2013,  Russian MiG Corporation  Start  delivery of  MiG carrier-based aircraft that installs  new engines and meets the  Navy requirements. In terms of performance,  RD-33MK  has increased thrust by 7% while maintaining the shape and weight of the engine. The engine is equipped with a modern digital automatic control system FADEC. At the same time,  Aircraft  also maintains the advantages of the basic type: fewer restrictions on aircraft control during takeoff, and a higher margin to external disturbances.  RD-33MK  is also equipped with vector nozzles developed by the Klimov Design Bureau, thereby improving the flight performance of the  aircraft . The development of  RD-33MK  was started under a contract with MiG in 2004 for the  MiG-29K fighter  with a  new engine  The  fighter made its first flight in  2007  and took off from the aircraft carrier deck in 2009.

618.doctext: 14  Nuclear Waste Management Organizations and  Research Institutes from 8 European countries are participating in a US$20.51 million technology development project to  test   Plugging and sealing systems for deep geological repositories for radioactive waste. The project, entitled Plugging and Sealing Demonstration, started in  September 2012 and will end in  August 2016 and is sponsored by the  Euratom Seventh Framework  Program  provides approximately 55% of  funding support. The project aims to compile the design basis for end caps and seals, develop new technologies for end caps and seal materials, perform complete or partial system design, and conduct 5 complete plugging and sealing tests. The DOPAS project team will organize an international seminar on plugging and sealing technology for deep geological disposal of radioactive waste in 2016. Finnish nuclear waste management company PosivaOy is coordinating the project, which includes a complete series of underground demonstrations, laboratory experiments and performance evaluations at research facilities in the Czech Republic, Finland, France and Sweden.

619.doctext: December 21, 2012,  Airbus Military Aircraft Company  C295 medium transport aircraft   equipped with future potential upgrade projects made its first flight Successfully, the winglets were modified to enhance the efficiency of take-off, climb and cruise phases. This flight test was conducted at the  São Paulo factory in Spain, and a series of flights will follow  Test, used for collection of test data. In May,  Airbus Military Aircraft Company disclosed that it was conducting modification research to improve the flight performance of  aircraft at high-temperature and high-altitude airports, including range and durability, and reduce its use cost.  C295  with modified winglets is a special mission configuration equipped with Elta Systems' airborne early warning and mission air guidance system,  2012 on this platform A rotating antenna was installed on the aircraft, and aerodynamic  tests were also conducted for verification. If verified through tests, the winglets will be installed on the new  C295 aircraft , providing customers with more model choices. According to the Flight Global Database, 16 aircraft of this type have been delivered or ordered.

The main contents of this maintenance work include maintenance, repair, modification and  testing . About 400 workers will be involved and it is expected to be completed in December 2013.  USS Mississippi was delivered to the   U.S. Navy by  Electric Boat Company in  May 2012   , delivery was a year ahead of schedule and its construction cost was $60 million below budget.  USS Mississippi  is the ninth  Virginia-class submarine  . The Virginia-class submarines are the world's most advanced submarines, helping the  U.S. Navy  achieve undersea combat superiority in this century.
