621.doctext: Lockheed Martin has successfully completed the  system   test required for the  U.S. Navy second Mobile User Target System satellite .  MUOS-2 Satellite Already ready for  July  launch, the MUOS constellation will provide greatly improved security for mobile warfighters Communications, including simultaneous voice, video and data services. The first  MUOS satellite was launched on  February 24, 2012   . It is planned that by 2015, the MUOS global constellation consisting of 5 satellites will receive Full operational capability. Lockheed Martin's narrowband communications mission area director said:   The U.S. Navy and  Lockheed Martin joint team has been integrated and  tested span_13 With the  MUOS-2 satellite,  Lockheed Martin is looking forward to the launch of this key satellite and will continue to produce MUOS satellites.  In the spring of 2013,  Lockheed Martin will move the  MUOS-2 satellite out of the storage room for final spacecraft parts equipment and final trust. degree  test, and then the  satellite will be shipped  and transported to  Cape Canaveral Air Force Base.  The satellite  will be launched by an Atlas-5 rocket. MUOS satellites carry wideband code division multiple access payloads with 16 times the throughput of current UHF satellite systems. Each MUOS satellite also carries a UHF payload.

Subject: The U.S. Navy and  Lockheed Martin joint team

622.doctext: The U.S. Air Force  recently announced that it has  tested  a  new airborne wireless router system  that will provide real-time tactical information to troops on the ground in the battlefield. The main difference between this router and the usual router is that this router is connected to a fighter jet. It is essentially a software upgrade known as  Net-T , designed for the advanced targeting pods of some fighter jets and B-1 bombers. Ground troops can remotely operate the video-enhanced receiver to communicate with fighter jets using a small touchscreen device that can be mounted on the arm. These troops can only communicate with aircraft in the air and cannot communicate beyond visual range with other ROVER-5 equipped personnel. But with the upgrade of  Net-T , ground troops equipped with ROVER-5 can communicate directly through the  wireless router  on the aircraft. Once the pilot activates the pod's NET-T transmission mode, he must remain within the range of the ROVER transmitter and within the user's field of vision, while the pod receives little or no interference. The test team at  Elgin Air Force Base   tested  the range and capabilities of the  router  by tracking the size and type of files sent.  NET-T  is expected to be installed on fighter aircraft in 2014.

623.doctext: India's Project 877EKM  Sindurakshak diesel-electric submarine was refitted at Zvezdochka Shipyard in  Russia and was  delivered again to   Indian Navy . The modification contract for the boat was signed in June 2010. The modification work mainly included the installation of Klub-S cruise missiles and the installation of more than ten systems made in India or abroad, including the Ushus sonar system and CSS-MK-2 radio communication system. , upgraded the cooling system of the  submarine, installed radio wave detectors, and other modifications to enhance the combat capabilities and safety of the  submarine. The boat will travel to Mumbai via the northern sea route on January 29, accompanied by a Russian icebreaker. This is the first time that India has received a  submarine  in freezing conditions.  INS Sindhurakshak submarine was built in 1995,  was launched in 1997   , and was delivered to  Indian Navy . The boat has a displacement of 2,300 tons, a crew of 52, a maximum speed of 19 knots, and a diving depth of 300 meters.

624.doctext: The sea trials conducted on the  Russian submarine Alexander Nevsky  also included the test firing of the  Bulava missile  in July this year, TASS reported on Monday. According to insiders in the Ministry of Defense,  from the end of June to early July this year,  Alexander Nevsky will conduct further  sea trials, including Maneuvering tests, electromagnetic field measurements, torpedo testing and other activities. The testing campaign will culminate with the  test launch of the Bulava missile   ordered by Moscow in July, followed by the ship  Submarines equipped with a new fully automatic combat missile launch control system will be delivered. If the test launch goes as planned, the  submarine  will return to the Northern Shipyards for further work. It later entered naval service as the second  Borei-class submarine . We hope by autumn.  Russia  plans to build 8 Borei-class and Borei-A-class submarines for the Northern Fleet and Pacific Fleet by 2020. Each boat will carry  Bulava missiles  . The development process of this type of missile was difficult, and many  test launches  failed.

He reminded that the industry needed to deliver the two submarines  Alexander Nevsky and  Severodvinsk as early as 2012, however, due to some events affecting the delivery date was rescheduled for the following year. Senior representatives of the defense industry complex said that in  2013   the Russian Navy will finally  acquire the   Alexander Nevsky,  Severodvinsk and  Vladimir Monomakh submarine. Among them,  the submarine Vladimir Monomakh   was launched in December 2012 at the  Severodvinsk Shipyard   . He added that the  Alexander Nevsky will  test-fire the first  missile  in June or July this year /span_16 . In addition,  this year   the Lada-class diesel-electric submarine St. Petersburg  will enter service after completing  sea trials  in the  northern waters . Currently, the submarine is undergoing  testing  for reliability. Russian shipbuilding is reportedly delaying the delivery of five ships for the Russian Navy by a year, including two  submarines and three  surface ships.

626.doctext: Picture: British Royal Navy  Type 45 destroyer HMS Duncan   British Type 45 destroyer HMS Duncan  will be delivered  on March 20th     Navy, the ship is currently undergoing  sea trials before delivery.  Duncan  is the sixth and final Type 45 Valorant-class air defense destroyer built by  BAE Systems  for the  Royal Navy . The  USS Duncan destroyer  with a displacement of 7,500 tons was launched  in 2010    and is scheduled to enter service in the first half of 2013. The Type 45 destroyer will become the backbone of the  British Royal Navy  air defense force in the next 30 years or more. This type of ship can perform a series of tasks including anti-piracy, anti-smuggling, disaster rescue, surveillance and high-intensity air defense operations. Each destroyer can engage multiple targets at the same time and can protect the aircraft carrier or fleet of ships against the strongest air threats in the future. This class of ships will also provide professional air defense combat capabilities for global maritime and joint operations.

627.doctext: The U.S. Navy's   future aircraft carrier catapult launch system  completed an independent  test Friday  .  Aircraft Ejection and Recovery Equipment Project Office 's  Electromagnetic Aircraft Ejection System  completed the motor sharing  test  .  EMALS  It was first installed on the CVN-78 Ford aircraft carrier to replace the steam ejection system on the existing aircraft carrier. The person in charge of the  EMALS integration team said that before conducting the shipboard  test on the  4 electromagnetic catapults, the test ensured that the motors in the land-based facilities could Proper allocation and operation is important to reduce the risk of problems on the ship. The electromagnetic catapult uses a linear motor to generate an electromagnetic field, and the electromagnetic field drives the slider to accelerate the aircraft. The electric motor uses its rotor to store the system's inertial energy and releases this energy during ejection from the aircraft.  EMALS  is composed of 6 subsystems, and the shared components are responsible for providing power to the 4 catapults on the ship. There is currently only one catapult at the test site, so the system can only control one launcher.  EMALS  completed the functional  demonstration   verification  stage of  system  in  November 2012 . The team is preparing a site with four catapults to simulate the shipboard environment.

Subject: The U.S. Navy's

628.doctext: Russia's United Shipbuilding Corporation stated that  Russia's third  Type 955 Borei-class nuclear-powered strategic submarine Vladimir Monomakh  will In  June this year,  sea trials began in  Beihai.  The submarine Vladimir Monomakh   was launched in December last year    and is expected to enter service in 2014. The first  Type 955 Beifeng-class submarine has been commissioned in January this year, and the second one will  be delivered at the end of this year   . Currently  Sea trials are in progress. All three submarines will carry 16 Bulava submarine-launched ballistic missiles. Russia plans to build a total of eight Borei-class submarines by 2020, with the next five being improved 955A Borei-class submarines. The Sevmash shipyard will start building the first and second 995A Borei-class submarines this year, which will be able to carry 20 ballistic missiles. The Borei-class submarines will replace the old Type 941 Typhoon-class submarines and Type 667 Delta-class submarines and become the main strategic deterrent force of the  Russian Navy .

629.doctext: The  774th Expeditionary Transport Squadron   tested a new airdrop program designed to improve the accuracy and efficiency of airdrops, based on a single-pass airdrop at Bagram Airfield, Afghanistan. In the plan, a  remotely controlled aircraft released a  airdrop detector at a specified point near the airdrop area to collect for the approaching  transport aircraft Meteorological data. During the  test on  March 18, the squadron's  C-130 transport aircraft successfully received  detector data , but no actual airdrop was attempted. Capt. Andrew Standeford, the squadron's precision airdrop system operator, said using the  detectors  to help establish wind profiles will help crews deliver supplies as accurately as possible. Airdropping the probe from a different platform means that  transport aircraft  no longer need to make two passes over the airdrop area, reducing the number of times  aircraft  are exposed to threats. SPAid also makes it easy to shorten delivery time. According to Robert Olson, a joint terminal attack manager with the U.S. Air Mobility Command's 817th Expeditionary Air Support Operations Squadron, which sponsored the SPAid test, this shaved 40 minutes off the normal time required.

Before 2015,  destroyers,  cruisers and  large amphibious ships will also be  installed   /span_11 Torpedo early warning/anti-torpedo countermeasures system.  TWS/CAT  consists of a towed array sonar that detects and identifies torpedoes and anti-torpedo torpedoes. Installing  TWS/CAT  on  CVN-77  In addition to  testing  various types of  torpedoes  attacks, it is also possible to provide sonar Operators provide training and collect data for future improvements to the system software.

632.doctext: U.S. Navy  The third  Littoral Combat Ship USS Fort Worth  has successfully completed final contract sea trials and has returned to Naval Base San Diego. The sea trials, hosted by the U.S. Navy Review Board, were part of a series of post-delivery tests that rehearsed, tested and corrected as needed the  ship  and its primary systems. During the four-day final contract sea trial, the  main propulsion system,  combat system, and  57 mm caliber naval gun of the  ship were tested The launch and recovery capabilities of  and  rigid inflatable boats were  tested. Post-delivery  testing of the  USS Fort Worth will be completed within a year, while  Littoral Combat Ships  The test took a long time because the problems of both ships needed to be confirmed and solved.  Littoral combat ship  is a high-speed, flexible, shallow-draft  multi-functional surface ship . It is mainly used for operations in offshore environments and can also perform various tasks on the high seas.  Littoral combat ship  Functionally complementary to other ships in the surface fleet, it has the ability to resist and eliminate evolving threats independently or in conjunction with other surface ships.

636.doctext: After a three-year delay,  Indian Space Research Organization  is preparing to conduct its first  Winged Reusable Launch Vehicle Technology Demonstrator  later in 2013. According to the latest 2012~2013 annual report of  ISRO , the review committee has clearly approved the  RLV-TD  hypersonic flight in  September 2013 Task. The  trial  was originally planned for 2010. As a preliminary step towards developing a fully reusable two-stage orbital rocket,  ISRO  expects to conduct a series of  technology demonstrator flight  tests . Currently, the demonstrator has been installed as a flight test platform and has the capabilities of autonomous landing, powered cruise flight and hypersonic flight using an air-breathing propulsion system. The  RLV-TD  with side and tail fins will be placed on top of a solid rocket booster for launch. At the start of the test,  RLV-TD  will perform an unpowered flight, eventually powered by an air-breathing scramjet engine.  RLV-TD  and the rocket booster will return to Earth separately.  RLV-TD  can land on a runway like an airplane, with the booster rocket landing via a parachute. The report states that the development of scramjet engines in India is currently at an advanced level.

Subject: Indian Space Research Organization
ISRO

638.doctext: Raytheon's  Improved Sea Sparrow missile was recently fired  from a   U.S. Navy self-defense test ship , eliminated a high-altitude diving supersonic target threat. "This launch resulted in a fantastic interception, and this success is a direct result of a series of improvements made to this truly international cooperation missile," said Raytheon Missile Systems' Vice President of Naval and Regional Mission Defense Product Lines. It is the continuous efforts and improvements of the multinational team that enable each cooperative member country to achieve strong protection of its respective fleets based on the interoperability of  ESSM  with multiple combat systems.  ESSM  can provide important multi-layer defense capabilities, implement defensive fire strikes, and deal with high maneuverability overload anti-ship cruise missiles, supersonic high-speed dive target threats, low-speed air target threats, and surface target threats. Recently, the  ESSM  was also successfully launched from a ground-based system   , demonstrating that the missile's performance on the ground matches that on the water. Importantly, demonstrating the improved capabilities of  ESSM  did not require software changes.

639.doctext: The U.S. Navy announced on July 2, 2013 that  in June successfully conducted a  long-range land attack projectile at the  White Sands Missile Range 's guided flight  test. A total of 4 artillery shells were fired during the test, all of which hit a distance of 83 kilometers. The test was successful  Demonstration  It demonstrated artillery firing, GPS signal acquisition, navigation and guidance, certain high-altitude explosion fuze, and warhead damage capabilities. This round of live-fire launches is part of the engineering and manufacturing, development stage land-based flight certification.  Long-range land attack artillery shell is a  155mm rocket-assisted guided artillery shell, designed to be equipped with the advanced naval gun system of the DDG-1000 class destroyer to support land attack Attack and maritime fire support missions. The test was managed by the Navy's Program Executive Office for Integrated Weapons Systems, a division of Naval Sea Systems Command that manages surface ship and submarine combat systems and technologies and coordinates open architecture on ship platforms.

640.doctext: The U.S. Air Force  has approved communications  testing  for the  Advanced Extremely High Frequency Satellite  . Recently, Canada became the first international partner to use the satellite for communications. According to Lockheed Martin, a team composed of U.S. and Canadian personnel successfully used a SMART-T communication terminal to connect to AEHF-1 near Ottawa, Canada. Users were able to communicate with the U.S. Air Force at Schriever Air Force Base in Colorado. The 4th Space Operations Group conducts data exchange. Since then, the  United States has also supported the  Canadian Forces   tested a variety of  Navy multi-band IP terminals and  AEHF networks  data exchange. Canada will continue testing for several months before achieving initial operational capability. The Netherlands and the United Kingdom, as international partners of  AEHF , are scheduled to complete the first terminal connection by the end of the year. The communication capacity of a single  AEHF satellite  is greater than that of a military constellation of five satellites. The data transmission rate of individual users will be increased by five times, and it can transmit military communication information such as real-time video, battlefield maps, and target targeting data. In addition to military applications,  AEHF  also provides emergency confidential communications to national leaders, such as presidential meetings in various conflict situations. According to the contract,  Lockheed Martin  will provide a total of 6  AEHF satellites  and ground control equipment. Currently, AEHF-1 and AEHF-2 are in orbit,  September 2013 will  launch   AEHF-3 ,  AEHF-4  On track.

641.doctext: The Spanish company Navantia  announced that the  Cold Mistral submarine   will start  sea trials  on July 4th  . This is the final stage of the submarine's refit at the  Cartagena Shipyard . A total of 8 sailings are planned for  this month  and all  tests  will be completed. The company plans to deliver the submarine   to the  Spanish Navy  in  this September  and guarantee that it will be able to serve normally for 5 years.  The submarine Cold Mistral  has been at the  Navantia Corporation 's  shipyard  for 18 months. From the company's personnel department to subcontractors at all levels, a total of more than 200 people participated in the fourth modification of the submarine.  Chill Mistral  is the third of the four Agosta-class submarines. It was launched  on 14 November 1983    and  delivered to the Spanish Navy on 5 June 1985    . This time is the fourth major modification of the submarine.

642.doctext: India 's first  navigation satellite IRNSS-1A  will begin a week of  trials  of its payload. The chairman of the Indian Space Research Organization said that  India 's indigenous navigation satellites will cover a range of 1,500 kilometers around the Indian continent, providing standard positioning services for civilians and more accurate navigation services for military authorized users. After the satellite payload is tested, it will be able to provide services for India's strategic decision-making. India will join the ranks of countries with navigation systems. On August 6 or in the following week,  India  will launch the GSAT-14 communications satellite using the Geosynchronous Satellite Launch Vehicle-D5. The  GSLv cryogenic engine  flight  test  will be carried out in  August .

643.doctext: The Israeli Navy is preparing to expand its submarine force. These submarines are the  Dolphin class built for it by  Germany and are considered to be the only ones in the Middle East capable of carrying and launching nuclear warheads. Missile capable  submarine. According to reports, the three submarines already in service cruise as far as the  Indian Ocean waters in southern Iran. The fourth  Dolphin-class submarine Tanin was launched in  in May 2012.   Delivered   to  Israeli Navy ,  sea trials and evaluation are in progress, expected in a few months will officially serve. The fifth  Lahav was launched  on April 29 this year in  Kiel, Germany    and is expected to be launched in 2014 In the middle of the year, he arrived in the northern city of Haifa, the headquarters and main base of the Israeli Navy's submarine force. The sixth and most advanced  Dolphin-class submarine was contracted in May 2012 and is expected to be delivered  in 2017     to the Israeli military  .  The Israeli military has disclosed little information about the purpose of the  Dolphin-class submarine, but it is generally believed that there are roughly three aspects: in the  Red Sea and  Indian Ocean /span_22 on  patrol; on  Mediterranean on  patrol; in Haifa for modification,  Dolphin-class submarines can be carried The Mariner turbine cruise missile developed by Israel's Rafael Advanced Defense Systems. It is reported that this type of cruise missile can carry nuclear warheads. In 2002, the US Navy tracked  Israel to secretly launch this type of missile in the Indian Ocean. Hit the target nearly 950 nautical miles away.  The Bamachaneh magazine of the Israeli military  revealed that the number of soldiers recruited into the Israeli Navy's submarine force has increased by 30% recently, and the number of trainees has increased by 35%.

The predecessor of this aircraft carrier is  the former Soviet aircraft carrier Gorshkov .  Recently  the aircraft carrier successfully passed the main engine test in the final  sea trial  and  Russia  has officially informed the Indian Ministry of Defense. A Ministry of Defense official said that the Russian Severodvinsk Shipyard, which is responsible for the modification of the Gorshkov aircraft carrier, has informed the Ministry of Defense that the main engine  will be tested /span_10 focus on testing the  propulsion system of the  aircraft carrier. After a series of delays, the delivery date originally scheduled for the end of 2012 was delayed again due to problems with the boiler of the  Vikramaditya  that were discovered during sea trials last year.  INS Vikramaditya  will next conduct ship-aircraft collaborative training with the Russian-made MiG-29K carrier-based aircraft. Sources from the Indian Ministry of Defense said that although India has paid more than twice the original contract, it is impossible for India to impose a breach of contract penalty on  Russia because  Russia has already refused India demanded this and had threatened to cancel the contract.

645.doctext: The Australian Navy tested the  Standard 2BlockIIIA air defense missile system in mid-course guidance mode on the  Adelaide-class frigate in  July this year  Conducted live-fire  testing. On August 5, a spokesman for the Australian Department of Defense confirmed the news to reporters. Ray Griggs, deputy chief of staff of the Australian Navy, said that the successful launch of the missile marked the completion of a series of tests,  experiments  and data collection that lasted several years. In 2009,  Australia invested 1.5 billion Australian dollars to upgrade the air defense missile systems of four  Adelaide-class frigates with  Standard 2BlockIIIA missiles The original Standard 1 missile was replaced and the related sensors and combat systems were upgraded.  At the end of 2009  , the  Adelaide class frigate  conducted the first  test launch  of the  Standard 2 missile  . According to people familiar with the matter, it was at the end of 2010 that the  Australian Navy  activated the mid-course guidance mode to adjust the path of the  missile  in the middle of the flight. Except for the  air defense missile system , there are no other major improvements in other systems of this type of frigate.  Australia plans to replace the current  Adelaide-class frigates with three  Hobart-class air combat destroyers, still equipped with  Standard Type 2 missiles , the first ship will be delivered to   Navy in  2016  .

646.doctext: The South Korean Navy's   fourth Type 214 submarine was launched on  this Tuesday at the  Daewoo Shipyard   South Korean President Park Geun-hye, South Korean Defense Minister Kim Kwan-jin, South Korean Navy Chief of Staff Choi Yoon-hee and others attended the launching ceremony. The submarine is named  Kim Jo Jin . It has a displacement of 1,800 tons and can attack 300 targets at the same time. It can also perform anti-ship, air defense, anti-submarine and other tasks, and can also launch cruises to land. missiles for precision strikes.  The Type 214 diesel-electric submarine  can sail from Seoul to Hawaii without replenishing fuel, and can also perform two-week underwater missions without surfacing.  Kim Jo Jin submarine  will be delivered to   Navy  in the second half of 2014   ,  2015  Start participating in  deployment.

647.doctext: According to the U.S. Naval Sea Systems Command News Network on January 25, 2002:  The U.S. Naval Surface Warfare Center completed the  Super Barrier Decoy Rocket required by the Weapon System Explosive Safety Review Board Play   test  .  At the end of December 2001, 13  102mm  MK261MOK0 infrared rockets  and 13  102mm  MK259MOD0 chaff rockets The bomb  was successfully  test-fired in  Indiana. These decoy rockets have undergone a series of environmental inspections  tests  . Because the plan was accelerated, the project sponsors of the U.S. Special Forces submitted the decoy launch system to the Weapon System Explosives Safety Review Board for review in advance. The trial is part of a series of tests to examine whether the British-developed lightweight super-barrier system is suitable for installation on small US Navy ships. The system provides a means to launch  102 mm chaff  and  infrared payloads  from ships at close range to counter incoming missiles.  The tasks of the U.S. Naval Surface Warfare Center  mainly include coordinating tests, formulating test plans, executing tests, analyzing test data, and writing test reports.

648.doctext: Europe 's  latest spacecraft transition experiment vehicle  mission is one step closer to its 2014 launch plan.  The aircraft  completed the pre-launch  test  on the  Sardinian coastline , and the test  aircraft  fell into the Mediterranean Sea from an altitude of 3 kilometers. During the test, most of the  aircraft  performed well and the parachute deployed as expected. However, problems arose after splashing down. The inflatable device failed to inflate and failed to provide buoyancy for the IXV after the  aircraft  fell into the water. It was a puzzling result, but engineers involved in the experiment brainstormed and figured out what the problem was. They believe the balloon failed to inflate because the sensor that detects impact with water was set too high, making the splash appear too smooth. The European Space Agency's IXV project manager explained that it is necessary to distinguish between shocks caused by the impact of the  vehicle  with the water surface and shocks caused by the wind resistance provided by the parachute, because these shock levels are very similar. Engineers rated these shock levels as quite high, but the parachute actually worked well and the landing was very gentle, so the detection of impact loads was lower than expected. Impact loads during splashdown were lower than expected, with the computer recording impact deceleration as 29.1m/s2 and the critical value of balloon buoyancy set at 30m/s2.  IXV prototype  represents a new chapter in  ESA ’s space flight technology.  In 2014  ,  IXV  will be launched by the  Vega rocket    and then re-enter the atmosphere and splash down in the Pacific Ocean.

649.doctext: Bahrain Coast Guard  is purchasing 6 British-designed  18-meter fast patrol boats  from  Turkey Ares Shipyard . This kind of patrol boat is built with qualified materials. The first one is expected to be launched in mid-October     and will be put into service by the end of 2013. All six  patrol boats  will be put into service by the end of February 2014.  Patrol boat  It is 4.8 meters wide and has a draft of 0.9 meters. It is driven by two MTU8V2000M48 diesel engines. The propeller is a five-blade fixed propeller. The cruising speed is 32 knots and the maximum speed exceeds 35 knots.  Boat  There is a light weapons station at the front, which can install a 7.62mm machine gun and is equipped with personnel protection devices. The first batch of  delivered   boats  are equipped with infrared radar systems and photoelectric night vision systems, as well as navigation radars from the British Rayson Company. Later  deliveries  of  speedboats  may be fitted with more comprehensive sensor equipment.  The boat has 5 people on board. The  boat can provide air conditioning equipment. The designer has conducted in-depth communication with the  shipyard on the design and construction to achieve  span_15 Bahrain Coast Guard Habitability needs.

650.doctext: Recently,  BAE Company began  secret electromagnetic radar test site   testing  on the Isle of Wight, which will be equipped on the Queen Elizabeth class in the future  Craftsman medium-range 3D surveillance radar on the aircraft carrier. In the first phase of testing, the  Royal Navy Type 23 frigate was equipped with the  modified radar to demonstrate the radar function and  system   /span_8, provides actual combat tracking and radar images for the QEC combat management system, and at the same time receives friendly ship data in the QEC mission system test system. The purpose of the test is to  verify  the new  3D radar  integrated  numerous subsystems , including 3D aerial reconnaissance, target identification and air traffic management services. Les Gregory, director of product and training services at BAE, said he was very satisfied with the excellent performance of  Craftsman mid-range 3D radar for BAE radar solutions and future Royal Navy warships.  Craftsman They are all landmark products.  Craftsman Surveillance Radar  It has strong anti-interference ability, enabling the ship to detect more than 900 target objects at the same time, with a monitoring range between 200 meters and 200,000 meters. The radar can provide precise surveillance and tracking capabilities under severe electronic signal interference, and can detect tennis ball-sized targets moving at 3 times the speed of sound 25 kilometers away.

651.doctext: As an important detection equipment on long-range anti-ship missiles,  BAE Systems  advanced  long-range sensors  can hit targets among many enemy ships with complete air defense systems.  BAE Corporation  has successfully  tested  its  new long-range sensor  which has been used in the  recent   LRASM  Precision guidance was provided for the  missile during the  flight tests. This test was the first time the  sensor  was tested through flight testing, and the test proved that the  sensor  can automatically lock and aim at the target.  LRASM  will be  fielded  as the next generation of  United States  anti-ship missiles. These five tests have proven that our  long-range sensor can accurately detect and identify targets, said the relevant person in charge of  BAE Systems, which also verified the  sensor The signal algorithm used, and the reliability of the  sensor under the environmental pressures generated during missile flight.  Sensor  The advanced optoelectronic technology used can detect targets in complex signal environments and then provide precise target location information to the missile control system.

652.doctext: October 15th,  Russia's first  Mistral-class amphibious assault ship was launched at  French shipyard   /span_4 . The ship is named  Vladivostok  and is built by  French DCNS Company . It is expected to start  sea trials  in  March next year  . The ship does not include on-board armaments when delivered, but will be  installed with    landing equipment produced by France. The DCNS project manager said at the launching ceremony that the ship The admiral  installs    weapons and equipment produced by Russia. The ship will be further installed at the shipyard in St. Petersburg, Russia, and will be delivered to the Pacific Fleet in  November 2014  .  Russia and  France signed a 1.2 billion euro contract in June 2011 to purchase 2  French Mistral-class  amphibious assault ships  . The second vessel is planned to be launched in  October 2014    . The Procurement Office of the Russian Ministry of Defense stated on the 15th that the decision on whether to purchase the third ship will be based on the testing of the first ship.  Mistral-class amphibious assault ship  can carry 16 helicopters, 4 landing craft, 70 armored vehicles and 450 soldiers. The Russian military hopes to equip the ship with eight Ka-52K attack helicopters and eight Ka-29/31 helicopters to assist in the landing.

In early September, Russia’s second  Borei-class nuclear submarine Alexander Nevsky and the third  Vladimir Monomakh span_7  Test-fired the  Bulava missile, but the launch was not successful.  The shipyard stated that the Borei-class nuclear submarine project is on schedule, and  Alexander Nevsky is expected to be launched on  November 15  Delivery of   Navy, while  Vladimir Monomakh may not be commissioned until mid-December, but this all depends on  Brava Missile testing conditions. It is reported that Russia’s current Type 941 nuclear submarines and Type 667BDR/BDRM nuclear submarines will be retired after 2018, and the Borei-class nuclear submarines will become the main force of Russia’s maritime strategic nuclear forces.

654.doctext: On October 4, 2013, during a  test organized by the Missile Defense Agency, the  U.S. Navy sailed from the  Lake Erie warship launched a  Raytheon Company  Standard-3BlockIB missile and hit a medium-range ballistic missile target. Tyler Lawrence, president of Raytheon's Missile Systems Division, said, "We still plan to deliver this critical capability on time in 2015 to meet the needs of global combatant commands, especially to meet the needs of the second phase of Europe's phased adaptation approach." This test is the 26th successful interception of the SM-3 project and the fifth consecutive successful interception test of the  SM-3BlockIB missile . The person in charge of the Standard-3 project of Raytheon's Missile Systems Department said that the successful continuous missile tests have enhanced confidence in improving the technological maturity of the  Standard-3 BlockIB missile . Currently, more than 155  SM-3 missiles  have been  delivered  to the   United States  and Japanese Navy  .  Raytheon  is scheduled to deliver   SM-3BlockIB missiles  in  2015   .  Standard-3BlockIB missile  will be deployed in two ways: sea-based and land-based.

655.doctext: The U.S. Sea Systems Command announced on November 7 that two projects won the Government Procurement Outstanding Partner Award on October 30. Among them, the Ohio Replacement Boat research and development design team won the Department of Defense Government Savings Award, and the Underwater Defense Combat Systems Program Office's  surface ship torpedo defense team  won the Department of Defense Myth-Busters Award. The Government Savings Award is awarded to defense units that successfully reduce production costs through innovative solutions. The Ohio Replacement Boat project team innovated on submarine research and development design contracts and saved approximately $2 billion over five years on the Ohio Replacement Boat project. The contract includes approximately $100 million in special incentive fees to incentivize cost savings. The Myth-Busters Award is presented to a team or individual that promotes effective communication between government and industry during the procurement process. This year the  surface ship torpedo defense team received the award in recognition of the team's  delivery of the USS Bush aircraft carrier nearly two years ahead of schedule Navy's first  hard-kill torpedo defense system. The system will be deployed on test vessels  this month  for rapid response  evaluation  and  deployment  in  2014  .

656.doctext: The Vietnamese Navy received the first  Russian-made Type 636 improved Kilo-class submarine Hanoi from  Russian Admiralty Shipyard on November 7. The submarine will be  shipped to Vietnam in mid-November. According to RIA Novosti, the submarine will arrive at  Cam Ranh Bay, Vietnam  in  January 2014  and will officially enter service in the  Vietnamese Navy  . Before the official delivery,  Hanoi submarine successfully completed the 3-month  sea trial that started in  July,  Vietnam Navy  The crew members have also started to undergo relevant training in April.  Vietnam ordered these 6  improved Kilo-class submarines from  Russia in mid-2009, with a value of approximately US$2.1 billion, if included The total value of weapons systems and related support infrastructure will be as high as US$3.2 billion. According to the plan, all 6 submarines will be delivered  in  2016   . The first  Hanoi started construction in August 2010, the second  Ho Chi Minh City started construction in September 2011,  December 2012  Launched and is expected to enter service in 2014. The third  Haiphong started construction in 2012 and will  be launched in the near future  /span_22 . This type of submarine has a displacement of 3,100 tons, a speed of 20 knots, a maximum diving depth of 300 meters, a capacity of 52 crew members, and is equipped with 533mm torpedo launch tubes, torpedoes, mines and 3M-54 Club cruise missiles. The weapon mainly performs anti-ship and anti-submarine warfare missions in shallow water areas.

657.doctext: Russia's United Shipbuilding Corporation said last week that  a brand new  ballistic missile submarine will be  delivered   by the end of this month or early next month /span_3Russian Navy. RIA Novosti reported that  United Shipbuilding Corporation said in a statement last week that the  Alexander Nevsky had  completed testing and is currently undergoing the inspection proposed by the State Inspection Committee. Some finishing touches. The submarine belongs to the Borei class. Due to the failure of the  new Bulava ballistic missile   test launch on the submarine, the sea trials originally scheduled for September were suspended. The status  test was restarted a month later. The submarine may not undergo further  Bulava missile  test firings before entering service.  Alexander Nevsky  and other Borei-class submarines, as well as the Yuri submarine already in service, will soon replace the Soviet-era Typhoon-class ballistic missile submarines.

658.doctext: Russian Navy Commander Adm. Vladimir Vysotsky said on Wednesday that construction of the fifth Borei-class nuclear-powered ballistic missile submarine is expected to begin at the end of 2014, but the specific date for the start of manufacturing has not yet been determined. It is certain that construction will start within a year. The shipbuilding project is included in Russia's national defense procurement program. The first Borei-class nuclear submarine, the Yuri Dolgoruki, entered service with the Northern Fleet in January. According to  Russia's United Shipbuilding Corporation, the second  Alexander Nevsky is expected to be most likely  at the end of this month or early December   Delivery to   Russian Navy.  In September this year the submarine  tested the   Bulava missile after the failure,  the Russian Ministry of Defense said it would still Conduct 5  test firings plans. The third  Vladimir Monomakh is at sea and in status  trials and the fourth Archduke Vladimir has been in northern Russia since July 2012 Construction was carried out at the Sulmash Shipyard. By 2020, the  Russian Navy  will have a total of eight Borei-class nuclear submarines. The Borei-class ballistic missile submarine will become the backbone of the  Russian Navy  strategic nuclear deterrent force, replacing the aging Project 941 and Project 667 submarines.

659.doctext: Raytheon's  Patriot air and missile defense system successfully  test-fired two missiles at the  White Sands Missile Range in New Mexico, USA  Patriot Advanced Capability-3 Missile. The mission included two launches, each against a target representing a tactical ballistic missile. Patriot's record of success is a testament to its continued experimentation and improvement. "Our customers trust the  Patriot system  they rely on to protect their nation from ever-evolving threats," said Ralph Acaba, deputy director, Integrated Air and Missile Defense, Raytheon Integrated Defense Systems. This is just the latest test, after more than 2,500 search route  tests and more than 1,000  Patriot missiles flown in real combat and test environments  Experiment . The test was part of a field surveillance program involving potential international customers and was the second successful FSP mission in a 12-month cycle. The annual FSP firing mission is designed to demonstrate the survivability and performance of currently fielded interceptors. Interceptors are randomly selected to provide an independent assessment of the large number of interceptors deployed around the world.  Raytheon  provides operations and maintenance assistance to its Patriot customers around the world.  Earlier this month, the  Japan Air Self-Defense Force successfully completed a series of  Test firing.  In October  ,  South Korea  conducted a successful  Patriot system   test  .

660.doctext: The Indian Ministry of Defense  announced the successful  test launch  of the  domestically produced Dhanush ballistic missile  , which can carry a nuclear warhead. In this test, the  missile  was launched from a naval ship. According to Integrated Test Range Director Prasad, the  missile  was successfully launched from a naval ship on the order of India's Strategic Forces Command. The test was conducted as part of the  Navy exercise with  DRDO   providing   logistics  and the  missile /span_9 Track the  missile flight path throughout the entire process after successful launch. The launch weight of this type of missile is 4.4 tons. The test verified the performance of the  missile  in terms of climb section, ballistic section, azimuth error, flight trajectory and engine separation.  Dhanush missile  is a  single-stage liquid-fuel ballistic missile  developed by the Defense Research and Development Organization of India as part of the Integrated Missile Development Program and is currently in service with the Army. According to Indian officials, through a series of sensor observations, the  missile  test was 100% successful. The missile can carry 500 to 1,000 kilograms of conventional or nuclear warheads and has a total length of 8.53 meters. It is a naval modification of the Indian Land Missile. In addition to being used as an anti-ship weapon, the missile can also be used for land attacks.

661.doctext: On November 19, 2013,  Egypt   received the first  Ambassador III built by  United States Missile speedboat Izzat,  Izzat was launched in  October 2012   , and the handover ceremony was held in   United States Pensacola, Florida   Held .  The United States plans to build four Ambassador III-class missile speedboats for  Egypt. The second  USS Zachary is nearing completion and will be    was delivered in December 2013, and the remaining two ships  Fahmi  and  Gede  will be delivered  in 2014 span_19  Delivery  . Egyptian navy sailors have been conducting relevant training at the US Navy Air Station Pensacola since July 2013 as part of the US military's international student program. The Ambassador III-class missile speedboat is 62m long and has a displacement of 700t. The weapon system includes an Otto Merara 76mm naval gun, eight Harpoon Block II anti-ship missiles, a Phalanx short-range weapon system, and two M60 machine guns. . The power system consists of 3 MTU diesel engines, with a maximum speed of 41kn and a crew of 38. The contract to build four missile boats was worth US$800 million and was awarded to VTH HaltherMarine in September 2008.

662.doctext: November 21,  Eurocopter’s Brazilian branch Helibras  completed the first  EC725 helicopter whose airframe structure was completely produced in  Brazil  's  first flight was about two months ahead of schedule.  The Brazilian Army  ordered 50  EC725  . All previously produced EC725s were shipped from Eurocopter's Marignane factory in France to ship parts to Brazil for final assembly. The  EC725  making its first flight this time will be the 17th  EC725  delivered to the  Brazilian Navy   . The official delivery is tentatively scheduled. To be conducted in  second half of 2014. Currently, a total of 8  EC725  are in service with the  Brazilian Army . In order to achieve local production,  Helibras  invested approximately US$179 million to expand its Itajuba factory. This first flight also marks the third phase of this project. The  EC725  contract between Brazil and Eurocopter contains a large number of key technology transfers, and has also led a group of European companies to set up factories in Brazil to provide equipment for the project, including engines and missiles. The delivery plan of  EC725 helicopter  will continue until 2017. By then, each  EC725  will be 50% domestically produced. The Itajuba plant will also produce the civilian version EC225 of this model for the Brazilian market. The procurement contract of Petrobras, the Brazilian state-owned oil company, clearly states strict localization requirements for components.  Helibras  The ultimate goal is to provide a fully indigenously designed and produced helicopter to the global market.

663.doctext: The U.S. Navy issued an announcement on December 5 that the latest missile satellite tracking and measurement ship  Howard Lorenz   recently  was in the waters near  San Diego.  Completed final contract acceptance  testing. The acceptance sea trial is organized and implemented by the  U.S. Navy Inspection and Investigation Board. It is the last comprehensive inspection of the  ship before delivery, including the  main propulsion system , damage control, material supply,  deck,  navigation, habitability,  electrical system and maneuverability, etc. span_11 Testing on all systems. INSURV officials recognized the performance of the ship's various systems during in-port testing and sea trials.  T-AGM25  Produced by VT Halter Maritime Company, equipped with Cobra Julli upgraded radar system, will be used to replace  1953   launched  of the  Observation Island research vessel. The CRJ system will provide high-precision dual-band radar data services for global ballistic missile inspections. In addition to the civilian crew that operates the ship, the ship has an Air Force Operations and Maintenance Personnel whose primary mission is to operate the mission radar system aboard the  ship . The CRJ radar project is managed by the U.S. Navy's Integrated Weapon System Program Executive Office, and the design and construction of the  T-AGM25 survey ship  is managed by the Integrated Weapon System Project Ship Department.  In 2014  After the ship reaches initial operational capability,  the U.S. Navy  will  deliver it to the   Air Force  for operations and maintenance.

Subject: U.S. Navy Inspection and Investigation Board

664.doctext: The Greek Navy  The latest fleet tanker -  Prometheus  will be launched  this month    . According to the ship's  builder Elefsis Shipyard, the ship will undergo  sea trials in  the second half of this year and will be launched in  2002 At the end of 2003 or  at the beginning of 2003   was delivered to  the Greek Navy. This  AOR  is designed and built based on the Etna-class oil supply ship built by Italian Pan Ancona Shipbuilding Company for the Italian Navy. It has a total displacement of 13,400 tons, a length of 146 meters, equipped with 2 Sulzer diesel engines, a maximum speed of 21 knots, an endurance of 7,600 nautical miles/18 knots, and a rated crew of 246. The weapon system includes a Raytheon Phalanx short-range weapon system, two Bofors 40mm/L70 naval guns and two 20mm machine guns. Loading capacity includes 4,700 tons of diesel, 1,200 tons of aviation fuel, 160 tons of potable water, spare parts, some frozen supplies and lubricants. In addition, the ship's hangar can accommodate an EH101 helicopter and will be equipped with a hospital and maintenance equipment.

665.doctext: Lockheed Martin has successfully  verified the  long-range anti-ship missile required for integration into the  Mk41 Vertical Launch System functions and  data interface. The company will also continue to discuss two  LRASM  ship-launched  demonstrations planned for  late 2014 at  White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico  Work begins on what is a further  test following the previous vertical launch  test.  The design of LRASM  is based on the AGM-158B extended-range joint standoff air-to-surface missile, and adds a new multi-sensor system developed by BAE Systems, which can reduce the impact on intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance platforms. , network connection and dependence on GPS navigation, it can autonomously detect and identify targets in enemy fleets in an electronic warfare environment. The general contractor of the project is  Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control Division of the United States, while BAE Systems' Information and Electronic Systems Division is the main contractor for the design and delivery of the missile-borne sensor system. business. After the LRASM project is completed, the missile will become one of the candidates for the U.S. Navy's offensive anti-ship warfare weapon project. The OASuW program will be an acquisition program designed to develop anti-ship weapons to replace the Harpoon anti-ship missile.

666.doctext: U.S. Navy's  amphibious assault ship USS America   January 31 completed acceptance  test /span_4 . During acceptance, the U.S. Navy inspection board conducted rigorous testing and evaluation of all major systems of the ship, including  combat systems,  propulsion, communications, navigation, mission systems and aviation capabilities. The successful completion of the acceptance test indicates that the ship is close to delivery.  USS America  is a modified version of the Wasp-class amphibious assault ship that will replace the aging Tarawa-class amphibious assault ship. The ship has enhanced aviation capabilities to support current and future aircraft capabilities, such as the MV-22 Osprey tilt-rotor aircraft and the F-35B Joint Strike Fighter. The design of the ship's aviation center includes an expanded hangar deck, increased storage capacity for aviation parts, expanded aviation maintenance facilities, and increased aviation fuel capacity. The LHA6 ship is 257.3 meters long, has a speed of more than 20 knots, and a displacement of 44,971 tons. The ship will use the same gas turbine propulsion plant, regional power distribution system and auxiliary systems as the Makin Island, replacing the previous steam engines that required intensive maintenance. This unique auxiliary propulsion system design helps improve fuel efficiency.  The amphibious assault ship USS America   was launched in June 2012    and is scheduled to be delivered in the spring of 2014. Its home port is at the San Diego Naval Base.

667.doctext: "Defense Daily" reported on March 7, 2002 that the mass-produced  multi-spectrum targeting system sensor pod delivered to the  U.S. Air Force will be installed in the  Air Force span_2's  Predator armed drone to continue  testing new combat use options for the aircraft.  Raytheon delivered 3 sets of  multi-spectrum targeting system sensor pods to  the U.S. Air Force   in  last December  ,  Later this month will  deliver the fourth set of pods of this system.  The U.S. Air Force began integrating the pod with the  Predator UAV last winter. At that time, the  Predator UAV was absolutely Most are still equipped with electro-optical/infrared sensors for reconnaissance missions.  Predator UAV After the installation of  Multi-spectrum targeting system sensor pod, new tactical usage scenarios will be tested in order to make the equipment Hellfire semi-active by the end of this year The laser-guided anti-tank missile  Predator armed drone can be deployed and used.

668.doctext: Russia began building bases and related facilities for its Mistral-class amphibious assault ship on February 11. The ship is currently being built in  France . Russia will build relevant facilities at the existing naval base in Uliss Bay near Vladivostok for the Mistral ship to dock. The infrastructure construction of the base will be completed in October 2015, and it will be available for ships to dock from 2018. The base's pier will be extended to 2,700 meters, providing a 1,600-meter-long berth. At the same time, related water conservancy, power and communication systems will also be updated. Ammunition supply depots will also be modernized and related roads and railways will be upgraded. Russia and  France  signed a $1.6 billion contract in June 2011 to purchase two Mistral-class amphibious assault ships. According to the Russian Ministry of Defense,  the Russian Navy will  receive the first  Mistral-class amphibious assault ship on November 1, 2014   Radivostok, the second  Sevastopol is planned to be launched  in October 2014   .

669.doctext: According to  Kockums Company  reported on March 5:  Visby stealth frigate  has been approved for a pre-service performance inspection plan. This was confirmed by the prosecutor, Commodore Olov Andersson. The inspection program will begin on March 5 and continue until May. The program has completed the engineering  sea trials  and preliminary  testing  phases with excellent results. The control program  testing  phase before the ship is put into service has also begun. This provides a reliable guarantee for the smooth progress of the  Visby  construction plan. The planning of engineering sea trials and pre-service testing under the direction of  Kockums  went very smoothly, requiring only minor adjustments. During the test, the ship showed excellent performance, which provides assurance for sailors who will pilot the modified version in the future.  Visby Frigate is the world's first surface ship built with a fully stealthy design, carbon fiber, which will make the ship difficult to detect, even with the latest and most advanced radar and Infrared reconnaissance equipment is also difficult to detect. The ship also has the ability to comprehensively perform multiple combat missions, making it a true warship for the future. The advancement of stealth technology is changing the strategic thinking of the world's navies.  Kockums  and the Royal Swedish Navy fully realized its importance in future naval battles and developed and used it. The Royal Swedish Navy has currently ordered five ships of this type and plans to purchase one more.

670.doctext: The Iranian Ministry of Defense   held a  ceremony on March 5th   to mark  Kader  ,  Ghiyam /span_4 ,  Fatah-110  and  Persian Gulf ballistic missiles   delivered  to  combat forces  .  Kader  is the latest version of the Meteor-3 liquid-fueled medium-range ballistic missile. The smaller and wingless  Ghiyam is considered a variant of the Meteor-2, and Iranian officials publicly announced in 2010 that the  Ghiyam would be difficult to detect by radar, and Has a more precise guidance system and shorter preparation time.  Fateh-110  is a tactical ballistic missile with a range of 300 kilometers, and  Persian Gulf  is a variant of the anti-ship missile.  Iran previously announced the successful  test of a  Persian Gulf ballistic missile in  February 2011 and in 2011 It attracted attention in July when it released a video purportedly taken by the electro-optical/infrared seeker of a  missile. While the possibility has been raised that  Iran  has invented a weapon that would be difficult for naval ships to defend against, doubts remain over whether the test was successful. Iranian media previously reported that the  missiles  were produced and delivered to combat units, and photos and video footage of the March 5 ceremony provided the first evidence of this possible fact.

671.doctext: March 6, 2014,  Italian Navy used  sniper frigate 127/54C naval gun system   test firing A large number of  127mm volcanic ballistic extended range projectiles and  projectiles have a range of 38 kilometers. For safety reasons, the launch distance is limited to 40 kilometers. In fact,  Volcano Ballistic Extended Range Projectile  can provide precise firepower strike capabilities of more than 60 kilometers. Quality certification for the Volcano Shell production line is underway, with trials using  Volcano Shells  from pre-production batches. Automelera stated that the company is ready to supply  Volcanic Ballistic Extended Range Ammunition  to the navy equipped with 127/64LW weapon system and  127/54C naval gun system  . In addition to  ballistic extended range type , the Volcano guided munition series also includes  long-range guidance type  and  laser semi-active guidance type , which is expected to be released in  2015  Started naval gun firing  test. The entire series of ballistically corrected and guided artillery shells, used in conjunction with the Otto Melara naval gun system, will be able to complete fire support at sea with a range of 35 kilometers to 100 kilometers.

Recently, a reporter saw a nearly completed  S-97  in the hangar of  Sikorsky , with the transmission system and CT7 engine being installed. In September 2013,  Sikorsky  began the final assembly of the prototype, which has a coaxial design.  Sikorsky  plans to spend approximately $200 million on development. In this project,  Sikorsky  has joined forces with 50 partners, 38 of which have invested their own money.  S-97  has absorbed the technical achievements of  The propulsion system provides high-speed acceleration and deceleration performance.  Sikorsky Corporation made its first  test flight in  2010 with the  X-2 coaxial technology demonstrator. Its speed It reached 250 knots, about twice the speed of conventional helicopters.  S-97  is improved on the basis of  It hovers as high as 10,000 feet in hot weather.

673.doctext: As reported by Jane's International Navy in March:  The Norwegian Coast Guard  has taken delivery of a new  offshore patrol vessel - KVSvalbard . The boat was launched on  February 17, 2001    and  January 18, 2002  was delivered to  Norwegian Coast Guard  , and conducts command and control system testing  trials at  Bergen Port, and is expected to enter official service in its home port of Sortland in mid-2002.  KVSvalbard  has a full load displacement of 6,500 tons and is the largest displacement ship in service in the  Norwegian Navy . Its service complements the capabilities of Australia's Nordkapp-class Arctic icebreaker fleet.  Svalbard 's combat area is in the Barents Sea. Its main tasks are fishery inspection, sovereignty consolidation, search and rescue, environmental protection, mission support, survey research and exploration. It usually performs missions with a Lynx helicopter, but the boat's hangar can accommodate two helicopters. It also has the ability to tow a 10,000-ton surface ship.  KVSvalbard  Good maneuverability is provided by two Azipod thrusters, powered by a 10MWABBAzipod electric propulsion system and 4 BRG-8 diesel generators.

674.doctext: After three years of research, development, and  testing,  Nippon Electric Co., Ltd. delivered the 1999  Detection system that detects signs of failure in large nuclear power plants.  Nippon Electric Corporation said the system will be  installed at the  Shimane Prefecture Nuclear Power Plant Unit 2 starting in late June, using the nuclear power plant's Large amounts of data detect signs of equipment failure.  Nippon Electric Corporation  has been developing the system together with  Chugoku Electric Power Company  since 2011. Initially, the system analyzed sensor information from August 2011 to November 2012, learning how to detect anomalies based on past defect cases. In October 2012,  Chugoku Corporation developed the system at the technical training facility of the Shimane Prefecture Nuclear Power Plant based on the  test and simulated various failures. , to detect their signs. After the successful completion of these tests, the company decided to introduce the system to  Shimane Nuclear Power Plant Unit 2  , a 789-MW boiling water reactor.  Nippon Electric Co.  said that in late June, the two companies plan to begin adjusting the system's detection sensitivity and other influencing factors deployed at the Shimane nuclear power plant as part of ensuring system effectiveness.

675.doctext: ATK Company  has delivered  the first  C235 armed transport aircraft  to the  Jordanian Army   .  ATK Company said that the first aircraft of this type arrived in Jordan on May 1 and will participate in the  Abdu near Oman from  May 6 to 8 King Ra I Air Base   held  the SOFEX2014 trade show. Contracted and managed in conjunction with the King Abdullah II Design and Research Authority in Oman, the project was launched in February 2011 to provide  Jordanian Special Forces  with armed transport aircraft capabilities. The two aircraft have been significantly modified and equipped with electro-optical targeting systems and laser designators, a self-defense system, synthetic aperture radar, and the ability to fire unguided rockets and Hellfire missiles. A rotatable M230 30mm cannon is installed in the rear cabin and can be controlled and aimed through the mission system on the  aircraft . The delivery was preceded by  sensor and  weapon   testing, also in  March this year in the  United States The completed  ATK  is called an accurate confirmation  test  . The aircraft was initially planned for  delivery  in late spring 2013  . Previously,  ATK   Another type of armed transport aircraft   made its first flight. This aircraft is a modification of the C-27J Spartan transport aircraft -  MC-27J Guards type was jointly developed by the company and Alenia for the Italian Air Force.

676.doctext: AgustaWestland will start installing the  digital automatic flight control system on its  AW159 Wildcat helicopter next month span_3 Fly  Test.  AWE  has leased back its second  Wildcat prototype  from the British military, with the  Dafcs system  installed on it.  The company  plans to begin flying  trials  in  July . The trial is expected to last about 18 months, and the  Dafcs system  will first be applied on the 8  AW159  ordered by  South Korea  in 2013. In addition to  Dafcs ,  Korea's  AW159  also includes  Seles   supplied   Pendant Sonar and  Combined Acoustic Treatment System,  Auxiliary Defense Components and  Electronic Countermeasures System, and  Lightweight torpedo and Rafael's  SpikeNLOS air-to-surface missile. The first batch of aircraft has started production at the  Yeovil factory and is expected to complete the  first flight in  October.  SpikieNLOS missiles The  target test will start in  UK in  2015. The first batch of 4 machines will be delivered to  South Korea   at the end of 2015, and all of them will be delivered in  in 2016. Year ends. Unlike  South Korea, the  AW159  ordered by the British Army Air Force and Royal Navy were not equipped with  Dafcs , but were used on the original Army and Navy Lynx helicopters AFCS system, therefore  Awe Company has always hoped that  Britain can get funds to upgrade to  Dafcs system.

677.doctext: India The domestically produced  stealth destroyer Kalkata that is about to be commissioned successfully  test-fired a  BrahMos supercar with a range of 290 kilometers Sonic anti-ship missile, the test site is located on the western coast of  Karwar Military Base.  BrahMos missile was developed by the Russian-Indian  BrahMos Aerospace Corporation and met all technical specifications during the  test . Indian military officials said that the process of this shipboard weapon test is very standard, and we can obtain the combat and operational parameters of the ship in a series of  sea trials . The air-launched and land-based versions of  BrahMos are being developed by the Indian Air Force and Army respectively, and the latest  BrahMos missile is expected to be integrated into a new generation of destroyers and frigates , the new generation of submarines will also be equipped with a submarine-launched version of the missile. The Indian Army has been fielding this type of missile since 2005. The missile has been delivered to the Air Force and is ready to be carried by Su-30MKI fighter-bombers. This type of missile has been equipped on many ships, including the Russian-made Talwar class frigates.  Kartal is an Indian P15A class destroyer . It is built by Mazagon Shipyard. It is the first ship of this class and is scheduled to enter service next month. After entering service, the ship will carry 16  BrahMos missiles .

678.doctext: The Russian Ministry of Defense will receive the first  IL-476 transport aircraft in  2014   . The  Aviation Star-SP Manufacturing Plant located in Ulyanovsk will also  deliver 39  IL-476 transport aircraft, delivery-related Details have not been released.  New transport aircraft IL-467  The first phase of national  testing was completed in  December 2013, all  aircraft systems Has passed inspection and performance evaluation. The second phase of national  testing will test the aircraft's  avionics and  communications systems, and the  IL-476  will also Carry out cargo airdrop  test. The first phase of national  testing started in  July 2013 and it was reported that after the completion of the first phase of national testing, the  Russian Ministry of Defense approved  Il-476  started serial production,  Aerostar-SP Manufacturing Plant  will produce the new transport aircraft in serial mode.  Il-476  is a modification of the Il-76.  In September 2012,   made its first flight. The aircraft was equipped with the new PS-92A-76 engines and the wings were strengthened. Its maximum flight speed is 850 kilometers per hour, its maximum payload is 60 tons, and its range is 6,000 kilometers.  IL-476  will also be transformed into a tanker. Russian Air Force Commander Victor once said that the new tanker will be named  IL-478  . In April 2014, UAC Vice President in charge of transport aircraft Olga said that  the company plans to sign a contract with  the Russian Ministry of Defense this year to  deliver 31 aircraft  IL-478 tanker.

679.doctext: India's Defense Research and Development Agency stated on June 19 that  India's  domestically produced nuclear submarine Arihant  will be launched within one or two months  Sea trials and test its ability to launch  submarine-launched ballistic missile BO-5 . India activated the reactor on the  domestically produced Arihant nuclear submarine  in August last year, which accelerated the process of sea trials. After this sea trial, the submarine will be officially  delivered to   the Indian Navy  for use. DRDO Director Avinash Chander told the Press Trust of India that the Arihant is going through a nuclear reactor power upgrade cycle. This is the first time they have carried out relevant work on a nuclear submarine, so they will be very cautious and proceed step by step. This will take one to two months to complete. He was also asked about some information about the domestic nuclear submarine project. In this project, at least three Arihant-class submarines are built for the Navy. He also mentioned that during the sea trial phase, the  Arihant submarine  will test-fire the mature  medium-range nuclear missile BO-5  . The missile has a range of more than 700 kilometers. After the nuclear submarine is put into service, India will have a triad of nuclear strike capabilities and can launch missiles carrying nuclear warheads from different environments on land, sea and air. Nuclear submarines have the ability to sail into the high seas and sail for long periods of time without surfacing. Conventional diesel-electric submarines must surface regularly for ventilation.  Arihant submarine has been undergoing  debugging at   Indian Navy Visakhapatnam Base and has Cleaning up most of the port acceptance testing facilities.

680.doctext: The U.S. Air Force  awarded a $1.86 billion fixed-price contract to complete the fifth and sixth GEO satellites of the Space-Based Infrared System, GEO-5 and GEO-6.  The Air Force  awarded initial funding for the two satellites in a 2012 contract to complete non-recurring engineering activities and procure select long-term parts. In 2013, the  Air Force  awarded an advanced procurement contract to secure additional long-term parts. This contract is the third part of the  Air Force’s acquisition strategy for the SBIRS system. This acquisition strategy will further reduce costs and shorten the cycle of the two satellites GEO-5 and GEO-6, while providing excellent service to combat personnel. data. The SBIRS system includes GEO satellites, HEO host payloads, and ground hardware and software. The  GEO-1 satellite  and the  GEO-2 satellite  underwent  Air Force Space Command   testing in  2013  , whose performance meets specified requirements and exceeds them in some areas. According to the schedule of  delivery at the end of 2014,  GEO-3 satellite is undergoing acoustic  testing and thermal vacuum  Test.  The GEO-4 satellite  has recently entered the final assembly, integration and  testing  stages. The SBIRS team is led by the U.S. Air Force Space and Missile Systems Center's  Infrared Space Systems Division, with  Lockheed Martin serving as prime contractor and  Northrop Grew Mann Corporation serves as the payload integrator, and  Air Force Space Command is responsible for SBIRS system operation.

After the builder's sea trials are completed,  USS Fall River will undergo acceptance  sea trials, during which  the U.S. Navy Ship Inspection Service will inspect and Evaluate to identify any deficiencies. Any necessary adjustments discovered during acceptance sea trials shall be completed prior to delivery.  The Navy  is expected to receive the   USS Fall River  late this year   .

The submarine is scheduled to be delivered  in 2015    to the  Russian Navy  .  Little Star Ship Repair Center  Previously, it has been repairing and modernizing nuclear-powered submarines. Vladikavkaz is the second diesel-electric submarine it has modified for the domestic fleet in the past two decades. In  2013, the  was  delivered to the  Russian Navy after repair and modification by the  Severodvinsk Shipyard The service life of the Yi diesel-electric submarine has been extended by ten years. The Russian Navy  plans to build 6  636.3 improved submarines  for the Black Sea Fleet. In August 2010, the construction of the first submarine  Novorossiysk  started. 687.doctext: As of  the morning of September 22, the  Mistral-class helicopter carrier Vladivostok carried the first batch of 200  Russian sailors, Completed a series of  tests.  On September 13th   Vladivostok left the French port of Saint-Nazaire for  sea trials. According to RIA Novosti, It is expected to carry the second batch of  crew members on  September 23 and go to sea for  testing. In June 2011,  Russia  and  French DCNS Shipyard  signed a contract to purchase two  helicopter carriers  with a total contract value of US$1.2 billion. The No. 1 ship  Vladivostok should be commissioned into the  Russian Navy in 2014, while the No. 2 ship Sevastopol will be commissioned in 2015. List. The United States has expressed opposition to the deal, but the  French DCNS company , which builds the  aircraft carrier , insists that Western sanctions against Russia will not affect the construction and transfer of the Mistral class. In early September,  France  threatened to suspend the supply of the helicopter carrier because Moscow unilaterally created the crisis in Ukraine. Later, a French government spokesman told RIA Novosti that the delivery of the ship would not be suspended and that French President Hollande was only expressing his political position. Hollande said that if the situation in Ukraine does not improve by November, he will block the delivery of the ship. He later said he would make a final decision by the end of October. He also said that the two conditions for the smooth delivery of the ship are: ① ceasefire in Ukraine; ② political reconciliation agreement. The French president also stressed that the sanctions imposed by the EU will not hinder the  delivery  of the  Russian helicopter carrier  .

688.doctext: The U.S. Navy   recently   received  the  ship signal acquisition equipment Incremental F system developed by  Boeing Company  . The early delivery of the ship signal acquisition equipment Increment F system project provides sufficient time for additional  testing  of the  US Navy . Chris Parent, APM, director of command, control, communications, computers and intelligence information warfare at the U.S. Navy's Program Executive Office, said: "Receiving this system in advance is very beneficial to our warfighters. We can do it without interrupting current missions or ongoing operations." Test new software versions and features to support future fleet integration under the conditions of fleet operations. Dan Marini, Boeing SSEE-F program manager, said: As the builder of this critical signals intelligence system,  Boeing  will focus on providing value-added services to the Navy in the future. We have been exploring next-generation improvements to the Increment F system, the ship’s signal acquisition equipment, to build an advantage for the Navy. The tactical cryptologic SSEE-F system was developed by Argon, a subsidiary of  The Boeing Company . The system has all the signal processing functions necessary for the collection, identification, location and analysis of domestic and foreign information.  SSEE Incremental F System  Based on the SSEE Incremental E system, additional field programmable gate array, embedded processing and server network technologies are added.

689.doctext: On October 18, 2014, the  U.S. Navy named the seventh  Littoral Combat Ship at  Marinette Shipyard, which is the fourth of the Freedom class ship. After launch,  USS Detroit will continue to be outfitted and  tested at the  Marinette Shipyard until her launch in  2015  Receive  sea trial and then  deliver to   Navy. According to the innovative turnkey procurement strategy, there are currently 20 offshore combat ship ships under procurement contracts, 12 of which are under construction. .

690.doctext: Today Two large diesel-electric submarine projects 636.3  Veliky Novgorod and  Korpino were  held at the same time ceremony.  Submarines Veliky Novgorod and  Korpino belong to project 636.3,  JSC Naval Shipyard is for  Russian Navy The best two of a series of 6 boats built. The first ship  Novorossiysk was delivered to   Navy  on  October 21 ,  August 22 span_13  Factory will start the  sea trials of the second  Rostov-on-Don,  the end of 2014 will also  span_17 Delivery of   Navy. The third ship,  Old Oskol , will continue  trials  . On  February 20, 2014   launched  the fourth boat of the series  Krasnodar  in the construction hall. The modified Project 636 submarine has higher combat effectiveness, thanks to its excellent acoustic stealth and target detection range. The latest inertial navigation system, modern automated information management system, and powerful high-speed torpedoes make it surpass other conventional submarines of the same size.

691.doctext: Recently, the NATO Science and Technology Organization stated that the  NATO Maritime Research and Testing Center successfully completed the testing and  demonstration of  floating and flying robots during sea testing in 2014  . As part of the NATO Science and Technology Organization, the  NATO Maritime Research and Testing Center  recently held sea tests in the context of the ICARUS program, which was developed by the European Commission to implement the EU's Seventh Research and Development Framework Programme. The offshore  test  was held from  October 13 to October 24, 2014 . Since its inception in 2012, the ICARUS program has aimed to build an advanced robotic platform to help personnel deal with the dangers they encounter at sea and on land, and to help crisis management teams detect, locate and rescue. Unmanned search and rescue equipment provides valuable resources for saving lives and accelerating search and rescue. In maritime accidents, the survival time of trapped personnel is short, and even search and rescue teams take considerable risks, so the establishment of this advanced robotic platform is very important for the handling of maritime accidents. ˆ

692.doctext: Orbital Sciences Corporation  won the U.S. missile defense launch vehicle competition.  Missile Defense Agency  selected  Orbital Sciences Corporation  to provide a   backup launch vehicle  for the Ground-Based Intermediate Range Defense Program  . Companies competing include Orbital Sciences Corporation, Lockheed Martin and  Boeing  . As a result of the competition,  Orbital Sciences Corporation  won. The main reason is that the company's costs are lower than the other two companies. It is estimated that the  backup launch vehicle  will cost $1 billion. Although  Orbital Sciences Corporation won the competition,  Missile Defense Agency is still considering, if funding allows, Lockheed Martin to assume responsibility for existing  commercial launch vehicles /span_10 part of the job. However,  the Missile Defense Agency  is not interested in the Minuteman launch vehicle that Lockheed Martin is improving.  The Boeing Company is also one of the system integration units of the Ground-Based Medium-Range Defense Program. It has also developed and  tested existing  commercial launch vehicles, but has lags and problems occur during testing. As a result, only a portion of  Boeing's  existing  commercial launch vehicles  could be adopted by Lockheed Martin.

693.doctext: Recently,  Northrop Grumman has delivered the first batch of  combat  to the  U.S. Navy   MQ-8C Fire Scout UAV. Shipboard commanders will use the system to improve the Navy's intelligence gathering capabilities.  MQ-8C  is an upgraded version of the existing larger MQ-8B Fire Scout UAV. It can fly nearly twice as far as the MQ-8B and carry three times the intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance payload.  Northrop Grumman Medium Range  Tactical Systems Vice President, Mr. George Vardoulakis said: We expect these aircraft will be ready for operational conditions by the end of this year, so The testing program will continue throughout the summer.  The MQ-8C  will conduct its first shipboard  test flight USS Jason Dunham   late this year  . The  U.S. Navy  will then  evaluate  the operational performance of the system.  Northrop Grumman  will build 19  MQ-8C Fire Scout UAVs  under the contract, including 2 test fighters.  The U.S. Navy  plans to purchase a total of 70 fighter aircraft.
