694.doctext: The  B-459 Vladikavkaz large diesel-electric submarine belonging to the Russian Northern Fleet is undergoing mid-term maintenance and modernization at the  Little Star Ship Repair Center in Severodvinsk After modification, mooring  testing will be carried out in the port  next January.  Little Star Ship Repair Center spokesperson stated that  Vladikavkaz will be delivered   2015    Russian Navy. At  Little Star Ship Repair Center after six years of repairs and modifications,  Vladikavkaz successfully completed the coastal phase of restoration, from the dock to the outfitting dock and again span_11 Get into the water. Palladium-M control systems, high-pressure air and hydraulic systems, navigation systems, radio and radar equipment are installed in the submarine.  Vladikavkaz  is the second diesel-electric submarine to be repaired and modernized by  Little Star Shipyard .  In 2013,  Little Star Shipyard delivered  the same type of  diesel-electric submarine Kaluga to  Russian Navy   , extending the service life of the submarine by 10 years.  Vladikavkaz  was built in 1989 at the Red Solmovo Shipyard in Nizhny Novgorod. The design of the submarine was completed by the Ruby Design Bureau in St. Petersburg.  Vladikavkazus has a displacement of 23,000 tons, a total length of 72.6 meters, a maximum submersible speed of 17 knots, a submersible depth of 300 meters, a crew of 52, a self-sustainability of 45 days, and a 6-seat 533 mm torpedo launcher.

695.doctext: The Russian Navy  will receive the No. 2 boat of the Type 677 Lada-class conventional submarine in 2017, and the No. 3 boat at the end of 2018. The first boat of this class,  St. Petersburg , was built in 1997.  In 2010,   the Russian Navy  received it   . The construction plans for boats No. 2 and No. 3, which began in 2005-2006, were temporarily suspended. In 2014,  Russian Navy  revised the construction contract for Lada submarines 2 and 3. According to the new contract, the No. 2 boat  Kronstadt and the No. 3 boat  Sevastopol will be launched in  2017 and  At the end of 2018,   was delivered to   Navy . Currently, the No. 2 boat  Kronshtadt  has entered the assembly stage, and the construction work is actively advancing at the  Naval Shipyard in St. Petersburg . The boat is expected to be launched  at the end of 2016   . According to the Navy's plan, AIP devices will not be installed on these two submarines for the time being in order to speed up the construction progress of the submarines to the greatest extent and enable the submarines to enter the  Russian Navy  battle order as soon as possible. At the same time, the construction of these two submarines was optimized based on the shortcomings of the lead submarine  St. Petersburg  in actual operation. The Lada-class submarine is the fourth generation of conventionally powered submarines of the Russian Navy. Compared with previous generations of submarines, it is quieter and equipped with more advanced systems. The Lada-class submarine is smaller than the Type 636 ALROSA-class submarine. , with a displacement of approximately 1,750 tons, and an underwater submersible speed of up to 21 knots.

696.doctext: According to "Defence Data" report on April 11, 2002, the first  German series production Eurofighter 3  )  yesterday  at  EADS /span_2 The Military Aircraft Division's  Manching Factory conducted a 31-minute  maiden flight. The first  IPA standard aircraft equipped with a  telemetry system will be used as a flight  test to record and transmit to the ground station every maneuver and Thousands of additional parameters for further evaluation. Aloysius Rauen, President and CEO of EADS Military Aircraft Division, said: "As the first Eurofighter prototype  makes its maiden flight in  Manching , we have all walked through the entire program. It took a lot of steps and a lot of hard work to get to where I am today.  IPA3  The successful maiden flight marks an important milestone ahead of deliveries of the first  standard aircraft  starting in the second half of 2002. This flight follows the recent  IPA2  maiden flight in  Italy    . The UK's first production aircraft, the IPA1, is expected to fly soon. Important European aerospace companies, EADS of Germany and Spain, Alenia/Finmeccanica Group of Italy and BAE Systems of the United Kingdom are all partners of the Eurofighter Industrial Group.

The delivery date of the new  Akademik Kovalev transport ship  and the modernized  Vladikavkaz submarine  has not yet been determined. Marshal Ustinov  Construction started in 1986. According to public data, it has a displacement of nearly 11,400 tons and a speed of 34 knots.  It is equipped with   volcanic anti-ship missile system  . The other two Type 1164 guided missile cruisers are Moskva and Varyag, serving in the Black Sea Fleet and Pacific Fleet respectively.

698.doctext: According to  Indian Navy News reported in Moscow on April 12: The Russian Arms Export Agency revealed that a submarine of the  Indian Navy underwent extensive upgrades and repairs  last Friday was launched at  a shipyard in northern Russia   . The  Sinduratna diesel submarine  built by Russia is the fourth generation Kilo-class submarine and has been re-innovated based on this contract.  INSSinduratna  was built in 1998 at  Severodvinsk's  Zvyozdochka Shipyard   After 2 years of upgrades and equipped with a tube-fired club - S cruise missile can effectively fight surface ships, submarines and ground targets within a range of 300km. The submarine also has new acoustic systems, information systems and navigation equipment. The boat will be delivered to   the Indian Navy  this summer  . So far, India has introduced 10 Kilo-class submarines.

699.doctext: Problems with the complex technology of the ships' equipment have forced the  Navy  and the ship's builder,  Bath Iron Works , to delay the delivery of the first two ships.  DDG1000  The first ship was originally planned to  be delivered  this summer, but it has been postponed to  November . The progress of the No. 2 ship  Monsour  is roughly one year behind that of the No. 1 ship, and is accordingly postponed to  November 2016 . The construction progress of the No. 3 ship  Lyndon Johnson  has not been affected and will be delivered as planned  in December 2018   . The main reason for the delay is the installation, integration and testing challenges of the large number of new technologies applied to the ship. The three ships are currently being built at  General Dynamics Bath Iron & Steel Shipyard. The first ship  was launched in October 2013   . Currently, 94% of the ships have been completed. The construction workload will be  at the end of this year and the project  sea trials will be carried out.  The Monsour  is planned  to be launched   at the end of this year  .  Bath Iron and Steel Shipyard  is also building  DDG51-class destroyers  , and the delay in the construction progress of  DDG1000  has also affected the construction of DDG51 to a certain extent.  DDG1000  is an innovative ship that adopts an integrated power system and applies a large number of new technologies, including full-ship computing environment, freeboard inward tilting ship type, etc. The U.S. Department of Defense's Office of Test and Evaluation did not discuss the ship's progress in its latest selective acquisition plan, nor did its report a year ago discuss major technical issues in the ship's construction.

700.doctext: The fourth of the Project 636.3 Warsaw Woman class diesel-electric submarine  Krasnodar  will be launched  on April 28 this year    .  The Krasnodar diesel-electric submarine  is planned to be launched  on April 28 this year   . The submarine started construction at the end of February 2014 and is scheduled to be delivered to the Russian Navy's Black Sea Fleet in November this year.  The Russian Navy  plans to build six Project 636.3 Warsaw Woman-class submarines for the Black Sea Fleet. The first boat, Novorossiysk, and the second boat, Rostov-on-Don, were delivered to  Russian Navy  last year. The third submarine  Old Oskol has started  sea trials  last week and is expected to be launched  in June this year  Delivery of   Black Sea Fleet  . The Type 636.3 diesel-electric submarine was developed by the Russian Ruby Naval Equipment Central Design Bureau and is a Kilo-class improved third-generation conventional submarine. The Type 636.3 submarine is 73.8 meters long, 9.9 meters wide, has a speed of 20 knots, a maximum diving depth of 300 meters, a submarine crew of 52, and a submarine displacement of 4,000 tons.

701.doctext: Raytheon Company  began to upgrade the software system for the  Standard-3BlockIB missile  to improve its ability to deal with new threats. This improvement will enhance the ballistic missile defense capabilities of combat commanders, shorten system response time and reduce costs by dismantling or replacing certain hardware.  Raytheon Company Stevenson, senior director of the Standard-3 project, said: This upgrade did not destroy the existing missile body, but it significantly improved the performance of the  Standard-3 missile combat capability. Software upgrades can effectively reduce the risks and costs of upgrades.  The SM-3 missile  can destroy incoming ballistic missiles in space. Its kinetic energy kill warhead hits the target with the force equivalent to a 10-ton truck hitting the target at a speed of 600 miles per hour.  BlockIB type  It includes a two-color infrared seeker and a throttle steering attitude control system, which can adjust the direction and attitude of the missile warhead to fly towards the target. The upgrades are being performed at  Raytheon 's Tucson facility, with final evaluation of the upgrades being undertaken by the Redstone Missile Assembly Facility in Huntersville.  The U.S. Navy and  Missile Defense Agency plan to  this year  test the upgraded  SM-3BlockIB missile span_11. Currently, more than  200  SM-3 missiles    have been delivered to   the United States  and  Japan  , BlockIB type is also deployed in Romania's shore-based missile defense system.

702.doctext: Boeing Company  recently completed the upgrade and modification of the  NATO early warning aircraft cockpit avionics system  and conducted the  first flight  .  The cockpit avionics system of the NATO early warning aircraft  is a product of the 1970s. The first flight lasted two hours and was used to test and evaluate the  glass cockpit  with five color displays. The new cockpit can display customized engine, navigation and radar data. The system performed better than expected and the next step will be more extensive flight  testing  . A total of 14  NATO early warning aircraft will be upgraded and refitted with new avionics systems . It is expected that the first aircraft with completed modifications will be delivered in January 2016.  The AWACS project manager of Boeing Company  said: The modified NATO early warning aircraft will save more operating time and fuel, and the fleet will reduce operating costs. These upgraded early warning aircraft will meet future air traffic control and navigation requirements, allowing the aircraft to reach wider airspace around the world.  Boeing  uses off-the-shelf commercial digital avionics equipment to complete the upgrade and modification. These early warning aircraft are modified from Boeing 707. While modifying NATO early warning aircraft,  Boeing is also upgrading and modifying the US Air Force's  early warning aircraft. The contract was signed in 2012 with a total value of US$39.4 billion. The first aircraft is expected to be It will make its first flight in  2016    and all modifications will be completed in 2018.

703.doctext: According to local media reports in  India ,  India ’s first domestically-produced Squid-class attack submarine was launched at the Mazaran Shipyard in Mumbai and is expected to enter service in September 2016. According to the Indo-French 75 project plan, there are 6 fish-class submarines designed by France and built by  India . This launch is the first one. One submarine is expected to be delivered every nine months, with the last one due in 2018. The Fish-class submarine has a displacement of 1,700 tons, a total of 6 petty officers and 25 ordinary crew members, and can carry up to 6 SM39 Exocet anti-ship missiles. The Fish-class submarines will contribute to the modernization of the Indian fleet in the future. It is reported that  India's submarine fleet currently has 9 Russian Kilo-class submarines, 4 German 209-class submarines,  Russia's   leased 's  Kula-1 nuclear submarine, and an Indian-built  Arihant ballistic missile nuclear submarine.  Arihant  was the first submarine built by  India . According to reports from India's New Delhi TV station, the submarine will be loaded with  nuclear missiles   this month  for  sea trials  and is expected to be put into service at the end of 2016. The second ship of the  Arihant class has been launched in  2013    and is expected to be delivered  this year    span_17.

704.doctext: Russian Navy The fourth Type 636.3 diesel-electric submarine  Krasnodar will be launched on  April 25 at  Russian Admiralty Shipbuilding Factory   launched . According to the  Russian Navy Headquarters plan, by  2016 will build and deliver  the Russian Navy 6  Type 636.3 submarines , all 6 submarines will  be delivered to   the Russian Black Sea Fleet. Currently, the first and second boats  Novorossiysk and  Rostov-on-Don have been  delivered to the   Russian Navy, No. 3 boat  Old Oskol is undergoing  sea trials before delivery and will be  June 2015   Delivered to   Russian Black Sea Fleet . Construction of boats No. 5 and No. 6 is scheduled to begin this fall. According to plan, the fourth submarine of Project 636.3  Krasnodar  will be delivered  in November this year     Russian Navy  .  Type 636.3 diesel-electric submarine  was developed by the Ruby Central Design Bureau in St. Petersburg, Russia. This type of submarine is nearly 74 meters long, has a maximum underwater speed of 20 knots, a diving depth of up to 350 meters, and a self-propulsion capability of one and a half months. Equipped with six 533 mm caliber torpedo launchers. The ammunition reserve includes 8 torpedoes, 4 rocket torpedoes and 24 mines.

705.doctext: The Russian Deputy Defense Minister revealed to the outside world that the new  Il-112V light military transport aircraft  will make its first flight in 2017 and start mass production at the same time. Last summer, CEO Ilyushin stated that the aircraft's  first flight  would be  November 1, 2016  . The Deputy Minister of Defense revealed that the aircraft will make its first flight in 2017 and complete the national  test in  2019, which will be carried out by the  Voronezh Aircraft Manufacturing Company Mass production. The Ministry of Defense plans to purchase at least 35  IL-112 aircraft  . Previously, Ilyushin CEO said that it would  deliver  62 aircraft. The deputy defense minister noted that  light military transport aircraft  is a long-standing issue for the  Russian Air Force .

706.doctext: Polish Deputy Prime Minister and Defense Minister Tomas Szymoniak said that the Polish government intends to purchase additional cruise missiles for the three new submarines it plans to purchase.  France said that if  If Warsaw chooses to purchase a French-designed submarine, it will be provided  with   de Croisiere Naval missiles. Paris has agreed to Poland's purchase of  French company DCNS   submarines  and European Missile Group long-range missiles. According to the plan, Poland can purchase 24 missiles for these three submarines. According to the military modernization plan of the Polish Ministry of Defense for 2013-2022, two  submarines will be delivered to the   Polish Navy before  2022   span_9, the third ship will be delivered   before  2023. In March, Tomas Szymoniak said that Warsaw was in talks with Washington and Paris about the purchase of cruise missiles. The purchase of cruise missiles was  Polish Ministry of Defense Polish Paw part of a project aimed at improving Poland's deterrent capabilities. According to Polish reports, the cruise missile contract will be signed in 2017. Polish Deputy Minister of Defense Maciej Jankovski said that  The Polish Ministry of Defense plans to launch a  submarine supply ship in  the fourth quarter of 2015   /span_15 Launched, the submarine is expected to be delivered before 2023.

707.doctext: U.S. Navy Electronic warfare experts seek to have  Cobham Corporation   provide   radio frequency transmitters for the Navy's EA-18G A jet aircraft's onboard electronic jammer designed to deceive and blind enemy low-frequency radar systems. Officials with the U.S. Naval Air Systems Command in Patuxent River, Maryland, announced their intention to award a contract to the  Cobham Corporation Advanced Electronic Solutions Division in Lansdale, Pennsylvania. Provides low-band transmitters for the AN/ALQ-99 jammer on the EA-18G aircraft. The upcoming contract involves the AN/ALQ-99 low-band hardened system currently in production. The contract amount has not yet been determined. U.S. Navy officials said that as part of the EA-18G Growler jet's electronic warfare suite, the LBT will provide the ability to jam enemy, low-frequency radar and communications signals in a tactical environment. The proposed low-band transmitter contract will require  Cobham's  engineers to carry out engineering modifications to improve existing LBT systems and will include engineering, manufacturing, integration and  testing   LBC Suite. The outcomes also require  Cobham Corporation  to deliver two test articles as well as appropriate technical data to support future qualification and testing of the improved transmitter.

708.doctext: On May 19th, the  French Navy's  European multifunctional frigate Aquitaine successfully sailed on the French Arms and Equipment Directorate on  Levant Island The shooting range of the test center   test-fired  the  naval cruise missile  and the  Exocet MM40 anti-ship missile . This is also the first time that a European surface combatant has launched a  cruise missile . During the two test launches of the  French Navy,  the team of the French Armament Administration,  the developers of the European Missile Group and  The French Shipyard participated in the technical capability verification process. This marks the follow-up to the  2013   test launch of the   Aster 15 air defense missile  and the  March 13   Kaimen After the Alligator helicopter mounted the MU90 light torpedo, the European multifunctional frigate passed another important milestone. As the main ship type of the French Navy in the future, the European multi-functional frigate has powerful armaments and can carry  naval cruise missiles,  MM40 Exocet anti-ship missiles,  Aster Anti-aircraft missiles and MU90 anti-submarine torpedoes. All European multipurpose frigates can take off and land Caiman helicopters, as well as special forces and their equipment.  By mid-2019  A total of 6  European multifunctional frigates   will be delivered  . The  naval cruise missile  with a range of hundreds of kilometers can provide deep strike capabilities and can be used to destroy fixed targets of high strategic value.

709.doctext: United Defense Corporation has been awarded a $22 million, 45-year contract to develop and integrate electrothermal chemical components for the Future Combat System's next-generation large-caliber artillery-Multipurpose Weapons and Munitions System. months.  United Defense Corporation  will design, manufacture and  test  the  electrothermal component plasma generator  used by the MRAAS. In addition, as part of the electrothermal component system, the company will design and supply the pulse power system used on the MRAAS, as well as the hardware to transmit the pulse power from the system to the weapon. This contract marks a key milestone in electric heating component research.  United Defense Corporation has designed and  tested many  electrothermal chemical components and  pulsed power systems /span_7, the contract will enable the  electrothermal propulsion device and  pulse power supply to be  applied to a prototype combat vehicle for the first time.

710.doctext: Russia's Malakat Maritime Engineering Design Bureau stated that the construction project of seven Yasen-class submarines will be completed after 2023.  Russia's Severodvinsk Shipyard stated at the 2015 Russian Military Technology Forum that it will deliver  Navy    before 2020 /span_3 8  Borei-class strategic nuclear submarines and 6  multi-functional Yasen-class attack submarines. The seventh Yasen-class and eighth Borei-class submarines are expected to lay down their keels next year. The Yasen-class nuclear submarine has a maximum speed of 16 knots on the surface and 31 knots underwater. It is 119 meters long, 13.5 meters wide and 9.4 meters high. Designed and built by the Malakat Maritime Engineering Design Bureau, the first ship  Severodvinsk had its keel laid as early as 1993, and  was put into service at the end of 2013 and was put into operation  The test is the 131st naval nuclear submarine built by  Severodvinsk Shipyard.  In 2012,  Severodvinsk submarine successfully  test-fired 5  new supersonic cruise missiles at a surface target in the White Sea /span_13 .

MRAAS is the next-generation large-caliber cannon that will be equipped with the U.S. Army's Future Combat System.  United Defense Corporation  will be responsible for the design, manufacture and  testing  of the  ETC plasma generator  used in the MRAAS munitions. In addition, as part of the ETC system, it is also necessary to develop and  provide the  pulse power supply system used in MRAAS vehicles, and  use the  pulse power supply Hardware conversion from PPS to weapons.  United Defense Corporation  Bill Chen, vice chairman of engineering, said: The signing of this contract is a key milestone in the development process of  Electrothermal Chemical Cannon . Over the past 15 years, we have designed and  tested a large number of  electrothermal chemical cannons and  pulsed power systems in our laboratories, and this contract For the first time,  electrothermal chemical cannon propulsion and pulse power supply will be used together on a combat vehicle prototype.

712.doctext: Russian Northern Fleet Spokesperson Vadim Sergo recently stated that  the conventional submarine Rostov-on-Don has arrived at the naval base of the fleet in the Kola district and is preparing to carry out operations. The next phase of  sea trials will be carried out in the  Barents Sea, including deep-sea diving tests.  The Rostov-on-Don submarine was started at the  Admiralty Shipyard in St. Petersburg in November 2011 and was officially  delivered in  2014   Russian Navy . The submarine is a third-generation Russian submarine and ranks among the quietest submarines in the world. The submarine has a speed of 20 knots, a maximum diving depth of 300 meters, a self-sustainability of 45 days and nights, a crew of 52, and an underwater displacement of approximately 4,000 tons. A senior commander of the Russian Navy said that before 2016, six Type 636 submarines will be built and incorporated into the Russian Navy's Black Sea Fleet. All six submarines will be named after Russian towns with military honors. They are Novorossiysk,  Rostov-on-Don, Stara Oskol, Krasnodar, and the No. 5 and No. 6 ships under construction Veliky Novgo Rhodes and Corpino.

713.doctext: The Australian branch of BAE Systems announced on the 23rd that the Royal Australian Navy's second  Canberra-class amphibious assault ship HMAS Adelaide  began  sea trials  for 10 days.  Adelaide displacement 27,000 tons,  June 17 departed  BAE Systems for  Williamston Shipyard , the destination is  Sydney. The ship's second  sea trial is expected to be held in  August, and the ship will be officially  delivered   within  this year Navy. This sea trial will last for 20 days, with more than 240 hours of testing, mainly to ensure that all systems can perform as expected. Bill, director of the Sea Trial Department of BAE Systems, said that some tests will be conducted at the same time, and the test content covers the operation of all  basic systems, such as the ship's  alarm system and the ship's navigation maneuvers sex. The second sea trial in August will test the ship's  communications and combat systems  . The two Canberra-class amphibious assault ships are by far the largest ships of the Australian Navy. The hulls of the ships were mainly built by  Navantia Shipyard in Spain  and were then towed by tugboats to Williamston Shipyard in Australia for outfitting. The Canberra-class amphibious assault ship has a crew of 400 people and can carry 1,000 soldiers, 4 landing craft, and 8 helicopters. It can also carry 18 helicopters at the same time. The first Canberra-class ship was delivered to the Navy at the end of last year.

714.doctext: Polish Defense Minister Tomasz Semoniak christened and  launched  the new patrol boat of the Polish Navy at the  Naval Shipyard  in Gdynia. The new patrol boat is named  Slazak . It is the first naval ship independently built by Poland in 21 years. Semoniak said: Our naval expansion not only incorporates the Polish people's emotions and love for the Baltic Sea, but is also something that must be done in our time. Next we will have the launch of another ship, as well as subsequent decisions about rebuilding our naval force. The new ships from the  Polish shipyard  are good news for Poland as a whole. The new ship will soon undergo sea  sea trials  and is expected to enter service with the Navy late next year. The 95.2-meter-long, 13.5-meter-wide patrol boat will have a displacement of approximately 1,800 tons and a maximum cruising speed of 30 knots per hour. Semoniak added that the construction of the next six ships, which will include patrol boats and coast guard vessels, is being negotiated with the Polish Armed Forces Group. The minister said: There is no doubt that in the Baltic Sea we need such possibilities, and what is happening in Europe also makes NATO start to see the possibilities in the sea. The new ship is powered by two main engines, which can reach a power of 2*3240kw. It is a continuation of the Gavron multifunctional light cruiser plan.

715.doctext: According to a report on the "Jane's" website on April 24, 2002, the British BAE system has achieved two firsts in the four-nation Eurofighter program it participated in. One of them was the first guided launch of Raytheon's  AIM- 120 advanced medium-range air-to-air missile; secondly, its first production aircraft equipped with test instruments flew first. The company's  two-seat DA4 development aircraft was launched  on  April 10 at  QinetiQ's Benbecula test range using slide rails   AMRAAM  Destroy the Mirach target. Until MBDA starts delivering its Meteor BVR air-to-air missiles around 2008,  AMRAAM  will be the Eurofighter's primary air-to-air weapon.  BAE Systems The first production Eurofighter, named  IPA1 , left the company's  Warton factory  April 14   First flight  26 minutes.  On April 16  , the two-seater aircraft conducted two more  test  flights. The company's industrial partners Alenia Airways and EADS also flew their first production aircraft on April 5 and 8 respectively.

716.doctext: Russia's first  Project 18280 reconnaissance ship  specially designed to monitor the US missile defense system will be delivered to the   Russian Navy  on Russian Navy Day . It is reported that Russian Navy Day falls on the last Sunday of July every year, and this year it is  July 26  . During Navy Day, a grand flag-raising ceremony of the St. Andrew's flag will be held on the first ship. The lead ship  Yuri Ivanov  will be incorporated into the Russian Navy’s Northern Fleet. The ship can guarantee the information control rights of the  Russian Navy  and can perform multiple tasks such as electronic warfare, radio and electronic reconnaissance, and monitoring of the US missile defense system and air defense missile integrated system.  Yuri Ivanov is the first ship of the  Project 18280 reconnaissance ship. Construction started on December 27, 2004 at the  Northern Shipyard Construction,  September 30, 2013   Launched. The displacement exceeds 4,000 tons, the endurance is no less than 8,000 nautical miles, and the personnel establishment is 120 people. Previously,  United Shipbuilding Group Head of the Defense Order Agency Anatoly Shremov said that  Project 18280 reconnaissance ship No. 2 will be  2016 /span_13 Carry out  sea trial work.

717.doctext: The U.S. Department of Defense has approved a possible foreign military sale to  Saudi Arabia for the sale of  Patriot PAC-3 missiles and related equipment, parts and logistics support for an estimated cost of $54 100 million. The U.S. Defense Security Cooperation Agency provided Congress with the necessary certification for arms sales on July 28, 2015.  Saudi Arabia requested to purchase 600  Patriot PAC-3  cost reduction program missiles, and 8  PAC-3CRI test missiles for  trial  . The total cost is estimated at $5.4 billion. This arms sale will enhance the security of Saudi Arabia, which has been and will continue to be a U.S. ally, and contribute to U.S. foreign policy and national security. Saudi Arabia is a political power in the Middle East. an important force for stability and economic development. The sales will upgrade and replenish  Saudi Arabia's  current stockpile of increasingly older and unsustainable  Patriot missiles  due to limited service life and limited availability of repair parts. This  Patriot PAC-3 missile  transaction will support current and future air and missile defense missions and promote regional stability.  Saudi Arabia  already possesses  Patriot missiles  and will therefore have no difficulty absorbing these new missiles into its armed forces. This arms sale will not change the basic military balance in the region. The prime contractors will be  Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control  , and  Raytheon  . Implementation of this arms sale will require approximately 30  U.S. Government personnel and 40 contractor representatives to travel to  Saudi Arabia for up to 60 months of equipment processing, on-site  Testing,  system   inspection, training, technical and logistical support.

718.doctext: The keel-laying ceremony of the 62-meter-long  general purpose landing ship took place  on August 31 at  Gardenridge Shipbuilding Engineering Co., Ltd. in  Dockyard   held in Kolkata  . A  Gardenridge Company public relations officer revealed to Jane's Defense: This is the last ship in the contract and will be delivered  in 2016   span_7 To the  Indian Navy, currently all work on all  ships is proceeding as scheduled.  Gardenridge Company signed a contract worth 21 billion Indian rupees with the  Indian Navy in September 2011 to build eight  amphibious landing ships for use To transport Indian Army vehicles and personnel, it can transport up to 216 people, including 160 armed soldiers and 56 crew members. The first  ship  of the series was launched  in March 2014    .  March 2015 When the fourth  ship   was launched, the Indian Ministry of Defense issued a statement saying: The ship can perform a variety of maritime missions, such as Security, beach landing and offshore operations, peacekeeping, humanitarian rescue, remote island evacuation and search and rescue, etc. According to Jane's Battleship Encyclopedia, the 830-ton ship is equipped with two 30mm CRN-91 naval guns and is equipped with an EON-51 photoelectric indicator manufactured by Bharat Electronics. The ship uses two 1,840-kilowatt MTU marine diesel engines and a dual fixed-pitch propeller propulsion system, with a maximum speed of 15 knots and a range of 1,500 nautical miles.

719.doctext: According to the  US "Defense Data" report on May 8, 2002, the F-22's latest  Advanced Integrated Avionics Software Package 3.1 batch has been successfully installed on  for the first time. Edwards Air Force Base   Test Flight  .  3.1 batch software  can provide functions including enhanced radar, electronic warfare, communications/navigation/identification, and global positioning systems. With  3.1 batch , you can complete other subjects of the flight test.  The F-22's advanced integrated avionics system eliminates the need for pilots to manage each sensor individually during combat, reducing the pilot's workload. The pilot can focus on understanding the combat situation and Maneuver the aircraft to get the most out of its performance.  The software and hardware of the F-22 avionics system are provided by Lockheed Martin, Boeing and other important suppliers. Northrop Grumman and Raytheon are responsible for the F-22 avionics system. What -22 provides is the APG-77 radar. The F-22's prime contractor  Lockheed Martin is responsible for the development and preliminary  testing of the  aircraft avionics system and its partner  The Boeing Company is responsible for final synthesis,  testing and software synthesis of the  avionics system. The development process of the F-22 received help from nearly 1,200 sub-contractors from 46 countries. The aircraft is equipped with engines developed by Pratt & Whitney and will begin to replace the F-15 in 2005.

720.doctext: India  will test-fire its first missile this month in preparation for delivery of its first domestically produced  Arihant nuclear submarine , according to top defense officials. The submarine is expected to be delivered  to the Indian Navy  during the International Fleet Review event  in Visakhapatnam in February next year  . It is said that the  submarine  sea trials are currently progressing smoothly, and the  test launch of the   Dreadnought missile  will be  this month, and another type will be launched later.  Dreadnought missile has a range of 1,000 kilometers and is a  long-range subsonic cruise missile;  Arihant submarine is then  launched Another type of missile will be India's first  submarine-launched ballistic missile with a range of about 700kms. Subsequently, the  Arihant submarine  will conduct other  tests  . At least two submarines of this type will be built.  Arihant submarine  Originally designed as an attack nuclear submarine, it was converted into a ballistic missile nuclear submarine in 1998.  The submarine was  launched as early as  2009. The nuclear reactor reached criticality in 2013,  in December 2014   Start sea trial.

721.doctext: The Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force's most advanced  submarine Akiryu was launched on  the morning of November 2nd at the  Kawasaki Heavy Industries Group The  Kobe Shipyard   was launched.  Submarine  is named after  Red Dragon , which means the divine dragon that protects the south.  The Chiryu submarine has a displacement of 2,950 tons, a total length of 84 meters, a width of 9 meters, and a speed of 20 knots. Although it is a  conventionally powered submarine, its silent performance is the best so far. The most superior among Japanese submarines, it is also equipped with the latest sonar system independently developed by Japan, which can capture enemy submarines from long distances.  Chiryuu After it is launched, it will take more than a year to install the equipment. It is scheduled to be delivered in  March 2017     Offshore Autonomous Vehicle Used by the Guard, mainly for the defense of the southwest islands and waters.

Subject: Kawasaki Heavy Industries Group
Object: Offshore Autonomous Vehicle Used by the Guard

722.doctext: Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control and the  U.S. Army conducted another successful  test at  White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico  New guided multiple rocket launcher system rockets were tested. GPS-assisted guidance was used during the test, and the test results were as expected. The rocket was launched from an M270 modified positioning system rocket launcher and traveled more than 70 kilometers, dispersing its submunition payload in the target area. The main test purposes of this test include launching  rockets  from the rocket launcher, verifying engine performance, tail expansion and rotation rate evaluation, and navigation performance. Preliminary data show that all trial objectives have been achieved. This test was the last of six consecutive engineering and development  tests  , all of which met or exceeded performance requirements. The guided MLRS rocket project is an international cooperation project. The countries participating in the cooperation include  United States,  United Kingdom,  Italy,  France /span_10 and  Germany. This guided MLRS rocket is equipped with a GPS-assisted inertial navigation component on its product-improved missile body. In addition, small canards mounted on the front of the missile will provide basic maneuverability and improve the accuracy of the system. According to the plan, the  guided MLRS rocket  will have initial operational capability in 2005.  Guided MLRS  An important step in the development of the MLRS munitions family, providing forward capabilities, reduced logistical support and precision strike capabilities.  The rocket  will have a range of more than 60 kilometers.

723.doctext: U.S. Navy The latest  Arleigh Burke-class guided missile destroyer USS Ralph Johnson was launched at  Ingalls Shipyard   /span_3 and  held the launching ceremony. Arleigh Burke-class program manager said: The launch of  DDG114  is an exciting milestone and represents a collective effort by the  U.S. Navy  and industry. We look forward to the ship completing outfitting, testing, and sea trials and joining the U.S. fleet as soon as possible. The ship is planned to hold a  naming ceremony in the spring of  2016   and will become the 64th  Arleigh Burke-class destroyer of the  U.S. Navy /span_10 will also become the 30th  ship built by  Ingalls Shipyard.  DDG114   After deployment  will carry out a series of tasks such as peacekeeping, crisis management, sea control and power projection. The ship is equipped with offensive and defensive weapon systems to support maritime warfare. It can conduct air defense warfare, surface warfare and underwater warfare at the same time, helping  the US Navy  to complete the strategy of the Department of Defense. Currently,  Ingalls Shipyard has built and  delivered 28  Arleigh Burke-class guided missile destroyers; including  DDG114 Including, there are 4 ships under construction. In addition,  DDG113  plans to conduct  sea trials in  2016, and  DDG117  plans to conduct  the first half of 2017 span_25  Launching, DDG119 plans to lay the keel in the second quarter of 2016.

724.doctext: Korea Aerospace Industries Corporation has upgraded the  T-50 trainer aircraft to meet the T-X requirements of the US Air Force. The flight  test will be  next year  Start.  KAI  was launched on  December 17    with the  T jointly developed with  Lockheed Martin  -50T-X version. The upgraded aircraft's cockpit functionality has changed with the addition of mid-air refueling and embedded training systems. A KAI spokesperson stated that  South Korea plans  next year to complete ground and air  tests and  flight  tests    Will be held in  2017  in  United States. A mid-air refueling capability has been added to the  T-50  by installing a back panel module between its cockpit and tail. A large display was also installed in the cockpit. However, the spokesperson did not provide a detailed description of the embedded training system. Presumably, the embedded training system should be able to provide pilots with simulations in a real flight training environment and introduce virtual elements, including enemy forces. In order to meet the needs of the T-X,  Lockheed Martin  and  KAI  agreed to jointly develop a  new version of the T-50  in July 2014.  Lockheed Martin  played a huge role in the initial development of the  T-50 , whose aerodynamic design was largely based on the F-16.  The Ministry of Industry of South Korea   funded  the  T-50  part of the  upgrade research and development costs  .

725.doctext: As reported in Defense Systems Journal on May 22, 2002,  Textron Systems Corporation was awarded a contract by the  U.S. Navy to develop and   provides   airborne sensors. The Airborne Interceptor Monitoring Program is a supply and services contract with a value not to exceed $13 million. Under the terms of the contract,  Textron Systems  will develop, install and  test  a  electro-optical data acquisition sensor package  for the unmanned aerial vehicle to monitor missile interceptions. UAVs will operate in restricted areas that are prohibited to manned aircraft and are designed to fly in adverse weather and atmospheric conditions. The work specified in the contract will be completed by March 2007.

726.doctext: Raytheon Company conducted a practical  trial of its  facial recognition system at  Boston's Logan International Airport Supplied by  Vesinex Inc., it is installed at security checkpoints and has a very high rate of correct inspections against the provided test sheets. Based on the results of these trials, Raytheon will recommend the use of biometric tools as a way to improve security at U.S. and international airports. Raytheon says the trial demonstrates surveillance Regarding the vitality of facial recognition technology, according to  Vesinix Corporation, similar  trials have been conducted at  other airports in the United States, and the results are all positive Better. These technologies can be used to deal with new threats that people face.

Subject: Vesinex Inc.
Vesinix Corporation
Location: other airports in the United States

727.doctext: In order to solve the problem of long-endurance drones on ships,  the U.S. Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency  and the Naval Research Laboratory jointly launched the Tactical Reconnaissance Node project.  TERN drone  can be equipped on small frontline ships and can be recovered into the cabin when parked. At present, the project is progressing smoothly.  DARPA  has signed the third phase contract with  Northrop Grumman Corporation  on December 24, 2015.  Northrop Grumman  will build a full-scale drone prototype with a tailseat vertical take-off and landing flying wing configuration. If the ground  testing of the  TERN prototype goes well, it will be used as a  simulation test platform destroyers or other small ships in the future.  Conduct takeoff, attitude conversion and horizontal flight  tests.  TERN drones  will greatly improve the mothership's sensing, transmission and connection capabilities. The project manager said that it will continue to develop breakthrough technologies to reduce costs while testing persistent intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance capabilities. Subsequently,  DARPA  and  Navy signed a memorandum of understanding to jointly undertake the development and  testing of  TERN prototype. At the same time, the U.S. Navy The Marine Corps Warfighting Laboratory has also expressed strong interest in the project and is providing relevant support.

728.doctext: The U.S. Navy has  received a new  non-combat expeditionary fast transport ship USS Braunschweig built by  Austal Corporation , the ship will be mainly used by the US Navy Sealift Command.  Braunschweig  adopts an all-aluminum hull design, with a length of 338 feet, a beam width of 93.6 feet, and a speed of 48 knots.  U.S. Navy Captain Stevens, head of strategic and theater sealift projects, said: The expeditionary fast transport ship project is proceeding at full speed, and the new  transport ship will also be coming soon  Launched   Delivered   Navy, each ship delivery is the result of a collaborative effort between the  U.S. Navy and manufacturer teams. This  expeditionary fast transport ship  can perform various operating tasks with ro-ro ships in narrow ports, waterways and other places. The ship is also designed with a helicopter flight deck and a passage for vehicles to quickly exit. Later this month,  Austal Corporation will start the construction of the seventh  Expeditionary Fast Transport Ship. It is expected to be ready  by the end of this year span_15 Delivery. The U.S. Naval Sea Systems Command stated that according to the previous contract,  Austal Corporation will continue to build up to the 10th  Expeditionary Fast Transport Ship, retaining the opportunity to build the eleventh ability.

729.doctext: The U.S. Navy  will begin production of the  electromechanical hybrid propulsion system  for the Arleigh Burke Type IIA destroyer this fall. The director of the Electric Power Ship Office stated at the Surface Ship Alliance annual meeting on January 13 that the  electromechanical hybrid propulsion system has completed the impact  test and the power module reception  test . The project goal is to install   electromechanical hybrid propulsion systems  for all 34  destroyers   to reduce ship fuel consumption. The installation of two equipment systems will be completed in fiscal year 2016, and then the modifications will be completed at a rate of four ships per year.  Electromechanical hybrid propulsion system  Installing a propulsion motor on the main reduction gear of the ship can provide propulsion power at low speeds. After installation, each ship can save thousands of barrels of fuel throughout its life.  In early 2015,  L3 Company delivered  2    electromechanical hybrids to the  Navy   Propulsion system  prototype   for system  testing  . As early as  2012, the  Navy  tested the first General Atomics on the  DDG-103 destroyer The developed  electromechanical hybrid propulsion system.

730.doctext: Another example of the military's increasing emphasis on electronic warfare is that the Naval Air Combat Warfare Center Weapons Division signed a contract worth 49.8 million with  AAI Company to  test upgrade to interdepartmental  Environmental Systems of the Electronic Warfare Simulation and Evaluation Laboratory. The contract will run for five years in Maryland's  Hunt Valley  and is expected to be completed by January 2021.  The Air Combat Weapons Division is located in China Lake, California, and provides research, development,  testing and evaluation for  weapons systems ranging from missiles to electronic warfare Waiting for business. The  Electronic Warfare Simulation and Evaluation Laboratory also located in China Lake and Point Mugu, California,  tests active and passive  electronic warfare systems and related of embedded software. Among them, the work performed in the laboratory uses flight dynamics and uses scene-controlled computers to simulate advanced actual combat electromagnetic environments, so that the  electronic warfare system  can be trial-run in a realistic laboratory environment. The contract with  AAI Corporation  isn't just about the military's commitment to electronic warfare, it's just a new focus on the issue. Just in December, the military launched at least four fundraisers for offensive and defensive operations. Recently, the U.S. Naval Research Laboratory said it is developing defense technologies for ships and other maritime assets, specifically regarding radio frequencies and electro-optical/infrared technologies. The Air Force is also seeking a way to use high-power electromagnetic technology to complement and enhance cyber and electronic warfare concepts.

Subject: The Air Combat Weapons Division
Equipment: weapons systems ranging from missiles to electronic warfare

Subject: Electronic Warfare Simulation and Evaluation Laboratory

731.doctext: Italian Navy  The fourth and latest  U212A submarine Romeo Romei  set sail for preliminary sea trials.  Submarine USS Romeo Romei After successfully completing the ashore  tests and  acceptance tests of the construction and outfitting phase, the start of construction in  Raspe Zia Bay conducts a series of  sea trials. The boat  was launched in July 2015    and is currently in the final outfitting stage. It is planned  to be delivered this fall    . The submarine has a surface displacement of 1,600 tons, an underwater speed of more than 16 knots, and can accommodate a crew of 27. In addition,  Italian Shipbuilding Finance Group  announced that  Romeo Romei  will be constructed of magnetic materials and use state-of-the-art sound attenuation technology to minimize sound signals.

732.doctext: Lockheed Martin C-130J Hercules transport aircraft's  civilian transport aircraft LM-100J 's first  aircraft components are being manufactured, the first Final assembly of the aircraft will begin later this year in Marietta, Georgia. Ray Fajay, vice president of business development for Lockheed Martin's airlift, special forces and maritime projects, said that the aircraft is planned to make its first flight in early 2017, and the FAA certification test flight project is expected to conduct 12 moon. The first  aircraft  will then be delivered to an unknown customer, Faray said  Lockheed Martin  has launch customers and other potential sales opportunities.  Lockheed Martin has manufactured 115 L-100 Hercules civilian transport aircraft based on the early C-130E, and expects  LM-100J  to have a market demand of 75-100 aircraft .  LM-100J  The sale will be a further expansion of Marietta's C-130J military aircraft production, which currently has an annual output of 24 aircraft. The multi-year contract signed in 2015 is to provide 78  aircraft to the  U.S. Army over a five-year period. There is also an intention for 5 more  aircraft to be purchased in    Delivery  from 2016 to 2020. In addition to the multi-year contract,  Lockheed Martin  believes that the U.S. Air Force and Marine Corps will need 100-110 more of the aircraft to complete the procurement plan.

733.doctext: Britain and  United States will conduct  a  military exercise  this year , testing the response capabilities of the government and nuclear power companies. Sources from government sources say that  Britain and the United States  will cooperate to explore the resilience of nuclear infrastructure after a terrorist attack. The source also stated that such an exercise was not conducted because of credible intelligence of such a terrorist attack threat, but simply out of careful planning for  testing  of  related systems  . In addition, Cameron will sign an exchange agreement with  United States , whereby  United States  will handle 700 kilograms of nuclear waste currently stored in Downray, Scotland, for  United Kingdom . At the same time, the  United States provides  the European Atomic Energy Community   with  another type of  uranium that can be converted into medical isotopes and used For the medical diagnosis and treatment of cancer.

734.doctext: The first of three  Type 209/1400 diesel-electric submarines ordered by the Indonesian Navy was launched in  South Korea's Daewoo Shipbuilding and Marine Engineering Company   span_3.  On March 24,  South Korea's Daewoo Shipbuilding and Marine Engineering Company   held  the launching ceremony of the submarine. The Indonesian Minister of Defense and the Commander of the Indonesian Navy participated in the ceremony .  The Indonesian Navy  revealed that the submarine’s hull number is  No. 403  . Indonesia's  Type 209/1400 submarine  is part of a 2011 contract signed between the Indonesian Defense Minister and  South Korea's Daewoo Shipbuilding & Marine Engineering  worth $1.1 billion. According to the contract, the first two  submarines  will be built in South Korea, and the third  submarine  will be built at the Indonesian PTPAL state-owned shipyard under a technology transfer agreement. Indonesia  Type 209/1400 submarine  It has an underwater displacement of 1,400 tons, a maximum speed of 21 knots, and a maximum combat radius of 10,000 nautical miles at a speed of 10 knots on the surface.  Submarines  Missions include anti-submarine warfare, surface warfare, mine clearance and special operations. The first submarine is expected to be delivered  in March 2017   , and the three  submarines  will all be delivered  by the end of 2018   /span_19 .

735.doctext: March 31, at the  Runway Arrested Landing Test Site at Lakehurst Base, New Jersey, for the  Gerald Ford-class aircraft carrier The  new generation ship landing system successfully implemented the first manned aircraft interception  test.  The test aircraft  is a  U.S. Navy Test and Evaluation Squadron 23   Boeing F/A-18E Super Hornet  .  General Atomics 's  AAG  is a leading turbine power system designed for controlled and reliable recovery operations of aircraft carrier aircraft. The first  aircraft arrest marks a major milestone in the  AAG  performance  demonstration verification and is the culmination of the extensive design and development work that has enabled this innovation The decisive step in moving the technology to the next stage of testing and optimization. Prior to arresting  aircraft, more than 1,200 static load arresting  tests were conducted at the  Rocket Trolley Test Site at Lakehurst Base. The aircraft was successfully intercepted and the overall performance of  AAG power control and system was verified.  AAG system  synchronization  installation  on the upcoming  USS Gerald Ford . In 2013, the  AAG system underwent extensive redesign, which delayed the test plan for 2 years.  The U.S. Navy had to test the upgraded  system while the equipment was being installed on ships. . However, officials from the U.S. Naval Air Systems Command stated that the main problem on the  Ford aircraft carrier was a software problem and there were not a lot of hardware improvements. They were confident that there would not be a technical duplication or the removal/replacement of any delivered parts. equipment.

736.doctext: Embraer KC-390 military transport aircraft The second and final flight test aircraft made its first flight on  April 28 in  Gaviao Paixoto   , the first flight test aircraft also started a series of key envelope  tests, including lowering and raising the rear ramp during flight. The aircraft also tested opening and closing other functions during flight. 2  hatches - cargo door and  parachute exit. Embraer CEO Frederico Fleury Curado said the company was very satisfied with the development progress. Curado said  Embraer is also optimistic about the future of its contract with the  Brazilian Air Force, which calls for the delivery of   to the  Brazilian Air Force 28  KC-390 , the first 3 are planned to start  delivery in  2018. But he acknowledged that Brazil's political chaos and domestic economy have created new constraints on government spending. He pointed to recent signs that  the Brazilian Air Force  is delivering on its investment commitments to  Embraer  . The project was suspended for several months in 2015 after  the Brazilian Air Force stopped paying funds to  Embraer, and last August  Embraer and  The Brazilian Air Force signed an agreement to resume investment and pay the remaining amount in the next four years. Currently  the Brazilian Air Force is fulfilling the relevant content in accordance with the agreement.  PIA has also signed a commitment to sell 32  aircraft with five other countries. However, these orders have not yet been converted into firm orders. By the end of this year  PIA Marketing efforts to the above-mentioned 5 countries and other potential countries will be strengthened.

739.doctext: The U.S. Army  and  Marine Corps   will conduct field  trials  of Bionic Power's regenerative walking technology. Bionic Dynamics has received a $1.25 million contract from the Office of the Secretary of Defense to provide its development of low-volume  production powered walking kinetic energy harvester components  . Wearing the  Powered Walking Collector  reduces battery weight while continuing to provide life-saving power in the fields of communications, navigation and optics. These components are being  tested  under the Joint Infantry Company Prototype Project. The goal of the Joint Infantry Company Prototype program is to develop and test a system capable of powering dismounted units, with the goal of reducing the logistical burden on dismounted units and increasing their self-sufficiency.  Powered Walking  is a lightweight leg exoskeleton that mimics each movement of a soldier and harvests energy while walking or running. The  U.S. Army and  Marine Corps will begin joint  testing under the new contract  early mid-2017 .  Power walking  requires the use of minimal effort while reducing muscle fatigue during downhill walking, thereby reducing metabolic rate and reducing the likelihood of injury. The technical director for the Joint Infantry Company prototype at Naval Surface Warfare Center Dahlgolen Division said in a statement that field testing is important to help the  Marine Corps and  Army define future small force power programs. is crucial. Data and direct feedback from base exercises are needed to develop technologies and systems that enable forces to achieve power autonomy, where power is generated and managed equal to power consumed.

Subject: The U.S. Army  and  Marine Corps
Equipment: production powered walking kinetic energy harvester components

740.doctext: The U.S. Navy is jointly executing a three-year contract with Northrop Grumman to develop shipborne high-energy laser weapons to quickly improve its ability to fight enemy unmanned boats, aircraft, surface ships, and missiles. Tom, director of the Air Combat and Weapons Division of the Office of Naval Research, said that this system uses multi-spectrum target detection and tracking technology, as well as advanced off-axis beam director and improved fiber laser technology to engage targets at longer distances. In addition, other hardware and software of this system have also been upgraded from the laser weapon prototype currently being tested.  The Office of Naval Research will spend 12 months and US$53 million to develop the  laser weapon system demonstration prototype in three phases: the first phase will mainly complete the initial design, and the second phase will be carried out Ground  testing, the third phase will be  testing on the  Navy Self-Defense Test Ship. Northrop Grumman will be responsible for the design and production of the 150-kilowatt solid laser weapon system and support for shipboard testing. Northrop Grumman said that if the  Office of Naval Research  wants to complete all contract elements, the total contract value and total term will be expanded to $91 million and 34 months. The ultimate goal of this research is to develop a  high-energy laser weapon engineering prototype  for the next step of  testing  analysis. It is unclear whether this type of laser weapon will eventually be used in actual combat, but judging from current related work, this type of weapon is likely to be equipped with large surface ships and provide a cheap means of attack and defense.

741.doctext: [Belgian Navy Recognition Network reported on May 7, 2020] Russian shipbuilding industry sources said on May 6 that the  11711 large amphibious landing ship Peter Mogunov will be launched in  in May In the second half of the year resume  sea trials.  The shipyard originally expected to restart sea trials of the large amphibious landing ship  Pyotr Mogunov in late April, but later postponed to  early May /span_5 Start  sea trials, and plan to   deliver  to  Russian Navy at the end of May.  Peter Mogunov is the second ship of the Type 11711 amphibious landing ship and the first serial production Type 11711 warship. The construction contract was signed in September 2014 and construction began in June 2015. . The ship has a displacement of 5,000 tons and can carry 13 main battle tanks and 36 armored personnel carriers or infantry fighting vehicles. It can also transport a reinforced company of naval infantry mobile military equipment and land it using pontoons. Weapons and equipment include a 30mm six-barreled gun and two Ka-29 transport/attack helicopters. The first ship of this type,  Ivan Glenn, was launched in  May 2012 in  Kaliningrad  , put into service on June 20, 2018.

742.doctext: [Reported by Jane's Defense Weekly on December 26, 2019]  On December 24,  Myanmar launched its first  amphibious dock landing ship HMAS Madaban A commissioning ceremony was held at  Yangon Navy Pier   to commemorate the 72nd anniversary of the  Myanmar Navy. According to the Office of the Commander-in-Chief of Defense, a new offshore transport ship Angsmyitkyina, two 27-meter-long fast patrol boats, two ocean-going tugboats and two 20-meter-long inland river patrol boats were also put into service during the same period.  Motor Class was built by  South Korea and launched in  July 2019 in  Busan   , based on the Makassar-class amphibious landing ship built by  Korea Daesun Shipbuilding and Marine Engineering for the Indonesian and Philippine navies. The ship is the largest ship of the  Myanmar Navy, with a length of 122 meters and a displacement of 11,300 tons. The flight deck can accommodate two medium-sized MilMi-17 transport helicopters and can carry 15 armored vehicles and 250 marines. team members and provide a hospital facility. The ship has been undergoing  sea trials  since its launch, and has docked in Vladivostok in the Russian Far East and Da Nang, Vietnam.

746.doctext: [Reported by the Belgian Navy on October 9, 2020]  U.S. Navy   The 26th Independence-class Littoral Combat Ship USS Mobile   September 25 Complete acceptance  test in  Gulf of Mexico. During the test, the  U.S. Navy conducted a comprehensive  test of the  USS Mobile's  main propulsion, auxiliary and electrical systems , and carried out full power demonstration, steering and rapid reversing, anchoring, and process testing of the combat system from detection to response. After commissioning and delivery,  Mobile  will sail to its homeport in San Diego along with 12 other Independence-class littoral combat ships such as USS Independence, USS Coronado, USS Jackson and USS Montgomery. 747.doctext: [Reported by the U.S. Navy Technology Network on February 28, 2020]  The U.S. Navy's  Unmanned Inductive Mine Clearance System is commonly used by  Textron Systems Corporation Based on the design of unmanned surface ships, the project will soon enter the small batch trial production stage and reach milestone C.  The U.S. Navy said it will soon exercise its option to procure an initial batch of three low-volume production systems under its existing contract with  Textron Corp., with plans  Delivery in 2021    .  The unmanned induction minesweeping system is designed as part of the littoral combat ship's mine countermeasures mission package, including a mine countermeasures unmanned surface vehicle and a towed minesweeper that can detect magnetic and acoustic signals, and can Carrying interchangeable payloads for different missions, it is mainly used for mine countermeasures, intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance. While the system is designed for use on Littoral Combat Ships, it is suitable for use on other ships and can be launched from shore. The development and testing of the system ended  last November. It mainly conducted tests on shore-based launch and recovery, command and control, mission planning and post-mission analysis, and completed the test with littoral combat ships and Integration  testing on other ships, including end-to-end mine clearance missions using simulated mine targets. (Gao Meng, China Shipbuilding Industry Comprehensive Technical and Economic Research Institute)

750.doctext: [According to a report on the Russian TASS news agency website on March 13, 2021] On March 12, 2021, relevant personnel in the Russian defense industry stated that  Severodvinsk Shipyard built the  Krasnoyar The Sksk nuclear submarine is planned to be launched  in August 2021 . 751.doctext: [Global Network Military Report] The Russian Satellite News Agency reported on May 8 that  Russian Defense Ministry Deputy Minister Alexey Krivoruchko said that  this year will The  test of the  Zircon submarine-launched hypersonic missile was carried out on the  Project 22350 frigate and the  Project 885 nuclear attack submarine. Russia's  Type 855 nuclear submarine Severodvinsk reported that the  Zircon missile conducted its first  test last December  , was carried out on the  Project 22350 Admiral Gorshkov frigate. Therefore, this year will be the first time it is tested on a submarine. Krivoruchko said: This year plans to test on the Type 22350 surface ship and the  Type 885 multi-purpose nuclear submarine . The Zircon hypersonic missile has a speed of Mach 9 and a range of more than 1,000 kilometers. In the future, Russian Navy surface ships and submarines will be equipped with this type of missile. According to the plan, the improved Type 885 Ash-M class first boat Kazan will be delivered to the Navy in September.

USS Delaware  is the last of the third batch of Virginia-class nuclear submarines. This batch has a redesigned bow and increased load capacity. Construction of the submarine started in September 2013 and was launched in December 2018. A total of 10,000 employees from Newport News Shipyard and General Dynamics Electric Boat participated in the construction.

755.doctext: [Global Network Military Report] On April 20, local time, a Russian military  MiG-31 interceptor aircraft developed a malfunction alarm during flight training in the Perm Territory and landed at the airport. 756.doctext: Data map: Japan's new domestic C-X transport aircraft Data map: Close-up of the nose of Japan's C-X transport aircraft International online special article: Japan's "Tokyo Shimbun" reported on January 8, according to relevant sources,  Japan's Ministry of Defense Same as  span_1 Kawasaki Heavy Industries will conduct the  first test of the  new-generation C-X transport aircraft at the  Air Self-Defense Force Gifu Base  later this month Test flight. If the test flight is successful and its safety is confirmed, the transport aircraft will  be delivered to   Ministry of Defense  for use. According to the Air Self-Defense Force's new generation transport aircraft development plan, the C-X transport aircraft, as the successor to the current main transport aircraft C-1, is mainly contracted and built by  Kawasaki Heavy Industries. It is built by  Kawasaki Heavy Industries near the Qifu base. span_9 Development is carried out at the Kifu Plant. The C - The test flight was postponed. The C-X transport aircraft is 44 meters long and 44 meters wide. It is 1.5 times the size of the Japanese domestic aircraft C-1, and its range and load capacity are four times that of the C-1. The engine is made in the United States, and the body is independently developed in Japan. The plan to transform this transport aircraft into a civilian transport aircraft is currently under discussion. If quantitative production is achieved, it will have an impact on the aircraft industry in the Tokai region of Japan. 760.doctext: China News Service, August 5. According to the China National Defense Science and Technology Information Network,  the Indian Navy  's first  domestically produced aircraft carrier  will be launched in  August Launched on the 12th at the  Cochin Shipyard   , this will make India the fifth country in the world capable of building  aircraft carriers. Indian Navy Deputy Chief of Staff and Vice Admiral R.K.DHOWAN said that the 40,000-ton  domestically produced aircraft carrier  is the most prestigious among Indian warship projects, and it is also unprecedented in terms of scale and complexity. It is reported that the aircraft carrier was designed by the  Indian Navy  design organization and built at the  Cochin Shipyard . The aircraft carrier has two take-off runways, and the landing area is equipped with three arresting cables, which can realize short take-off and arrested landing of aircraft.  Aircraft carrier  It is equipped with domestic light fighter jets, MiG-29 fighter jets and multiple helicopters. The aircraft carrier will be equipped with a long-range ship-to-air missile system, as well as multi-functional radar and short-range weapons systems. Dhowan said. Dhowan said that the main outfitting work will be completed in 2016, after which a large number of  sea trials  will be carried out. He added that the aircraft carrier is expected to be delivered to the Navy as early as  2018   .

761.doctext: [Reported by Netherlands Today Navy Network on November 15, 2019]  November 11,  South Korean Navy   Seoul frigate in  Hyundai Heavy Industries  Successfully  launched, planned  to be delivered in early 2021   .  Seoul  is the first  Daegu-class frigate built by  HHI . It is also the third frigate of this class. The first two ships were built by  Built by Daewoo Shipbuilding and  Offshore Engineering Company,  the first ship Daegu was delivered in  March 2018    used, the second one was used in  June this year in  South Korea's  Daewoo Shipyard 's  Okpo Shipyard   Launch.  Daegu-class frigate is also known as  FFXII type. It is  an improved version of the Incheon-class frigate. It is 122 meters long and has a displacement of 500 tons more than before. It has a weight of 2,800 tons and is powered by a Rolls-Royce MT30 gas turbine with a top speed of 30 knots. It is equipped with a 16-unit Korean vertical launch system and 6 torpedo launch tubes, which are used to defend against air threats and anti-submarine warfare. It will also carry a towed array sonar system and naval artillery and Phalanx close-in weapons systems. The South Korean Defense Acquisition Agency has awarded a total of eight construction contracts for this type of frigates, and the construction plan for the third batch of frigates is also in progress. They have a displacement of 3,000 tons and are equipped with phased array radars.

Subject: Built by Daewoo Shipbuilding
Daewoo Shipyard
Offshore Engineering Company
Materials: an improved version of the Incheon-class frigate

762.doctext: Indian Navy   Domestic stealth warship   launched  According to a report on the US Defense News website on December 2, 2009, the Indian Navy Commander is very concerned about the speed of shipbuilding and hopes to review the construction process. The Indian Navy Chief proposed at the annual Navy Day press conference on December 2 that we need to review the shipyard’s construction strategy. And more measures need to be taken. The construction schedule is the main problem currently facing our shipyard. The main reason for the schedule delay was the basic method of construction. India's shipbuilding capabilities are currently at saturation, and the Navy plans to introduce more ships to the Navy to replace a large number of ships that will be retired in the next five years. The Navy has ordered 34 ships from three different shipyards, but the delivery rate is only one ship a year. The Navy plans to order more than $15 billion worth of weapons and equipment over the next 10 to 12 years. Under the long-term plan approved in 2008, the Navy will purchase 60 new surface ships, submarines, an aircraft carrier, maritime reconnaissance aircraft, C4ISR, specialized satellites and other sea-based equipment.  India's   first self-developed aircraft carrier will be  launched next year    and is expected to be put into service in 2014. The second one will be built locally. Aircraft carriers may also be approved for construction. However, the Navy Commander stated that the aircraft carrier must be redesigned and it will not be a replica of the current self-developed aircraft carrier.

763.doctext: [According to defense-aerospace website report on June 19, 2020] Following the completion of the  British Navy   early this year the naval autonomous advance force held in  northern Norway  After the exercise  severe weather conditions test, land trailer simulated take-off and landing test,   British Navy NavyX project team,  span_7 Discovery Analysis and Rapid Development Team and  British Malloy Aviation and Planck Aviation Systems UAV Company jointly developed the  Malloy heavy-duty cargo drone, and it was Conduct a new round of on-site  testing of ship takeoff and landing. It is reported that the  Malloy UAV  is a heavy-duty cargo UAV designed to provide supplies to  Navy  ships. It can carry a load of 180 kg and has a range of 20 kilometers.  The British Navy  believes that using drones to perform logistics support tasks can reduce operating costs, reduce the time to complete tasks, and reduce certain risks faced by ship personnel. [Original information...] Read [Collection] Related topics: Products and Technology

764.doctext: At 22:41 on April 20, 2019, my country successfully used the  Long March 3B carrier rocket at the  Xichang Satellite Launch Center and successfully  Launched   the 44th Beidou navigation satellite. This launch is the first launch of Beidou navigation satellites in 2019, kicking off this year's Beidou high-density networking. This satellite is the 20th networking satellite of the Beidou-3 system and the first tilted geosynchronous orbit satellite of the Beidou-3 system. After a series of on-orbit  tests, the satellite will be the same as the one previously launched. 18 medium earth orbit satellites and 1 geosynchronous orbit satellite are networked together. This hybrid constellation design including three different types of orbit satellites is unique to the Beidou system and the first in the world. It will effectively increase the number of visible satellites in the Asia-Pacific region. Provide better services to the Asia-Pacific region. The Beidou navigation satellite and supporting launch vehicle launched this time were developed by  China Academy of Space Technology and  China Academy of Launch Vehicle Technology respectively. . This is the 302nd flight of the Long March series of launch vehicles and the 100th flight of the Long March-3A series of launch vehicles.

Subject: China Academy of Space Technology
China Academy of Launch Vehicle Technology
China Academy of Space Technology
China Academy of Launch Vehicle Technology

765.doctext: According to a report on the Belgian Navy’s recognized website on August 21,  Russian Navy   Project 20385 Roar frigate left  St. Petersburg Northern Shipyard on August 20 for  span_3 Baltic Sea Constructor's  sea trials conducted. The sea trial will last about three months, and a delivery team composed of  shipyard representatives,  designers and contractors will conduct all  shipboard systems and special equipment   Inspection of the operation in combat mode, including  radar, sonar, air platforms and weapons and equipment, etc., aiming to discover and eliminate defects, and provide Prepare for  Navy acceptance  sea trials in  December.  Roar is the first ship of the Type 20385 frigate. It was designed by the Russian Diamond Central Ship Design Bureau. Construction started on February 1, 2012.  In June 2017,   was launched. , the ship's  equipment has  8-unit UKSK vertical launch system, which can  launch   Club cruise missiles Or  P-800 Onyx supersonic anti-ship missile, and is equipped with a Ka-27 helicopter hangar. After delivery, it will serve in the Russian Pacific Fleet and is mainly used to detect and destroy enemy submarines and water surfaces. Ships, providing support for troop landings and other offshore combat missions. The ship will also be the first warship in the Russian Pacific Fleet to carry Club cruise missiles. Wang Hongshu, China Shipbuilding Industry Comprehensive Technical and Economic Research Institute

designers and contractors

766.doctext: [According to a report from the U.S. Naval Academy News Network on May 28]  USS Zumwalt  After the first ship is finally delivered in September this year, it will continue to conduct combat system testing to promote the maturity of the system. Previously, the  U.S. Navy will   Zumwalt-class destroyer combat system   install on the  USS Foster for testing  Test was conducted on the ship, and on  April 26, 2019   launched a  RIM-162 improved naval The Sparrow Missile proved that the combat system can detect and intercept cruise missiles, helicopters and surface threats. The combat system had previously been  tested  only at the  Ground Facility at Wallops Island, Virginia  . Currently, the lead ship  USS Zumwalt has completed the installation of combat systems, and has recently sailed in the waters of California,  Alaska and  Hawaii Conducted  Combat System trials and other post-delivery  testing. The ship has passed land and test ship tests, which has significantly reduced technical risks. However, there are no relevant land facilities for underwater parts such as sonar systems to carry out tests. Subsequent tests will mainly rely on the ship itself to carry out relevant system tests. The second ship of the class  USS Michael Monsoor  was delivered in  January  and  integrated  with the  combat system  . The third ship, USS Lyndon B. Johnson, is scheduled to be delivered in 2020.
