767.doctext: [According to  General Atomics reported on March 8, 2019]  General Atomics Electromagnetic Systems announced the completion of the first end-to-end  Aluminum Power System  Demonstration to power a  remotely operated underwater vehicle at the company's test tank facility. During the demonstration, the  aluminum power system  was used to generate hydrogen and oxygen and deliver them to Teleda Energy Systems' fuel cells to generate electricity to drive the remotely operated vehicle.  General Atomic Electromagnetic Systems  said the demonstration was an important milestone, showing for the first time that the  Aluminum Power System  could be integrated with a fuel cell system to power an underwater vehicle.  Aluminum power system  is a unique high specific energy system that can provide 10 times the energy output of similar batteries. Due to its long shelf life, good safety and high specific energy,  aluminum power system  can truly realize an underwater refueling station to support long-endurance unmanned underwater vehicles.  General Atomic Electromagnetic Systems  stated that we view fuel cells as an important component in supporting the missions of large UUVs and other underwater platforms. Prior to this demonstration, we had only successfully  tested  the  aluminum powertrain  with the  load box  . Working with Teleda, we were able to integrate the end-to-end system and test it under real-world conditions. Results and data collected during the demonstration will be used to continue testing and optimizing the  aluminum power system  to meet the energy needs of future underwater platforms.

768.doctext: [Navy Today reported on March 6, 2019]  On January 26,  the Russian Navy   held the third  Alexander class ship Commissioning ceremony of the minesweeper  Ivan Antonov  .  Ivan Antonov's flag-raising ceremony was held in  Baltisk, whose home port is Sevastopol, which will become the  Russian Navy Baltic Sea A member of the fleet.  Ivan Antonov  Displacement of 890 tons, length of 62 meters, crew of 44 people. Sredne-Nevsky Shipyard started shipbuilding in January 2017,  and launched in April 2018. The ship is designed to provide mine protection, detection and destruction for naval bases and coastal waters, provide mine protection for transit ships, exclusive economic zones and offshore mineral deposits, conduct mine reconnaissance and dispose of minefields. When the mine threat is low, the ship can be used for both water protection and training.​

769.doctext: Russia's TASS news agency reported that Russia's Tupolev has developed a full-scale model of the future long-range aviation system. The PAKDA model is made based on the flight wing layout. The materials for the several models that have been completed are mainly composite materials and wood.  The new bomber will minimize radar exposure through the use of radar-absorbing materials and embedded weapon systems in the structure. It will also be equipped with a new domestic electronic warfare system that has not been simulated by other countries in the world. . In addition, sources from the  Russian defense industry revealed to TASS that the  new bomber is capable of subsonic flight, and its first test prototype will be completed in  2025  First flight. TASS has not yet received official confirmation of the above news. Russian Deputy Defense Minister Yuri Borisov said earlier that PAKDA may be announced in 2018 and that its performance will surpass existing bombers.  Russia plans to deliver the  new bomber   to   troops in  2023-2025,  First flight work will be carried out in  2019-2020. However, the development of the  new bomber  was subsequently delayed due to the resumption of mass production of the Tu-160.

770.doctext: With  funding from  NGO,  African bush plane operator Manaf Cargo has confirmed the purchase of 4 from Canadian  Solar A  small cargo airship will provide critical support for joint expeditions in the African Great Lakes region. Manaf will receive two 200kg-class Lynx hybrid airships with a range of 200km and capable of vertical take-off and landing; it will also receive two 5000kg-class Wolverine hybrid airships with a range of 500km and the ability to carry 20-foot cargo hold. The first airship will be delivered in 2017 and will initially be used in Burundi. The Bobcat hybrid airship is already flying, but  solar companies  are still tinkering with its design. The larger  Wolverine Hybrid Airship  is under development and is expected to make its first flight in  2017    .

Subject: NGO
Object: African bush plane operator Manaf Cargo

771.doctext: Airbus Group's Silicon Valley-based innovation company A³  has awarded  Modern Technology Solutions  a contract to provide  Vahana  in the air. Flight testing and station services.  MTSI Corporation  has formed a joint team with the Oregon SOAR Agency. SOAR operates three FAA-designated UAV test sites as part of the Pan-Pacific UAV Test Facility.  MTSI  will lead the  Vahana  flight  testing  work, SOAR will provide test site support, and the prototype of the aircraft is planned  by the end of 2017  First flight.  Vahana  is a single-seat, autonomous, vertical take-off and landing small aircraft that can be used for short-distance urban transportation.  A³ Company plans to conduct a test flight of the  Vahana full-scale prototype at the end of 2017, and  complete the production prototype development and  test flight in 2020 .

Subject: Airbus Group's Silicon Valley-based innovation company A³
A³ Company
Date: complete the production prototype development and  test flight in 2020

772.doctext: Airbus  plans to deliver  the first  C295W search and Rescue aircraft. At present, the aircraft has completed its  first flight  and is undergoing preparations for delivery.  Brazil ordered three  C295W search and rescue aircraft in June 2014 to supplement its fleet of 12 C295 transport aircraft,  Airbus Initially planned for delivery of the first aircraft in late 2014, the  C295W  is equipped with third-generation integrated tactical systems, a technology also used by  Airbus  in Canada's $3.2 billion fixed-wing search and rescue mission A bargaining chip for the rescue aircraft project. The other two competitors are the C-27J and KC-390, with Canada planning to select the winner by the end of 2016.

773.doctext: Russia  Heavy UAV series Altair  has now entered a critical stage. The developers stated that the test prototype completed the  test flight  in  2016  in accordance with the project schedule, and its flight was suspended in December of the same year. According to the plan, the first batch of  test prototypes  modified based on the test flight results will continue to  test flights  in the  spring-summer  stage.  Altair series drones  adopt fully automated take-off and landing methods, and can also be converted to manual operation according to the situation. Simultaneous with the manufacturing of test prototypes is the development of weapon systems for a new generation of reconnaissance and strike unmanned systems. Researchers said that the UAV will be equipped with a large number of weapons and equipment, and some prototypes are currently equipped with corresponding weapon systems.  In the summer of 2016  Russia  media reported about the first flight of  Russian heavy UAV   in  Kazan  's message. UAV satellite-produced images from  Kazan Airport  appeared on the web in the autumn. The UAV is equipped with two REDA03/V12 diesel engines with aerial propellers and a take-off power of about 500 horsepower. It can operate continuously for 2 days without supplies and has a maximum flight altitude of 12 kilometers. The body length is 12 meters, the wingspan is about 30 meters, and the maximum flight distance is 10,000 kilometers. Industry experts estimate that the drone weighs about 5 tons. It is reported that the drone may be used to perform tasks such as monitoring the Arctic region. Mass production will begin in 2018. Russia has not yet disclosed any more information about the drone.

774.doctext: According to the US "Aviationnow" report on June 27, 2002, after 44 months of development and testing,  American Honeywell Company's  AS907 turbofan engine has been approved by the United States Airworthiness certificate issued by the Federal Aviation Administration. Last week, the FAA issued a model and production certificate to  Honeywell . The  AS907 engine  with a thrust of 7,500 pounds will be used in Bombardier Aircraft Company's business jet Flexjet. It is expected that aircraft equipped with  AS907 engines  will enter service in mid-2003. So far, Bombardier has received orders for 125 aircraft from Continental Airlines.  Honeywell  will start producing the first production engine in September this year and deliver it to Bombardier in December. In the design and production of this new engine,  Honeywell  always puts the needs of users first, and puts operating costs, maintenance costs and reliability in an important position. Currently,  AS907 engine  has conducted nearly 18,000 hours of testing and completed 50,000 mission cycles. The  trial  of  AS907  will continue until  2003  . Currently,  Honeywell is  testing a total of 18  AS907 engines, and there are also 10  engines Flight  tests are ongoing and more than 675 flight hours have been completed.

775.doctext: Sikorsky Aircraft Company has started the final assembly work of the first  HH-60W combat rescue helicopter. This progress is ahead of the end of  this year  Overall arrangements for the first flight.  HH-60W  is a modification of the UH-60M aircraft.  The U.S. Air Force  spent US$8.12 billion to purchase 112 aircraft to replace the old HH-60G helicopter fleet. , performing search and rescue missions for pilots in distress. The Sikorsky Air Force project director said: Entering final assembly now means that the manufacturing work of the aircraft is two months ahead of schedule. Even so, U.S. government auditors are keeping a close eye on the program, arguing that the  Air Force is ignoring best practices in an effort to quickly get the long-awaited  HH-60W helicopters into service Strategy. After several failed attempts to procure larger helicopters, and in order to avoid a series of legal challenges due to a lack of bidders, the  U.S. Air Force announced the CRH project in 2014, and the procurement was carried out on an existing platform. Small modifications to the resulting helicopter. In order to enable  HH-60W  to reach a larger platform level in terms of mission capabilities,  the U.S. Air Force integrated a new sensor, radar and multi-purpose self-defense system based on the UH-60M The tactical mission component will also be replaced with a new fuel system, which will double the internal fuel capacity of the UH-60M to 660 gallons.  Sikorsky plans to build 9 engineering and manufacturing prototypes and provide  103  production aircraft to the  U.S. Air Force   .

Subject: Sikorsky Aircraft Company
Sikorsky
Materials: production aircraft to the  U.S. Air Force   .

Human_Trig: Overall arrangements for the first flight
Subject: Sikorsky Aircraft Company
Sikorsky

776.doctext: Aviation Jet Engine - Rocketdyne Corporation successfully completed the thermal combustion  test of a  new space engine ISE-100 . The engine is very likely to Becoming a key component for future lunar robotic missions.  ISE-100  is  Rocketdyne's latest space engine developed for commercial space applications, adding a mission-proven thruster portfolio to provide propulsion during flight force and also provides landing thrust for missions to Mars and asteroids.  ISE-100 engine  Using MON-25/MMH as propellant, it is economical, affordable and reliable. MON-25 is a high-performance storable oxidant with a low freezing point, which is particularly suitable for deep space environments. During the test, the engine successfully completed 75 individual tests, 774 pulses and more than 500 seconds of hot test time. Key tests conducted in the program include multiple long steady-state burns; multiple short bursts; and the long-lasting duty cycles required for robotic lunar lander missions  tests  .  Rocketdyne  Julie, vice president of advanced space programs, said: "We have developed and demonstrated a low-cost, high-performance engine capable of carrying a payload to the moon.

777.doctext: On December 6,  Belarusian Armed Forces Chief of General Staff Lieutenant General Kozlovsky said that  in 2019 the Belarusian military  tested  Upgraded  Polonaise and  Hurricane-M Multiple Rocket Launcher System . The development of reconnaissance means, automated command and control systems, artillery and missile force support subsystems, and modernization of key artillery and missile weapons are Belarusian military priorities.  In 2019,  Belarusian Military Forces successfully  tested the  Hurricane-M multiple rocket launcher system, which was installed in Belarus On the chassis, a portable reconnaissance and fire control system was developed. Work is currently being completed on the development of a new ballistic moving target detection device.  The Belarusian military  earlier in  2019   test-fired  the  Polonaise-M multiple rocket launcher system  . According to the  Polonaise-M multiple rocket launcher system  modernization plan, the range will reach 300 kilometers.  In May of this year during the  exercise held at the  Sarishagan Shooting Range in Kazakhstan,  troops also  used SS-21 Scarab Tactical Missile System. In  2018~2019,  Belarusian artillery and missile forces   conducted about 1,000 indirect fire exercises and more than 300 direct-fire/anti-tank missile launches  exercises   .

Subject: Belarusian Armed Forces
Equipment: Upgraded  Polonaise and  Hurricane-M Multiple Rocket Launcher System

Subject: troops
Content: used SS-21 Scarab Tactical Missile System

778.doctext: USS Ford The Department of Public Affairs stated on June 7 that in the post-delivery test  test, the  Carrier Air Wing 8 has completed so far The largest ship landing test marks a major milestone for  USS Ford.  During the test,  The 8th Carrier Air Wing conducted day and night flight cycles and completed a total of 324 ejection takeoffs and arrested landings. A total of 50 pilots passed the qualification Certification. The trials also tested secure communications and tactical data links to support the use of networked weapons, the Joint Close Air Support System for fixed-wing and rotary-wing aircraft, and SIMDIS, a multi-dimensional graphical interaction and video display system that enables Replays of major events. To date, the  USS Ford has used electromagnetic catapult systems and advanced arresting devices to conduct 3,480 catapult takeoffs and arresting landings for fighter aircraft, and has used advanced weapons elevators for the  aircraft carrier Comprehensive transportation of weapons provides opportunities. So far, the advanced weapons elevator has completed more than 10,000 cycles. During this sea  test, Rear Adm. Craig Clapperton, commander of  Carrier Strike Group 12, boarded the  USS Ford for the first time. He said that the current test is aimed at discovering abnormalities on the  USS Ford and proposing feasible solutions. Currently, a command and control test plan among the ships in the strike group has been prepared in advance.

779.doctext: Recently,  Australia's Gilmore Aerospace Company successfully conducted a  self-developed hybrid rocket engine ignition  test with an ignition time of 110 Seconds, it is the hybrid rocket engine with the longest ignition time at present.  Gilmore Aerospace Company is developing a  three-stage small rocket. In this test, the upper stage engine was ignited, and a full operating cycle was completed and  verified  It improves the throttling capability and lays the foundation for the subsequent development of primary and secondary engines with greater thrust. The company plans to achieve the first flight of the  rocket   in  2022   with the goal of providing low-cost launch services for small satellites.

780.doctext: According to the information released by  India media,  India will start the system of  INS Vikrant from  this month Mooring  test, the test content mainly includes propulsion and ship electrical system.  INS Vikrant  was designed by the Indian Naval Design Bureau and built by  Cochin Shipyard . The design of the ship began in 1999, and construction started in February 2009.  It was launched on August 12, 2013.    .  INS Vikrant  It is 262 meters long, 62 meters wide, with a displacement of 40,000 tons. It is powered by 4 General Electric LM2500+ gas turbines, with a maximum speed of 28 knots and an endurance of 8,000 nautical miles. The ship can carry 36 to 40 aircraft and is equipped with four 76mm naval guns, two sets of 32-unit vertical launch systems and the AK-630 close-in defense weapon system.

781.doctext: Russia's Kuznetsov Plant begins delivery of new mass-produced engines for  Tu-160M2 bomber  Samara Kuznet, a member of the Russian United Engine Manufacturing Group Zov Factory has started regular delivery of new mass-produced  NK-32-02 engines for the  Tu-160M2 supersonic bomber.  Kuznetsov Plant concluded procurement contracts with  Tupolev Design Bureau and  Russian Ministry of Defense, of which  was delivered first /span_8's two  NK-32-02 engines are completely assembled from Russian domestic materials and components; in the future, this engine will replace all NK-32-01 engines. Since 1995, product deliveries from the  Kuznetsov plant  have been interrupted for 25 years, during which time only aircraft engines of the long-range aviation unit of the Russian Aerospace Forces were repaired and maintained. In order to resume production of  NK-32-02 ,  Kuznetsov Plant  underwent extensive modernization and updating of production processes.  Last week at  Gorbunov Kazan Aviation Plant, equipped with  NK-32-02   Tu-160M2 bomber span_17  First flight, the flight altitude was 6223 meters and lasted two hours and twenty minutes. The crew performed all necessary checks on the updated common systems and avionics and also  evaluated  the performance of the new engines. The flight was conducted in normal mode and systems and equipment were operating normally.

782.doctext: Russia  completed the upgrade of the  2S7M Marka 203 mm self-propelled howitzer . The first  upgraded 2S7M  is ready to be delivered to the Russian Armed Forces, and its manufacturer is preparing for serial modernization.  Upgraded 2S7M  The gearbox, internal communications and radio stations were replaced, and all parts imported from Ukraine were replaced with Russian-made parts, improving maneuverability, control capabilities and all major characteristics. The gun has successfully passed all  tests designed to verify maneuverability, operating gear characteristics, power transmission, etc. In addition, it has also  tested the  loading device, the 2A44 gun Endurance capability and fire control system.

Subject: Russia
Equipment: loading device, the 2A44 gun Endurance capability and fire control system

783.doctext: The Estonian Disaster Relief Team   last week  conducted a  urban search and rescue   exercise  using Milrem Robotics’ multifunctional rescue unmanned vehicle.  . The exercise personnel used multifunctional rescue unmanned vehicles to transport the equipment of the two urban search and rescue teams to the operation area, which made it easier to transport the equipment to the search and rescue area faster while reducing energy consumption. The exercise was conducted at the  Estonian Rescue Committee's main training facility  . The multifunctional rescue unmanned vehicle has a maximum load capacity of 1,200kg and can be used to clean landslide areas containing many heavy concrete fragments. This kind of work was usually done manually in the past; the vehicle body is of suitable height and can provide first aid to the injured on the stretcher it carries; The noise signal is low; the vehicle can be remotely controlled from a safe distance to check the direction of the vehicle; the operator can also move with the unmanned vehicle in a safer area. In future  exercises,  Estonian Disaster Relief Team hopes to   test this  during a rope rescue using a vehicle as an anchor. Autonomous vehicles   . Such unmanned vehicles can also be equipped with gas detectors to determine whether the search and rescue area is safe. The unmanned vehicle can also have intelligent functions and can move autonomously from point A to point B, or independently follow the operator to perform tasks.

Subject: The Estonian Disaster Relief Team
Area: Estonian Rescue Committee's main training facility

784.doctext: The Indian Air Force has issued a tender for the purchase of HTT-40 primary trainer aircraft. The Indian Air Force plans to issue a tender for the procurement of 70 HTT-40 primary trainer aircraft to  Hindustan Aeronautics . The tender document clearly stipulates the start date of production, completion of delivery within two years, and employee quality requirements. After the Indian Air Force completes the installation of the first batch of 70 HTT-40s, it will order 36 more. Currently,  HAL  has completed the  HTT-40 prototype anti-spin parachute system bench  testing  and is conducting 10-15 spins  test flight, the Indian Air Force has sent test flight personnel to assist  HAL  in user-assisted technology verification. It is reported that the development cost of  HAL  on the HTT-40 primary trainer aircraft is approximately 5.5 billion rupees.

785.doctext: Northrop Grumman this week produced the first  multi-purpose electronically scanned array radar antenna for Australia's Wedgetail Airborne Warning and Control System aircraft. , and has been installed and ready for  testing. The Australian Defense Force signed a contract with Boeing to purchase 4 AEW&C aircraft converted from  Boeing 737-700 . MESA is  Northrop Grumman  for Boeing. Developed under the company's Wedge Tail program. MESA provides 360-degree electronically controlled horizontal scanning without mechanical rotation. The antenna is installed on the upper rear part of the fuselage. It is an advanced three-layer composite lightweight antenna structure, which is a side-firing multi-channel array and an axial radiation array. MESA can carry out a variety of surveillance methods, using pulse Doppler radar mode for air search and pulse mode for sea search. In addition, it can also be used for identification of friend or foe by military and civilian aircraft.  MESA  will be  first quarter of next year  for flight  test  and  delivery in May next year    To Boeing Military Aircraft Flight Center. The first  Boeing 737-700  equipped with MESA will make its first flight in  early 2004  for comprehensive flight  testing  .

Subject: Northrop Grumman
Northrop Grumman
Equipment: multi-purpose electronically scanned array radar antenna

786.doctext: April 5-13,  U.S. Air National Guard-Air Force Reserve Command Test Center and  182nd Airlift Wing at  Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, Arizona Conducts precision airdrop  testing of the  LITENING targeting pod. The pod is used to locate, discover and target enemy targets, and is used by U.S. Air Force fighters and bombers to detect combat areas and track designated targets. During the test,  AATC  and  182nd Airlift Wing  used two aircraft to  test  the capabilities of the pod and its advantages to combat missions.  AATC  is working on fully integrating the  LITENING pod  with the C-130, aiming to use the pod to generate airdrop location coordinates, locate and avoid enemy and sensitive objects, and airdrop The ability to track airdrop supplies after release helps the C-130 perform airdrop missions. This kind of testing in a simulated combat environment can provide improved capabilities for a large number of air combat platforms and rescue forces.

Subject: U.S. Air National Guard-Air Force Reserve Command Test Center
182nd Airlift Wing
182nd Airlift Wing

787.doctext: The Russian Black Sea Fleet  plans to receive two Project 22800 Karakut-class frigates before the end of 2021 -  Zykrun  and Askold Island. The two ships were built by Zalif Shipyard.  Zykrun   was   launched in 2020  and is currently undergoing  trials ; Askold Island is in the final stages of construction. The Type 22800 frigate can launch Caliber and Onyx missiles and is equipped with the Pantsir M air defense system; the hull adopts a stealth design. Currently, the Russian Navy has three Type 22800 frigates: Tischi, Sovetsk, and Otintsovo, all of which are attached to the Baltic Fleet. Russia's Pacific Fleet, Baltic Fleet, and Black Sea Fleet each plan to equip six frigates. They will be named after natural phenomena before 2018, and the follow-up ships will be named after Russian towns.  The Russian Ministry of Defense  is actively providing   new ships  to the  Black Sea Fleet  . The fleet has received six Type 636.3 conventional submarines and Type 11356 frigates in recent years, and will also receive the Type 20380 Diligence frigate at the end of 2021.

788.doctext: Citing news from PR Newswire,  Dominion Engineering Corporation of the United States and Korea Nuclear Fuel Corporation have reached a cooperation agreement. Both parties will serve the development and delivery of the Korean domestic market.  Dominion Engineering Corporation will Providing  advanced  vacuum tank fuel suction equipment and services for  South Korea's nuclear reactor  . This equipment can strengthen the detection of nuclear fuel leaks to support South Korea's nuclear reactors. Fuel storage and nuclear refueling activities. Under the partnership agreement,  Dominion Engineering  will  provide  its patented  Nuclear Fuel Intelligent Pumping System  . Compared with traditional vacuum tank suction equipment, this system uses unique fission gas removal technology to enhance the detection of small leaks. Therefore, the system can test spent fuel rods for leaks before dry storage, and effectively identify and isolate fuel rods with small leaks during  reactor  overhaul and refueling.

Subject: Dominion Engineering Corporation of the United States
Dominion Engineering Corporation

789.doctext: On July 27, the Polish Arms Inspection Service signed a contract with a consortium led by the Polish Arms Group to order  three  Michenik sea protection frigates for the  Polish Navy /span_1, the contract is worth approximately PLN 8 billion and will cover all program costs including weapons systems, integrated combat systems, logistics and training. At the signing ceremony held at the PGZ Naval Shipyard in Gdynia, Polish Defense Minister Marius Bryce said that the consortium will submit three sets of design plans by the end of November and select the best design concept in early 2022. After final design and construction, the first ship is planned to be  launched within four years   . PGZ Group spokesperson Jacek Zagodsson revealed to Jane's on August 2 that  three frigates will be built at  Polish shipyards and are planned to  2034 Before all  delivered.  The three frigates  were purchased in accordance with Poland's "Technological Modernization Plan 2021-2035" and are designed to simultaneously respond to air and maritime threats in Polish waters and support NATO's blue water operations. Poland launches Michnik sea protection frigate project

790.doctext: The South Korean military will  test   in the first half of 2022    new grenade launcher  and  small module Chemical UAV  . South Korea's Defense Acquisition Project Administration said it will purchase an undetermined number of the above-mentioned drones through a fast-track procurement process before testing.  The grenade-launching UAV will be equipped with six single-shot 40mm grenade launchers. The operator can remotely control it within a radius of 2 kilometers and control the photoelectric drone equipped with a laser range finder. /The infrared sensor turntable aims at the target and can continuously fire 6 rounds of grenades to the target within a radius of 5 meters. The aircraft will also feature dual-axis gimbals and recoil shock absorbers to allow it to maintain smooth flight even when firing.  The small modular drone  will weigh less than 1.95 kilograms and can be equipped with components such as optical/thermal imaging cameras, speakers, searchlights and laser rangefinders, and components can be added or subtracted as needed. The aircraft has multiple functions such as warning, tracking and radio communication jamming, and can perform anti-terrorism and special operations operations. According to DAPA,  South Korea's ONC Technology Corporation will provide  an undetermined number of  grenade launchers to the  South Korean Army   for 662 million won. Man-machine,  South Korea Preneu Company will provide  an undetermined quantity of  the South Korean Navy and Air Force   at a price of 1.71 billion won  Small modular drone.

791.doctext: On September 7, 2021,  General Electric Aviation announced that starting from  August 26, 2021, it will start the  second XA100 adaptive cycle engine 's  test.  The first XA100  started  testing in  December 2020, marking the world's first three-channel adaptive cycle that meets the installed flight weight requirements The engine began operating, confirming the engine's ability to provide transformative propulsion for current and future fighter aircraft.  Engine 2 entering testing will allow  GE Aviation to continue to collect high-quality test data that will inform the engine's advanced components and revolutionary triple-duct design further develop and mature. After completing the first phase of testing,  GE Aviation will continue work on  Engine 2 at  the U.S. Air Force's Arnold Engineering Development Complex span_12 Test to complete all planned USAF Adaptive Engine Conversion Program test activities.

Subject: General Electric Aviation

792.doctext: According to a Sina report on March 16,  the UAE Air Force decided to choose  from  General Electric Company after a long period of technical  evaluation Modified F110 engine to equip its newly purchased  F-16 fighter jets. The new  fighter jets  are manufactured by Lockheed Martin, with a total of 80 aircraft worth approximately $400 million. The engine is  F110-GE-132 , which has a high thrust-to-weight ratio and is a derivative of the F110 engine family. Mainly used for F-16C/D fighter jets, planned to start  delivery  in  2002  . This engine can provide 32,500 pounds of thrust, approximately 50% more than the F-1650. This engine combines the advantages of many engines. Such as the after combustion chamber of the F120 engine and the external fan duct of the F404/F414. At present, more than 50% of the engine's development work has been completed, including ground  testing  . Airborne  testing  will take place  later this year  and flight  testing  will take place  in 2002  .

793.doctext: The U.S. Navy Aeronautical Systems Command said yesterday that the  Sub-extreme short take-off and landing flight  test. Jennifer Young, project manager of the VECTOR program, commented after the trial: We obtained a lot of useful data from this trial. A year ago, ESTOL was just a theoretical thing, and now it has been proven that ESTOL can be achieved. During Monday's flight tests, on a virtual runway in the air, the  During the test, the aircraft approached and landed at an angle of attack of 24°.  . The person in charge of the flight test of the VECTOR project claimed that after the  X-31  is equipped with the advanced atmospheric data system provided by EADS, the approach attack angle can reach up to 70°. FADS can provide real-time and accurate data on the speed, altitude, ambient temperature and flight attitude of aircraft approaching at any angle of attack.

794.doctext: U.S. Naval Sea Systems Command and  USS McVehr's crew successfully conducted the latest  Aegis Baseline- First fleet  test of B6P3 . The baseline is the operating system for the first combat system operating on a local area network of Aegis equipment that incorporates commercially available technologies. In  B6P3 Baseline , COTS technology actually controls all main processors, instead of only being used in backup and auxiliary processing.  The CSSQT team  includes technical personnel from Lockheed Martin, the Naval Surface Warfare Center, and the Naval Undersea Warfare Center, who will help build messaging protocols and develop new procedures. USS MacFair's  CSSQT team will also  test new  anti-submarine warfare equipment, SQQ89, 5-inch 62-caliber light naval gun, advanced Tomahawk weapon system, New information distribution technology provided by computer-aided DRT/tactical decision support systems. In addition, the ship tested a modification to improve troop protection, which made full use of the space previously occupied by the CIWS to provide space for 11 independent 50-caliber and MK1940mm rifle grenade launchers.

Subject: U.S. Naval Sea Systems Command
USS McVehr's crew
Equipment: Aegis Baseline- First fleet  test of B6P3

795.doctext: After the  Global Hawk UAV successfully  first flight,  Northrop Grumman Integrated Systems Division has submitted a request to  U.S. The Air Force delivered the seventh  Global Hawk unmanned reconnaissance aircraft system. In accordance with the requirements of the Advanced Concept Technology Demonstration Phase of the Global Hawk program, this is the last aircraft planned to be delivered. Northrop Grumman plans to deliver the first two production aircraft later this year. The aircraft took off from the final assembly plant in Palmdale, California, and flew for 3 hours over the  Edwards Air Force Base test flight area in an autonomous inspection mission aimed at  evaluation of the UAV system before delivery. performance. It will continue a series of test flights from the base. The aircraft was built in a transitional configuration between the ACTD phase and the first production system. It features enhanced avionics systems, including an open system architecture starter. The UAV system will be used to evaluate improved combat performance prior to delivery of production UAVs.

Subject: U.S. The Air Force
Location: Edwards Air Force Base test flight area

Tenix Company has delivered   4 frigates of this type to the  Australian Navy   and to  the New Zealand Navy   Delivered   2 ships. The fifth Anzac-class frigate PARRAMATTA, which is about to be delivered to the  Australian Navy , is scheduled to enter service within this year. 797.doctext: BAE Systems's  M777E1 howitzer completed its first  launch in  July at the  Yuma Proving Ground  Raytheon's  XM982 Excalibur GPS/inertial navigation guidance extended range 155mm projectile firing  test. The test evaluated seven  mm Howitzer Physical compatibility.  The M777E1 howitzer  is currently in the low-rate initial production stage and is intended to replace the M198 howitzer in the US Army and Marine Corps. The first  production howitzer for  testing is scheduled to be delivered  February 2004   to the U.S. Navy   Team. The gun is currently being integrated with a towed gun digital system to provide positioning and targeting as well as digital integration with the Alfaz gun fire control system. Part of the digitization is the provision of an electronic interface with the  XM982 projectile  that provides the projectile with the required position and target coordinates.  M777E1 howitzer  and Excalibur guided artillery shells will be equipped with the US Army in 2006, which will provide artillery with precision strike capabilities. The maximum range of the Excalibur guided artillery shell is 40 kilometers and the accuracy is 10 meters. The Army's Stryker brigade combat team and the 18th Airborne Corps artillery unit will both be equipped with  M777E1 howitzers  and Excalibur guided artillery shells.

798.doctext: The first  AgustaWestland   A109 light multi-purpose helicopter assembled in South Africa has completed its  debut at Daniel's  Kempton Park factory in the country. Fly, the first flight lasted two and a half hours. At present, the aircraft has completed a series of acceptance test flights. The South African Air Force has ordered a total of 30  A109 . According to the agreement, 25 of them will be assembled in South Africa. Daniel is responsible for sub-system integration, manufacturing, final assembly, customized engineering and flight testing, as well as after-sales support. . Production work in South Africa will last for 3 years. The helicopters were ordered under South Africa's Strategic Defense Procurement Program and their uses include humanitarian missions and disaster relief. Prior to the first flight, a  joint Daniel-AgustaWestland team  conducted a week of pre- testing  of the aircraft's systems.

799.doctext: The UAE Navy  and  Abu Dhabi Shipyard  have completed the selection of the main combat system and platform suppliers for the Navy's  new 70-meter Baynunah class frigate .  Baynunah class frigate The main contractor  Abu Dhabi Shipyard has received a US$500 million contract from  UAE and will start from  2008 Started  delivery of four  frigates, with the possibility of adding two more, designed by French shipbuilder CMN.  Abu Dhabi Shipyard  is responsible for providing relevant training and logistics services. This project is mainly to provide the  UAE Navy  with multi-functional  surface ships  capable of sustained operations, and also to patrol territorial waters and exclusive economic zones in peacetime. It will also be responsible for intelligence collection, maritime interception, mine laying and anti-ship operations. As the project designer and main sub-contractor,  France CMN will build the first frigate of this class in Cherbourg, France, and then provide subsequent construction for  Abu Dhabi Shipyard material.  CMN  hopes to start construction at the end of 2004.  In 2006  , the first ship  will be launched  . The selection of all major equipment was completed at the end of September this year. In June this year, the combat system integrator was determined and will provide 6 IPN-S combat management systems. A land-based test station will be established in  Italy  to  test  the  combat system software and hardware  . Alenia Marconi will provide the NA-25XM fire control radar, and Ericsson Microwave Systems will provide its three-dimensional surveillance radar. Sagem will provide the VIGY-EOMS optoelectronic multifunctional system. Each ship will carry 45 crew members.

800.doctext: Patria Company recently received an order from the  Finnish Defense Forces for the purchase of 62  AMV armored personnel carriers, with a total value of US$96 million. Scheduled  for delivery in 2006-2007   . The 8×8 wheeled vehicle will be equipped with a heavy machine gun turret. Over the past year, the  Finnish Defense Forces  have been trialling 2  AMV prototypes  . In addition, the  Finnish Defense Forces  also ordered 24  AMV vehicles  as chassis for the AMOS mortar system, with delivery expected to begin in 2006. So far,  Patria Company's  AMV vehicles have been successfully used in  Finland, Poland, the Czech Republic, Croatia, South Africa and Brazil  Trials were conducted, the most recent  Trials in  December 2004 in  Lithuania and  Latvia Proceed.

801.doctext: China's   ARJ21-700 regional airliner 's  first flight may be delayed by more than a month, and the first  delivery  The time will also be pushed back to  2010. China's Xinhua News Agency quoted Commercial Aircraft Corporation of China Chairman Zhang Qingwei as saying that the first flight would be postponed to  the end of November  . The project has experienced several delays and was originally scheduled to fly at the end of October. If the aircraft cannot make its first flight in October, it seems that it will hinder the  ARJ21-700 aircraft 's originally planned trip to the Zhuhai Air Show in early November. Zhang Qingwei said that once the aircraft makes its first flight, it will take 18 months to be certified, while  Air China hopes to reduce the certification time to 12 months so that the aircraft can be delivered to launch customers by the end of next year - ―  Shandong Airlines. If certification takes 18 months, the aircraft will be delivered in May 2010. The ARJ21-700 aircraft certification is different from the earlier certification process for Chinese aircraft. The US FAA has hinted that it must ensure that the certification complies with international standards.

802.doctext: Lockheed Martin   recently  conducted the first controlled test projectile of the  Joint Common Missile at the  U.S. Navy China Lake Test Site in California  Fly  Test  . This flight test is part of the first phase of risk reduction work stipulated in the  JCM System design and development contract. It is the first phase of the missile system level test, and it tests the missile body performance, gas and air in the missile design. Power performance and range are tested. This controllable test bomb adopts an aerodynamic layout close to that of an actual combat missile, is equipped with a production engine, and uses a counterweight to replace the seeker and warhead, but is equipped with sufficient guidance electronic components to generate a maximum range of 16 kilometers for helicopter-borne launch flight. trajectory. The purpose of this test flight is to verify that the missile battery and engine start accurately, safely separate from the M299 launcher, and fly out of the maximum range stably and controllably according to the computer-generated simulated ballistic trajectory. The first  controllable test projectile test flight was successful, recording performance data on the autopilot, guidance algorithm, inertial measurement device, engine, aerodynamics, and control drive, thus providing the basis for the subsequent seeker and guidance and control electronic components to provide support for flight testing. This test flight will also provide support for future test flights to verify the maximum range of 28 kilometers launched from a fixed-wing aircraft at high altitude. Currently,  JCM  has completed the  fixed-wing aircraft-borne bomb  wind tunnel  test  and matching/loading  test  .

Subject: Lockheed Martin
Location: U.S. Navy China Lake Test Site in California

803.doctext: ADI Limited The third of six Huon-class minehunters built for the  Australian Navy  Norman is on schedule and on budget span_3 Delivery.  The Norman minehunter  has successfully undergone  sea trials  and will soon be put into  Navy  service. Among the last three minehunters, the  Gascoyne  was launched  in March this year   , and the Diamantina and Yarra will also be put into service as scheduled.  Analog Devices  has signed a long-term contract to provide support for six minehunters during their service life. The company will be responsible for key performance management, configuration, systems and maintenance engineering, in-service management and training for at least the next five years  ADI Corporation said the total cost of $1 billion Huon-class minehunters will be  The Royal Australian Navy provides the world's most advanced mine countermeasures capability.

804.doctext: Recently,  Pratt & Whitney of the United States  won a contract to modify the system development and verification plan of the F135 engine according to the time schedule of the F-35 Joint Attack Aircraft. The modification extends the original SDD contract period by 16 months, increasing the total value by up to $968 million, depending on the work required to be completed. In 2001,  Pratt & Whitney  was awarded a 10-year SDD phase contract worth US$4.8 billion to complete the flight license, flight test and qualification of small batch initial production of the F135 propulsion system. So far,  Pratt & Whitney has delivered 3  conventional takeoff and landing engines and 4  short takeoff and vertical landing engines Used for experiments. The SDD test hours of these engines have accumulated to more than 3,400 hours. The initial SDD test hours of the propulsion system have also accumulated to more than 3,600 hours. At the same time, the engine is being installed on all JSF concept proof aircraft for ground and flight tests. . The other two  CTOL certification engines  will be delivered in  September  for ground  testing  . The F135 propulsion system team includes prime contractors  Pratt & Whitney  ,  Rolls-Royce  and  Hamilton Sundstrand  .

During the 1.6-hour flight to Edwards Air Force Base, California, the crew tested the functionality of Total Core 2.2  test  . Under the low-rate initial production agreement,  Boeing  will install the kit on 11 C-130 transport aircraft. Under a contract awarded by the  U.S. Air Force  in 2001,  Boeing  hopes to provide AMP modernization and upgrades for more than 200 C-130s. The first AMP aircraft, AMP1, is currently at Maxwell Air Force Base undergoing a comprehensive system inspection.  AMP2  will continue ground and flight  testing  at  Edwards Air Force Base  . The third aircraft, AMP3, is currently undergoing modernization and upgrades at  Boeing's  facility in San Diego. The aircraft will be equipped with fully integrated night vision equipment, a digital glass cockpit and a new aviation system to enhance situational awareness for warfighters.

806.doctext: Alliant Technology Systems   recently  demonstrated  its  liquid oxygen-methane propellant rocket engine  in a vacuum chamber  Key capabilities.  LOX/Methane Propellant Rocket Engine  is designed for lunar ascent missions. The test engine is designed to have a thrust of 3,500 pounds to achieve the thrust range expected from the lunar ascent engine.  ATK Company  has also  tested  a  LOX/methane engine  with a thrust of 7,500 pounds at sea level.  ATK Corporation expects to conduct additional  LOX/methane engine technology  testing in a variety of operating environments to simulate the lunar ascent. operating environment. The ascent engine is a critical propulsion system on the lunar lander, needed to transport astronauts to and from the lunar surface and dock with the Crew Exploration Vehicle in orbit.  LOX/Methane  Propellant blends provide better performance than other propellant blends. The weight of the engine is also significantly reduced, which can enhance the safety of the lunar lander design based on the allowable weight of the lunar lander's ascent module.

807.doctext: Eurocopter has begun  test flights  of its  HAD version of the Tiger attack helicopter   which is being used by France and Spain Under development. The first flight of this model was  on December 14th  at the  Marignane factory in France  .  HAD version  Features include an increased power MTR390-E engine, enhanced ballistic protection measures and a new electronic warfare system. Spain's  HAD aircraft will be equipped with Israeli Rafael Spike-extended range air-to-surface missiles, and France's  HAD aircraft will be equipped with Lockheed Martin's Hellfire II missile. The serial number of the  HAD aircraft that first flew is 5001. It is the first  HAD aircraft produced in batches for the  Spanish Army. The aircraft will be launched in  2009 Transferred to  Eurocopter Spain for  support development work.  The first aircraft of HAD type  is scheduled to be delivered  at the end of 2010  .

808.doctext: Recently, the  International Atomic Energy Agency conducted a Assessment.  The IAEA  conducted a  assessment  of the  nuclear  emergency response capabilities in  Murmansk Province  in northwestern Russia. Officials say potential threats in the area are of concern because the area houses aging Soviet-era nuclear submarines and stores radioactive waste.  The IAEA  said the assessment was to test Russia's emergency response preparedness for possible emergencies related to security and environmental threats.  IAEA  and Vince Novak, director of the Nuclear Safety Program of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development, said that  IAEA ’s assessment of the nuclear emergency preparedness capabilities of the Murmansk region of Russia is very important and provides us with relevant work. refer to. The 10-day assessment event was conducted at the invitation of Rosatom.  The IAEA  has been working in the northwestern region of Russia for over a decade to promote and coordinate the safe management of radioactive waste in the region.

809.doctext: Boeing Boeing has submitted a proposal to NASA to build two next-generation geostationary environmental operational satellites for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, known as the GOESR series, officials said. Satellite proposal. In 2005, Boeing received the GOESR risk reduction contract from NASA and is committed to helping NOAA achieve its goal of making correct decisions using a comprehensive understanding of the role of oceans, seashores, and atmosphere in global ecosystems. Imagine.  Boeing  is the prime contractor for the current series of geosynchronous environmental satellites, GOESN, O and P. The GOESN program series includes the three latest imaging satellites and ground command and control equipment. The GOESN satellite  currently known as   GOES-13  was launched on  May 24, 2006  aboard a  Boeing Delta IV rocket   /span_7 Launch into the air.  GOES-13  was delivered to users after six months of rigorous testing. The  testing  was managed by the  NOAA Satellite Operations Control Center  .  GOESO  is scheduled to launch  late this year    .  Boeing Company  has manufactured more than 260 commercial and civilian satellites, with a total service life of 2,500 years. The satellites are manufactured at  Boeing's  satellite manufacturing facility in California.

810.doctext: A multi-purpose tanker/transport aircraft modified from an Airbus A330 passenger aircraft has received a supplementary type certificate issued by the European Aviation Safety Agency.  EASA  issued the certificate to Airbus parent company  EADS  on March 17 at its headquarters in Germany.  EASA 's STC involves aerial refueling casings, refueling pods, operating stations in the cockpit, and other military features. This certificate was obtained after  EADS  completed 60 flight hours of  testing specifically for the  STC  and for the first user  Australian Air Force  Awarded after 170 flight hours of  testing.  EADS  currently plans to deliver  3  A330 multi-purpose tanker/transport aircraft to the  Australian Air Force    this year /span_12, with the goal of reaching initial operational capability in 2011, and full operational capability in  2012  after all five aircraft are  delivered. The modification work of KC-30A is carried out in Getafe, Spain.

811.doctext: New Zealand's  first  A109 training helicopter  will be put into development  at the end of March this year for  testing and evaluation, the aircraft completed its  first flight in  February this year at  AgustaWestland's  Vergiate factory   . The Royal New Zealand Air Force purchased 5 winch-equipped  A109 helicopters  for training pilots and crews of its NH90 and the Navy's Kaman SH-2G Seasprite. This batch of  A109  Will replace existing aging Bell Sioux training helicopters. This batch of  A109  will be delivered to the  Royal New Zealand Air Force   at the end of  this year and will be deployed there in 2011. Served at Ohakea Base.   A109  simulator  will be delivered  next year    and the interactive virtual trainer is currently in use at Ohakea.  A109  Equipped with two turboshaft engines, it can carry 3 crew members and up to 5 passengers.

Subject: New Zealand
Date: at the end of March this year

812.doctext: India's Tejas light fighter limited-volume production model No. 3 has completed its  first flight  recently. This is after LCA entered India in October 2010 The time point of Air Force service is getting closer and closer. The  test flight was conducted on  April 23 at the  Hindustan Aeronautics Limited airport in  Bangalore with the test pilot For G. Thomas of the Indian National Flight Test Center, the entire test flight fully achieved the expected purpose. So far, the number of test aircraft that have been flown by the Canadian LCA project has reached 9, and the cumulative idle time has reached about 800 hours. The  LSP-3 aircraft  participating in this test flight was equipped with multi-mode radar, new communication and navigation system, radar warning receiver and other equipment provided by Israel, and is already very close to the final production version of LCA.

813.doctext: Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency  announced to various media on April 22 its plan to launch a solar-powered space yacht. The  interstellar kite-aircraft satellite , which relies on solar radiation acceleration, carries a 20-meter sail made of thin-film solar technology. The reflected pressure of sunlight on the solar sail will serve as the power of the satellite. In addition, the  satellite  also carries solar cells that can generate electricity. Therefore  Icarus  is a hybrid spacecraft.  Icarus  will be launched from  Tanegashima Space Center   on  May 18   . The assignment period is 6 months.  Icarus  will use photon propulsion, with electricity from solar sails powering onboard equipment. If this experiment is successful, it will be the first time  Icarus  uses this technology in space. Japan says a second  experiment  will be conducted in the  late 2010s  . A medium-sized solar sail with a diameter of 50 meters will be used, combined with an ion propulsion engine, and the launch destination will be Jupiter and Trojan-type asteroids. In addition to Japan, Russian and NASA scientists have also been testing solar sail technology.

814.doctext: According to a report from a special correspondent at the Paris Air Show on June 19,  the new generation of Boeing 737 family's largest passenger aircraft  B737-900   was delivered for the first time    Aviation The company made its  appearance at the  Paris Air Show in less than a month, and only two months after obtaining the FAA/JAA certificate. The exhibition added a lot of brilliance.  Boeing 737-900  The aircraft is 42.1 meters long. It can accommodate 172 passengers in a two-class cabin layout and a maximum capacity of 189 passengers in a single-class cabin layout. The initiating user is  Alaska Airlines .  Alaska Airlines has ordered a total of 11  Boeing 737-900s , all of which are expected to be put into operation in April 2003.  Boeing Company has now placed the first Delivered to  Alaska Airlines , numbered  Alaska-900 ,  this year will also  deliver 3 more to    .  Boeing  737-900   started the certification  flight test after the first flight in  last August, and in the following eight Within a month, the two aircraft completed nearly 300 flights, 156 hours of ground  testing and 650 hours of aerial  testing.  Boeing  claims that  Boeing 737-900  is the world's lowest operating cost and most fuel-efficient aircraft in its class of single-aisle passenger aircraft.

815.doctext: According to a report on the Defense Daily website on June 26,  Lockheed Martin   X-35B Joint Attack Aircraft short takeoff/vertical landing concept demonstrator, in  span_2 It completed its first vertical  takeoff during a series of flights last Sunday. "We are proud of these flights," said Harry Blot, the company's deputy X-35 program manager. These flights demonstrate how much thrust our aircraft has, and this thrust is a problem for STOVL aircraft. Four vertical takeoffs were conducted at  Lockheed Martin 's  Palmdale facility  on Sunday. The duration of these flights ranges from a few seconds to around 2 minutes. Blot said that during the flight, the demonstrator proved its capabilities and the spin stop was stable. The first flight lasted about 35 seconds and reached an altitude of 25 feet above the ground.  Fan clutch provides power. The next set of  test flights  of the  X-35B  will take place  next week  at  Edwards Air Force Base  . The aircraft will perform several quality flights and a series of transitions from wing flight to vertical flight.

816.doctext: Northrop Grumman  stated that the newly launched  hybrid airship  has a carrying capacity similar to Lockheed Martin's C-130E Hercules transport aircraft. Less than 50 days ago, the U.S. Army awarded a contract to the Northrop Grumman/Hybrid Air Vehicles team to demonstrate the feasibility of a long-endurance multi-mission payload vehicle as an intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance platform. Northrop Grumman chief engineer Michael Addison said that after removing the ISR payload and making the necessary modifications, the same aircraft can carry a payload of 15,875kg. Using the same appearance and changing some structures in the lower part can provide greater carrying capacity. These modifications do not need to change the basic appearance. The high-load shape can carry a load of 15,875kg and fly a distance of 1,852~2,778km. In comparison, the U.S. Air Force's C-130E transport aircraft can carry a load of the same weight and fly a distance of 2,315km. The goal of the LEMV project is to use a  hybrid airship  to perform ISR missions and remain airborne for more than 21 days at an altitude of 20,000 feet.  Airship  Designed to carry a load of 1133kg and operate for 3 weeks. ISR payloads include ground moving target detection radar, full-motion cameras, and communication relay loads.  Northrop Grumman hopes to complete the initial design within 2 weeks, with  first flight expected in  end of 2011, possibly even  next year   First flight at the end of the second quarter.

817.doctext: Italy/UK  AgustaWestland hopes to have a third  AW159 Wildcat helicopter flying in the project by  the end of this month  Testing in progress.  On October 14th, the company   AW159  TI2  entered the flight test stage after completing the  first flight,  TI1  began flight  testing in  November 2009. TI3 is expected to join the flight test ranks in the coming weeks as part of a 600-hour flight test program. The tasks of each aircraft are:  TI1  will conduct verification flights for basic envelope expansion and aerodynamic testing;  TI2  will be used to test core and mission avionics and software; TI3 is expected to perform naval-type missions and payload survey test verification. The first  production AW159  is under construction and will be delivered next year. The United Kingdom has announced plans to purchase 62 helicopters of this type. The army version will become combat effective in 2014, and the naval version will become combat effective in 2015. However, as part of the British Strategic Defense and Security Review, the number of this procurement project is still being evaluated, and the results will be announced on October 18th and 19th.

818.doctext: The  Jantar Shipyard  in Kaliningrad prepares for mooring  trials  of the next  Indian frigate  . Currently the installation of wooden paneling on the  frigate  internal compartments has begun. The assembly of electronic equipment is being carried out in parallel with the laying of cables. These works must be completed by the end of April or early May 2011. Thereafter, the  frigate  will receive power, which means that the mooring trials of the  frigate  are about to begin. According to a US$1.6 billion contract signed with India in 2007,  Jantar Shipyard is currently building three  11356 engineering frigates for the  Indian Navy span_8. The first ship  Tiger was launched in  November 2009    and will be  mid-2011   Delivered to the   Indian Navy  .  The second Tarkash and  The third Trikander will be delivered in  2011~2012   span_18.

819.doctext: The second  EC175 prototype completed its  first flight  today at the   Eurocopter Marignane factory . The first flight lasted about 45 minutes and verified its basic operability and system functions.  EC175  was developed by  Eurocopter  in cooperation with AVIC. The first  prototype  was launched in  December 2009  in  span_9 Marignane  completed  first flight.  EC175  The main purpose of the design consideration is offshore oil and gas industrial transportation. Its prototype is equipped with emergency buoys, external life rafts, a full set of radio navigation equipment, HTAWS, HUMS, cargo hooks and winches, and high-performance air conditioning system.  The final version of EC175  will be completed in the second half of 2011 for airworthiness evaluation, and delivery is expected to begin in 2012. In addition, the tasks of the EC175 industrial sector are also proceeding as planned. Its fuselage production line in Harbin has started operation. China is expected to deliver the first fuselage at the end of this year, and the second fuselage will be delivered in the first half of 2011.  EC175  Comprehensive logistics support work has begun, and INDRA is responsible for developing the first full flight state simulator. So far,  EC175  has received 114 orders from 14 customers. In addition to offshore oil and gas support,  EC175  can also undertake search and rescue and emergency medical evacuation missions, and can also be used as a business jet.

Human_Trig: first flight  today at the   Eurocopter Marignane factory
Subject: Eurocopter
Eurocopter

820.doctext: Russia's Sukhoi   SSJ-100  completed two key certification tests:  emergency evacuation test  and aborted takeoff test. According to airworthiness requirements  SSJ100  all 98 passengers and 5 crew members on board must be evacuated within 90 seconds. The trial was completed with the participation of ARIAC and EASA. The final results will be derived from the analysis of data collected by cameras onboard and externally. The test was conducted on the first  production aircraft , which had to meet all airworthiness requirements. It was said that the evacuation of all personnel was completed within 73 seconds.  Aborted takeoff test  was conducted on  SN95003 , in which the energy of the brake pads reached maximum. This test will comprehensively inspect wheels, tires, brake pads, etc. Priority for testing was the brake components provided by Goodrich. During the aborted takeoff test, the aircraft reached a maximum takeoff weight of 45,880kg and a speed of 300km/h. The test results met the certification requirements. There was no wheel fire after the plane came to a stop.

821.doctext: September 14, 2011,  DCNS  built  FREMM multi-purpose frigate for  Royal Moroccan Navy in  Lorient shipyard   launched . The ship has been under construction at the  Lorient Shipyard  since December 2008 and is scheduled to be delivered in  2013    . This newly built frontline frigate will enhance the combat capabilities of the  Royal Moroccan Navy . The ship was designed to reduce the crew to just over 100 and be capable of performing air defense, anti-ship and anti-submarine missions. The ship will continue to be assembled at the dock in the coming months. The next important stage is the installation of the mast that houses the ship's sensor installation.

822.doctext: AAI   announced the  Shadow-M2 significantly improved UAV, which is larger and heavier than its prototype RQ-7B heavier. The wingspan was increased from 20 feet to 25 feet, the weight increased by 120 pounds, the fuel tank was redesigned, and the signal box was replaced with the latest increased lift structure. These improvements increase flight endurance to 16 hours. Steven Reid, senior deputy director of  AAI , said that basically there are not many changes, except that it can carry more payloads and use the enhanced bandwidth provided by the tactical common data link. Through upgrades, the  Shadow-M2  can carry two independent payloads in place of the original standard EO/IR single turret.  The company  plans to  test  the payloads  of two integrated aperture radars, wide area surveillance, intelligence and electronic warfare components. It will also use a  new engine  with a thrust of up to 60lb and a five-blade propeller. This type of engine is undergoing static  testing  and is expected to make its first flight in early 2012. Design work on the  M2  is complete, but production has not yet begun. A test aircraft named Shadow-M has been flying for several months.  Shadow-M2  is expected to make its first flight  in the summer of 2012    .

823.doctext: Project 21630 Makhachkala small gunboat  was launched on  April 27, 2012  at  Diamond Shipbuilding Company   . The ship is the third ship of the Buyan class and the last ship built in St. Petersburg. It will serve in the Caspian Sea Fleet.  Leningrad Navy  The commander of the base said that the launch of the small gunboat signified that the government was insisting on upgrading naval ships. Leonid Grabovets, the head of  Diamond Shipbuilding Company, said in his speech: I am very happy for the maiden voyage of Mahakachira. We will deliver 6  ships this year and lay the groundwork for new ships. keel. The directors of the shipyard wish everyone a happy Labor Day, especially today, the anniversary of victory. Construction leaders reported that the ship was ready to leave the launch dock. The ship is ready to be delivered to the   Navy  via the Astrakhan Inland Waterway  in the  coming weeks  . Following sea trials and acceptance tests at the shipyard,  Makhachkala  is expected to be delivered  in September or October 2012     Caspian Fleet.

824.doctext: According to a report by "Defense Data" on November 7, the third pre-production  AB139 helicopter was launched on  October 22 in   Italy AgustaWestland's Vergiate factory successfully conducted its  first flight. The certification program consists of the TieDown helicopter and three pre-production aircraft.  TDH  started  test flights  in  December 2000  .  The first pre-production AB139  made its first flight on  February 3, 2001 at  Agusta's Cascina Costa factory   ,  The second pre-production AB139  made its first flight on  June 4, 2001   . The test flight plan of the two pre-production aircraft is proceeding according to the scheduled time and budget, and the flight time of both aircraft has exceeded 100 hours. The test flight outline has confirmed the estimated aircraft performance, including that the two aircraft have a maximum sustained flight speed of more than 157 nautical miles at a maximum take-off weight of 6,000 kilograms, a maximum ceiling of 20,000 feet, and no ground effect when hovering at an altitude of 12,000 feet. Maximum rate of climb exceeds 2,200 ft/min. AB139IFR certification will be carried out in 2002 in accordance with the provisions of Part 29 of the JAR/FAR regulations. The first aircraft will be delivered after certification. So far, more than 40 AB139s have been ordered, and its customers are Australia, Europe, Africa, the Middle East and the Americas.

825.doctext: Airbus Military Aircraft Company  hopes to obtain the airworthiness certificate for the  A400M  in July this year, although the 300-hour functional and reliability test has been delayed due to problems with the TP400D engine.  Airbus Military Aircraft Company expressed confidence that the first  A400M   would be delivered  to the  French Air Force  this year span_6. This  testing  phase will last for 1.5 to 2 months, and a type certificate will be obtained soon after completion of testing. The delay in the functional and reliability tests was mainly due to the occurrence of engine flutter. The functional and reliability test plan has been adjusted. This work is mainly carried out near Toulouse from the perspective of saving time.  French Air Force  There are 2 groups of aircrews undergoing training, which will increase to 12 groups by June 2013. Initial training will be conducted on the  A400M . In addition, pilots will also learn on the A380 simulator to better understand the cockpit of Airbus aircraft. The first aircraft delivered to France is currently under construction and is expected to make its  first flight in the  third quarter.  MSN8  is also under construction. It is expected to achieve the  first flight in the  fourth quarter of this year. France expects the aircraft to reach service status by the end of 2014.

826.doctext: Airbus Military Aircraft Company   has recently  restarted the  A400M  function and reliability  test  and the company is currently preparing for the first flight next year. We will work hard to deliver the first aircraft to the  French Air Force in the second quarter. The test, which was mainly conducted on the fifth aircraft, is key to  A400M  obtaining the civil aviation airworthiness certificate and is a key milestone in the first quarter of 2013. The test will include a total of 300 hours of flight testing.  Earlier this year due to a  engine   failure the  test was interrupted span_9, which had completed 160 hours of flight testing before the interruption. Earlier this month,  A400M  restarted the test as EPI re-delivered the repaired engine.  MSN7  is the first production aircraft and is currently in the final assembly line of  Airbus Military Aircraft Company  in  Spain . The company expects the aircraft to be launched in 2013 The  first flight was made in the first quarter, and 4  A400M  are expected to be  delivered next year.

827.doctext: The European Neuron unmanned combat aircraft demonstrator  is conducting stealth characteristics tests in  France  and will then start flying  tests  . The joint verification project is led by  France's Dassault SA  and involves defense companies from   Italy , Greece, Spain, Switzerland and Sweden . Alenia Maggi leads the research work of  Italy  defense companies,  Italy  The share of the defense industry involved in the work is approximately 18% and is worth approximately 405 million euros. France provides 50% of the investment, Sweden's investment is the same as Italy's. The remaining investments are borne by Spain, Switzerland and Greece.  Neuron  The first flight was completed in  last December. After a short test flight, it went to  France to carry out radar cross-section  Test. In the next step,  Neuron  will carry out envelope expansion  test flights  at  Vidsel Test Site in Sweden  .  Next year the aircraft will  be transferred to   Italy for weapons  testing /span_20 . The unmanned combat aircraft project will verify a stealth drone that can autonomously perform air-to-ground strike missions. The British company BAE is also developing a Thor stealth unmanned combat aircraft demonstrator. The aircraft's first flight has been postponed from last year to this year and has not yet taken place.

Equipment: The European Neuron unmanned combat aircraft demonstrator

828.doctext: In the final phase of compatibility  testing,  U.S. Army and  Raytheon utilized  at  Yuma Proving Ground The German-made PzH2000 self-propelled howitzer successfully fired 10 rounds of  Excalibur precision-guided artillery shells. The test, funded by the United States and Germany and supported by  Raytheon Company , verified the compatibility and performance of the Excalibur and the PzH2000 self-propelled howitzer. During the test, the PzH2000 howitzer fired 10 Excalibur shells with a range from 9 kilometers to 48 kilometers. The impact point of each shell was within three meters of the target, achieving precise results and once again verifying the damage capability of the warhead and the three fuze modes. The average miss distance of artillery shells at 48 kilometers is within one meter. In addition, the PzH2000 test demonstrated the maneuverability of the artillery shell from a conventional ballistic trajectory to a predetermined deviation from the target. In October, similar capabilities were demonstrated using Swedish Acher guns and American howitzers. The German Ministry of Defense is also evaluating the Excalibur shell within a competitive framework for the 2014 options program. Since 2007, nearly 700 Excalibur rounds have been equipped and used on the battlefield. Additional testing this year will include  testing of the first production Excalibur Ib   testing  to verify its production completeness. In addition,  Raytheon Company has invested in adding a laser seeker to the 155mm GPS-guided artillery shell, so that the shell has dual-mode guidance capabilities, and plans to launch live ammunition in  early 2014 span_11 Verification  This  Excalibur-S  .

829.doctext: Northrop Grumman's  AN/TPS-80 Land/Air Mission Directional Radar project has been approved to enter the low-rate initial production phase. The U.S. Navy is responsible for research, The Assistant Secretary for Development and Acquisition approved the project to move to Milestone C.  Northrop Grumman Company  The head of the Land and Self-Protection Systems Division said that the combat capabilities of G/ATOR have fundamentally changed the scope of the Marine Corps' detection and tracking of targets. He added: This type of radar system will become one of the series of products of  Northrop Grumman Company that provides multi-mission medium and long-range ground radar systems for domestic and global customers. Currently, it is the most Mature S-band air-cooled ground radar system. Open architecture design and system technology capabilities enable this product line to meet the mission and capability requirements of ground and shipborne radars. The system has undergone rigorous  testing and environmental conditions verification over the  past year, proving its ability to operate on a variety of platforms including fixed-wing aircraft, helicopters, cruise missiles and unmanned systems. Strong situational awareness. The approval to enter Milestone C is mainly based on the successful development  testing  and operational evaluation in  2013 , as well as the Marine Corps' formal production readiness review. The system has been tested in a range of operating environments including offshore, desert and mountain environments. Developed  and tested in the shallow ocean environment of  Ground Combat Systems Center Wallops Island, Virginia, and in the desert and mountainous areas of  Marine Corps Air Station Yuma, Arizona carried out in the environment.

830.doctext: Indian Space Research Organization  will conduct the  first test flight  of the  reusable space launch vehicle demonstrator  before  mid-2015  .  ISRO  announced the  Reusable Space Launch Vehicle  technology verification project in 2009. This project is the first step in India's development of a fully reusable two-stage orbital vehicle. Singh, the Minister of Science and Technology of India, revealed on  March 4 that the  verification machine that is about to carry out  test flight weighs about 1.5 tons and will be boosted by solid rockets. It reaches an altitude of 70 kilometers and reaches the speed of Ma5. After separating from the booster, it glides down and finally splashes into the sea. This test flight will verify the aircraft's hypersonic aerodynamic characteristics, avionics, thermal protection and control systems, as well as mission management and other technologies.  ISRO  has planned 4 test flights for this project. After this hypersonic test flight, it will successively carry out landing test flights, orbit entry and return test flights, and scramjet propulsion system demonstration and verification tests. The  first flight  of the  RLV technology verification project  was originally planned for  2011  but suffered several delays. As of now, the detailed first flight date has not yet been determined. Indian officials said that this test flight will provide a decision-making basis for the subsequent design and development of a fully reusable two-stage orbital vehicle from the perspective of cost-effectiveness.

831.doctext: France  DCNS Shipyard  will be delivered  on March 16th     France   Three Aquitaine-class FREMM frigates Languedoc.  Languedoc was built at the  DCNS company Lorient shipyard,  launched in July 2015 ,  In October,  sea trials were launched.  February 2016 set sail for   France Toulon for the final The  sea trial will be based in Toulon.  France   The first FREMM frigate Aquitaine   Delivered in November 2012   ,  The second ship D652  Delivered in  June 2015    .  France  The FREMM project plans to purchase eight ships, including 6 anti-submarine ships and 2 air defense ships. Three of the anti-submarine warfare ships are under construction and are expected to be delivered in 2017, 2018, and 2019 respectively. A spokesperson for the company told Jane's that the former  France second FREMM ship Normandie was Sold to Egypt. By 2022, the  France  FREMM project will deliver six anti-submarine ships to replace its F70 and F67 ships; two air defense FREMM ships will replace the F70 and Jean Bart ships. .

832.doctext: Lockheed Martin delivered  the first  II.5 upgraded P-3C  to the  Navy  . The aircraft was upgraded according to the Surface Warfare Upgrade Project plan. According to the contract in 2004 and 2005,  Lockheed Martin  will install AIP upgrade modules on 5  II.5 upgraded P-3C aircraft .  Type II.5 P-3C aircraft  It is an older model of the P-3C and in most cases is used less than subsequent production aircraft. The AIP upgrade plan first focused on the III upgraded P-3C aircraft, and now focuses on earlier models. This   II.5 upgraded P-3C  aircraft will initially be delivered to the   U.S. Navy Air Flight Test and Evaluation Squadron 20 /span_10, using it as a sea trial demonstrator. The aircraft will also undergo some network communications upgrades and anti-submarine warfare maritime upgrade program upgrades. The aircraft is expected to conduct its first offshore  test flight  during an exercise in  November 2005  .

833.doctext: Kiev Aviation Plant  has resumed production of  An-32 aircraft  after a ten-year hiatus. The new aircraft has now completed initial  testing  .  An-32  was designed in  Kiev  in the 1980s. It is a unique aircraft in the world. So far,  An-32  has unparalleled performance for air transportation in high altitude areas, deserts and tropical areas.  Libya  ordered a fire extinguisher modification of this aircraft. Within the framework of this contract,  Kiev Aviation Plant restored the  An-32  Production. The pilot spent an hour and a half testing the new aircraft today. The test pilot believed the aircraft was a success and even better than he expected. The specialized equipment has some minor flaws, but these will be addressed on the next flight and can be avoided.  Kiev  will provide 4 aircraft to  Libya  capital Tripoli, but the total contract amount is a commercial secret. The general manager of the Kiev Aviation Factory claimed that  Libya  had already paid 50% of the payment in advance. Under normal circumstances, the price of Ukrainian aircraft is only a fraction of that of similar American aircraft. It is impossible to occupy the African and Asian markets at a price of US$27 million. Currently,  An-32P aircraft  is undergoing  tests  on temperature and durability.

834.doctext: Cartagena Shipyard delivered the fifth Schigula class ship to  the Spanish Navy   on  July 5 Minehunter  Douro.  Douro  is the first of the second batch of Schigula-class minehunters. The second and final  Tagus  was launched  on June 10    . The Shgula-class minehunting boats have made some new improvements in their minehunting equipment, which can detect and destroy various types of mines. In addition, this class of minehunting boats is equipped with an intelligent system that can plan and direct minehunting operations and record the results. The Shgula-class minehunters are constructed of non-magnetic materials to avoid triggering magnetic mines. For example, the hulls of the  Douro  and Tagus minehunters are made of fiberglass, while the superstructure and other parts are made of stainless steel and aluminum alloys.
