The Office of the Taipei Economic and Cultural Representative in the United States requested that the United States sell 144  SM-2 Block III Standard Missiles, 16 telemetry missiles, missile containers, spare parts and maintenance parts to  Taiwan . and provide supply support, personnel training and training equipment, technical data, and other related logistical support. This arms sale will improve the Taiwan Navy’s air defense capabilities.  Taiwan  hopes to deploy  SM-2 missiles    on destroyers and other surface ships to defend against cruise missiles.  Taiwan  currently has  SM-2 standard missiles  . The prime contractor for this arms sale is Raytheon Missile Systems.

1309.doctext: Some of the  warship technology products   developed by  Indian Naval Institute of Science and Technology will be delivered to   Indian Navy at Vishakapatnam  tomorrow . Dr. ASivathanu Pillai, director of the Defense Research and Development Agency of India, will hand over the  product  to Lieutenant General D.S.P. Varma, director of equipment of the Indian Naval Command.  Indian Institute of Naval Science and Technology  is involved in warship technology for evading enemy, ship/submarine detection. These technologies will be used on modern warships being designed and built.  The Indian Naval Institute of Science and Technology  has successfully developed these technologies not long ago and is moving towards independent research and development in this key field. Warship technology is multidisciplinary and covers different aspects such as acoustics and electromagnetics covering a wide frequency range. Therefore, these products are developed using an interdisciplinary, holistic approach.  The Indian Naval Institute of Science and Technology  has developed a number of  products  that prevent Indian Navy warships from being damaged in enemy attacks. These products include sound domes, silencers, dual-stage vibration isolation systems, radar transparent ladders, struts, camouflage screens, helicopter grids, composite blowers and many others. All of these products have undergone extensive laboratory and shipboard evaluation. Following successful evaluation, these products have been commissioned into service with the  Indian Navy .

Subject: Indian Naval Institute of Science and Technology
Indian Institute of Naval Science and Technology
The Indian Naval Institute of Science and Technology
The Indian Naval Institute of Science and Technology

1310.doctext: United States Customs and Border Protection,  Border Patrol have signed a $2.7 million contract with the U.S. division of Belgian company FN Herstal to It ordered FN303 non-lethal weapons systems. The FN303 provides users with a non-lethal solution to suspicious elements. The system fires 8.5-gram .68 caliber ammunition with a range of 68.6 meters. The ammunition uses a fin-stabilized polystyrene body and a non-toxic bismuth warhead. The types of ammunition that can be fired by this system include: permanently dyed bullets, OC bullets, trigger-type bullets and washable dyed bullets. Each type of ammunition is designed to suppress an incoming target without causing permanent damage. The FN303 is equipped with a translucent 15-round magazine, which allows the operator to easily see the remaining ammunition. The system uses compressed gas to fire ammunition, and one pressure bottle can fire 110 rounds of ammunition. FN303 can also fire PAVA rounds with a range of 90 meters. The  Border Patrol  stationed at the  U.S.-Mexico border  is currently equipped with more than 1,000 FN303 non-lethal weapons systems.

1311.doctext: United States  Sniper  has received the M110 semi-automatic sniper system developed and produced by Knight Ordnance Company of the United States. The weapon system will provide enhanced firepower to snipers conducting combat support operations. The new M110 semi-automatic sniper system has been issued to  deployed in mid-November 2007 and is in the hands of  snipers at  Fort Polka, Louisiana, USA. This is the first time this system has been equipped with troops. The M110 semi-automatic sniper system equipped with a silencer has a total combat weight of 8.5 kilograms and is equipped with 7.62 mm ammunition. This new weapon replaces the M24 manual bolt system with a quickly detachable large-capacity box magazine, so it has a higher rate of fire, allowing snipers to accurately and quickly lock on enemy targets even in densely populated areas. Another improvement to the weapon is the addition of a flash suppressor/suppressor. When snipers must change equipment to attack enemy targets at close range, the M110 semi-automatic sniper system can also eliminate unnecessary baggage. In addition, the M110 semi-automatic sniper system includes a 3.5-10x variable power rifle scope and a Picatinny rail that complies with Military Standard 1913 to enable the weapon to mount various matching accessories on the rail for use, such as The AN/PVS-26 clamp-on night sight currently equipped at Fort Polka.

1312.doctext: The U.S. Air Force Air Combat Command  announced Wednesday that the  F-22 Raptor  has reached full operational capability. The milestone was achieved by the active-duty 1st Fighter Wing at Langley Air Force Base, Virginia, and the Virginia Air National Guard's 192nd Fighter Wing. According to a news release from Air Combat Command, this milestone means that the Raptor has met all performance and operational requirements and that the entire program, including aircraft, pilots and maintainers, is ready for the aircraft's full service, including war deployment. Prepare. Gen. John D.W. Corley, commander of Air Combat Command, said: Through years of collaborative efforts, the F-22 has reached a critical milestone. The integrated task force at Langley Air Force Base has sufficient Raptor aircraft, equipment and trained pilots. providing air superiority to the joint force for many years to come. The news released by  Air Combat Command also stated that  Langley Air Force Base   was deployed with 40  F-22 fighter jets .

Subject: The U.S. Air Force Air Combat Command
Air Combat Command

1313.doctext: The  MK57 vertical launch system  developed by Raytheon for the  DDG1000 destroyer  was awarded the fifth place award in the 2006 Department of Defense Systems Engineering Project by the Department of Defense and the National Defense Industry Association. Developed by Raytheon Integrated Systems and BAE Systems, the  MK57 Vertical Launch System provides critical ship self-defense capabilities and can launch all of the  U.S. Navy’s current and future inventories model missiles. The first system will be  deployed  on  the U.S. Navy’s new DDG1000 destroyer . The relevant person in charge of Raytheon Company said that this award is the user's affirmation of  MK57 vertical launch system . Raytheon will apply its engineering innovation and expertise to develop more reliable, affordable systems and capabilities to meet warfighting needs.

Subject: U.S.
Location: the U.S. Navy’s new DDG1000 destroyer

1314.doctext: The United States   Los Angeles-class attack nuclear submarine USS Norfolk left Pier 3 of the Norfolk Naval Base on December 28, 2007, and began a six-month, scheduled Norfolk will deploy within the U.S. Central Command area of ​​responsibility.  USS Norfolk This deployment is independent and does not follow an aircraft carrier or an expeditionary strike group. This deployment brings special challenges to the submarine commander Jackson and his crew. He said: The challenge of this kind of independent deployment is that we have no relevant direct guarantee, for example, no other troops can provide us with protection. At the same time, this also brings many opportunities, within the allowed scope, to make our operations more efficient. Great flexibility.  The HMS Norfolk submarine  has a variety of combat capabilities, can attack and destroy the enemy's military and economy at sea, provide close-range early strike capabilities, and ensure underwater superiority.  Norfolk  is 110m long, has a displacement of 6900t and a speed of over 25kn.

Subject: The United States
Militaryforce: Los Angeles-class attack nuclear submarine USS Norfolk

1315.doctext: During his visit to Russia, Polish Foreign Minister Skowski announced that he would propose to Russia the possibility of  Poland participating in the  United States missile defense system, that is, in  Poland   Deployment 10  interceptors. He pointed out: The United States is our ally. Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov said: We do not want to put any pressure on  Poland  or other countries, we just want other countries to listen and understand our interests. Polish Prime Minister Tusk plans to hold talks with Russia on missile defense issues during his visit to Russia in February.  Poland  requires the United States to provide certain additional security guarantees and military assistance in exchange for allowing the United States to deploy a missile defense system in  Poland . Tusk also made it clear that  Poland  would be in no rush to sign the deal. The Czech Republic hopes to obtain advanced military technology in exchange for allowing the United States to deploy a missile defense radar in the Czech Republic. Among the countries bordering  Poland, Slovakia is one country that has not considered missile defense systems. Prime Minister Fizo told a European Parliament committee: We do not want to see missile defense systems deployed in Europe. Any reason.

1316.doctext: Roman Research, a subsidiary of PAR Technologies, recently received a contract from the  U.S. Navy to provide equipment to  stationed in  Guam  U.S. Naval Computer and Communications Station provides support to operate and maintain communications equipment. Under the terms of the contract, RRC will provide uninterrupted technical services in support of the U.S. Navy radio communications installation and U.S. Air Force ScopeCommand radio station stationed in Riga, Guam, as well as support for the satellite communications facility and technical control facility located in Gaya, Guam. If all options of the contract are exercised, the total value will be US$25.6 million and will be completed within four years.  The U.S. Naval Computer and Radio Communications Station on Guam  provides reliable command and control, fleet communications, computer, and base communications services to U.S. Navy, joint and allied forces.

Subject: U.S. Navy
Location: The U.S. Naval Computer and Radio Communications Station on Guam
Militaryforce: U.S. Naval Computer and Communications Station

1317.doctext: The two largest U.S. defense contractors, Boeing and Rocky Martin, announced on the 25th that they will jointly compete for a contract to develop  the U.S. Air Force's next-generation strategic bomber . Their opponent may be Northrop Grumman.  The Pentagon  has stated that it hopes to  deploy  by  2018  . The requirements for the  new long-range strategic bomber  are to have a combat radius of 3,700 kilometers without refueling and to be able to carry a 14-ton payload. These requirements make the  new bomber  more similar to the F-111 than the Air Force's current B-52 and B-2 heavy bombers. Combined, Boeing and Rocky Martin may be the best team to provide the U.S. Air Force with a  new long-range bomber .

Subject: The Pentagon
Militaryforce: the U.S. Air Force's next-generation strategic bomber

1318.doctext: The U.S. Navy  changed the deployment of warships in the Mediterranean on Wednesday, continuing to maintain its military deterrence amid tensions in Syria and Lebanon. U.S. officials called the deployment a routine military deployment, but one that would draw attention from the Middle East. The United States' announcement last week that it would increase the deployment of warships in the Mediterranean caused political turmoil in Lebanon. Suez Canal officials said the  USS Cole  and its supporting fleet passed through the Suez Canal on Wednesday night, sailing from the Mediterranean Sea into the Red Sea. U.S. Navy officials stated that the mission of the  USS Cole  has been taken over by another guided missile destroyer, the USS OS, and a Ticonderoga-class guided missile cruiser, the USS Philippine Sea.  The  deployment  of the USS Cole  has been met with strong opposition from Lebanese Hezbollah and former Syrian groups in Lebanon, as well as criticism from Syria.

Subject: The U.S. Navy
Militaryforce: The  deployment  of the USS Cole

1319.doctext: According to Taiwan Defense Minister Tsai Ming-hsien on April 9, two U.S. aircraft carriers will be deployed in waters near Taiwan to ensure the smooth transition of the Taiwanese authority amid tensions in the region. Tsai Ming-hsien said that Taiwan will  deploy Arriving in the  Western Pacific near Taiwan, and will continue to stay in this area for a while. Tsai Ming-hsien said that this deployment is of strategic significance and said that this is the intention of the US Pacific Command. For the Taiwan Strait, the period from March 22 to May 20 is an extraordinary period. Ma Ying-jeou will take office on May 20. It is expected that both the  Kitty Hawk  and the  USS Nimitz  will linger in the waters near Taiwan before Ma Ying-jeou takes office. According to a spokesman for the U.S. Pacific Command in March, during this deployment, the escort force of the  USS Nimitz was the entire strike group, including several surface ships and submarines, while  Kitty Hawk was escorted by only one destroyer.

1320.doctext: American Alliant Technology Systems has been awarded a $90 million contract from Lockheed Martin to produce solid rocket propulsion systems for the U.S. Navy's three-stage Trident-2 carrier-based ballistic missile. According to the contract, ATK will continue to provide Trident solid rocket propulsion systems to Lockheed Martin, the general contractor of the  Trident-2 missile system  until 2011.  The Trident-2 missile system was  deployed in 1990    and remains the only submarine-launched missile system in  the United States strategic missile system.

1321.doctext: The U.S. Navy's   guided-missile destroyer USS Cole will return to Norfolk Naval Base on Friday. The ship was  deployed to  before returning. 5th, 6th and 7th Fleet, duration is 6 months.  HMS Cole  was part of the Royal Navy's HMS Excellence aircraft carrier strike group, providing support for the strike group and participating in some operations off the coast of Lebanon. The HMS Excellence aircraft carrier strike group consists of ships from the United Kingdom, France and Spain. This is the first time that a U.S. Navy ship has joined a strike group from another country.  USS Cole  has a total crew of 275.

1322.doctext: Germany initiates the first overseas  deployment of the  Typhoon fighter jet, several of its  aircraft have been deployed to  Siauliai, Lithuania The air base provides rapid response warning services to the Baltic countries. On September 1, the German Air Force began to undertake the NATO Baltic Sea rapid response warning mission, which will be carried out for four months. Previously, four Saab Gripen aircraft of the Czech Air Force performed this mission. The  Typhoon fighter aircraft  of the 74th Squadron of the German Air Force Neuburg Base will provide air surveillance for Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania during the first half of the service period. After that, the F-4 Phantom Interceptor of the 71st Squadron will replace the Eurofighter to continue this mission. Task. Nearly 100 people are providing relevant support services for this Eurofighter deployment. Since April 2004, 14 NATO member states have jointly provided continuous air warning services to the Baltic States. NATO has pledged to continue providing the service until around 2018.

1323.doctext: The U.S. Navy  recently awarded  Lockheed Martin  a contract to upgrade the MK92 fire control system for Turkey's G-class guided missile frigates. After the system upgrade, it will support the installation of improved Sea Sparrow missiles, thereby enhancing the self-defense capabilities of this class of ships. The MK92 system was originally developed by  Lockheed Martin to provide  integrated  X-band radar surveillance for the  Navy's naval gun and missile systems  ,  Target tracking and  Weapon fire control capability. Under this new contract,  Lockheed Martin  will complete the design, development and integration of the system to adapt it to new missiles. Stan Ozgar, Lockheed Martin's naval radar project director, said: This upgrade of the MK92 system is the first time the U.S. Navy has sold our solid-state continuous wave radar illuminator to support the deployment of ESSM in other countries around the world. This upgrade, together with  Lockheed Martin's MK41 vertical launch system, uses the MK25's quadruple launcher to allow each MK41 launch unit to load 4 ESSMs, which will improve the ship's own capabilities defensive capabilities. ESSM is a medium-range rapid reaction missile designed to intercept anti-ship missiles. At present, more than 125 sets of MK92 ship-based systems have been produced and deployed on naval ships of 9 different countries around the world. These include more than 70 guided missile frigates, as well as coast guard boats, corvettes and fast attack ships.

1324.doctext: Comprehensive report of this magazine on April 14: On April 14, more than 400 British public gathered opposite No. 10 Downing Street, the British Prime Minister's Office, to hold a demonstration to protest against the  United States's national missile defense plan. Opposing  the United States to meddling in the affairs of other countries everywhere, and demanding that the British government refuse to cooperate with the United States on this issue. The British government's current attitude on whether to participate in the US missile defense program is still unclear. British Foreign Secretary Cook earlier said it was too early to talk about the possibility of Britain assisting  the United States  on anti-ballistic missile systems. A spokesperson for the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament, one of the organizers of the demonstrations, said:  The deployment of the   national missile defense system by the United States   will upset the balance of international relations and trigger A new round of arms race.

1325.doctext: The Hellenic Air Force  received the first batch of 4  US-made F-16CBlock52+ fighter jets  it ordered on May 22. According to reports, these aircraft will be  deployed at the  Araxos Air Force Base where the 116th Fighter Wing of the Greek Air Force is stationed. The first aircraft will be used to equip the 335th Fighter Squadron. . According to the plan, the 335th Fighter Squadron will receive all the new fighter jets ordered and be responsible for bringing them to initial combat capability as soon as possible. Under the Peace Pollen IV program,  the Hellenic Air Force  ordered a total of 20 single-seat F-16C and 10 two-seat F-16D fighters. Except for the 4 aircraft delivered this time, the remaining 26 aircraft will be delivered before March 2010 as planned.

1326.doctext: The U.S. Air Force  has a cost-plus-fixed-fee contract with  Northrop Grumman Defense Mission Systems, San Diego, Calif. , valued at up to $276 million. This contract will  provide   rapid deployment and support of airborne battlefield communications node systems  . The contractor will install the BACN system on three Bombardier BD-700 Global Fast aircraft that will enter service immediately, as well as two Global Hawk 20-seat unmanned aircraft, and will continue to deploy it into 2015. The system was developed by Northrop Grumman under contract from the U.S. Department of Defense Microelectronics Agency as part of an interim program. This contract addresses an urgent need to enhance communications capabilities for overseas emergency operations. Currently, more than US$97 million in funding has been committed.

Subject: Northrop Grumman Defense Mission Systems, San Diego, Calif.
Materials: rapid deployment and support of airborne battlefield communications node systems

1327.doctext: The Defense Subcommittee of the U.S. Senate Appropriations Committee approved a $7.7 billion appropriation plan for the U.S. missile defense agency for fiscal year 2010 on September 9. The money is included in the fiscal year 2010 defense appropriations bill, scheduled to be submitted to the appropriations committees. Senator Richard Shelby said in a statement: The need for a robust national missile defense program has never been clearer than it is today.  The U.S. Missile Defense Agency is responsible for the development and  fielding of an integrated, layered  ballistic missile defense system that protects the U.S. homeland, U.S. deployed forces, Allies and their friends fight enemy ballistic missiles of all ranges and in all stages of flight. The defense legislation provides $846 million for ground-based midcourse defense and $1.1 billion for the terminal high-altitude area defense program. The Patriot Advanced Capabilities III program will receive $569 million in funding. At the same time, the Department of Defense issued a $93 million contract to produce the new Standard Missile 6.

1328.doctext: U.S. President Obama announced on September 17 that he would abandon his plan to establish missile defense bases in Eastern Europe. But he also warned that Iran's missile program remained a threat. Obama said at a press conference that the decision to abandon the plan to establish missile defense bases in Eastern Europe was to adopt more effective new technologies to strengthen  the United States 's missile defense capabilities. In addition, the United States believes that Iran is less interested in developing long-range missiles than in the past. Obama said the  new missile systems being deployed by the  United States in  Europe  will be more comprehensive than older systems and will provide a better defense for the United States Provide stronger, more precise and faster protection from U.S. troops and allies at home and in  Europe. Obama said that  the United States  will continue to cooperate with allies such as Poland and the Czech Republic on anti-missile issues. In July 2008,  United States  and the Czech Republic signed an agreement on the establishment of an anti-missile radar base in the Czech Republic by  United States . According to the agreement,  the United States  will begin construction of this base in the Czech Republic in 2010. In August of the same year,  the United States  and Poland reached an agreement on the establishment of an anti-missile base in Poland.

1329.doctext: The UAE's purchase of four Boeing C-17 transport aircraft has taken another step forward. The foreign military sales transaction has been notified to the U.S. Congress and is awaiting congressional approval. The contract will include logistics support and is expected to be worth a total of US$501 million. The Pentagon stated that the aircraft purchased by the UAE will not only be used for its own needs, but will also support US and NATO operations in Afghanistan.  The UAE military has deployed  drones in Afghanistan's  Helmand area   to provide intelligence, Surveillance and reconnaissance. The UAE will be the second country in the Middle East to purchase C-17 transport aircraft. Qatar received two C-17 transport aircraft this year, bringing the country's C-17 fleet to four. Saudi Arabia is also a potential customer for the aircraft, and Boeing said customers in the Middle East will purchase a total of 20 C-17 transport aircraft. The United States is also negotiating with India to purchase this type of transport aircraft. The United Kingdom recently stated that it will purchase another one, and the Royal Air Force will purchase another one.

1330.doctext: Harris accepts a $73 million order from  U.S. Marine Corps, including  Falcon IIIAN/PRC-117G multi-band portable radio system, accessory tools, remote control and satellite communications antenna.  The Marine Corps  will  deploy the   AN/PRC-117G  to provide high-speed network communications to enhance information collection and distribution in tactical areas. The radio system extends tactical IP connectivity and can submit urgent combat requests to Marines, greatly improving dynamic awareness capabilities. Steve Marschilok, president of Harris Wireless Communications Division, said:  AN/PRC-117G  provides wireless, network high-bandwidth communications, video streaming and biometrics applications and will transform the  U.S. Marine Corps span_6's way of fighting. In addition, these multi-band radios provide reliable persistent tactical satellite and single-channel terrestrial and airborne radio system voice communications capabilities. The single-man-portable  AN/PRC-117G  is only half the size of traditional radio equipment, reducing the soldier's load. The radio supports applications such as streaming video, imaging, biometrics, logistics and other data-intensive applications, and also provides a frequency extension ranging from 30MHz to 2GHz.

Militaryforce: Falcon IIIAN/PRC-117G multi-band portable radio system
Subject: U.S. Marine Corps
The Marine Corps

1331.doctext: AML Communications, which specializes in providing amplifiers and integrated circuit components to the electronic warfare weapons industry, announced on April 6, 2010 that the  U.S. Air Force will continue to provide  small air-launched decoys invest.  Small air-launched decoy bomb  is a miniaturized drone with electronic interference capabilities, developed by Raytheon Company. As a major supplier of MALD microelectronics, AML Communications will benefit from increased  U.S. Air Force  investment in the program. Starting from 2010 to 2015, the purchase volume of MALD will increase.  The U.S. Air Force  has previously revealed plans to  deploy  a total of 1,500  small air-launched decoys  by  2012  . The fiscal year 2011 U.S. defense budget provides continued MALD procurement funding for the U.S. Air Force. In fiscal year 2009, suppliers delivered a total of 146 MALDs to the  U.S. Air Force . In fiscal years 2010 and 2011,  the US Air Force  plans to purchase 291 and 228 MALDs respectively. Judging from recent developments, MALD's procurement volume will average approximately $90 million per year between now and fiscal 2015. It should be pointed out that the U.S. Army and Navy will also be equipped with MALD. Coupled with possible future foreign military sales contracts, the total production volume of MALD will further increase.

1332.doctext: The Polish Ministry of Defense  spokesperson stated that the first batch of  US Patriot missiles  will arrive in Poland at the end of May  for  deployment  . After preparation and consultation work, the deployment of the first batch of  Patriot missiles  began on May 24. The deployment site is located at the  Polish Morongo Military Base , located 250 kilometers north of Warsaw and only 60 kilometers away from the Kaliningrad border in Russia. The spokesman declined to say when the deployment would end, but said the tentative plan was February. Poland reiterated that  base 's proximity to Kaliningrad was not a choice for political or strategic reasons, but simply because of the good infrastructure there. Under the current agreement, the United States will ensure assistance to Poland in upgrading its national air defense system through  Patriot missiles .

1333.doctext: Boeing  has completed the installation of 10  video surveillance systems  for the U.S. Border Patrol's Detroit Division, and the company has completed all site work involved in the Northern Border Patrol project.  Delivery of the  system to  U.S. Customs and  Border Patrol will enhance 37 miles of border defense along the St. Clair River Surveillance capabilities. The Northern Border Defense program also includes five systems similar to those delivered by Boeing to the Buffalo, N.Y., department, which covers a 15-mile area of ​​the upper Niagara River. Tim Peters, vice president of Boeing Global Security Systems, said: These systems will provide the most direct tools for border surveillance and can also help enhance the security of the authorities. We are providing the ability to provide  Customs and  Border Protection is proud to provide the capability to deploy the next generation of border surveillance. For each deployment, CBP provides system power, cameras and sensors, while Boeing will be responsible for the installation and linking of sensors, etc.

1334.doctext: The Iranian Revolutionary Guards  deployed   a large number of high-speed missile boats  in the  Persian Gulf  . Admiral Van der Far, commander of the Navy of the Revolutionary Guards, said that the Zolfagar-class, Tareg-class, Ashura-class and Zorjona-class high-speed boats have demonstrated good navigation capabilities and extremely strong damage capabilities. These high-speed boats are equipped with rocket launchers and other advanced military equipment and can attack any foreign ship. Military adviser Major General Raheem Safavi said that at any time, all hostile targets and ships passing through the  Persian Gulf  are within the range of Iranian Revolutionary Guard missiles. There is no doubt that this approach will provide security in the  Persian Gulf  and the Strait of Hormuz.  Iran's Revolutionary Guards  will combine ground, naval and air forces to defend border areas and the Islamic Republic.

1335.doctext: Russian Helicopters Ulan-Ude Aviation Manufacturing Plant  recently completed an order contract for 40 Mi-171 helicopters from  UTair . The contract was signed three years ago. The batch of  Mi-171s delivered to  UTair    are based on the Mi-8AMT  and are specially launched for the Russian domestic market. The purpose helicopter will be deployed at the Tumen Airport of  UTair Airlines in the future. According to UUAP General Manager Leonid Belykh, the order contract signed by  UTair  is one of the largest commercial contracts for UUAP and the entire Russian helicopter industry. He also said that the manufacturing and delivery of these helicopters were ahead of schedule.

Subject: Russian Helicopters Ulan-Ude Aviation Manufacturing Plant

1336.doctext: Harris International Communications and Information Technology Corporation has received a $9 million order from the  United States Military to  supply the   Falcon IIAN /PRC-150 high frequency backpack radio. The U.S. Army is purchasing  AN/PRC-150 radios  to provide soldiers with superior long-distance beyond-visual-range tactical communications capabilities.  AN/PRC-150 Radio  Widely deployed by US military and NATO forces around the world, it is the only high-frequency radio system certified by TYPE-1 today. The radio system continuously covers the 1.6MHz~60MHz frequency range, providing secure voice and data communications even in the harshest conditions. "Harris is the global leader in high-frequency tactical communications," said Brendan O'Connell, president of Harris' RF Communications defense business.  AN/PRC-150 Radio  Provides critical long-range communications for warfighters when line of sight is obstructed.

Subject: Harris International Communications and Information Technology Corporation
Materials: Falcon IIAN /PRC-150 high frequency backpack radio

1337.doctext: Raytheon  has  delivered  more than 4,500  AGM-154 Joint Standoff Weapons  . While the vast majority are deployed with  U.S. troops  , the export benefits of this weapons system are clear. The main customer for joint standoff weapons is the U.S. Navy. The current procurement focus is on the  AGM-154C joint standoff weapon , which is being produced at full rate. The Air Force turned back to focus on joint standoff weapons in 2005, but the chances of reversing this situation are slim. The Air Force's purchase order will not have a big impact. As for the  AGM-154B Joint Standoff Weapon , the status of this type of weapon will continue to be on hold, waiting for the final order decided by the U.S. Navy. Although export orders are now increasing, the needs of the U.S. Navy are the driving force behind joint standoff weapons production. So far, Australia, Greece, Poland and Turkey are export customers for joint standoff weapons, while Singapore and Finland have also placed orders. India can acquire this weapon by purchasing US-made fighter jets.

1338.doctext: The U.S. Air Force will equip Langley Air Force Base with 7 T-38C Talon supersonic jet trainer aircraft, which will be used as accompanying trainer aircraft for the F-22 fighter jets of the 1st Fighter Wing of Langley Air Force Base. It will provide the base's F-22 pilots with additional flight time and also serve as a hostile aircraft for F-22 combat training. U.S. Air Force Combat Command spokesperson Sean Collins revealed that this batch of T-38 trainer aircraft will be in place from March to September 2011. Pilots who are qualified to fly F-22 and T-38 dual aircraft and All F-22 pilots in training will fly T-38 trainer aircraft, and the Air Force will no longer arrange additional pilots to Langley Air Force Base. According to reports, this batch of T-38 trainer aircraft is the Korean T-38B, not the T-38C of the U.S. Air Force Air Education and Training Command.  The U.S. Air Force also plans to station a  T-38 detachment at  Tyndall Air Force Base, Florida   for the same purpose Purpose.

1339.doctext: South Korea's Yonhap News Agency reported that a senior member of South Korea's ruling party's National Assembly said on Tuesday that  the United States should once again deploy   short-range nuclear weapons in  South Korea   /span_3 . Representative Chung Mong-joon said that countering nuclear threats may be the only thing that can prevent North Korea from developing nuclear weapons. To make matters worse, he added, the  United States  appears to be running out of patience in endless and fruitless negotiations with North Korea. Perhaps  the United States  is now more interested in preventing North Korea's nuclear proliferation than in completely eliminating its nuclear weapons.  The United States  removed  tactical nuclear weapons  from  South Korea  in 1991.  The Obama Administration  has stated that it will continue to support the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula without providing  South Korea  with  short-range missiles  to maintain a sustained nuclear deterrent.

1340.doctext: The  U.S. Navy is deploying   unmanned helicopters to  Afghanistan   to support the Ground force operations. The US military plans to transport 3 MQ-8B Fire Scout drones, 2 ground stations and related hardware to Afghanistan. Developed for shipboard applications, the  FireScout UAV  can stay aloft for eight hours and will provide full-motion video surveillance for coalition forces.

1341.doctext: BAE Systems has been awarded a six-year contract to provide support services for the  Royal Navy   HMS Clyde patrol ship .  HMS Clyde patrol ship  has high maneuverability, a displacement of 1847 tons, a cruising speed of 21 knots, and a personnel strength of 43 people. The ship replaces HMS Leedsburgh and HMS Dumbarton, and will be permanently  stationed  at  Falkland Island  . The ship has advanced air defense radar, a multi-functional flight deck and helicopter aerial refueling capabilities. Sources from the BAE Surface Ship Division said that this contract will help the British Ministry of Defense reduce costs and maximize the practicality of the ships to meet operational needs.

1342.doctext: Canada became the second country to withdraw from the Northrop Grumman RQ-4 joint ground surveillance project, but according to sources, the remaining NATO countries in the project are very close to signing a final agreement. This decision means that the AGS project has lost another source of funding, and the remaining 13 NATO member states will bear more costs. In June last year, Denmark announced its withdrawal from the project. In the near future, Northrop Grumman is likely to sign a contract with  NATO  to start the development phase of the AGS project. However, each member state still needs to approve the contract before it can be signed. According to the current plan, the AGS project will purchase 6  RQ-4 UAVs, which adopt the U.S. Air Force’s Batch 40 standards and are equipped with MP-RTIP wide-area surveillance sensors, including those from EADS. European partners will provide mobile ground stations for the fleet, with all six  aircraft being  deployed at  Sigonella Air Force Base in Sicily, Italy.

1343.doctext: After the United States threatened to withdraw from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty,  the Russian military  stated that it would hold nuclear force exercises in  2019 . On December 18, 2018, Russian Defense Minister Shoigu said at the annual Defense Council meeting of the Ministry of Defense that new exercises and training plans would be held in 2019, including the Strategic Command designed to test Russia’s ability to launch a nuclear strike if necessary. with the Staff's  Center-2019 Exercise and Strategic Forces Thunder   Exercise. Shoigu pointed out that unlike the United States' approach of deploying a global missile defense system, the Russian military is increasing its nuclear strike potential. The Russian Ministry of Defense stated in the minutes of the meeting that it had completed the task of raising the modernization level of strategic nuclear forces to 82% in 2017.

Subject: the Russian military
Content: Center-2019 Exercise and Strategic Forces Thunder

1344.doctext: Recently   the U.S. Air Force is conducting an Air-Ground Weapon System Evaluation Project test  exercise codenamed Operation Hammer to test laser-guided Joint Direct Attack Munitions assessment of combat performance. The Iron Hammer combat exercise was conducted at  Hill Air Force Base, Utah. During the test,  the B-1B bomber used six 500-pound GBU-54 LJDAMs against the Utah test and training range. The ground moving target was struck. LJDAM is an improvement based on the original joint direct attack munition and a laser seeker. Due to the use of dual-mode guidance, LJDAM has higher accuracy and has the ability to hit moving ground targets.  The U.S. Air Force The purpose of implementing the Hammer Combat Exercise is to verify and evaluate the effectiveness, maintainability, applicability and accuracy of LJDAM and other advanced air-to-ground weapons. Simulate specific battlefield situations such as deceleration/acceleration states.

1345.doctext: A certain type of  anti-aircraft missile intercepts air targets . Photo by special reporter Gao Yi  Anti-tank missiles accurately strike against moving targets on the sea  . Photo by special reporter Gao Yi  Vehicle-mounted anti-tank missiles carry out precise strikes against targets  . Photo by special reporter Gao Yi  Amphibious howitzer fires long-range fire  . Special reporter Gao Yi took photos of amphibious howitzers firing long-range fire. Photo by special reporter Gao Yi  On July 1, a  Marine Corps brigade known as a tiger on land and a dragon on sea, set up a complex tactical background in an unfamiliar area and used multiple types of The live firing of missiles, artillery and mortars tested the professional training results of shooters and strived to improve the overall assault and fire strike capabilities of the troops.  During the assessment, the anti-aircraft missile shooters reacted quickly and accurately positioned themselves to attack and chase targets towed by target drones; the anti-tank missile shooters completed the entire process of shooting at moving targets on the sea from occupying positions to aiming and firing. It took less than 3 minutes; the amphibious self-propelled howitzer was pulled to an unfamiliar area to carry out long-range precision strikes on maritime targets. Source: Ministry of National Defense website

Content: Anti-tank missiles accurately strike against moving targets on the sea
Vehicle-mounted anti-tank missiles carry out precise strikes against targets
Subject: Marine Corps brigade

1346.doctext: Spanish Navantia Group delivered the  Cantabria supply ship   at  San Fernando Shipyard on  July 23 A launching ceremony was held for the ship, which was built for the Spanish Navy. The contract for the ship was signed in July 2005, and the keel was laid in July 2007. The ship is expected to enter service within 12 to 14 months after launch. The ship is a catamaran capable of replenishing liquids and solids for army and navy operations. The ship can also support maritime pollution control and provide medical assistance, so it can be used for humanitarian relief and natural disasters. Its main performance indicators are as follows: Total length: 173.9 meters Waterline length: 162 meters Width: 23 meters Design draft: 8 meters Depth: 11.8 meters Net weight: 9800 tons Displacement: 19,500 tons Power unit: 2 10.89 kW diesel engines + single propeller Maximum speed: 22 knots Endurance: 6,000 nautical miles Crew: 122 people

1347.doctext: Raytheon Missile Systems delivered a total of 366  Improved Sea Sparrow missiles in 2010, equivalent to twice the number of the previous year. This number also set a record for Raytheon's  Improved Sea Sparrow missiles. Sparrow Missile Record of delivered quantities. According to Nick Nelson, vice president of the Naval Weapons Systems Division of Raytheon Missile Systems, the delivery quantity of Raytheon's  Improved Sea Sparrow missile has increased for two reasons: first, increased customer demand; Second, Raytheon's own manufacturing technology level has been improved and enhanced.  The improved Sea Sparrow  is a medium-range, all-weather, semi-active radar-guided  missile  capable of achieving face-to-air and face-to-face strikes on surface ships. Currently, this type of missile has been  deployed by more than 11 countries and regions in the world   .

Militaryforce: Improved Sea Sparrow missiles. Sparrow Missile
Subject: deployed by more than 11 countries and regions in the world

1348.doctext: The Office of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India stated that due to insufficient performance of avionics equipment in service, the air combat capabilities of the  Indian Navy  have seriously deteriorated. In a report before Parliament, the Office of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India stated that the Indian Navy aircraft carrier Virat and its carrier-based aircraft are on the verge of decommissioning due to long service life and maintenance requirements. INS Virat is the only aircraft carrier in active service in the  Indian Navy . It underwent life extension modifications from March 2008 to August 2009, and can serve until 2012 after modification. The Sea Harrier, the only carrier-based aircraft carried by the INS Virat, either crashed or could not be replenished due to mismatch with the performance of the fire control radar. The report stated that the missiles, bombs and 30mm naval guns on the aircraft carrier were also abandoned. In December 2009,  Indian Navy received 4  MiG-Fs which were  deployed on the  aircraft carrier INS Vikramaditya Type 29 fighter aircraft, this aircraft carrier is planned to join the  Indian Navy at the end of 2012.

1349.doctext: The U.S. Army is currently undergoing transformation to cope with the complex war patterns of the future. To this end, the Army Chief of Staff will  test the future during Joint Exploration Military  Exercise No. 10 Challenges that may be encountered in the operational environment. As part of the Army Learning Program, the Joint Winter Military Exercise scheduled for February 9-14, 2013 will provide  Army and civilian domain experts an opportunity to question existing and proposed doctrine and concepts . During the exercise, a number of new Army operating concepts will be developed and examined how these concepts can help  the Army  support joint operations and global integrated operations central thinking. Future Operations oversees joint exploration programs and Army learning programs. This will help U.S. military senior commanders make decisions about the needs of the  Army  and the joint force in 2020 and beyond. The military exercise is also part of a collaboration between the  Army  and the Joint Staff. Planning for the exercise, known as STAFFEX, began in November 2012, with participants investigating current and potential future national security challenges. The investigation will be carried out from different angles, and STAFFEX participants will be divided into 5 groups: 2 operational working groups; the 3rd working group focuses on on-site preventive actions; the 4th working group is responsible for global force management; and the 5th is strategic working group.

1350.doctext: [According to dolphin-news website report on March 22, 2018] The USS Hartford attack nuclear submarine and the Seawolf-class attack nuclear submarine participated in a multinational maritime ice exercise on  March 10, 2018 in the Arctic Circle surfaced simultaneously. The two submarines, along with a  Royal Navy submarine, are taking part in a biennial exercise in the  Arctic to  train and validate submarine performance in extremely cold waters. Combat capabilities under conditions. The Arctic Ocean is truly unique from a military, geographic and scientific perspective, and it remains one of the most challenging ocean environments on Earth, said Navy Rear Adm. James Pitts, a member of the Undersea Warfare Development Center. The  exercise on ice provides an opportunity for the  United States submarine force and partners from the  Royal Navy to test in a challenging operational environment Combat and weapons systems, sonar systems, communications and navigation systems.

1351.doctext: From May 1 to 5, 2017, the US Air Force's  49th Wing stationed at  Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico conducted a   MQ-9 Reaper UAV extreme sortie  drill  , MQ-9s from the 6th, 9th and 29th attack squadrons of the wing all participated, achieving 45 sorties in 5 days , flying more than 465 hours. This exercise is designed to enable U.S. Air Force remotely piloted aircraft student pilots, sensor operators and maintainers to discover and record dispatch limits, while also providing commanders with an opportunity to test the capabilities of each squadron. Personnel supporting this exercise include air traffic controllers, maintenance personnel, planners, flight safety personnel, fuel and munitions specialists, and others. During the exercise, both real machines and simulators were used to train trainees to the maximum extent possible, with the simulator running for approximately 18 hours or more per day. After takeoff, each MQ-9 remains in the air for 10, 11 or 12 hours.

Area: Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico
Subject: 49th Wing
Content: MQ-9 Reaper UAV extreme sortie  drill

1352.doctext: From September 16 to 18, 2018,  Joint Task Force 55 of the U.S. Navy's Fifth Fleet conducted a missile and naval gun  exercise during which the  Tornado class Coast patrol boat test-fired Griffin missile. The purpose of the exercise is to deal with high-speed maneuvering targets to improve the ability to protect minesweepers and other coastal patrol craft from potential threats. A total of five Cyclone-class coastal patrol boats participated in the exercise, of which the Perak patrol boat fired a Griffin missile. The commander of Joint Task Force 55 said that this exercise provided valuable experience in the use of weapons systems for coastal patrol boats, enhanced the lethality capability against small ships, and expanded the range and weapon selection of coastal patrol boats.

Subject: Joint Task Force 55 of the U.S. Navy's Fifth Fleet
Content: Tornado class Coast patrol boat test-fired Griffin missile

1353.doctext: According to the Washington Post,  this week,  more than 4,000 federal, state and local government officials attended a conference in  Virginia A counter-terrorism military  exercise, which cost US$3.5 million. TOPOFF4, funded by the Department of Homeland Security, is the fourth in a series of national terror incident preparedness and response exercises. Exercise  Assume that terrorists smuggled two weapons of mass destruction into the United States, one exploded on the West Coast and the other detonated in Washington  . Department of Homeland Security official George Foresman said: This exercise provides an excellent practice opportunity to strengthen the country's effective and appropriate response to terrorist attacks and disasters. Although the events are hypothetical, the dangers are real. Each TOPOFF exercise is based on the real world and draws lessons from the previous exercise. This was not a public exercise, and the FBI kept some activities secret. 100 people sitting by phones and laptops serve as the control center, while the rest work at designated locations. George Foresman said: TOPOFF allows us to find flaws in plans and capabilities and record them to ensure that the country will be better prepared for real events. The exercise tested our ability to plan, communicate and make interdepartmental decisions in an event in real time. The next full-scale TOPOFF exercise is planned for next year and will involve three states.

Subject: more than 4,000 federal, state and local government officials

1354.doctext: Canada’s Minister of Defense announced on June 7 the purchase of six remotely operated submersibles for the Royal Canadian Navy. These small underwater ROVs are provided by Aurora ROV Systems of Lower Sackville, Nova Scotia, Canada, and are valued at $1.66 million each. These ROVs allow Canadian forces to see and operate objects 950 meters below the waterline. Uses include locating the location of a plane crash at sea and recovering the plane's black box. ROVs can also recover discarded items from smuggling ships, inspect suspicious items, deliver weapons to destroy mines and inspect ship bottoms. During the 2012 Nunavut military operation, the Canadian military had safely and independently used two remotely operated submersibles of the same model purchased this time in the high latitudes of the Canadian Arctic. At that time, a remotely operated vehicle was used to explore the bottom of the Northwest Passage at  805 kilometers north of the Arctic Circle and found a   that sank in 1853   Bredol Merchant ship.

Location: 805 kilometers north of the Arctic Circle
Subject: that sank in 1853   Bredol

1355.doctext: August 18, 2016,  The USS Louisiana ballistic missile submarine was performing a routine mission with  in the waters near  Washington State A U.S. Navy supply ship   collided. The accident occurred at 6 pm.  There were no casualties  . Damage assessment of the  submarine  and  supply ship  and further investigation of the incident are currently underway. Both ships have safely returned to their respective ports. The supply ship returned to Port Angeles, and  USS Louisiana  successfully returned to Bangor Kitsap Naval Base.  USS Louisiana  is  Ohio-class submarine No. 13 . It was commissioned in 1997. It has 24 vertical missile launch tubes and can launch 24 Trident II missiles. This type of missile has a maximum range of more than 12,000 kilometers and a hit accuracy of 90 meters. Each missile can carry up to 12 warheads. This class of boats adopts the most advanced stealth measures, mainly acoustic stealth, and takes a series of measures to reduce noise. If the S8G natural circulation pressurized water reactor is used, the main circulation pump does not need to be used when sailing at medium and low speeds, floating rafts are used to reduce vibration in the engine room, and anechoic tiles are laid on the outer surface of the hull, so the radiated noise is very low. In addition, stealth measures such as eliminating infrared characteristics, degaussing, and reducing waste emissions have been adopted. The diving depth of the boat is 400m, which increases the range of activities in the vertical depth of the ocean and has good concealment.

Subject: The USS Louisiana ballistic missile submarine
submarine
USS Louisiana
USS Louisiana
Ohio-class submarine No. 13
supply ship

1356.doctext: Under a new agreement between the  United States  and the French government, NASA space shuttles can make an emergency landing at a  air force base  in southern France if an emergency occurs during launch. Under the agreement signed in Washington, NASA said in a statement that the two governments agreed to establish a transoceanic emergency landing site for the U.S. space shuttle at  Istres Air Base  in southern France. The agreement signed by the NASA administrator and the French ambassador to the United States provides a landing site in France for space shuttle missions to the International Space Station. The agreement also allows the  United States Government to conduct advance inspection of  equipment and  personnel for space shuttle missions at  French Air Force Base  Deployment.

1357.doctext: U.S. Army night vision researchers are advancing a plan to improve and  demonstrate   superlattice infrared focal plane arrays for high-resolution military thermal imaging Imaging. Army Contracting Command Aberdeen Proving Ground officials announced their intention to negotiate a single-source contract this week with Teledyne Science and Imaging LLC to accelerate the second phase of the program's fielding mission for critical infrared sensor technology. In Phase 2 of Project VISTA, known as Dual Band Development and Beyond, Teledyne Scientific's optoelectronics scientists will complete the development and increase production capabilities of  antimony-based III-V focal plane arrays  . The contract value has not yet been determined. Teledyne Sciences will increase quantum efficiency to optimize detector design and reduce dark current density. Army Contracting Command is negotiating with Teledyne Sciences on behalf of the Army Night Vision and Electronic Sensors Directorate.

1358.doctext: On October 8, 2010,  U.S. Navy  aircraft carrier USS Lincoln passed  Strait of Malacca , with lightning and thunder not far away. Global Network reporter Li Zongze reported that according to Taiwan’s Central News Agency on October 8,  the U.S. Navy   the USS Lincoln aircraft carrier battle group   on the morning of the 8th   Arrive at   Strait of Malacca  and dock at Port Klang, about 38 kilometers away from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, for a 4-day visit. According to the report, Alexander, the commander of the Lincoln, was unwilling to explain the mission sent to Malaysia, but said that the crew continued to train during the past month's voyage.  The U.S. Navy  pointed out on its official website on the 8th that the mission of the USS Lincoln aircraft carrier to Malaysia is to demonstrate the friendly relations between the United States and Malaysia. As for the  USS Lincoln aircraft carrier battle group  entering the U.S. 7th Fleet area of ​​responsibility, it is a routine dispatch mission to promote regional peace, cooperation and security. It is understood that the Nimitz-class nuclear-powered aircraft carrier USS Lincoln carries 5,000 crew members, F-18 Hornet fighter jets, E-2C Hawkeye airborne early warning aircraft and EA-6B Prowler electronic warfare aircraft.

Subject: U.S. Navy
the U.S. Navy
The U.S. Navy
Militaryforce: the USS Lincoln aircraft carrier battle group
USS Lincoln aircraft carrier battle group

1359.doctext: A top Russian diplomat said this week that talks on further nuclear weapons reductions must take place in multilateral relationships beyond Russia and the U.S., according to a former U.S. Defense Department official, a possible sign of Russian President Vladimir Putin's response A sign of unease about its domestic political position. RIA Novosti quoted Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov as saying that we cannot endlessly negotiate with the  United States to reduce and limit nuclear weapons, while some other countries are strengthening their Nuclear and missile capabilities. Ryabkov said turning nuclear disarmament negotiations into a multilateral process is a priority. After Russia and  the United States  held presidential elections last year, they hoped that the new government would be confident enough to conduct follow-up negotiations on the New START treaty. However, Putin has spoken out in recent months about  U.S.  policy toward Syria and the deployment of   missile defense systems in  Europe     Take a tough stance on matters. These moves eliminated the Obama administration's early optimism about nuclear arms control negotiations.

1360.doctext: According to Agence France-Presse, on June 26, Russia announced a new strategic equipment development plan, which is a response to the United States’ plan to develop a missile defense system. Russia's First Deputy Prime Minister Sergei Ivanov said during a visit to the factory in Votkinsk that Topol M strategic missiles will be produced. He said that we are carrying out equipment improvement work for nuclear strategic and tactical forces, not prototype design, but mass production. He said that we will produce Topol M missiles and also produce mobile missiles that can be equipped with different missiles, such as  IskandeM missiles . Topol M is an intercontinental ballistic missile with a range of 6,200 miles. 6,200 kilometers is approximately the distance from Moscow to Los Alamos National Laboratory.  IskandeM  is a short-range tactical missile. Last year, Ivanov announced that Russia would produce 40 Topol M missiles per year. He also stated that  Russia  will  deploy   60  IskandeM missiles  before 2015.

1361.doctext: Dutch Deputy Defense Minister Jack de Vries has called for a new investigation into noise pollution from US-produced Joint Strike Fighters. The Netherlands plans to purchase multiple JSFs to replace its aging F-16 fighter fleet. In the past, procurement was delayed due to rising costs, and now JSF's noise problem has attracted attention again. Recent data from the U.S. Air Force shows that the JSF's noise level during takeoff reaches up to 130 decibels, far exceeding the standards set by the Netherlands. The  JSF  procured by  Netherlands will be  stationed at  Levaten Air Base in the province of Frisia and environmental regulations will JSF is prohibited from taking off from the base. Due to strong requests from the Frisian Provincial Senate, the Dutch Deputy Defense Minister issued an order to conduct a new round of research on the noise problem of the Joint Strike Fighter. The Dutch national agency responsible for aerospace recalculated the data and the result was 110 decibels. Residents near Levaton Air Base and the Frisian Provincial Council have expressed concerns about the discrepancy in the data. In February 2010, the Dutch House of Representatives will again discuss the purchase of JSF or Lockheed Martin's F-35 Lightning II fighter jets. The purchase plan is causing heated debate in the Netherlands because the United States does not disclose information about the actual cost of the aircraft, which means that the Netherlands may face serious financial risks. Regarding the noise causes of JSF, detailed examination of each node of the JSF project will still be carried out. However, several parties want the procurement plan scrapped, including the ruling Labor Party and the opposition Socialist Party.

Subject: Netherlands
Location: Levaten Air Base in the province of Frisia

1362.doctext: Rear Admiral Habibullah Seiri, commander of the Iranian Navy, said that  the Iranian Navy  is being fully equipped and improving its military readiness to deal with any threats posed by the enemy. A number of new Qadir-class mini-submarines will join the Iranian naval force to further strengthen its capabilities. Iranian Navy Admiral Aziz Naserzad said that Iran also plans to design and manufacture an air-to-air missile that is more advanced than the Phoenix missile. Nasezad said that once this kind of long-range missile is launched, the enemy's flying target will be hit. According to the "Tehran Times" report, the Phoenix missile is an air-to-air missile that can automatically track and strike targets. Rear Admiral Seyri said that the deployment of   warships  in the  Gulf of Aden   is part of Iran’s naval strategic policy to demonstrate Iran’s military strength.

1363.doctext: South Korea  may require the United States to re-deploy   US tactical nuclear weapons  in  South Korea   . After reports emerged that North Korea allowed American scientists to visit its secret uranium enrichment facilities, South Korean Defense Minister Kim Tae-young discussed the issue with South Korean lawmakers on the 22nd. Members of Congress have asked questions about the possible reintroduction of U.S. tactical nuclear weapons. Kim responded that I will raise this issue when meeting with members of the South Korea-US Expanded Deterrence Policy Committee. The United States is thought to have only withdrawn its  nuclear weapons  from South Korea in 1991.

1364.doctext: Russian Baltic Fleet spokesman Vladimir Matveyev said that the Russian and Swedish navies will conduct a joint submarine rescue  exercise  . Later this year, experts from the  Baltic Fleet Search and Rescue Division  will join forces with experts from the  Swedish Navy  to practice search and rescue operations for distressed submarines. Last October, Russian Baltic Fleet Vice Admiral Viktor Kravchuk and Swedish Navy Commander Rear Admiral Jan Thörnqvist signed a preliminary agreement in Kaliningrad, and this exercise falls within the framework of the agreement. The main contents of this exercise are:  Search for distressed submarines sinking on the seabed, use remotely controlled submersibles to find the hull and rescue crew members  .

Subject: Baltic Fleet Search and Rescue Division
Swedish Navy

1365.doctext: Lockheed Martin has been awarded a $27 million fixed-price contract by the  U.S. Navy  to produce components for 22  vertically launched anti-submarine missiles  for the U.S. Navy.  The vertically launched anti-submarine missile is a supersonic, emergency attack anti-submarine warfare weapon that enables combatants to engage submarines at a relatively safe distance. It is  equipped in   US Navy cruisers and destroyers aboard. This type of missile will be stored and launched using the MK41 missile vertical launch system developed by Lockheed Martin. The lightweight torpedo it carries can strike designated target areas to deal with enemy threats.  The vertically launched anti-submarine missile  exceeds its operational and test performance requirements, can operate effectively in high seas, offshore and even in bad weather, and has twice the range of previous anti-submarine rocket systems. Navies of various countries have expressed strong interest in  vertically launched anti-submarine missiles  and hope to replace the old, unguided and deck-launched anti-submarine weapons that are about to be retired.

1366.doctext: The U.S. Office of Naval Research said on April 9 that the  large-diameter unmanned underwater vehicle naval innovation prototype will be displayed for the first time  at the Sea, Air and Space Exhibition hosted by the Navy Alliance. Out, LDUUV-INP represents the cutting-edge unmanned underwater vehicle technology that can change the rules of the game, with strong endurance, power and autonomy. The Director of Naval Research will speak on ONR technology at the show on April 14. Other ONR technologies exhibited include: LOCUST is a prototype launch tube-launched UAV prototype technology that will enable rapid launch of multiple UAVs and suppress the enemy through autonomous swarm technology. In the future, it will also promote the development of autonomous control technology, and plans to test the technology of launching 30 drones in one minute on the FSF-1 Sea Fighter test ship in 2016. GBAD is a vehicle-mounted mobile high-energy laser that can effectively defend against asymmetric threats such as drones at a lower cost. This exhibition will display the radar and planar waveguide laser models of this system. MDUSV is an autonomous unmanned surface vehicle. The technology used on the boat will be used in the anti-submarine continuous tracking unmanned boat developed by ONR and DARPA. In the future, autonomous and directed energy technologies will place greater emphasis on autonomous capabilities. The 50th Sea, Air and Space Expo hosted by the U.S. Navy League will be held on  April 13-14  at the  Gaylord National Resort and Convention Center Hotel  .

Subject: The U.S. Office of Naval Research
Equipment: large-diameter unmanned underwater vehicle naval innovation prototype
Location: Gaylord National Resort and Convention Center Hotel

1367.doctext: Oleg Senkoun, director of the Ural Vehicle Plant, said that plans are under way to equip the  T-15 Armata heavy infantry fighting vehicle  with drones. UAVs are indispensable at the tactical level, and convoys cannot move forward without forward reconnaissance and surveillance capabilities. The types of drones to be equipped on the  T-15  are still being negotiated. Testing Russian-made drones is a clear issue for the Defense Department. At the Victory Day parade on  May 9, 2015,  Russia   unveiled the  new T-15 Armata heavy infantry fighting vehicle  .  T-15  is the latest generation of armored infantry fighting vehicle developed and produced by the Russian defense industry. It has three crew members in the armored cabin at the front of the vehicle body. At the rear of the car body is an unmanned turret developed and produced by the Tula Instrument Design Bureau. The turret is equipped with a 2A42 30mm automatic cannon. Other weapons include a PKTM-style 7.62mm machine gun and Kornet-D anti-tank missile launchers on both sides of the turret. The remotely controlled weapon station is equipped with a computerized fire control system, which includes gunner's and commander's sights. The turret has day/night firing capability. For better protection, the  T-15  is equipped with an Afghani active protection system, including sensors and laser detection systems.

Subject: Russia
Equipment: T-15 Armata heavy infantry fighting vehicle
new T-15 Armata heavy infantry fighting vehicle

1368.doctext: The U.S. Strategic Command announced on December 1 that it has achieved the combat capability of using nuclear or conventional weapons to quickly strike targets around the world. Last month,  the U.S. military completed the task of striking enemy countries in a nuclear war. Ability test. In a press conference yesterday, U.S. Strategic Command said a new joint functional command for space and global strike capabilities meets the requirements for declared initial operational capability. During the Global Lightning Operation exercise, it experienced a rigorous test of comprehensive planning and combat execution capabilities. According to public military documents, the annual exercise Global Lightning Operation held last month tested the United States' strategic combat capabilities, including the so-called CONPLAN 8022 global strike mission. Hans Kristensen, an adviser to the Natural Resources Defense Council, said the mission is part of a new strike plan that includes preemptive nuclear strikes against facilities around the world that store weapons of mass destruction. Military analyst William Arkin wrote in a Washington Post column in October that the secretive  exercises  also include  responses to a virtual nation or terrorist attack using radioactive dirty bombs  .

1369.doctext: The Chinese Air Force produced and released a poster to display the image of a peaceful, mighty and civilized force. China Air Force Network, Beijing, July 20. Colonel Shen Jinke, spokesperson of the Chinese Air Force, said in Beijing that with the approval of the Central Military Commission, the Chinese Air Force dispatched an aviation unit and three Su-30 aircraft to leave the country on July 20  Russia participated in the Aviation Darts-2014 International Pilot Competition. This move is conducive to strengthening  pragmatic cooperation between the two air forces in the field of military  training, and China  Russia military cooperation Not directed at third parties. Colonel Shen Jinke introduced that the Aerodarts-2014 International Pilot Competition organized by the Russian Air Force includes  aerial navigation skills, aerial visual reconnaissance, single or dual-plane aerobatic driving skills, ground attack practical applications, etc. project. The Chinese Air Force will use the multilateral platform of the international competition to strengthen experience exchanges with pilots from participating countries. Colonel Shen Jinke said that since its establishment 65 years ago, the Chinese Air Force has won wide recognition with its image of openness, confidence and cooperation. In recent years, the Chinese Air Force and foreign air forces have organized and carried out a series of joint exercises, joint training and military exchange activities, learning from the useful experience of foreign militaries, improving the actual combat training level of the troops, and providing reference for promoting training innovation and deepening training reform. Colonel Shen Jinke said that the Chinese Air Force is a strategic service and will increasingly go abroad to learn from the air forces of world powers and enhance its ability to carry out diversified military tasks in a broader space. Source: Ministry of National Defense website

Subject: pragmatic cooperation between the two air forces

1370.doctext: The U.S. Navy stated that the USS Spruance, the first ship of the 31 DD963 Spruance-class destroyers,  completed its last air-launched Harpoon missile target mission.  Sunk on December 8. The shipwreck  exercise was conducted  300 miles from the Port of Virginia in bad weather, with aircraft from the U.S. Navy's Carrier Air Wing 8 and Patrol and Reconnaissance Wing 5 P-3Cs and F/A-18s fired missiles. The USS Spruance is the longest-serving destroyer of its class and the last DD963 ship to be retired. The ship was launched in September 1975 and decommissioned in 2005. The Spruance-class destroyer is a multi-purpose anti-submarine-focused destroyer built by the  U.S. Navy  in the 1970s. It was the main surface fleet ship of the United States from the 1880s to the 1890s.

Subject: The U.S. Navy
U.S. Navy
Area: 300 miles from the Port of Virginia

1371.doctext: Israel  Schematic diagram of anti-missile system  Israel  announced the next generation anti-missile system. The Arrow-3 interceptor, designed to intercept ballistic missiles, remains a mystery.  November 22 A full-size  Arrow-3 model was  exhibited at the Second International Astronautical Congress in  Jerusalem  . To counter the threat, engineers developing the Arrow-3 needed to tackle a daunting technical challenge: building a satellite that could collide with an incoming long-range ballistic missile with high accuracy. Similar to the previous two generations,  Arrow-3  was also developed by  Israel  Aerospace Industries with funding from the United States. The system is expected to be operational by 2015. The  Israel  missile defense program announced on November 22 is described as a multi-layered active air defense network designed to provide complex defense against multiple threats. The lowest level is the Iron Dome, which is used to intercept missiles with a range of 5-70 kilometers. This system is produced by the Israeli state-owned enterprise Rafael Advanced Defense Systems. The second level is David's Sling, designed to intercept a variety of more capable missiles. It is jointly developed by Rafael and the American Raytheon Company and is expected to be operational before 2013. It is said that this defense network is expected to be fully operational by 2015.

1372.doctext: InteroceanAmerican Shipping has been awarded a fixed-price contract by the  U.S. Navy Maritime Supply Command to operate and maintain the  U.S. Navy   sea-based X-band radar platform . The contract is worth US$28.18 million, including a four-year option contract. If the terms of the contract are fulfilled in full, the total contract value will reach US$165.2 million.  SBX-1  is deployed by   in the  Pacific  to provide ballistic missile tracking and countermeasures information to interceptor missiles of the Ground-Based Midcourse Defense System. Contract work will be performed offshore and is expected to be completed in September 2012.

1373.doctext: On March 8, 2012, ThyssenKrupp Marine Systems signed a multi-phase design study contract with the Ministry of Public Works and Government Services of  Canada in Hamburg, Germany, for  Canada The Navy is developing the next generation of joint  support ships. As part of a major fleet revitalization project,  Canada  intends to replace the two existing fuel supply ships with 2-3 joint support ships.  The new joint support ship  may be based on the latest Berlin-class supply ship of the German Navy, and then be improved and designed according to the needs of  Canada . The contract signed this time includes a concession agreement. If the design of the Berlin-class supply ship is selected,  Canada can use its design in construction and has the right to  deploy   /span_7 New joint support ship. The improved design was jointly completed by ThyssenKrupp Marine Systems Canada and Blomworth Naval Engineering. It will use existing technologies from the Canadian Ministry of National Defense, the Navy and BMT Fleet Technologies to design and transform the interior of the hull. Once the improved Berlin-class supply ship design is selected,  Canada will award a functional design for construction of the  New Joint Support Ship in  Canada contract.

1374.doctext: According to a report on the Defense Daily website on November 6, a group of 20 members of the House of Representatives is strongly requesting House Appropriations Committee Chairman Bill Young to provide help in restoring the $104.5 million  C-5 in the 2002 defense appropriation list. Aircraft Upgrade Project Grants. The House has not yet voted on the list. The C-5 avionics modernization project initially decided to allocate $104.5 million. After a year of changes, it was decided to cut the funding from reliability improvements and engine replacement by $14 million to $90.5 million. The main contractor of the entire AMP project is Lockheed Martin, which originally planned to replace it with GE's CF6-80C2 engine.  United States These 20 members of the House of Representatives believe that cutting funding for  C-5  improvements will affect the  C-5  in the  Global  Military  The role of deployment in support will especially affect military operations against terrorism, and will also affect the continued use of  C-5  in Europe and Japan. Therefore, they proposed that they cannot Cut funding for  C-5  improvements.

Militaryforce: C-5 in the 2002 defense appropriation list. Aircraft
Subject: United States

1375.doctext: U.S. Navy   Littoral Combat Ship The original idea was to be able to quickly convert modular mission packages, allowing it to be easily converted from a minesweeper to an anti-submarine ship in a single deployment ship. However, it is currently found that switching between mission packages cannot be completed in a few days, but actually takes weeks.  Littoral Combat Ships  The first two ships are currently in its home port of San Diego, the third ship is about to be delivered, and the fourth ship will be delivered in 2013. The first  Littoral Combat Ship Liberty is planned to be deployed to  Singapore in  Spring 2013. This will be the  Littoral Combat Ship First  deployment outside the Western Hemisphere. The assessment concluded that  Littoral Combat Ships  would be unable to fulfill most of the fleet missions proposed in the Navy's original strategy document, such as performing theater security cooperation and deterrence missions, as well as maritime security operations, such as counter-piracy. However,  Littoral Combat Ship  cannot successfully perform the other three core missions envisaged: forward presence, sea control and power projection; instead, it can only complete some humanitarian assistance and emergency and disaster relief missions. In addition, the  Littoral Combat Ship  also has a fatal flaw: it cannot effectively defend against anti-ship cruise missiles, a weapon that almost all potential enemy small fast attack ships can carry.

1376.doctext: Since 1961,  NRO  has conducted 24-hour orbital surveillance using secret satellites, including keyhole camera satellites, downscan Lacrosse space radar, signals intelligence spacecraft, and extensive ground-based receiving arrays .  NRO  is currently looking for a way to rapidly expand this team. The agency hopes to quickly launch repositionable orbiting sensors to keep an eye on fast-moving things on the ground. In pursuit of an interim response,  NRO  said 2012 will be spent analyzing other innovative space launch options and new options for potentially launching  NRO  payloads, including reusable vehicles. Currently, the only reusable vehicle in the United States is the Air Force’s secretive X-37B orbital test vehicle, which has a payload just big enough to hold a camera or sensor. According to the budget plan,  NRO   Another technology goal for 2012 is to  field  a set of  devices that can deliver to warfighters on the battlefield Intelligence data system. The Army, Marine Corps and Air Force already use handheld detector terminals - such as large, rugged smartphones - to download video from aircraft. It is not difficult to imagine that  NRO  also uses similar hardware to receive satellite data relayed in near real time from some remote ground station in  NRO .

Subject: NRO
NRO
NRO
NRO
NRO
NRO
NRO
Militaryforce: devices that can deliver to warfighters on the battlefield Intelligence data system

1377.doctext: The U.S. Navy awarded General Dynamics Electric Boat a contract to provide planned shipyard maintenance, engineering and technical support services for its nuclear submarine force. Under the contract, support activities will cover all aspects of the submarine's life cycle, including concept development and design during construction, maintenance and modification, as well as decommissioning and disposal of nuclear submarines. Under this $459 million modifiable contract, Electric Boat will deploy's  submarines and  undersea vehicles for  the United States    Provide design, engineering, logistics and research and development activities. Electric Boat will also provide information services and ensure maintenance and modernization of the submarines, as well as training and improving affordability. Drawings and related technical data are also included in the contract, which provide services for design modification documentation, propulsion plant and maintenance engineering, and site support. Work will be performed at Electric Boat's locations in Connecticut, Georgia, Washington, and Rhode Island; expected to be completed by September 2013. The contract has a three-year performance period and, if all selected work is carried out, the entire contract is worth approximately $1.2 billion.

1378.doctext: 50 years ago,  the United States officially  deployed the first  Minuteman-3 intercontinental ballistic missile to support the strategic deterrence mission . These missiles are still in service 50 years later, providing safety, security and an effective strategic nuclear deterrent.  Minuteman 3 missiles  have received a series of upgrades and modernizations since their deployment. Air Force Global Strike Command officials stated that they will continue to modernize and improve the system and extend the life of the  Minuteman-3 missile  through a series of life extension projects.
